name: Macallan Concept 2
description: From the distiller: "The Macallan Concept Number 2 calls on exceptional casks to produce a rich and rewarding multi-sensory experience, where a powerful foundation is brought to life with flourishes and tones woven together to create a harmonious and vibrant work of art."

name: E.H. Taylor, Jr. Old Fashioned Sour Mash - 2011
baxus_class_name: E.H. Taylor, Jr. Old Fashioned Sour Mash - 2011

name: E.H. Taylor, Jr. 18 Year Marriage
description:
Named in honor of Colonel Edmund Haynes Taylor Jr., a visionary figure in American whiskey-making, this bourbon epitomizes the timeless tradition and uncompromising quality of the Bottled in Bond Act of 1897.

Crafted with precision and passion, E.H. Taylor Bottled in Bond is a testament to Colonel Taylor's unwavering commitment to excellence. From the moment it meets the lips, this bourbon captivates the senses with its deep amber hue and enticing aroma of caramel, oak, and spice.

On the palate, layers of complexity unfold, revealing notes of vanilla, butterscotch, and a hint of pepper, all harmoniously balanced by the bourbon's signature smoothness. Each sip is a journey through time, a tribute to the craftsmanship and legacy of one of America's most revered distillers.

As a Bottled in Bond bourbon, E.H. Taylor adheres to strict regulations, ensuring that it is distilled, aged, and bottled under government supervision at a single distillery during a single distillation season. This commitment to authenticity and integrity sets E.H. Taylor Bottled in Bond apart, making it a beloved choice among bourbon enthusiasts and collectors alike.

Whether enjoyed neat, on the rocks, or in a classic cocktail, E.H. Taylor Bottled in Bond invites you to savor the rich history and enduring legacy of America's native spirit with every sip.

name: E.H. Taylor, Jr. Warehouse C Tornado Surviving - 2011
description: On Sunday evening April 2 2006 a severe storm with tornado strength winds tore through Central Kentucky damaging two Buffalo Trace Distillery aging warehouses. One of the damaged warehouses was Warehouse C a treasured warehouse on property built by Colonel Edmund Haynes Taylor Jr. in 1885. It sustained significant damage to its roof and north brick wall exposing a group of aging bourbon barrels to the elements. That summer the exposed barrels waited patiently while the roof and walls were repaired meanwhile being exposed to the Central Kentucky climate. When these barrels were tasted years later it was discovered that the sun wind and elements they had experienced created a bourbon rich in flavors that was unmatched. This was truly a special batch of barrels and though the Distillery does not hope for another tornado it feels lucky to have been able to release this once in a lifetime product.
series: Warehouse C Tornado Surviving Bottled In Bond
baxus_class_name: E.H. Taylor, Jr. Warehouse C Tornado Surviving - 2011

name: Russell's Reserve 15 Year 2024 Release
description: One of the most sought after bourbons of 2024, this Russell's Reserve 15 year old has been crafted from barrels hand picked by Eddie Russell that were earmarked and carefully tasted throughout the last decade. Bottled 58.6% Abv, just slightly above their barrel entry proof of 115, this higher proof offering from the Russells was reportedly aged in Camp Nelson. Turkey fans will be familiar with this warehouse, with Camp Nelson known to be the location where some of the best barrels are stored.

name: Lehman Brothers "Ashes of Disaster" 8 Year - 2017
description: Introducing Chapter 11 of Lehman Brothers' Whiskies—a continuation of the captivating narrative that began with our inaugural release. Crafted with precision and care by our master malter, Chapter 11 delves deeper into the intricate tapestry of Lehman Brothers' legacy.From the heights of prosperity to the depths of turmoil, each sip of Chapter 11 encapsulates the essence of Lehman Brothers' journey—a tale of ambition, resilience, and transformation. With nuanced flavors and complexities, this whisky pays homage to the company's enduring spirit and unwavering determination.As the story unfolds, Chapter II invites you to explore new dimensions of Lehman Brothers' legacy. With every drop, experience the triumphs and tribulations of a bygone era—a reminder of the indomitable human spirit in the face of adversity.Whether savored alone or shared among friends, Chapter 11 of Lehman Brothers' Whiskies is a testament to the resilience of the human spirit and the enduring legacy of a once-great institution.

name: Johnnie Walker Ghost & Rare
description: A sweet and fruity release in Johnnie Walker's Blue Label Ghost & Rare series featuring casks from Speyside ghost distillery Pittyvaich, as well as Port Dundas and Carsebridge. The palate offers notes of apples, autumnal berries, cinnamon, vanilla, and crystalized ginger that linger in the finish.

name: Bardstown Chateau de Laubade
description: In their press release, Bardstown states that the 2022 Château de Laubade Armagnac release includes a blend of 12-year-old Kentucky and 10-year-old Tennessee bourbon, finished in Laubade Armagnac casks for 16 months. Their first release featured a 12-year-old Indiana bourbon finished in Armagnac barrels for 18 months.

name: Willett Family Estate Single Barrel Rye 22 Year - 2006
description: An excellent un-chillfiltered barrel proof Kentucky bourbon, this bottle has been aged for 22 years and is from Barrel number 618. Only 263 bottles were produced from this particular bottling.
series: Family Estate Bottled Single Barrel Rye
baxus_class_name: Willett Family Estate Single Barrel Rye 22 Year - 2006

name: Willett Family Estate Single Barrel Rye 8 Year
description: After 8 years in oak barrel number 1457, this bourbon was bottled at casl strength for Willett's Rare Release series.
baxus_class_name: Willett Family Estate Single Barrel Rye 8 Year

name: Willett Family Estate Single Barrel 12 Year
description: Aged for 12 years in oak barrel number 1271, this bourbon was bottled for Willett's Rare Release series at cask strength. Only 157 bottles were produced from this barrel.
baxus_class_name: Willett Family Estate Single Barrel 12 Year

name: Willett Family Estate Single Barrel 13 Year
description: Aged for 13 years in oak barrel number 8140, this bourbon was bottled for Willett's Rare Release series at cask strength. Only 140 bottles were produced from this barrel.
baxus_class_name: Willett Family Estate Single Barrel 13 Year

name: Willett Family Estate Single Barrel Rye 22 Year - 2006
description: An excellent un-chillfiltered barrel proof Kentucky bourbon, this bottle has been aged for 22 years and is from Barrel number 8. Only 216 bottles were produced from this particular bottling.
baxus_class_name: Willett Family Estate Single Barrel Rye 22 Year - 2006

name: Willett Family Estate Single Barrel 10 Year
description: Aged for 10 years in oak barrel number 1432, this bourbon was bottled for Willett's Rare Release series at cask strength. Only 143 bottles were produced from this barrel.
baxus_class_name: Willett Family Estate Single Barrel 10 Year

name: Willett Single Barrel "Step Brothers Barrel" 7 year - 2021
description: Prime bourbon aged a minimum of 7 years in new America white oak barrels with a finished barrel strength of 106.6 proof.
baxus_class_name: Willett Single Barrel "Step Brothers Barrel" 7 year - 2021

name: Willett Family Estate Single Barrel 11 Year
description: Aged for 11 years in oak barrel number 1647, this bourbon was bottled for Willett's Rare Release series at cask strength. Only 161 bottles were produced from this barrel.
baxus_class_name: Willett Family Estate Single Barrel 11 Year

name: Willett Family Estate Single Barrel 11 Year
description: Aged for 11 years in oak barrel number 1647, this bourbon was bottled for Willett's Rare Release series at cask strength. Only 161 bottles were produced from this barrel.
baxus_class_name: Willett Family Estate Single Barrel 11 Year

name: Gordon & MacPhail Glen Grant 72 Year - 2020
description: Truly a one-of-a-kind bottle, this extremely old whisky has garnered not only record-breaking auction prices but also worldwide recognition.

name: E.H. Taylor, Jr. Barrel Proof - 2014
description: Edmund Haynes Taylor Jr is considered one of the true bourbon pioneers. Born in 1830 he was orphaned at the age of five and was adopted by his uncle Edmund Haynes Taylor Snr who rechristened him as his junior. E.H. Taylor Jr is also referred to as Colonel Taylor due to his holding of the honourary title of Kentucky Colonel something he shares with a number of state's distinguished sons most notably a certain fried chicken vendor. Throughout his career Taylor set up and owned seven different distilleries and his lobbying for the Bottled in Bond Act of 1897 has seen him considered as the father of modern bourbon. Ten years earlier having sold his stake in the OFC distillery (now Buffalo Trace) to George T. Stagg he set up the Old Taylor distillery near Frankfort in Kentucky. The distillery featured a faux-Castle and sunken gardens on-site and was the birthplace of bourbon tourism. Here he established the Old Taylor brand which following Prohibition passed into the hands of National Distillers one of the big four distilling company's who dominated the post-repeal market. The distillery itself closed in 1972 but production was moved to the neighbouring Old Grand-dad site until National Distillers were acquired by Jim Beam in 1987 who converted it into a warehousing and bottling facility. Beam marketed the brand alongside the other Olds from the National Distiller portfolio (Old Crow and Old Grand-dad) until 2009 when the Sazerac Company acquired it returning Taylor's name to his early spiritual home at Buffalo Trace. The Buffalo Trace version of the brand is known as Colonel E.H. Taylor. With the exception of the Barrel Strength releases they are all Bottled in Bond at the 100 US proof required by the law that Taylor heroically campaigned for. This is a single barrel release from 2013.

name: E.H. Taylor, Jr. Barrel Proof - 2012
description: Edmund Haynes Taylor Jr is considered one of the true bourbon pioneers. Born in 1830 he was orphaned at the age of five and was adopted by his uncle Edmund Haynes Taylor Snr who rechristened him as his junior. E.H. Taylor Jr is also referred to as Colonel Taylor due to his holding of the honourary title of Kentucky Colonel something he shares with a number of state's distinguished sons most notably a certain fried chicken vendor. name: E.H. Taylor, Jr. Warehouse C Tornado Surviving
description: This ten-year-old Bottled in Bond bourbon was aged in Warehouse C, built by Col. Taylor in 1885, and the barrel warehouse he was most proud of – the final piece in his “model distillery.”  Like some of the previous releases, this one-time-only bottling of E.H. Taylor, Jr Warehouse C Bourbon is very limited.
baxus_class_name: E.H. Taylor, Jr. Warehouse C Tornado Surviving

name: E.H. Taylor, Jr. Single Barrel - 2022
description: The story of the Colonel E.H. Taylor Single Barrel 2022 bourbon is deeply rooted in the rich tradition of American whiskey-making. This exquisite bourbon, distilled and aged at the historic Buffalo Trace Distillery, is a tribute to Colonel Edmund Haynes Taylor, Jr., an influential figure in the bourbon industry and a staunch advocate for the Bottled-in-Bond Act of 1897. The 2022 release is presented in a bottle that features a label reminiscent of the early 1900s, reflecting the heritage and enduring legacy of the E.H. Taylor brand. The label is elegantly designed, showcasing the distillery's commitment to quality and tradition, with intricate detailing that includes the distillery's name, the proof of the whiskey, and a nod to its single barrel origin. This bourbon not only offers a complex and rich flavor profile but also serves as a collector's item, with its label and packaging designed to honor the historical significance of Colonel Taylor's contributions to the bourbon industry.

name: Blacksboat Bridge Speyside 2012 12 Year Single Barrel #180622 For BAXUS
description: A 2012 vintage single cask expression of a secret Speyside distillery named for the bridge just a short distance from the distillery. Although the name cannot be officially given, this Speyside single malt was sourced from the Glenfarclas distillery. Glenfarclas is a  powerhouse known for its sherry matured spirit and is one of the only remaining distilleries in Scotland still owned by its original family. This cask was chosen exclusively for Baxus and highlights the typically sherry dominant distillery in a more distillate forward style, as this cask was matured for 12 years in a 1st fill bourbon barrel. Released in collaboration with Single Cask Nation, it was bottled at 58.3% Abv with just 190 bottles produced.
baxus_class_name: Blacksboat Bridge Speyside 2012 12 Year Single Barrel #180622 For BAXUS

name: Aberlour 10 Year 1980s Bottling
description: A 1980s era bottling of Aberlour Highland single malt matured for 10 years and bottled at 43% Abv.

name: Cardhu 12 Year
description: Cardhu comes from one of the oldest of the Speyside distilleries, which have nestled in foothills near the River Spey for 200 years and the Cardhu range is an excellent representation of these Speyside whiskies. Known for its smooth, sweet-natured single malt whisky, the history of Cardhu’s rise to fame is to a large part told in the story of two determined women who were members of the founding family.

name: George T. Stagg 2019 Release
description: A 2019 release of the annual George T Stagg bourbon crafted from Buffalo Trace's #1 low rye mashbill. This batch was matured for 15 years and 4 months and is bottled at 58.45% Abv.

name: Wild Turkey Freedom
description: A special duty free bottling from Wild Turkey first released in 2002. This expression was blended from barrels aged between 7 and 13 years and bottled at 106 proof.

name: Glengoyne 30 Year 2017 Release
description: A 30 year old expression from Glengoyne fully matured in sherry casks. Bottled in 2017 at 46.8% Abv.

name: Russell's Reserve 13 Year Batch 4
description: The 4th batch of Wild Turkey's hugely popular 13 year old age statement bottled in the Russell's Reserve series. Bottled at barrel proof, the 4th batch was released in Spring 2023. First introduced in 2021, the 13 year old expression has rapidly become a serious fan favourite and in 2021 esteemed writer Fred Minnick awarded it his American whiskey of the year.

name: Ben Holladay 6 Year Bottled-in-Bond - 2022
description:
Rooted in time-honored methods, this bourbon is produced using original two-grain cooker system, maintaining consistent distillation proofs and barrel entry proof to preserve its distinctive character.

Handcrafted with care, each batch of Ben Holladay Bourbon is a testament to dedication to quality. Monthly, the master distiller selects barrels from different floors of two seven-story rickhouses, carefully blending them to meet stringent flavor profile criteria.

Primarily sourced from barrels aged on the fifth floor of Warehouse C, the largest rickhouse on-site, approximately 80% of the very first batch embodies the essence of this storied location. The remaining 20% hails from barrels on the first floor of the same rickhouse.

Embracing the unique aging conditions of each floor, subsequent batches of Ben Holladay Bourbon feature varying ratios, reflecting the diverse flavors imparted by temperature variations and humidity levels. From the cooler, more humid conditions of the first floor to the warmer, drier atmospheres of the higher floors, each barrel contributes distinct nuances to the final blend.

To honor the individuality of each batch, the Ben Holladay Bourbon label showcases a blending chart, guiding consumers through the intricate blending process and enabling them to discern the unique characteristics of each expression. Experience the artistry and tradition of Ben Holladay Bourbon—a true embodiment of quality and craftsmanship.

name: Leaf Me Be
description: A 2024 special release of Wild Turkey's signature 8 year old expression bottled at 101 proof. This release celebrates the 70th anniversary of master distiller Jimmy Russell, the world's longest serving master distiller. This release was crafted from 8 to 9 year old bourbon sourced from Jimmy's favourite rickhouses. Jimmy has always believe that Wild Turkey tastes best at 8 years and at 101 proof, committing to that style of bourbon for much of the 20th century. This release is a return to the much loved style of WIld Turkey that Jimmy helped to make world famous.

name: Wild Turkey Rare Breed
description:
The Wild Turkey Rare Breed from the late 1990s and early 2000s, particularly batches like the renowned W-T-01-99, represents a pinnacle in bourbon craftsmanship that many enthusiasts consider legendary. These expressions, bottled at barrel proof (typically around 108.4 proof), showcase the distillery's commitment to producing complex, full-flavored whiskeys during a time when the bourbon industry was experiencing a glut of aged stocks. This era of Rare Breed is particularly prized for its rich, multifaceted flavor profile that balances intensity with elegance.

Tasting notes for these vintage Rare Breed releases often describe a dense, classic Wild Turkey profile with remarkable depth. The nose typically offers a fragrant bouquet of brandy-like fruitiness, honey-maple sweetness, and medicinal cherry, complemented by caramel creme, sweet oak, and herbal-floral spices. On the palate, enthusiasts report an oily mouthfeel delivering waves of cherry-vanilla, butter toffee, and brown sugar, intertwined with sweet herbs, citrus notes, and warm baking spices. The finish is characteristically long and flavorful, leaving a lasting impression of vanilla bean, cola, and molasses. These batches are often cited as being superior to modern releases, showcasing a perfect harmony of aged stocks that's difficult to replicate in today's high-demand bourbon market.

name: Wild Turkey Rare Breed 2021
description: A long running series from Wild Turkey, rare breed is a barrel proof expression of their signature bourbon. First launched in 1991, this almost three decade long series is a batched release produced from barrels of varying ages. Average ages in each batch has fluctuated over time, with on average 6-12 year bourbons included but with Wild Turkey's warehouses being stuffed with older stocks as the years have gone by it is common for 17+ year old barrels to be included.

name: Blanton's Takara Red 2022 Release
description:
Blanton's Takara Red is a special edition of the celebrated Blanton's Single Barrel Bourbon, exclusively released for the Japanese market. Part of the Takara series, which also includes Takara Black and Takara Gold, this expression is highly sought after by bourbon enthusiasts and collectors around the world.

Takara Red is distinguished by its unique characteristics, including an aging process that is rumored to be a minimum of eight years, although this is not officially confirmed on the label. It is bottled at 93 proof (46.5% ABV), the same as the standard Blanton's Single Barrel, ensuring a robust flavor profile.

The packaging of Takara Red adds to its allure, featuring a distinctive red box with a woven texture and a deep maroon bag that contrasts with the brown bag of domestic Blanton's. The bottle is adorned with a gold-colored wax seal, similar to that found on Blanton's Straight From The Barrel. The label showcases light brown handwritten and printed portions, along with Japanese script spelling out "Whiskey," further emphasizing its exclusivity.

The Takara Red series is particularly interesting for collectors due to its limited availability and the variations that can arise from individual barrel selections. Some special releases within this series, such as the HBA (Hotel Barmen Association Japan) Single Barrel picks, offer even more unique expressions.

While many enthusiasts speculate about the potential superiority of the Takara series due to its rumored longer aging process, recent reviews suggest that modern releases may be more comparable in quality to standard Blanton's. Nevertheless, Takara Red remains a highly coveted expression in the bourbon world, often commanding premium prices on the secondary market.

name: Glentauchers Ooshkie - 2020
description: Another member of the ‘1890s gang’, Glentauchers was established in 1898 by James Buchanan & Co. to provide fillings for its Buchanan’s and Black & White blends. This unique bottling was aged for 11 years in a first fill bourbon barrel, and bottled at cask strength. Only 389 bottles were produced.

name: Macallan 25 yr Jerez
description: In the early 1980’s a 25 year distilled in 1957 was bottled to commemorate the 25th Anniversary of the foundation of Rinaldi Brothers, Inc. The bottle has a handwritten label, with a red ribbon and wax seal.

name: Old Rip Van Winkle 10 Year - 2022
description: Sweet, spicy, and caramel-nut-fudge aromas. The palate is fruity, medium-to full-bodied with intense dried fruit and toasted nutty notes. The finish is long, bold and peppery, followed by floral honey and charred barrel flavors.

name: SMWS 84.15 Glendullan 2001 11 Year
description: A 2001 vintage single cask expression of Glendullan matured for 11 years in a refill bourbon cask. It was bottled at 56.4% Abv by the Scotch Malt Whisky Society.

name: I.W. Harper 15 Year Bourbon Heritage Collection
description: A circa 1996 era release of I.W. Harper bourbon produced at the Bernheim distillery in Louisville. This 15 year old bourbon was bottled at 80 proof in the bourbon heritage collection series, a line of bottlings taking inspiration from United Distillers' classic malts series in Scotland. This edition features the gold veins style bottle common for Stitzel-Weller products that was expanded to United Distillers SKUs in the 1990s. Other editions of this 15 year old have appeared with a gold medal neck instead of the solid black packaging, but these are assumed to be later releases using left over Bernheim stock.
baxus_class_name: I.W. Harper 15 Year Bourbon Heritage Collection

name: Laphroaig 10 Year Early 1970s Bottling Carlton Import
description: An exceptionally rare US import bottling of Laphroaig 10 year old bottled in the early 1970s. This special US market bottling was done at 91.4 US proof/45.7% Abv, a higher strength than the usual 43% provided at the time. Carlton imports such as this routinely score amongst the highest Scotch whiskies, with Angus of whiskyfun hailing a 60s Carlton as a 95 point whisky in 2024. Older editions of Laphroaig 10 year such as this are praised for their bigger focus on tropical fruit flavours than just pure heavy peat character. With this likely being distilled in the early 1960s the whisky will have been crafted from local Islay barley, floor malted at the distillery and diluted with local peat influenced water.
baxus_class_name: Laphroaig 10 Year Early 1970s Bottling Carlton Import

name: VSO Jamaica Rum John Wagner & Sons 1940s Bottling
description: Estimated to be bottled in the 1930s/1940s, this VSO rum was imported by John Wagner & Sons of Philadelphia. This bottling is marked as pre prohibition suggesting the spirit was distilled prior to the enactment of prohibition. Dating details for this bottle are somewhat slim but Wagner left their Dock Street address in 1947, so this bottle pre-dates 1947. The note about prohibition suggests it was bottled after prohibition was lifted, so circa 1930. This was likely blended from a variety of Jamaican estate producers. Wagner were primarily importers of tea products but also handled wine & spirits, with the firm reportedly selling booze illegally during prohibition. They notably also imported a VSO Scotch whisky blend from Mackinlay (owners of Glen Mhor), so VSO is likely a brand they gave to products blended for them.
baxus_class_name: VSO Jamaica Rum John Wagner & Sons 1940s Bottling

name: SMWS 4.188 Highland Park 2000 13 Year
description: A 2000 vintage single cask expression of Highland Park matured for 13 years in a 1st fill bourbon barrel. It was bottled at 61.8% Abv by the Scotch Malt Whisky Society.

name: Lehman Brothers "Ashes of Disaster" 8 Year - 2017
description: Introducing Chapter 11 of Lehman Brothers' Whiskies—a continuation of the captivating narrative that began with our inaugural release. Crafted with precision and care by our master malter, Chapter 11 delves deeper into the intricate tapestry of Lehman Brothers' legacy.From the heights of prosperity to the depths of turmoil, each sip of Chapter 11 encapsulates the essence of Lehman Brothers' journey—a tale of ambition, resilience, and transformation. name: Wild Turkey Cheesy Gold Foil 12 Year 1992 Bottling
description:
The Wild Turkey Cheesy Gold Foil (CGF) 12 Year is known for its exceptional balance between sweet and oaky flavors, leaving a finish that's quite desirable. It's referred to as a premier bourbon that stands the test of time. It has an alcohol volume of 50.5%, which translates to 101 proof.

This bourbon was distinguished by its "Cheesy Gold Foil" labeling, a term used by bourbon communities to refer to this particular release. Among the Wild Turkey 101 12-year releases of the 1990s, the CGF variety is highly valued when compared to the "Split Label" variety from later in the decade. The CGF bottles tend to be valued more highly due to their iconic label and perhaps the quality of the bourbon itself.

It's described as a fantastic pour with a perfect combination of sweetness and oak. This blend of flavors is often what bourbon enthusiasts seek, making it a beloved choice among many.

This bourbon has become a collectible item over time due to its exceptional quality and the nostalgia associated with its release era.
baxus_class_name: Wild Turkey Cheesy Gold Foil 12 Year 1992 Bottling

name: Old Grand-Dad 1989 Bottling
description: A 1989 bottling of Old Grand-Dad bourbon bottled at 86 proof. This era of the brand was crafted from overaged stocks left over from the original Old Grand-Dad distillery after Beam acquired National Distillers in 1987.

name: Booker’s 13 Year Limited Edition Rye 2016 Bottling
description: Booker's Rye was produced from some of the last batches of spirit distilled by the legendary Booker Noe. A limited-edition one-off release, this high-rye whiskey has been bottled at 68.1%, resulting in an intense and spicy whiskey. Awarded World Whisky of the Year in Jim Murray's Whisky Bible 2017
baxus_class_name: Booker’s 13 Year Limited Edition Rye 2016 Bottling

name: Old Weller 7 Year 107 Proof 1981 Bottling
description: A 1981 bottling of Weller bourbon matured for 7 years and bottled at their signature 107 proof. This Stitzel-Weller era produced bottle of the brand is crafted from their signature wheated mashbill whilst under the ownership of United Distillers.

name: Old Weller 7 Year 107 Proof Handle 1988 Bottling
description: A big format bottling of Old Weller 107 matured for 7 years and bottled at 53.5% Abv. Bottled in a 1.75 litre handle format this 1988 bottling was produced at the now legendary Stitzel-Weller distillery.
baxus_class_name: Old Weller 7 Year 107 Proof Handle 1988 Bottling

name: Elijah Craig 1990 21 Year Single Barrel #59
description: A 1990 vintage single barrel expression of Elijah Craig from Heaven Hill matured for 21 years. Crafted from spirit distilled at the original Heaven Hill springs site before it was destroyed in a fire in 1996.

name: Caroni 1998 22 Year Old Single Cask Tortuga No.1
description: The first edition in the Tortuga series of rum bottlings from East Asia Whisky Co featuring liquid sourced from the closed distillery Caroni. Distilled in 1998 and matured for 22 years it was bottled in 2021 at 66% Abv.
baxus_class_name: Caroni 1998 22 Year Old Single Cask Tortuga No.1

name: Double Eagle Very Rare 20 Year - 2020
description: This very limited 20-year-old bourbon whiskey lives up to its name, maturing twice as long as our standard Eagle Rare 10-year-old bourbon and featuring two beautifully-sculpted crystal glass eagles in the Double Eagle decanter. A true collectors’ item Double Eagle Very Rare is presented in a luxurious silver box and crystal decanter. Very few bottles were produced, with an individually-numbered letter of authenticity included with each.

name: Dos Artes Extra Anejo Skull Decanter
description: A limited edition hand-painted skull decanter released to commemorate 2020 Day of the Dead. This tequila is created by resting the Blanco 5 years in both French oak and white American oak barrels. It is then combined in a 80/20 mix favoring the French oak to create an incredibly bold extra añejo.
baxus_class_name: Dos Artes Extra Anejo Skull Decanter

name: SMWS G1.15 North British 1991 25 Year
description: A 1991 vintage single cask expression of single grain whisky from the North British distillery matured for 25 years in heavily toasted medium charred virgin oak butt. It was bottled at 63.9% Abv by the Scotch Malt Whisky Society,

name: SMWS 4.191 Highland Park 1991 22 Year
description: A 1991 vintage single cask expression of Highland Park matured for 22 years in a refill bourbon hogshead. It was bottled at 54.2% Abv by the Scotch Malt Whisky Society.

name: SMWS 127.9 Port Charlotte 2001 9 Year
description: A 2001 vintage single cask expression of Port Charlotte, a heavily peated spirit produced at the Bruichladdich distillery. This cask was matured for 9 years in a refill cask and bottled at 65.1% Abv.

name: SMWS 9.100 Glen Grant 2002 12 Year
description: A 2002 vintage single cask expression of Glen Grant matured for 12 years in a 1st fill bourbon barrel. It was bottled at 59.9% Abv by the Scotch Malt Whisky Society.

name: SMWS 23.63 Bruichladdich 7 Year
description: A 7 year old expression of Bruichladdich matured in a refill bourbon barrel and bottled at 62.6% Abv by the Scotch Malt Whisky Society.
series: Candy Floss by a Swimming Pool

name: Glen Scotia 23 Year Batch 1 Dram Select
description: The first batch in the Dram Select series, an independent label produced for the US market. This Glen Scotia was bottled by William Muir. Despite having been mothballed several times throughout its history, Glen Scotia is a proud survivor of the early 20th century desolation of Campbeltown, once known as the whisky capital of the world. The Kintyre peninsula formerly boasted over 30 distilleries,  but by the end of the 1920s, only this and Springbank remained. Shut for most of the 1990s before being re-opened by Loch Lomond Distillers, today Glen Scotia is one of only three in the region, and despite having a prominent portfolio of distillery bottlings in shops today, older releases like this -- even from independents -- are quite rare.
baxus_class_name: Glen Scotia 23 Year Batch 1 Dram Select

name: SMWS 137.8 English Whisky Co 2012 8 Year
description: A 2012 vintage single cask from The English Whisky Co aged for 8 years. This cask was first matured in a bourbon barrel before being finished in a 2nd fill heavily charred hogshead. It was bottled at 64.4% Abv by the Scotch Malt Whisky Society,

name: SMWS 4.225 Highland Park 2001 15 Year
description: A 2001 vintage single cask expression of Highland Park matured for 15 years in a refill sherry butt. It was bottled at 60.6% Abv by the Scotch Malt Whisky Society.

name: SMWS G14.1 Dumbarton 1986 28 Year
description: A 1986 vintage single cask expression of Dumbarton single grain whisky matured for 28 years in a refill bourbon barrel. It was bottled at 47.8% Abv by the Scotch Malt Whisky Society.

name: Balvenie The Week of Peat 14 Year
description: The Balvenie Week of Peat is a limited edition single malt that beautifully combines the distillery's traditional style with a week-long exposure to peat smoke during malting. The result is a subtly smoky whisky with Balvenie's signature complexity - honeyed sweetness, delicate fruit notes, and hints of vanilla and oak. This rare release appeals to whisky enthusiasts and collectors alike, offering a unique and sought-after experience that showcases the best of both worlds - Balvenie's craftsmanship and the allure of peat influence.
baxus_class_name: Balvenie The Week of Peat 14 Year

name: SMWS 138.5 Nantou 2014 5 Year
description: A 2014 vintage single cask of Taiwanese single malt whisky from the Nantou distillery matured for 5 years in a refill bourbon barrel. It was bottled at 55.5% Abv by the Scotch Malt Whisky Society.

name: BenRiach Blue Label 20 Year - 2013
description: A Silver Medal winner at the 2006 International Wine and Spirits Competition and a Gold Medal winner at the International Spirits Challenge a year prior; a superb 20 year old single malt from BenRiach.

name: Ardbeg 25 Year - 2020
description: Bottled from incredibly rare casks filled during some of the Distillery’s darkest days, this is Ardbeg at its most intricate, balanced and, beguiling. Majestic aromas of smoked cream and earthy bonfires are masterfully interwoven with layers of pine and fragrant candle wax. Hot pepper rises on the palate twisting around lemon sherbet sweetness while hints of carbolic soap and tar flow into a long aftertaste characterised by delicate aniseed entwined with lingering cream and fudge. Non chill-filtered with a strength of 46%

name: Ardbeg 2000 Single Cask #10 Bottled 2020
description: A 2000 vintage single cask expression of Ardbeg matured in a 1st fill bourbon barrel. Bottled in June 2020 at a cask strength of 46.7% Abv with 179 bottles produced exclusively for the US market.

name: Elijah Craig 1991 20 Year Single Barrel #42
description: A 1991 vintage single barrel expression of Elijah Craig from Heaven Hill matured for 20 years. Crafted from spirit distilled at the original Heaven Hill springs site before it was destroyed in a fire in 1996.

name: Bowmore 17 Year
description: A delightful 17 year old Islay malt that was distilled at Bowmore and released in the 1990’s in this iconic screen printed label. The liquid is beautifully balanced with great a complexity of citrus  chocolate and brine mingling with the peat.

name: Port Ellen 1983 35 Year Single Hogshead #DL13765 Douglas Laing
description: A 1983 vintage single cask expression of Port Ellen matured for a huge 35 years in a hogshead. Bottled in 2019 at 54.3% Abv by Douglas Laing as part of their premier XOP series. Just 133 bottles were produced from this cask.
baxus_class_name: Port Ellen 1983 35 Year Single Hogshead #DL13765 Douglas Laing

name: Heaven Hill 20 Year Single Cask Cadenhead's
description: A curious era bottling of Heaven Hill matured for 20 years and bottled in 2017 at 51% Abv by Cadenhead's. The Heaven Hill distillery in Bardstown, KY was tragically destroyed by a fire in November 1996, meaning this cask was distilled just slightly before the fire. It may also potentially be produced from stocks contract distilled by Heaven Hill from the likes of Beam, but this is more likely produced at HH just before the fire. Production did not restart until 1999 when the company acquired the Bernheim distillery from United Distillers.
baxus_class_name: Heaven Hill 20 Year Single Cask Cadenhead's

name: Tomatin 1965 37 Year Single Cask #20945 Duncan Taylor
description: This rare 37 year old Speyside single malt was laid to rest at the Tomatin distillery in January 1965 and bottled by Duncan Taylor & Co. Ltd for their Cask Strength Rare Auld series in December 2002. Yielded from oak cask number 20945 at a natural strength 48% ABV, this is one of only 200 bottles.
baxus_class_name: Tomatin 1965 37 Year Single Cask #20945 Duncan Taylor

name: Bruichladdich 1985 32 Year Rare Cask Bourbon: Hidden Glory
description: A 1985 vintage special release from Bruichladdich crafted from spirit distilled by the Islay site's previous owners. Originally filled into quite inert 3rd fill bourbon barrels, the mature single malt was then recasked into fresh bourbon barrels. Bottled at 48.7% Abv as part of the Rare Cask series.
baxus_class_name: Bruichladdich 1985 32 Year Rare Cask Bourbon: Hidden Glory

name: Eagle Rare 17 Year - 2013
description: From the distiller: "This rare bourbon ages in oak barrels for nearly two decades and is only available in small quantities once a year, every fall. Sip this polished, well-aged whiskey to appreciate why patience is such a virtue."

name: Bowmore 30 Year Old Sea Dragon 1990s Bottling
description: A special age statement from Bowmore, this 30 year old matured expression was bottled in the 1990s in a unique black ceramic bottle featuring imagery of a sea dragon. The sea dragon release is notoriously sought after as the distillate inside is from the 1960s, a magical era for Bowmore that produced such legendary releases such as the 1964 Black Bowmores.
baxus_class_name: Bowmore 30 Year Old Sea Dragon 1990s Bottling

name: Bowmore 15 Year Aston Martin Edition 2
description: A special 2021 edition of Bowmore's 15 year old duty free offering. Fully matured in 1st fill bourbon casks this expression was bottled at 43% Abv in a litre duty free format in collaboration with Aston Martin.

name: Benromach 20th Anniversary 19 year - 2018
description: Containing some of the first whisky distilled at Benromach when it reopened in 1998, this bottling celebrates the 20th anniversary of the distillery's rebirth under Gordon & MacPhail ownership. Lightly peated and aged in a combination of bourbon and sherry casks, this combines notes of fruit cake, vanilla, and gentle smoke.

name: A Midwinter Night’s Dram Act 7 Scene 2 - 2019
description: From the producer: "This limited-release whiskey is a sumptuous marriage of rye whiskeys finished in Port barrels. The rye forms a beautiful base of vanilla, caramel, and cinnamon while the port barrels provide notes of plum, dried fruit, and spice. Like a proper holiday plum pudding, it's brimming with lovely mulling spices, dried fruits, and crème anglaise. Sip it slowly through the coldest night."
baxus_class_name: A Midwinter Night’s Dram Act 7 Scene 2 - 2019

name: Don Julio Primavera
description: A new limited edition variant meticulously crafted to ensure liquid perfection that honors the legacy of Don Julio González's innovative spirit and is on par with the existing unparalleled portfolio. This deliciously smooth expression takes Tequila Don Julio’s traditional Reposado and finishes it in orange wine casks for a sophisticated  silky taste. A luxurious escape that knows only sunny skies and celebrates moments spent outdoors with friends  Casa Primavera embodies all that Tequila Don Julio Primavera has to offer.

name: Balblair 25 Year 2019 Bottling
description: A 25 year old expression of single malt whisky from the Highland distillery Balblair. Matured in both bourbon and sherry casks it was bottled in 2019 at 46% Abv.

name: Craigellachie 1995 24 Year Single Cask #5229
description: A 1995 vintage single cask expression of Craigellachie matured for 24 years in a sherry cask. Bottled in 2020 at a cask strength of 52.2% Abv it was chosen as part of the distillery’s exceptional cask series. This label is reserved for only the finest casks available throughout Craigellachie’s warehouses.

name: Dos Artes Blanco Skull Decanter
description: This is the Limited Edition Dos Artes Skull Tequila, a true collectors item that you won't get the chance to buy in the future! This Beautiful ceramic skull design is filled with Dos Artes Blanco, which is made from estate-grown 100%  blue agave.

name: Dalmore 30 Year The Stillman’s Dram 1998 Bottling
description: Distilled in the 1960’s, this small batch release of Highland single malt whisky from Dalmore was matured for 30 years. It was bottled in the late 1990s at 45% Abv as part of The Stillman’s Dram. This series featured a variety of Whyte & Mackay and Invergordon distillers in both small batch and single cask forms.
baxus_class_name: Dalmore 30 Year The Stillman’s Dram 1998 Bottling

name: Dos Artes Extra Anejo Ceramic Decanter
description: One Liter, very smooth and sipping Extra Anejo tequila. A must for any tequila collector, limited supply and quantity, it take several day just to make the ceramic bottle, and the tequila is one of the best. Dos Artes Extra Anejo Tequila is an exceptionally smooth and luxurious spirit, aged for a minimum of three years in oak barrels, boasting rich flavors of caramel, vanilla, and agave with a velvety finish.
baxus_class_name: Dos Artes Extra Anejo Ceramic Decanter

name: Dos Artes Reposado Ceramic Decanter
description: Dos Artes Reposado Tequila is a delightful and well-balanced spirit that has been aged for a minimum of six months in oak barrels, offering a harmonious fusion of agave sweetness and subtle hints of oak, culminating in a smooth and satisfying sipping experience.

name: Dos Artes Blanco Ceramic Decanter
description: Dos Artes Blanco Tequila is made from estate-grown 100%  blue agave, presented in One Liter (1L) ceramic bottles, each bottle is unique and has a story of it's own. This tequila is distributed in limited amounts, making it a lot harder to find than other tequilas.

name: Dos Artes Anejo Ceramic Decanter
description: Dos Artes Añejo Tequila is made from estate-grown 100% blue agave, presented in One Liter (1L) ceramic bottles, each bottle is unique and has a story of it's own. This tequila is distributed in limited amounts, making it a lot harder to find than other tequilas.

name: Compass Box Tobias & The Angel - 2019
description: A rather special limited edition release from Compass Box, "Tobias and the Angel," comprises just two parcels of whisky from Clynelish and Caol Ila, matured in refill Bourbon hogsheads before being vatted together. Only 2634 bottles are available worldwide. These distilleries have long been staples of the Compass Box bottlings but never with malt this old. Clynelish accounts for 50.9% of the blend and is a parcel of 24-year-old malt, while the Caol Ila accounts for the other 49.1%, and we are only told it is 'considerably older' (rumored to be a 34-year-old). Along with the beautiful artwork on the bottle (the original artwork was partly produced by Da Vinci), this is another stellar whisky highlighting the elements of both distilleries (waxy, grassy, citrus, earthy, and peaty) in a superb blended malt.

name: Buffalo Trace 1989 23 Year Old Experimental Collection 135 Gallon French Oak Barrels
description: A 1989 vintage single barrel from Buffalo Trace crafted from their #2 rye bourbon mashbill. Matured in a huge 135 gallon French oak cask this barrel was bottled in 2012 at 45% Abv as part of the experimental collection.
baxus_class_name: Buffalo Trace 1989 23 Year Old Experimental Collection 135 Gallon French Oak Barrels

name: Chichibu The First 3 Year - 2011
description: "Chichibu The First," released in 2011, is a remarkable Japanese whisky that marked the inception of the Chichibu Distillery, founded by Ichiro Akuto. As the inaugural expression from this distillery, it holds immense significance in the world of Japanese whisky. Crafted with utmost care and passion, "Chichibu The First" exudes an exquisite blend of flavors and aromas.

name: Chichibu London Edition 2020 Release
description: This is a blend of whiskies from seven casks that matured between six and eight years. The majority are ex-bourbon barrels, the others are refill ex-peated casks and casks that have been fitted with new Japanese Mizunara Oak heads. Only 1736 bottles of Ichiro's Malt Chichibu London Edition 2020 have been released.

name: Benriach 25 Year 2018 Bottling
description: A 25-year-old release from Benriach made from a combination of whisky finished in new wood and sherry butts. This has been bottled for the export market at 46.8%.

name: Caroni 1998 23 Year Old Single Cask Tortuga No.2
description: The second edition in the Tortuga series of rum bottlings from East Asia Whisky Co featuring liquid sourced from the closed distillery Caroni. Distilled in 1998 and matured for 23 years it was bottled in 2022 at 59.9% Abv.
baxus_class_name: Caroni 1998 23 Year Old Single Cask Tortuga No.2

name: Barrell Bourbon New Year 2017 Release
description: From the distiller: "New Year. New Beginnings. New Traditions. We came up with the idea of blending a bourbon to celebrate the New Year and gave ourselves free rein to develop something to capture the spirit of the season. It was the first time we blended barrels of different ages with different mashbills from different states and we had a lot of fun doing it. To date, every bourbon release has been a marriage of casks produced in the same distillation season. We do this to highlight different production styles aging techniques and age expressions. To commemorate 2017, we combined 5 to 13-year-old barrels from several different states which were distilled and aged using different techniques. We had one goal: to make the most captivating  delicious bourbon we could."

name: Old Rip Van Winkle 7 Year Bay Colony Bicentennial Decanter 1975 Release
description: This is an incredible piece of bourbon history. Following the forced sale of Stitzel-Weller distillery by the Van Winkle family in 1972  Julian II (son of the legendary 'Pappy') was granted an office and a license to continue procuring and bottling Stitzel-Weller stock on site as a gesture of goodwill by new distillery owners  Somerset Imports. Although Julian had sold the distillery and all of its brands, he retained one: the pre-prohibition Van Winkle label, which he immediately revived. The earliest releases from the Van Winkle brand were decanters like this. Bottled in 1975 at 7 years old, the Stitzel-Weller whiskey it contains would have been barrelled at the distillery while Julian II was still in charge. While Van Winkle was generally always bottled using Stitzel-Weller stock procured from its new owners, there aren't many like this that contain Van Winkle-era Stitzel-Weller whiskey. Following the death of Julian II, his son, Julian III took over the family business and moved bottling to Old Commonwealth distillery in 1983. With Stitzel-Weller's closure by United Distillers in 1992 causing his stocks to begin thinning out  Van Winkle reached an agreement with the Sazerac company to store and bottle his remaining stock. He also entrusted the production of new Van Winkle whiskey to their Buffalo Trace distillery, which was already using the familiar recipe to produce W.L. Weller, another former Stitzel-Weller brand. The Van Winkle brand we are familiar with today has been produced at Buffalo Trace since 2002. This -- a Van Winkle-era Stitzel-Weller bourbon bottled for the Van Winkle brand -- is a true collector's item. The decanter itself is a celebration of the Bay Colony bicentennial in 1975  and was produced by Cumberland Porcelain.
baxus_class_name: Old Rip Van Winkle 7 Year Bay Colony Bicentennial Decanter 1975 Release

name: Buffalo Trace 2002 9 Year Old Experimental Collection Made With Oats
description: A 2002 vintage expression of bourbon crafted from a special recipe of corn, malted barley and oats. 20 barrels were filled at a low entry proof of 102 & 115 and left to mature for 9 years. Aged in 6 month air dried white oak casks they were bottled in 2011 at 45% Abv as part of Buffalo Trace's experimental collection.
baxus_class_name: Buffalo Trace 2002 9 Year Old Experimental Collection Made With Oats

name: Buffalo Trace 1993 19 Year Old Experimental Collection Giant French Oak Barrels
description: A 1993 vintage single barrel from Buffalo Trace crafted from their #2 rye bourbon mashbill. Matured in a huge 135 gallon French oak cask this barrel was bottled in 2012 at 45% Abv as part of the experimental collection.
baxus_class_name: Buffalo Trace 1993 19 Year Old Experimental Collection Giant French Oak Barrels

name: Rowan's Creek Bourbon
description: A 100.1 proof offering of bourbon from Willett produced under their historic Rowan's Creek bourbon label.

name: Old Fitzgerald 1849 8 Year 1987 Bottling
description: A 1987 bottling of Old Fitzgerald's 1849 brand bourbon matured for 8 year and bottled at 90 proof.

name: Jack Daniel's Coy Hill Single Barrel 2024 Release
baxus_class_name: Jack Daniel's Coy Hill Single Barrel 2024 Release

name: Wild Turkey 9 Year Single Barrel #2931 For Whiskey Jewbilee 2016
description: A 9 year old expression of Wild Turkey bourbon matured on the 5th floor of rickhouse O. This barrel is unique amongst Wild Turkey releases as it is bottled at a barrel strength of 60.7% Abv instead of the required 55% Abv for a Russell's Reserve pick. This barrel was bottled exclusively for the 2016 NYC whiskey Jewbilee festival and was bottled by Single Cask Nation/The Jewish Whisky Company.
baxus_class_name: Wild Turkey 9 Year Single Barrel #2931 For Whiskey Jewbilee 2016

name: MGP Rye & Bourbon Blend For Whisky Jewbilee
description: A special blend of bourbon and rye whiskies from MGP in Indiana bottled exclusively for the Whiskey Jubilee Festival. This release contains 5 year old rye whiskey blended with 12 year old bourbon before being bottled at 53% Abv with 280 bottles produced.
baxus_class_name: MGP Rye & Bourbon Blend For Whisky Jewbilee

name: Glenmorangie 15 Year Pre-2007 Bottling
description: A pre-2007 era bottling of Glenmorangie matured for 15 years in American oak ex-bourbon casks before a finishing period in new wood oak casks. This age statement was discontinued in 2007.
series: Single Highland Rare Malt Scotch Whisky

name: Yellow Rose Of Texas 15 Year 1989 Bottling
description: A 1989 bottling of Yellow Rose Of Texas produced by Heaven Hill. This release was matured for 15 years and bottled at 101 proof. This era of the brand was produced at the original Heaven Hill Springs distillery before it burned down in 1996.
baxus_class_name: Yellow Rose Of Texas 15 Year 1989 Bottling

name: Yellow Rose Of Texas 15 Year 2001 Bottling
description: A 1989 bottling of Yellow Rose Of Texas produced by Heaven Hill. This release was matured for 15 years and bottled at 101 proof. This era of the brand was produced at the original Heaven Hill Springs distillery before it burned down in 1996.
baxus_class_name: Yellow Rose Of Texas 15 Year 2001 Bottling

name: Yellow Rose Of Texas 12 Year 1997 Bottling
baxus_class_name: Yellow Rose Of Texas 12 Year 1997 Bottling

name: Rebel Yell 1990s Bottling 1125ml
description: A 1990s era bottling of Rebel Yell bourbon imported for the Australian market. Bottled at 37.2% Abv in a 1125ml format. This era of the brand was owned by David Sherman/Luxco and contained spirit either sourced from Stitzel-Weller, or more likely Heaven Hill.

name: Old Rip Van Winkle 10 Year 2021 Bottling
description:
One of the most recognizable names in bourbon, the legacy of Pappy Van Winkle is both extensive and complex. Originating at the illustrious Stitzel-Weller distillery, the modern iteration of this incredibly hard-to-find whiskey is currently produced at Buffalo Trace in Kentucky. 

The youngest member of the Van Winkle line, the 10 year old is bottled at a higher proof of 107.
baxus_class_name: Old Rip Van Winkle 10 Year 2021 Bottling

name: Van Winkle 12 Year Special Reserve Lot "B" 2021 Bottling
description: This quite fabulous 12 year old straight Kentucky Bourbon whiskey was produced at the Old Rip Van Winkle distillery and was bottled at 45.2% ABV for the Van Winkle Special Reserve series. Drawn from charred American oak barrels, this limited edition Bourbon is released in very small batches annually and is described as a full-bodied, smooth and mature whiskey. First released in 1991, this series had just one release from Lot A before Lot B followed on.
baxus_class_name: Van Winkle 12 Year Special Reserve Lot "B" 2021 Bottling

name: Van Winkle 13 Year Family Reserve Rye 13 Year 2022 Bottling
description: A 13 year old expression of rye whiskey chosen by Julian Van Winkle and bottled at the Buffalo Trace distillery. This batch of rye whiskey was produced at Buffalo Trace and then selected by Julian Van Winkle for his line of bottlings.
baxus_class_name: Van Winkle 13 Year Family Reserve Rye 13 Year 2022 Bottling

name: Van Winkle 12 Year Special Reserve Lot "B" 2019 Bottling
description: A 2019 bottling of Van Winkle 12 year distilled by Buffalo Trace from their wheated mashbill. This release is chosen by Julian Van Winkle and bottled at 45.2% Abv.
baxus_class_name: Van Winkle 12 Year Special Reserve Lot "B" 2019 Bottling

name: Van Winkle 12 Year Special Reserve Lot "B" 2019 Bottling
description: A 2019 bottling of Van Winkle 12 year distilled by Buffalo Trace from their wheated mashbill. This release is chosen by Julian Van Winkle and bottled at 45.2% Abv.
baxus_class_name: Van Winkle 12 Year Special Reserve Lot "B" 2019 Bottling

name: Pappy Van Winkle 20 Year Family Reserve 1999-2002 Bottling
description: A circa 1999-2002 era bottling of Pappy Van Winkle's 20 year old. This era of the label was produced using sourced barrels Julian Van Winkle acquired from the Stitzel-Weller distillery. The 1998 release of the 20 year old featured green tinted glass, with this 1999-2002 era release having clear glass. Julian moved from his Lawrenceburg facility in 2002, shifting his operations to Buffalo Trace.
baxus_class_name: Pappy Van Winkle 20 Year Family Reserve 1999-2002 Bottling

name: Old Weller 7 Year 107 Proof 1977 Bottling
description: A 1977 bottling of Old Weller 107 proof bourbon matured for 7 years. This era of Weller was distilled at the Stitzel-Weller distillery from their wheated mash bourbon.

name: Wild Turkey 8 Year 101 Proof 2000 Bottling
description: A 2000 bottling of Wild Turkey's 8 year old age statement bottled at their signature 101 proof.

name: Bain's 21 Year Pinotage Cask Finish
description: A 21 year old expression of single grain whisky from the James Sedgewick distillery in South Africa bottled as part of their Bain's label. Finished in pinotage casks this release was bottled at 50.8% Abv in a 1 litre format with 325 bottles produced.

name: Three Ships 21 Year Millennium
description: The first release of 21 year old whisky from South African producer Three Ships. Matured in bourbon and Oloroso seasoned sherry oak casks it was bottled at 51.8% Abv.

name: Bain's 15 Year Single Grain Special Release
description: A 15 year old expression of single grain whisky from the James Sedgewick distillery released under their Bain's whisky label. This edition is bottled at 52.5% Abv in a 1 litre format.
baxus_class_name: Bain's 15 Year Single Grain Special Release

name: Fettercairn 28 Year 2018 Release
description: Aged in American White Oak ex-bourbon barrels for 28 years, this expression from Fettercairn is deep shimmering gold in colour. With initial bursts of pineapple and melon on the nose before giving way to treacle and banana, and hints of warm ginger and liquorice; this expression opens up to citrus peel and black pepper on first taste, followed by tempered walnuts, coffee, apricot, and a touch of sweet balsamic for a rewarding drinking experience.

name: Old Rip Van Winkle 1986 23 Year Family Selection Decanter 2009 Release
description: This outrageous 23 year old bourbon whiskey was distilled at the Van Winkle distillery in 1986 and bottled in 2009 for the Family Selection in this special limited edition crystal decanter. Bottled at 114 proof (57% ABV), this was the first time that the 23yo was offered at any other strength than the series standard 95.6 proof and is one of only 1200 sets released. Each crystal decanter was individually hand engraved and numbered and comes supplied in a lovely solid wood, leather-lined presentation case containing two Glencairn glasses and a signed COA by company President, Julian P. Van Winkle III.
baxus_class_name: Old Rip Van Winkle 1986 23 Year Family Selection Decanter 2009 Release

name: George T. Stagg 2017 Release
description: A 2019 release of the annual George T Stagg bourbon crafted from Buffalo Trace's #1 low rye mashbill. This batch was distilled in spring 2002 matured for 15 years and 3 months and is bottled at 64.6% Abv.

name: Glenfiddich Winter Storm Batch 2
description: From the distiller: "For our third experiment, malt master Brian Kinsman travelled to Canada to meet a renowned winemaker in Niagara. There he learned how the grapes had to be picked by moonlight at -10 degrees Celsius to produce the intensely sweet icewine. Upon his return to the Glenfiddich distillery Brian started experimenting with several French oak icewine casks from the Canadian winery, filling them with different Glenfiddich aged malts for up to six months. Only the rarer whiskies, those aged for 21 years, could cope with the extra icewine intensity." This is the second release.

name: Wilderness Trail Single Barrel BAXUS Exclusive
description:
Barrel #767775 is a BAXUS-exclusive family reserve high-rye bourbon from the Wilderness Trail distillery, bottled at cask strength of 58.5% ABV. This barrel was selected at the distillery by members of the BAXUS team, as well as two community members chosen to join the trip based on the bottles of bourbon they had listed in their collections on the app. The legendary whiskey writer David Tao also participated in selecting this bourbon, which was chosen from among seven other options as the most outstanding of the lot. This particularly small barrel yielded only 144 bottles, rather than the standard 200, further highlighting its concentrated flavor profile. It was matured for 5 years in an ISC Classic #4 charred barrel and fermented with yeast strain 927.

Wilderness Trail is one of the most innovative distilleries in the world, particularly renowned for its focus on yeast due to its long history as fermentation experts. In 2006, Dr. Pat Heist and Shane Baker founded FermSolutions, a consulting firm that created unique yeast strains and provided technical assistance to distilleries and breweries across the United States. After seven years, the firm had established itself so well in Kentucky distilling circles that Heist and Baker decided to set up their own distillery.

Wilderness Trail Distillery was built in 2013 in Danville, initially using a pot still before expanding twice to ramp up production. The founders initially focused on contract distillation for other brands but later began producing barrels for themselves, with varying mash bills, including a high-rye, wheated, and traditional rye mash bill. Their industry-leading experience in fermentation innovation means the yeast strain used for each mash is just as important as the grains or stills used. Whiskey is fundamentally made of water, yeast, and grain, with most modern distillers primarily adjusting the grain to create new products. Wilderness Trail's fundamentally scientific approach means these different yeast strains can create various types of spirits using the same mash bill, with one potentially being fruit-forward while another is heavier and earthier in character.

Typically choosing to release their spirits around the 4- to 6-year mark, their expertise in all aspects of production has allowed them to create a flavor-first style of whiskey at a relatively young age. This innovative brilliance caught the eye of the large Italian drinks company Campari, which purchased a 70% stake in Wilderness Trail in October 2022, with the final 30% to be purchased in 2031. The deal was reportedly valued at $420 million, signifying just how valuable the new Kentucky producer has become in the market.
baxus_class_name: Wilderness Trail Single Barrel BAXUS Exclusive

name: Russell's Reserve 15 Year 2024 Release
description: One of the most sought after bourbons of 2024, this Russell's Reserve 15 year old has been crafted from barrels hand picked by Eddie Russell that were earmarked and carefully tasted throughout the last decade. Bottled 58.6% Abv, just slightly above their barrel entry proof of 115, this higher proof offering from the Russells was reportedly aged in Camp Nelson. Turkey fans will be familiar with this warehouse, with Camp Nelson known to be the location where some of the best barrels are stored.

name: Hibiki Blossom Harmony - 2022
description:
From the distiller: "Hibiki means “Resonance” in Japanese. From its launch in 1989 to commemorate the 60th Anniversary of Suntory, Hibiki embodies the Suntory philosophy to live in harmony with nature and people. As the Founding House of Japanese Whisky and A House of Master Blenders, the House of Suntory has gone to great lengths to explore the breadth and depth of what Harmony can mean for a blend. Every Hibiki expression is one of the most sought after blends in the world where every Hibiki expression is meticulously crafted for us to discover a different kind of Harmony. Achieving the right balance and orchestration proved to be a great challenge from the start since the Sakura cask is one with strong character that can easily become overbearing. 

After much trial and error, we found that the grain whiskies finished in the Sakura cask best elevated the overall balance as a Blossoming Harmony slowly unfolding. The end result is a particularly unique expression of Hibiki. The invitation of an enticing floral bouquet, followed by the signature Hibiki depth and complexity of honey, candied orange peel, jasmine and chocolatey decadence, all climaxing to a surprising finish of bitter sweet spicy notes."

name: Weller Special Reserve
description:
Weller Special Reserve is a Kentucky straight bourbon whiskey produced by Buffalo Trace Distillery, known for its smooth and approachable character. This wheated bourbon, crafted using Buffalo Trace's wheated mashbill, is bottled at 90 proof (45% ABV). On the nose, it offers inviting aromas of vanilla, caramel, and a hint of dried fruit. The palate presents a harmonious blend of honey, butterscotch, and soft woodiness, complemented by subtle notes of cinnamon and citrus.

As the entry-level offering in the Weller lineup, Special Reserve delivers a sweet and mellow drinking experience that appeals to both bourbon enthusiasts and newcomers alike. Its softer flavor profile, attributed to the use of wheat instead of rye in the mashbill, makes it versatile for sipping neat or as a base for cocktails. While it has become increasingly difficult to find due to high demand, Weller Special Reserve remains an excellent value at its suggested retail price, offering a quality bourbon experience that showcases the appealing characteristics of wheated bourbons. Despite its growing scarcity, it continues to be appreciated for its smooth taste and well-balanced flavor, making it a sought-after bottle in the world of American whiskey.

name: Highland Park 1973 32 Year Single Cask #8375 For Park Avenue Liquors
description: An extremely rare 32-year-old single malt scotch from Highland Park, this whisky was distilled in 1972 and bottled in 2005 at an ABV of 41.3%. Chosen exclusively for Park Avenue Liquors.
baxus_class_name: Highland Park 1973 32 Year Single Cask #8375 For Park Avenue Liquors

name: Glenfiddich Winter Storm Batch 1
description: From the distiller: "For our third experiment, malt master Brian Kinsman travelled to Canada to meet a renowned winemaker in Niagara. There he learned how the grapes had to be picked by moonlight at -10 degrees Celsius to produce the intensely sweet icewine. Upon his return to the Glenfiddich distillery Brian started experimenting with several French oak icewine casks from the Canadian winery, filling them with different Glenfiddich aged malts for up to six months. Only the rarer whiskies, those aged for 21 years, could cope with the extra icewine intensity." This is the first release.

name: Blanton's Single Barrel 1991 Bottling
description:
The Blanton's Single Barrel Bourbon, based on a review from 1991, emanates a classic and well-rounded profile. Originating from barrel #288, situated in Warehouse H, Rick 48, and decanted on July 1, 1991, this bourbon displays a proof of 93, indicating an alcohol content of 46.5%.

Upon olfactory examination, this bourbon presents a delightful trio of aromas, encompassing caramel, brown sugar, and sweet herbs, forming a sweet and inviting nose that beckons the taster.

Transitioning to the palate, it initially unveils a sweet landscape dominated by the richness of brown sugar complemented by a hint of maple syrup. As the tasting journey progresses, a notable transition occurs, ushering in a spicier profile mid-palate, which adds a contrasting yet harmonious layer to the tasting experience.

Although the review does not correspond to the specific barrel number H-48 288, it sheds light on the meticulous craftsmanship and the quality of flavors one might anticipate from a Blanton's Single Barrel Bourbon of the early 1990s era. This vintage bourbon, with its blend of sweet and spicy notes, embodies the timeless and cherished characteristics associated with Blanton's bourbon lineage.

name: Macallan 25 Year Fine Oak Pre-2018 Bottling
description: The Macallan Fine Oak 25 Year Old forms part of the Fine Oak range and is matured for a minimum of twenty-five years in three exceptional oak cask types. This complex combination of casks delivers a robust flavor profile with notes of vanilla, peach, and sherry.
baxus_class_name: Macallan 25 Year Fine Oak Pre-2018 Bottling

name: Russell's Reserve 13 Year Batch 4
description: The 4th batch of Wild Turkey's hugely popular 13 year old age statement bottled in the Russell's Reserve series. Bottled at barrel proof, the 4th batch was released in Spring 2023. First introduced in 2021, the 13 year old expression has rapidly become a serious fan favourite and in 2021 esteemed writer Fred Minnick awarded it his American whiskey of the year.

name: Ardbeg Kildaton 2013 Release
description:
Tasting notes from the producer
NOSE
A beautiful, seductive, exotic bouquet, with hints of smoked apricots in syrup, salt and pepper seasoning and some soft, creamy vanilla. This then leads in to a symphony of smoky and herbal notes, like woodsmoke, tar, menthol and fennel. A little water releases more volatile top notes, like pine resin, vetiver root, coriander, liquorice and a curious soapy note.
TASTE
The texture is soft, ‘sappy’, gently coating the tongue. The explosion of firm robust flavours is unquestionably Ardbeg – coal tar soap, aniseed, peppermint, espresso coffee, sweet barley malt and a lingering, aromatic smokiness.
FINISH
The lingering finish is both fresh with menthol and spicy, with hints of allspice, clove and bitter almonds, finally revealing a distant vanilla essence sweetness.

name: Willett 10 Year Single Barrel Bourbon #2894 For LeNell's
description:
This 10 year old single barrel bourbon from Willett was crafted from a mashbill of 72% corn, 13% rye and 15% malted barley. It was matured in warehouse A on the 4th floor and was bottled at 65.8% Abv exclusively for LeNell's. 

A legendary name in the bourbon industry, LeNell's was founded by LeNell Camacho Santa Ana. Now a true industry icon, LeNell opened her first store in 2003 in Brooklyn and rapidly built the location into a premier American whiskey destination. She frequently collaborated with brands on special releases for the store and throughout her six year period of operating in Brooklyn, she established LeNell's as one of the greatest liquor stores on the planet. It was through her collaboration with KBD, otherwise known as Willett, that she would establish her own brand of rye whiskey called Red Hook Rye. This mature rye whiskey was sourced from Willett who held an extremely deep archive of well matured American whiskies.

Willett had stopped distilling themselves in the 1980s amid a serious downturn in the market, instead pivoting to being a bottler of other distillery's products. This meant that they had slowly established a serious collection of barrels from various distilleries across Kentucky who were either closing amid the industry downturn, or rapidly scrambling to sell barrels at very low prices.

LeNell contacted KBD and the company was more than happy to provide very old barrels of rye whiskey for her Red Hook Rye brand. She chose barrels that were 23 & 24 years of age, a set of ages that are unheard of in rye whiskey. This series of bottlings has become mythic amongst whiskey collectors and routinely breaks auction records each time one is unearthed. It is heralded as the greatest rye, if not the greatest American whiskey, ever produced.
baxus_class_name: Willett 10 Year Single Barrel Bourbon #2894 For LeNell's

name: Glenfarclas 1983 Single Cask #30 Bottled 2011
description: Distilled in 1983 this single cask expression of Glenfarclas was matured and bottled in 2011 at 49.5% Abv. Bottled as part of their Family Casks series, this label identifies exceptional vintage casks from the distillery’s deep archives.

name: Russell’s Reserve Single Rickhouse Camp Nelson B 2024 Release
description: The third edition in Wild Turkey's Single Rickhouse series, this 2024 release uses barrels exclusively drawn from Camp Nelson B. This warehouse was built in 1946 and features seven floors. The site is elevated and is consistently exposed to high levels of sun, making for a very warm maturation environment. For this release the barrels were pulled from the 6th floor of the rickhouse, focusing on those that have experienced the most sun to create a very oak heavy expression. Bottled at 120.2 proof this is a super limited bottling exclusively based on how selective Eddie Russell has been with his barrel choice.
baxus_class_name: Russell’s Reserve Single Rickhouse Camp Nelson B 2024 Release

name: Macallan 30 Year Fine Oak Pre-2018 Bottling
description: A pre-2018 era bottling of Macllan's 30 year old age stated expression in their fine oak range. This series of bottlings sees Macallan matured in sherry seasoned European & American oak as well as bourbon casks. This series was discontinued in 2018 and renamed the triple cask series.
baxus_class_name: Macallan 30 Year Fine Oak Pre-2018 Bottling

name: 2006 Opus One - 6L
description: A Methusaleh (Imperial) 6 Liter bottle of the 2006 vintage with original Wooden wine case from the famed Opus One winery in Napa Valley, California.A saturated black-purple, the 2006 Opus One shows aromas of fresh cut roses, licorice, dark chocolate, blackberry pie, smoked bacon and sassafras. Simultaneously silky and dense on the palate, this unfined wine offers flavors of cassis, espresso and zesty black cherry with a persistently smooth yet expansive finish. Varietals: Cabernet Sauvignon- 77%, Merlot-12%, Cabernet Franc-5%, Petit Verdot-3%, Malbec 3%. Skin Contact: 26 Days, Barrel Aged for 17 months in new French Oak. Source: Opus One

name: Dad's Hat Single Barrel Rye #456 For Club Marzipan
description: A 2018 vintage single barrel expression of Pennsylvania rye distilled by Dad's Hat. Bottled in 2024 at 64% Abv it was chosen exclusively for Club Marzipan, the exclusive members club run by American whiskey writer Fred Minnick.
baxus_class_name: Dad's Hat Single Barrel Rye #456 For Club Marzipan

name: Blanton's Single Barrel 1989 Bottling
description: Blanton’s Original was the first bourbon to be bottled from a single barrel back in 1984, revolutionising American whiskey and bringing it back to its former glory. Every batch is unique and the bottling strength of 46.5% helps maintain the authentic character of each barrel.

name: Suntory Old Grain
description:
Suntory old whisky is a series of whiskies from Suntory, first released in 1950 when it was considered the classiest of all of Suntory’s whiskies. This particular bottles is elegant, delicious and very rare today. It’s a real gem that carries with it a little bit of history. 
Tasting Notes Nose: Full-bodied aroma.  Palate: Lovely, mild on the tongue with a slight burn at the end.  Finish: Finish is smooth and long.

name: Glenlivet 1977 42 Year Old Single Hogshead #22140 Gordon & Macphail
description: This 42-year-old Glenlivet was distilled on December 12, 1977, and matured in a refill American hogshead for over four decades. It was bottled in 2020 at a natural cask strength of 42.4% ABV. This is one of only 65 bottles that were released as part of Gordon and MacPhail's Private Collection.
baxus_class_name: Glenlivet 1977 42 Year Old Single Hogshead #22140 Gordon & Macphail

name: Springbank 18 Year Old 2018 Bottling
description: A 2018 bottling of Springbank's 18 year old core age statement. This release was comprised of 100% bourbon casks, a relatively rare vatting from the distillery. Bottled at 46% Abv and non-chill filtered.

name: Old Grand Dad 1917 Bottled 1933
description: A 1917 vintage expression of Old Grand-Dad that was actually distilled at the Old Taylor (DSP 19) distillery by Richard E Wathen. The Wathen family purchased the Old Grand-Dad brands in 1899  along with the distillery at Hobbs Station. When prohibition hit the American Medicinal Spirits Co took over their interests, bottling their barrels.

name: Convalmore 1984 32 Year Old Cask Strength
description: Sourced from the closed Speyside distillery Convalmore, this 1984 vintage was matured for 32 years and bottled in 2017 as part of the Diageo special releases. It was bottled at a natural cask strength of 48.2% Abv. Convalmore spent much of the 20th century as a malt component in DCL’s blended whiskies like Johnnie Walker. The site closed in 1985 and remaining stocks have slowly found their way into releases from Diageo.

name: Tomatin 1978 Warehouse 6 Collection Bottled 2020
description: A 1978 vintage small batch offering of Tomatin matured in a pair of 1st fill Oloroso sherry casks. Matured for over four decades this well matured Highland single malt was bottled at 47% Abv with just 350 bottles total produced.

name: Glenmorangie a Tale of Cake
description: Glenmorangie A Tale of Cake is a limited-edition single malt whisky that was created by Dr. Bill Lumsden, the Director of Whisky Creation at Glenmorangie. The whisky is finished in Tokaji dessert wine casks, which gives it a unique flavor profile that is both sweet and complex.

name: George T. Stagg 2010 Release
description: A high proof expression of bourbon from Buffalo Trace bottled under the George T Stagg label as part of their annual Buffalo Trace Antique Collection. This 2010 release was matured for over 17 years and bottled at a huge 143 proof.

name: Highland Park Hjärta
description: Hjarta is the ancient Norse word for heart. Orkney was under Nordic rule until 1468 when it was gifted to Scotland. This limited edition celebrates their rich cultural heritage   Nose: Very fruity, cherries, pineapple, green apple, cheesecake, oak. Lusciously sweet. Palate: Initially creamy caramel. Then the rich fruits come forward with the caramel playing the supportive role, almost coating the fruits. A bit of smoke wanders throughout. Robust flavors. Finish: The unique Orkney peat comes forward, but a bit more restrained than other HP's. A faint hint of char. At the very end, there's any extremely subtle note of pineapple that the smoke almost covers up. Wish it were a bit longer, but interesting nonetheless.

name: Wild Turkey Batch W-T-01-93 Rare Breed
description: A 1993 release of Wild Turkey Rare Breed, a barrel proof expression of bourbon. Older editions of Wild Turkey are particularly sought after amongst enthusiasts, notably for their remarkably different taste profile to modern Wild Turkey bottles. The distillery originally produced bourbon using cypress wood tanks but these were slowly phased out from 1984 until 1990. The other notable production change came in 2004 when the barrel entry proof was changed to 110, up from 107. The combination of these changes have resulted in serious demand for older vintage bottlings from the much loved distillery, with some believing 1990s era bottlings to be the distillery’s best ever.
baxus_class_name: Wild Turkey Batch W-T-01-93 Rare Breed

name: Balvenie Double Wood 17 Year
description:
Balvenie Double Wood 17 Year is a refined expression from the esteemed Balvenie Distillery, known for its commitment to traditional craftsmanship. This single malt Scotch whisky undergoes a unique maturation process, initially aged in ex-bourbon casks before being finished in European oak sherry casks, allowing it to develop a rich and complex flavor profile.

On the nose, the 17-Year Double Wood presents inviting aromas of oak, vanilla, and cinnamon sugar, complemented by hints of citrus and salted caramel. The palate reveals a delightful interplay of flavors, featuring notes of dried fruits, honey, and creamy toffee, with a subtle spiciness that enhances its depth.

The finish is smooth and lingering, characterized by warm oak and gentle vanilla notes. This expression beautifully balances the sweetness from the bourbon cask aging with the richer characteristics imparted by the sherry casks, resulting in a sophisticated dram that appeals to both seasoned whisky enthusiasts and newcomers alike. Balvenie Double Wood 17 Year is a testament to the distillery's heritage and craftsmanship, offering a luxurious tasting experience.

name: Hibiki Blossom Harmony 2021 Release
description: A special edition release from Hibiki, the award winning blend from Suntory crafted from Yamazaki & Hakushu malt whisky with Chita grain whisky. This blossom harmony edition sees Suntory's signature blended whisky matured in cherry blossom sakura wood casks.

name: Yamazaki Very Rare Old
description: The Suntory Very Rare Old Whisky, distilled and bottled by Suntory Limited at their Yamazaki distillery in Osaka, Japan, is a blend of select malt whiskies that presents itself with a classic and elegant design. The bottle, with its distinctive red cap and vintage label, exudes a sense of rarity and quality, as suggested by the "Very Rare Old" designation. This whisky, with its dark amber hue, is bottled at 80 proof (40% ABV), offering a taste of Suntory's reputable craftsmanship. While the name implies exclusivity, it is noted that this whisky, despite its title, is not as rare as one might expect, yet it is recognized for its excellence. The Yamazaki Very Rare Old is a piece of Suntory's storied history, a brand that has built its reputation on such distinguished blends, making it a desirable addition to any whisky enthusiast's collection.

name: Dominican 6 Year Single Cask #4 Rolling Fork
description: A 6 year old expression of Dominican rum produced on a column still from molasses. Bottled by Rolling Fork at 55% Abv for the US market.
baxus_class_name: Dominican 6 Year Single Cask #4 Rolling Fork

name: Jack Daniel's Oloroso Sherry Finish Distillery Series Selection #12
description:
Jack Daniel's Distillery Series is an innovative line of limited-edition expressions that showcases the distillery's commitment to experimentation and craftsmanship. This series features unique offerings that highlight different aging processes and flavor profiles, allowing whiskey enthusiasts to explore the versatility of Jack Daniel's.

One notable release from this series is the Distillery Series Selection #12, which is a straight Tennessee whiskey finished in Oloroso sherry casks. This expression offers a delightful interplay of flavors, with aromas of pink bubble gum, maple sugar, and light barrel char leading to a palate rich in dry oak, leather, and subtle baking spices.

Another standout is the Distillery Series Selection #13, a Tennessee Straight Rye Whiskey that undergoes a twice-barreled process. Aged initially in new charred American white oak barrels, it is then transferred to a second barrel for additional maturation. This method enhances the whiskey's depth and character, showcasing a bold spiciness balanced by sweetness.
