The Distillery Series is not just about unique flavors; it reflects Jack Daniel's heritage and innovative spirit. Each release is crafted with care, inviting consumers to experience the distinct qualities that make Jack Daniel's a beloved name in the world of whiskey. Whether you are a long-time fan or new to the brand, the Distillery Series offers an exciting journey through the rich landscape of Tennessee whiskey.
baxus_class_name: Jack Daniel's Oloroso Sherry Finish Distillery Series Selection #12

name: Lagavulin 18 Year Feis Ile 2018
description: An 18 year old expression of Lagavulin matured in refill American oak hogsheads, rejuvenated American oak hogsheads and ex Bodega sherry butts. This release was bottled at 53.9% Abv in 2018 to celebrate the annual Islay Feis Ile festival.

name: Hibiki Kacho Fugestu 21 - 2015
description: Kacho Fugetsu is the Japanese Kanji for Flowers and Lunar. This bottle is designed to embody the beauty of Japanese nature, and is beautifully handprinted across the 24 elegant facets that make up Hibiki’s signature bottle style.

name: Old Grand Dad 1917 Bottled 1932 Half Pint
description: A 1917 vintage expression of Old Grand-Dad that was actually distilled at the Old Taylor (DSP 19) distillery by Richard E Wathen. The Wathen family purchased the Old Grand-Dad brands in 1899  along with the distillery at Hobbs Station. When prohibition hit the American Medicinal Spirits Co took over their interests, bottling their barrels.
baxus_class_name: Old Grand Dad 1917 Bottled 1932 Half Pint

name: Bruichladdich 18 Year - 2008
description: Aged in bourbon casks prior to a finishing spell in Israeli kosher wine casks, this unique single malt is bottled at 46%.

name: Wild Turkey Rare Breed Non Chill-Filtered - 2018
description:
Wild Turkey Distillery, located in Lawrenceburg, Kentucky, is renowned for its storied heritage and commitment to producing exceptional bourbon whiskey. Founded in 1869 by the Ripy brothers, Wild Turkey has upheld a tradition of craftsmanship and quality for over a century. The distillery is known for its use of high-quality ingredients, including a high proportion of rye in its mash bill, which contributes to the bold and robust flavor profile of its bourbons. Wild Turkey bourbons are aged in new, charred oak barrels, imparting rich notes of caramel, vanilla, and spice. With its iconic turkey logo and dedication to traditional methods, Wild Turkey remains a cherished name in the world of American whiskey.

Rare Breed is a standout release from Wild Turkey, showcasing the distillery's prowess in crafting high-proof, full-bodied bourbons. This expression is a blend of Wild Turkey bourbons aged 6, 8, and 12 years, selected for their exceptional character and complexity. Bottled at barrel proof without chill filtration, Rare Breed delivers an intense and robust flavor experience. On the palate, expect a harmonious blend of sweet caramel, dark fruits, baking spices, and a hint of leather. The high ABV provides a warming sensation, complemented by a long and satisfying finish. Rare Breed exemplifies Wild Turkey's dedication to producing bold and flavorful bourbons, making it a favorite among enthusiasts seeking a powerful yet balanced whiskey experience.
baxus_class_name: Wild Turkey Rare Breed Non Chill-Filtered - 2018

name: Hibiki Japanese Harmony 30th Anniversary - 2018
description: The Hibiki Japanese Harmony 30th Anniversary Limited Edition, released in 2018, is a special bottling created to celebrate 30 years of the Hibiki brand. This exquisite blend is crafted from carefully selected malt and grain whiskies from Suntory's Yamazaki, Hakushu, and Chita distilleries. Bottled at 43% ABV, it features a harmonious and complex flavor profile. The nose offers aromas of rose, lychee, and a hint of rosemary, complemented by mature woodiness and sandalwood. On the palate, it presents honey-like sweetness, candied orange peel, and white chocolate, leading to a subtle, tender, and long finish with hints of Mizunara (Japanese oak). The bottle design is inspired by a traditional kimono pattern and is embellished with the tabane-noshi, a traditional Japanese symbol of celebration, reflecting the brand's dedication to craftsmanship and the celebration of life's special moments.

name: Blanton's Single Barrel 1990 Bottling
description: Blanton’s Original was the first bourbon to be bottled from a single barrel back in 1984, revolutionising American whiskey and bringing it back to its former glory. Every batch is unique and the bottling strength of 46.5% helps maintain the authentic character of each barrel.

name: Hibiki 21 Year
description: Arguably the world’s most sought after blended whisky, Hibiki is crafted by Suntory in Japan with malts from their Hakushu and Yamazaki distilleries as well as grain whisky from Chita. Presented in a stunning glass bottle featuring 24 sides to represent the 24 seasons in Japan, Hibiki exploded in popularity throughout the 2010s leading to many of the age stated expressions being discontinued. This 21 year old expression features very well matured Japanese spirit that is always in such short supply due to the extreme popularity of the harmonious blend.

name: Bowmore 25 Year Old The Gulls 1990s Bottling
description: A 1990’s era bottling of Bowmore matured for 25 years and bottled in a unique black ceramic decanter. This series is commonly known as “The Gulls”, drawn from the unique design on the bottle. The gulls tells the story of two Scottish lovers, a princess and a warrior who were shipwrecked at Loch Indaal on Islay. The clans never found the pair, instead finding two white gulls circling the wreck.
baxus_class_name: Bowmore 25 Year Old The Gulls 1990s Bottling

name: Hibiki 17 Year Kacho Fugestu
description: The Hibiki 17 Year Old Kacho Fugetsu, released in 2016, is a limited edition Japanese whisky from Suntory, renowned for its exquisite craftsmanship and exceptional quality. This expression, which translates to "Flowers, Birds, Breeze, and Lunar Phases," embodies the beauty of Japanese nature and is presented in a bottle with 24 facets representing the ancient Japanese lunar calendar. Less than 1000 bottles were produced, making it a highly sought-after collector's item. The whisky is a harmonious blend of hand-selected matured malts and grain whiskies from Suntory's Yamazaki, Hakushu, and Chita distilleries, all aged for a minimum of 17 years. Bottled at 43% ABV, it offers a sweet floral aroma combined with a natural wood essence, creating a distinctive and full-bodied taste. The bottle is beautifully decorated with chrysanthemum and crane motifs in traditional Maki-e patterns, symbolizing felicitations and wishing happiness and good fortune.

name: Elixir Distillers Imperial 23 Year - 2020
description: A limited edition bottling of a 23 year old Single Malt whisky from the Imperial Distillery. As the distillery has since been closed down, releases like this one are extremely rare.

name: Royal Lochnagar Selected Reserve 2007 Release
description: A special release of precious few individually numbered bottles, drawn from selected casks held in reserve to commemorate the very day of Queen Victoria's visit to Royal Lochnagar in 1848,

name: Old Fitzgerald Bottled in Bond 13 Year 25th Anniversary
description:
The Old Fitzgerald Bottled in Bond 13 Year Anniversary Edition is a remarkable bourbon that celebrates Heaven Hill's 25th anniversary of acquiring the Old Fitzgerald brand.

This unique expression was distilled in September 1999, shortly after Heaven Hill's acquisition of the Bernheim Distillery. It aged for 13 years before being transferred to a holding tank, where it waited for over a decade for a special occasion. The result is a bourbon that offers a glimpse into the distillery's past while showcasing the exceptional quality of well-aged wheated bourbon.

On the nose, this Old Fitzgerald presents a rich bouquet of aromas, including aged wood varnish, leather, vanilla frosting, and toasted coconut. There are also hints of brown sugar, salted nuts, and melted rum raisin ice cream, creating a complex and inviting olfactory experience.

The palate delivers a harmonious blend of flavors, with prominent notes of seasoned oak and leather that speak to its extended aging. Vanilla, coffee, and chocolate notes mingle with fruity undertones of cherry, spiced baked apples, and sweetened dried apricots. Notably, the heat is more subdued compared to younger Old Fitzgerald releases, allowing the nuanced flavors to shine.

The finish is remarkably long and oak-forward, with additional notes of scorched caramel, subtle almond, and drying leather. Despite the robust oak presence, the bourbon maintains a balance that prevents it from becoming overly bitter.

This limited edition Old Fitzgerald, bottled at 100 proof as per Bottled in Bond requirements, is exclusively available at the Heaven Hill Bourbon Experience in Bardstown, Kentucky. Its unique provenance and exceptional flavor profile make it a highly sought-after release for bourbon enthusiasts and collectors alike.
baxus_class_name: Old Fitzgerald Bottled in Bond 13 Year 25th Anniversary

name: Van Winkle 12 Year Special Reserve Lot "B"
description: This quite fabulous 12 year old straight Kentucky Bourbon whiskey was produced at the Old Rip Van Winkle distillery and was bottled at 45.2% ABV for the Van Winkle Special Reserve series. Drawn from charred American oak barrels, this limited edition Bourbon is released in very small batches annually and is described as a full-bodied, smooth and mature whiskey. First released in 1991, this series had just one release from Lot A before Lot B followed on.
baxus_class_name: Van Winkle 12 Year Special Reserve Lot "B"

name: Glendronach 1995 19 Year Single Puncheon #3250 For The UK
description: A 19 year old single cask Glendronach (#3250) distilled in 1995 and bottled at cask strength in 2014, aged in a Pedro Ximenez sweet sherry cask. Every year since being taken over by Billy Walker in 2008 (The Benriach Distillery Co), Glendronach has invested in several high-quality single casks and the traditional expressions aged in sherry casks have been joined by more unusual maturations, such as port and bourbon casks. A limited edition of 554 bottles.
baxus_class_name: Glendronach 1995 19 Year Single Puncheon #3250 For The UK

name: William Larue Weller 12 Year - 2015
description: From the distiller: "Uncut and unfiltered, this hand-bottled bourbon is barrel proof. Weller substitutes wheat for the traditional rye grain, a production method pioneered by W.L. Weller."

name: Arran The Illicit Stills Smugglers' Series Special Consignment
description: Arran Distillery's Smugglers' Series, specifically "The Illicit Stills" released in 2015. This single malt Scotch whisky from the Isle of Arran is a tribute to the island's history of illicit distilling. Bottled at cask strength with an ABV of 56.4%, it is non-chill filtered and boasts all-natural color. The whisky combines both un-peated and heavily peated malt, with some of it matured in Port Pipes, offering a complex profile of citrus, wood, and fruit notes. The label emphasizes its special consignment and dedication to traditional methods, reflecting the distillery's commitment to quality and heritage.
baxus_class_name: Arran The Illicit Stills Smugglers' Series Special Consignment

name: Springbank 1997 23 Year Single Cask #289 The Whisky Baron
description:
A 1997 vintage single cask expression of Campbeltown whisky from the Springbank distillery. This cask was mature for 23 years in a sherry butt before being bottled in 2020 at 54.6% Abv by new independent bottler The Whisky Baron. 
.
baxus_class_name: Springbank 1997 23 Year Single Cask #289 The Whisky Baron

name: Arran The High Seas Smugglers' Series Second Consignment
description:
Launched in October 2016, The High Seas stands proudly as a distinguished member of the Smugglers’ Series Volume 2, paying homage to the audacious distillers who cunningly outmaneuvered government officials while navigating the treacherous Arran Waters. This exceptional release is a testament to the ingenuity and daring spirit of those who dared to defy authority in pursuit of their craft.

Matured in a carefully curated combination of rum casks and first-fill bourbon barrels, The High Seas boasts a complexity and depth of character reminiscent of the fearless individuals who inspired its creation. With only 8,700 bottles produced, each sip offers a voyage of discovery, unveiling layers of rich flavors and captivating aromas that transport the palate to distant shores and adventurous times.

Experience the allure of The High Seas—a whisky that embodies the essence of adventure, defiance, and craftsmanship. Whether savored neat or enjoyed in a cocktail, each drop invites you to embark on a journey of exploration and discovery, celebrating the indomitable spirit of the smugglers who dared to defy the odds.
baxus_class_name: Arran The High Seas Smugglers' Series Second Consignment

name: Adelphi The Glover 18 Year 2017 Release
description: This is a 18 year old fusion of Japanese malt and Scottish malt, released in 2017. Named after Scotsman Thomas Glover who moved to Japan and set up The Japan Brewery Company and the company that would become Mitsubishi. This particular bottle is a blend of whiskies from the Glen Garioch, Longmorn, and Hanyu distilleries.

name: Garrison Brothers Guadalupe - 2022
description:
Garrison Brothers Guadalupe is a distinctive bourbon that exemplifies the innovative spirit of Garrison Brothers Distillery. Aged for four years in charred American oak barrels, it undergoes an additional two years of maturation in tawny port casks imported from Portugal, creating a unique fusion of flavors.

On the nose, Guadalupe offers a rich bouquet of aromas, featuring notes of ripe plums, fresh berries, and strawberry butter on flaky biscuits. Hints of chocolate and cinnamon add depth, while subtle floral notes of lavender honey and toasted coffee beans enhance its complexity.

The palate is a sensuous experience, bursting with flavors that reflect its unique aging process. Expect a delightful combination of dark fruit, creamy toffee, and warm spices, alongside a velvety mouthfeel that makes it incredibly enjoyable. The port cask finish imparts a sweet richness that complements the bourbon's inherent characteristics.

The finish is long and satisfying, with lingering notes of caramel and spices that invite another sip. Garrison Brothers Guadalupe is often described as a "dessert bourbon," making it an ideal choice for evening enjoyment or pairing with chocolates. This expression stands out for its bold flavors and innovative approach, appealing to both bourbon aficionados and those seeking something uniquely delicious.

name: Very Old Fitzgerald 1950 8 Year For Phil Smidt & Son Bottled In Bond 1/2 Pint
description: A 1950 vintage 8 year old expression of Old Fitzgerald produced by the Stitzel-Weller distillery during the legendary Pappy Van Winkle's ownership. This 1/2 pint bottling notes it was done especially for Phil Smidt & Son and is bottled in bond at 100 proof.
baxus_class_name: Very Old Fitzgerald 1950 8 Year For Phil Smidt & Son Bottled In Bond 1/2 Pint

name: Whiskey JYPSI Legacy Batch 2
description:
Whiskey JYPSI Legacy Batch 002: "The Alchemist" is an innovative and complex expression that showcases the brand's commitment to pushing the boundaries of whiskey blending. This limited release, co-founded by country music star Eric Church, is a meticulously crafted blend of rare whiskeys from three different countries.

On the nose, "The Alchemist" offers an enticing bouquet of aromas, featuring notes of plums, vanilla, and cinnamon, complemented by subtle hints of pear and oak. This complex scent profile sets the stage for an equally intricate tasting experience.

The palate delivers a harmonious blend of flavors, featuring an interplay of black pepper, sweet crème brûlée, plum, cinnamon, raspberry, and tobacco. The influence of the triple-barrel finish on the Canadian rye component is evident, adding layers of dark fruit and subtle tannins that enhance the whiskey's depth and complexity. Despite its high proof of 114.3, the mouthfeel is remarkably smooth.

This unique blend consists of:
- 60% 11-year-old Tennessee corn whiskey aged in re-charred American oak barrels
- 36% 18+ year-old Canadian rye, finished in port, sherry, and vermouth casks
- 4% 10-year-old Indian single malt

The finish is long and satisfying, with the fruity notes gradually giving way to more pronounced pepper, cinnamon, and a hint of peppermint. Lingering flavors of oak, tobacco, and leather provide a complex conclusion to each sip.

name: Bowmore 22 Year The Gulls 1990s Bottling
description: A 1990’s era bottling of Bowmore matured for 22 years and bottled in a unique black ceramic decanter. This series is commonly known as “The Gulls”, drawn from the unique design on the bottle. The gulls tells the story of two Scottish lovers, a princess and a warrior who were shipwrecked at Loch Indaal on Islay. The clans never found the pair, instead finding two white gulls circling the wreck.

name: Mannochmore Flora & Fauna 12 Year
description: Flora and Fauna, nicknamed by the late whisky writer, Michael Jackson, was a themed series of distillery only single malt whisky releases. The Mannochmore edition from the Flora and Fauna is a great showcase of mid-aged malts and offers loads of character.

name: Blanton's Takara Red 2021 Release
description: This unique American whiskey starts its journey in white oak barrels, where it is aged for over 8 years before being finished in Takara red wine casks. The additional aging process adds further complexity to the flavor profile, giving the bourbon rich dark chocolate, roasted pecan, caramelized sugar, orange zest and tobacco notes that linger on the palate until the next sip. Whether enjoyed neat or in a cocktail, this exceptional spirit will delight any palate! The bourbon is then bottled at 46.5% ABV, making it a high-proof whiskey that is full of character.Blanton's Cream Label Takara Red Single Barrel Straight Bourbon Whiskey has a truly unique flavor profile that consists of deep and rich flavors. Caramelized sugar, dark chocolate, roasted pecan, orange zest and tobacco notes make up the delightful flavor layers that linger on the palate until the next sip. The additional aging process in Takara red wine casks adds an extra layer of complexity to the whiskey, making it stand out from other spirits. Whether enjoyed neat or in a cocktail, this exceptional spirit will tantalize your taste buds!

name: Sazerac 18 Year - 2005
description: Sazerac 18 Year has certainly gone through some growing pains since the last of the legendary “steel tanked batch” dried up in 2015. It was hard to say goodbye, but it has allowed the brand to ebb and flow more than it was ever allowed to in the past. The result has seen Sazerac 18 Year reach its arguably lowest point ever, and even when it seemed like it might be reaching for past graces, it fell short there too. While the brand certainly deserves all of the time it needs to find its new groove, every year, there’s wishful hoping that this is the year Sazerac 18 Year comes roaring back. In many ways, Sazerac 18 Year finds its best footing since 2016. The nose is wonderfully expressive, instantly transporting me back to the steel tanked years. This is largely due to the whiskey returning to the classic Sazerac 18 Year profile. There aren’t any hard left turns here, which will satisfy diehards of the old batch and newcomers hoping to taste what all the fuss was about. If it wasn’t for its astringent finish, this rye would be firing on all fronts. Perhaps it spent too much time in the barrel (this year’s release was aged for an extra 6 months). Despite that, it is Sazerac 18 Year’s best showing post steel tanked batch. There is a lot to really enjoy here, but for a brand that used to go toe to toe with Van Winkle Family Reserve Rye, it still has some working out to do before it’s back in its old fighting form again. That said, the elements are all present: classic rich nose and an elegant flavor profile with pitch perfect balance. If Buffalo Trace is able to further dial this in a few more notches, the Saz will finally have its groove back.

name: Great Outback Superior Blend Australian Whisky
description: A rather mysterious bottle, not much is known about this Australian blend. The contents are stated as being distilled in the southern states of Australia in the mid 1980s, and "carefully matured in the great Australian Outback."
baxus_class_name: Great Outback Superior Blend Australian Whisky

name: Van Winkle 12 Year Special Reserve Lot "B" 2013 Bottling
description: A 12 year old expression of wheated bourbon carefully chosen by Julian Van Winkle, the grandson of the original Pappy Van Winkle. Early Van Winkle offerings were crafted from barrels sourced from the legendary closed Stitzel-Weller distillery, but in 2002 Julian struck a deal with Buffalo Trace to use their wheated bourbon once his stored barrels ran empty. This 2013 bottling will have been crafted from Buffalo Trace's wheated bourbon mashbill and carefully blended by Julian and his son Preston Van Winkle.
baxus_class_name: Van Winkle 12 Year Special Reserve Lot "B" 2013 Bottling

name: Old Weller 7 Year
description: William Larue Weller was born into a distilling family in Kentucky in 1825  and launched his W.L. Weller brand in 1849. Originally a rectification business (creating 'whiskey' using neutral spirit  colouring and flavourings)  this all changed with the Bottled in Bond Act of 1897 and the death of Weller two years later. The company was left in the hands of the fiercely passionate Julian 'Pappy' Van Winkle I who having steered it safely through the wreckage of National Prohibition  established Old Weller alongside the newly acquired Old Fitzgerald labels and the flagship brands for the new Stitzel-Weller distillery in 1933. It was produced there for over 60 years  eventually being sold to the Sazerac Company in 1999  who distil it at Buffalo Trace using Pappy's recipe to this day. This is a 1978 bottling of the 7 year old Original 107 Proof wheated bourbon. This was produced by United Distillers at Stitzel-Weller  although by this point it had been renamed by its previous owners after flagship brand  Old Fitzgerald. The Stitzel-Weller company was officially established in 1933 at the repeal of National Prohibition in the US. It was the result of a merger between the A. Ph. Stitzel distillery and its biggest customer  W.L. Weller & Sons. The Stitzel-Weller distillery opened on Kentucky Derby day in 1935  and quickly developed a reputation for its high quality wheated bourbon  and its main brands were Old Weller  Old Fitzgerald and Cabin Still. The original ownership was shared between Alex T. Farnsley  Arthur Philip Stitzel and Julian Van Winkle. The former passed-away in 1941 and 1947  respectively  leaving the Van Winkle family as the sole heirs to the business. 'Pappy' died in 1965  having handed the reigns to his son  Julian II the year prior  who ran it until 1972 when the board of directors forced him to sell it to the Norton-Simon subsidiary  Somerset Imports. When they were bought over by the American arm of Scottish distillers  DCL  its subsequent iteration invested heavily in bourbon. So much so in fact  that their newly rebuilt Bernheim distillery had such capacity that Stitzel-Weller was rendered surplus to requirements. It was shut down in 1992. Still part of the Diageo portfolio  it has never re-opened and instead now houses the visitor experience for their Bulleit brand.

name: Wild Turkey Rare Breed 2021
description: A long running series from Wild Turkey, rare breed is a barrel proof expression of their signature bourbon. First launched in 1991, this almost three decade long series is a batched release produced from barrels of varying ages. Average ages in each batch has fluctuated over time, with on average 6-12 year bourbons included but with Wild Turkey's warehouses being stuffed with older stocks as the years have gone by it is common for 17+ year old barrels to be included.

name: Lark Muscat Cask Finish II
description:
Introducing the latest addition to our distinguished lineup, the successor to one of the most celebrated and award-winning releases to date—the Muscat finish. This lavish and indulgent dram is a testament to the artistry and dedication of Lark's Head Distiller, Chris Thomson.

Hand-selected with meticulous care, the finest Muscat casks from Seppeltsfield Winery were chosen to impart their unique character to this rich whisky. Through the skilled craftsmanship of our distiller, a moment of syrupy sweetness and toffee pecan magic is captured within every sip.

With each pour of this exquisite Muscat finish, you are transported on a sensory journey of opulence and indulgence. Delight in the luscious notes of dried fruits, honeyed sweetness, and subtle spice, culminating in a velvety smooth finish that lingers on the palate.

Indulge in the luxury of our latest Muscat finish—a whisky that embodies the epitome of sophistication and refinement. Each bottle is a testament to our unwavering commitment to excellence and our relentless pursuit of perfection in every sip.

name: High West The Prisoner's Share 4 Year
description:
High West's "The Prisoner's Share" is a unique and innovative expression that showcases the distillery's commitment to pushing the boundaries of whiskey craftsmanship. This limited release is a blend of straight bourbon and rye whiskeys, finished in French oak barrels that previously held The Prisoner red wine blend.

On the nose, The Prisoner's Share offers an enticing bouquet of aromas. Notes of plums, vanilla, and cinnamon are prominent, complemented by subtle hints of oak and pear. This complex scent profile sets the stage for an equally intricate tasting experience.

The palate delivers a harmonious blend of flavors, featuring an interplay of black pepper, sweet crème brûlée, plum, cinnamon, raspberry, and tobacco. The influence of the wine barrel finish is evident, adding layers of dark fruit and subtle tannins that enhance the whiskey's depth and complexity. Despite its high proof, the mouthfeel is remarkably smooth, with no overwhelming burn.

As the finish unfolds, the fruity notes gradually give way to more pronounced pepper, cinnamon, and a hint of peppermint. Lingering flavors of oak, tobacco, and leather provide a satisfying conclusion to each sip.

The Prisoner's Share represents a successful collaboration between High West and The Prisoner Wine Company, resulting in a whiskey that appeals to both bourbon enthusiasts and those who appreciate wine-finished spirits. While its premium price point may give some pause, many fans of High West consider it a worthy addition to their collection, particularly those who enjoy the distillery's other limited releases like Midwinter Night's Dram.
baxus_class_name: High West The Prisoner's Share 4 Year

name: Blanton's Single Barrel 1996 Bottling
description: Blanton's Single Barrel Bourbon is a celebrated expression that holds the distinction of being the first single-barrel bourbon ever produced, introduced in 1984 by Buffalo Trace Distillery. Known for its rich heritage and craftsmanship, Blanton's has become a sought-after favorite among bourbon enthusiasts.  Each bottle of Blanton's comes from a single barrel, resulting in unique flavor profiles that can vary from one release to another. Typically bottled at 93 proof, this bourbon is aged in charred American white oak barrels, allowing it to develop a complex character over time.   On the nose, Blanton's Single Barrel offers inviting aromas of honey, caramel, and ripe fruit, complemented by hints of citrus and spice. The palate is full-bodied and vibrant, featuring flavors of cinnamon, vanilla, and dark chocolate. A subtle spiciness adds depth, while the finish is smooth and lingering, leaving behind notes of oak and sweet toffee.  Blanton's iconic packaging includes a distinctive bottle shape and a horse-and-jockey stopper that has become a collector's item in its own right. With its combination of quality, rarity, and craftsmanship, Blanton's Single Barrel remains a benchmark for bourbon aficionados and continues to capture the hearts of whiskey lovers around the world.

name: Pittyvaich Flora & Fauna 12 Year
description: Flora and Fauna, nicknamed by the late whisky writer, Michael Jackson, was a themed series of distillery only single malt whisky releases. The Pittyvaich edition has a perfumed, fruity nose and robust flavor with a hint of spiciness.

name: Eagle Rare 10 Year - 1980s
description: All the way from the legendary Buffalo Trace Distillery in Frankfort, Kentucky, comes Eagle Rare 10 Year Old. A spectacular Kentucky straight Bourbon whiskey, matured for at least a decade before making its way into its distinctive bottles at 45% ABV.

name: Crown Royal Special Edition (for Japan) Mini
description: This miniature Crown Royal bottle is a 50ml version of the iconic Canadian whisky, specially created for the Japanese market. Featuring the same high-quality blend of 50 full-bodied Canadian whiskies found in the standard Crown Royal bottles, this petite offering packs a punch of flavor in a compact size.
baxus_class_name: Crown Royal Special Edition (for Japan) Mini

name: Hibiki 17 Year
description: Arguably the world’s most sought after blended whisky, Hibiki is crafted by Suntory in Japan with malts from their Hakushu and Yamazaki distilleries as well as grain whisky from Chita. Presented in a stunning glass bottle featuring 24 sides to represent the 24 seasons in Japan, Hibiki exploded in popularity throughout the 2010s leading to many of the age stated expressions being discontinued. This 17 year old expression features very well matured Japanese spirit that is always in such short supply due to the extreme popularity of the harmonious blend.

name: Glendronach Parliament 21 Year - 2020
description: From the distiller: "Matured in a combination of the finest Oloroso and Pedro Ximenez sherry casks for a minimum of 21 years and bottled at 48% ABV, the 'Parliament' continues the great GlenDronach tradition of offering fruit-laden intensity in its single malts."

name: Laphroaig 1960 40 Year Old Cask Strength
description: The oldest age stated Laphroaig ever released, this very special edition was crafted in 1960 from Islay grown barley malted by hand at the remote distillery’s own malting floors. Peat was collected from local bogs to smoke the barley and soft peat influenced water from local sources was used in its careful production. This vintage was produced under the watchful eye of Bessie Williamson, historically the first female whisky distiller who would become a pivotal character in Laphroaig’s history. After an incredible four decades of maturation this release was bottled at a natural cask strength of 42.4% Abv in 2001. With aged stocks of this Islay distillery in short supply this is the only time a 40 year old expression has ever been released.

name: Auchroisk Flora & Fauna 10 Year
description: Flora and Fauna, nicknamed by the late whisky writer, Michael Jackson, was a themed series of distillery only single malt whisky releases. This single malt lies at the heart of the Auchroisk range, it being the only official bottling.

name: Thomas H. Handy 6 Year - 2017
description: From the distilelr: "Named after the New Orleans bartender who first used rye whiskey in the Sazerac Cocktail, this uncut and unfiltered Straight Rye Whiskey is bottled directly from the barrel, just as it was over a century ago. Full of rich flavors, this authentic American rye whiskey is a symbol of the timeless history of New Orleans and the legacy of Thomas H. Handy."

name: Evan Williams Jug 90 proof
description: An antique bottle of Evan Williams bottled at 90 proof in a ceramic jug.

name: Kentucky Senator Release #5 "John Brown" 9 Year
description:
Kentucky Senator 9 Year Release 5, also known as the John Brown Release, is a distinguished bourbon that honors Kentucky's first U.S. Senator, John Brown, who played a pivotal role in the state's early history. This limited-edition bourbon is aged for nine years, allowing it to develop a rich and complex flavor profile that reflects the craftsmanship and heritage of Kentucky bourbon.

On the nose, this release offers inviting aromas of caramel and vanilla, enriched by hints of toasted oak and leather. A subtle nuttiness rounds out the bouquet, creating an enticing introduction.

The palate is smooth and well-balanced, featuring initial flavors of sweet corn and honey that transition into darker notes of chocolate and dried fruit. As it develops, spices like cinnamon and clove emerge, harmonizing beautifully with the oak influence that provides depth without overwhelming the other flavors. The mouthfeel is luxuriously silky, coating the palate with a creamy texture.

The finish is long and satisfying, with lingering notes of vanilla, spice, and a faint smokiness that adds to its complexity. With only 1,200 bottles produced, Kentucky Senator 9 Year Release 5 stands as a testament to the artistry of bourbon-making, offering a memorable experience that pays homage to both its historical significance and the rich tradition of Kentucky bourbon.

name: Nikka Whiskey From the Barrel - 2018
description:
From the producer: "Nikka From The Barrel is a blended whisky which was released in 1985. The development of this expression started with an aim to deliver full flavors and richness of whisky like "from the barrel", which only blenders can sniff and taste. The secret behind its gorgeous flavor is the unique combination of complex blending, higher ABV 51.4% and "marriage" process.

The iconic square bottle reflects its concept "a small block of whisky" and embodies the intense and rich flavors of the whisky inside. Long after its launch, this bottle is still timeless and recognized for its ultimate simplicity."

name: Allt A Bhainne 1993 22 Year Single Hogshead Hunter Laing
description: A 1993 vintage single cask expression of Allt A Bhainne matured for 22 years in a refill hogshead. It was bottled at 53.9% Abv by Hunter Laing as part of their First Editions series.
baxus_class_name: Allt A Bhainne 1993 22 Year Single Hogshead Hunter Laing

name: Very Very Old Fitzgerald 1955 12 Year Bottled In Bond
description: A 1955 vintage expression of very old bourbon matured for 12 years. Produced by Sitzel-Weller distillery during the legendary Pappy Van Winkle's tenure this very very old bourbon was bottled in bond in 1967 at 100 proof.
baxus_class_name: Very Very Old Fitzgerald 1955 12 Year Bottled In Bond

name: Pittyvaich 1993 29 Year Single Cask #3723 Connoisseurs Choice Gordon & Macphail
description: Distilled in 1993 this single cask expression of the closed distillery Pittyvaich was matured for 29 years in a refill American oak hogshead. It was bottled in 2022 at 48.6% Abv by Gordon & Macphail as part of their legendary Connoisseurs Choice series. Pittyvaich was a very short-lived Speyside distillery built in 1975 to supply extra malt whisky for Arthur Bell & Sons blended Scotch whiskies. It was closed in 1993 and then demolished shortly after amid the downturn for Scotch whisky first started in the 1980s.
baxus_class_name: Pittyvaich 1993 29 Year Single Cask #3723 Connoisseurs Choice Gordon & Macphail

name: Yamazaki "Royal" 60th Anniversary
description: The Yamazaki "Royal" 60th Anniversary whisky is a special limited edition release that commemorates the 60th anniversary of the Yamazaki distillery, one of Japan's oldest and most esteemed whisky distilleries. The bottle features a distinctive shape with a brown glass body and a gold-colored cap, and the label is adorned with elegant script and the Suntory logo, emphasizing its premium and exclusive nature. This whisky is part of Suntory's rich heritage and is known for producing high-quality single malt whiskies that are sought after worldwide. The serene landscape printed on the glass of one of the bottles suggests a connection to the natural environment surrounding the distillery, and the "Royal" designation indicates that this is a special or limited edition release. The Yamazaki "Royal" 60th Anniversary is a collector's item, celebrating the heritage and craftsmanship of the Yamazaki distillery, and is likely to have a unique flavor profile and character that matches its distinctive design.

name: Bruichladdich 1990 25 Year Single Hogshead Hunter Laing
description: Like its island neighbour Bunnahabhain distillery, Bruichladdich has traditionally been an un-peated single malt, mostly owing to its requirements by the blenders who owned it. The last of these was Whyte & Mackay, who eventually shut it down in 1995, deeming it surplus to requirements. They sold the distillery to Murray McDavid in 2001, who launched the peated Port Charlotte and heavily-peated Octomore single malts in 2006 and 2008. A recommissioned Lomond still also now produces the popular Botanist gin there.This whisky was distilled in October 1990. It was aged in a single refill hogshead for 25 years before being bottled in September 2016. Part of the Author's Series,  this particular bottle celebrates Jules Verne.Edition Spirits was founded in 2010 by Scott and Andrew Laing, the sons of Douglas Laing founder, Stewart. When he left Douglas Laing to establish the new Hunter Laing company in 2013, he was joined by his sons who made Edition Spirits one of its operating arms, along with Langside Distillers.
series: The First Editions Jules Verne - Series No 11
baxus_class_name: Bruichladdich 1990 25 Year Single Hogshead Hunter Laing

name: Waubs Harbour  Great Southern Reef - 2023
description: This maritime single malt whisky is a Limited Release in support of the Great Southern Reef Foundation. Made, matured & bottled at Waubs Harbour Distillery on the east coast of Tasmania, just metres from the ocean and covered in salty air.

name: Ardbeg 1998 Almost There
description: The third edition in Ardbeg's work in progress editions as they progressed to a core 10 year old product. This release was distilled in 1998 and bottled in 2007 just around 9 years of age, hence "almost there".

name: Bruichladdich 2012 10 Year Single Cask #2195 For Barrel & Batch
description: A 2012 vintage single cask expression of Bruichladdich matured for 10 years in a 2nd fill Jurancon wine cask. Crafted from concerto barley this cask was bottled at 63.6% Abv exclusively for Barrel & Batch in Australia.
baxus_class_name: Bruichladdich 2012 10 Year Single Cask #2195 For Barrel & Batch

name: Penelope 5 Year Toasted Barrel
description: Penelope 5 Year Toasted Barrel is a premium straight bourbon whiskey that showcases the innovative spirit of Penelope Bourbon. This expression is aged for five years in new American oak barrels before being finished in freshly toasted barrels, which impart a rich and complex flavor profile. The bottle features a striking design with a bright orange hue and the Penelope logo prominently displayed, emphasizing its artisanal quality. The whiskey offers a harmonious blend of vanilla, caramel, and warm spices on the nose, with a palate that reveals layers of butterscotch, dark chocolate, and toasted oak. The finish is smooth and luxurious, making it an excellent choice for sipping neat or in sophisticated cocktails. This bourbon is a testament to Penelope's commitment to creating unique and memorable whiskey experiences.

name: Little Rest Double Matured Cask Strength
description:
Tenmile Distillery's Little Rest American Single Malt is an exciting debut release from this New York-based distillery. Named after a local hamlet where horses and drivers would take "a little rest" during their journeys, this whiskey invites drinkers to pause and savor its carefully crafted flavors.

On the nose, Little Rest offers an enticing bouquet of aromas. Notes of creamy peanuts and chocolate chip cookie dough provide a sweet and inviting introduction, complemented by hints of mocha. This combination creates a rich and dessert-like olfactory experience that draws you into the glass.

The palate presents a bright and lively flavor profile. Initial notes of crisp apples bring a refreshing fruitiness, balanced by the sweetness of caramel. These flavors are beautifully complemented by rich chocolate notes, creating a harmonious blend of fruit, sweetness, and depth.

This First Edition release is a marriage of ex-bourbon casks, Oloroso Sherry, and red wine barrels, showcasing Tenmile's commitment to innovative cask management. The diverse barrel influences contribute to the whiskey's complexity and depth of flavor.

Tenmile Distillery's approach, which combines traditional Scottish whisky-making methods with American innovation, is evident in Little Rest. The involvement of Shane Fraser, who previously distilled for renowned Scottish distilleries, brings a wealth of experience to this American Single Malt.

Little Rest represents a promising start for Tenmile Distillery, offering a well-crafted and nuanced American Single Malt that should appeal to both seasoned whiskey enthusiasts and those new to the category[1].
baxus_class_name: Little Rest Double Matured Cask Strength

name: Linkwood Flora & Fauna 12 Year
description: Flora and Fauna, nicknamed by the late whisky writer, Michael Jackson, was a themed series of distillery only single malt whisky releases. The Linkwood 12 year is viscous and exquisite, from the depths of one of Scotland’s biggest workhorse distilleries.

name: Laphroaig 30 Year Old Pre-2008 Bottling
description: First released in 1998 as an exclusive for the US market, this 30 year old expression of Laphroaig was bottled before 2008. 1960’s and 1970’s vintage Laphroaig are particularly sought after by enthusiasts as spirit from this time is notably heavy with tropical fruits and less focused on peat.

name: Hibiki 12 Year
description: NOSE Very fruity, with ripe oranges, apple pie, marmalade and plums (would I have still got those plums if I didn't know about the plum liqueur maturation? I'd like to hope so). Fresh honeysuckle and nougat aromas, sugared almonds, sponge cake, icing sugar. Expressive and exciting. PALATE Smooth as a snooker ball, with delicious fresh grain, oak tannins and delicately sherried malt. Some clove, pepper and mixed peel as the sherry comes forward. The citrus is here as well, if slightly more tart like lemon or grapefruit. FINISH Spices, apple peel and the last remnants of the finely-tuned grain. Nothing dominates, everything in place - the integration and balance are quite remarkable. The spices seem to build in intensity at the finale. COMMENTS Slips down easier than a greased eel in an oilslick. This is tremendous. A hugely impressive feat of blending that proves, if there were any remaining doubt, that Japanese whisky can equal or beat anything produced in Scotland at this moment in time. Bravo.

name: Jura 1988 Rare Vintage Bottled 2018
description: Distilled in 1988 and initially matured in bourbon casks this rare expression from the Island distillery Jura was finished in tawny port casks. Bottled in 2018 at 53.5% Abv with just 1406 bottles produced.

name: Macallan 25 Year Fine Oak Pre-2008 Bottling
description: A pre-2008 era bottling of Macallan's 25 year old fine oak series. The Macallan Fine Oak Series involves aging in a combination of ex-sherry (American & European Oak) and ex-bourbon (American oak). The Fine Oak series was first introduced in 2004; prior to that  the single malt whisky releases had been aged exclusively in sherry casks.
baxus_class_name: Macallan 25 Year Fine Oak Pre-2008 Bottling

name: Willett 18 Year Single Barrel Bourbon #1608 "It's Classified"
description: A huge 18 year old expression of single barrel bourbon from Willett sourced from an undisclosed Kentucky distillery. Named "It's Classified" barrel #1608 was bottled at 62.3% Abv with a small outturn of just 69 bottles produced.
baxus_class_name: Willett 18 Year Single Barrel Bourbon #1608 "It's Classified"

name: Ardbeg Alligator For Discussion
description: Released in June 2011 Ardbeg Alligator takes its name from the aggressive charring of the American casks the whisky was matured in. This charring level is known as the Alligator char because the cracking of the wood under the heat looks similar to the skin of an Alligator. Two editions of Alligator were released, a "for discussion" edition exclusive to Ardbeg committee members as well as a more wide normal branded Alligator release.
series: Alligator - Exclusive Committee Reserve for Discussion

name: Mortlach Flora & Fauna 16 Year
description: Flora and Fauna, nicknamed by the late whisky writer, Michael Jackson, was a themed series of distillery only single malt whisky releases. The Mortlach 16 Year Old, from the first of seven distilleries in Dufftown, Speyside is a heavily sherried, world famous, dram and boasts a delightful smooth, fruity finish.

name: Wild Turkey 101 Proof 8 Year 375ml - 1984
description:
The 1980s Wild Turkey bourbon bottled in a 375ml format represents a unique and collectible expression from a pivotal era in the distillery's history. This smaller bottle size, often referred to as a "half-pint" or "flask" size, offers a compact yet potent representation of Wild Turkey's craftsmanship during this period.

Typically bottled at the iconic 101 proof (50.5% ABV), this 375ml Wild Turkey from the 1980s showcases the rich, robust flavor profile that the brand became renowned for under Master Distiller Jimmy Russell's guidance. The nose likely presents a harmonious blend of classic bourbon notes - vanilla, caramel, and oak - complemented by the signature Wild Turkey spice and hints of leather and tobacco. On the palate, enthusiasts might expect a full-bodied experience with flavors of butterscotch, dark fruits, and a pronounced spiciness characteristic of Wild Turkey's high-rye mashbill. The finish would likely be long and warming, with lingering notes of oak, vanilla, and a touch of medicinal cherry - a hallmark of Wild Turkey from this era. While the 375ml size might be smaller, it doesn't diminish the complexity and depth of the bourbon inside. These bottles are particularly prized by collectors not only for their compact size but also as representations of Wild Turkey's quality during a time when aged stocks were plentiful and the bourbon industry was on the cusp of significant changes.

name: Ardbeg Day Feis Ile 2012
description: A 2012 special release from Ardbeg bottled to celebrate the Feis Ile Islay festival. This non age stated release was matured in refilled sherry casks and bottled at 56.7% Abv. This Feis Ile special edition is heralded as one of the best annual releases from the distillery and reportedly uses both young and old stocks of Ardbeg.

name: Michter's 10 Year Single Barrel Rye 2023 Bottling
description: A 2023 bottling of 10 year old rye bottled from a single barrel by Michter's. Prior to 2015 Michter's was contract producing its spirits at an undisclosed Brown-Forman distillery, rumoured to be Early Times/Old Forester. In 2015 the company established their full scale distillery in Shively, slowly transitioning to their own spirit. This 2023 bottling will have been crafted from spirit contract distilled by Michter's at the undisclosed Brown-Forman site.
baxus_class_name: Michter's 10 Year Single Barrel Rye 2023 Bottling

name: Nikka Whiskey From the Barrel 500ml
description:
From the producer: "Nikka From The Barrel is a blended whisky which was released in 1985. The development of this expression started with an aim to deliver full flavors and richness of whisky like "from the barrel", which only blenders can sniff and taste. The secret behind its gorgeous flavor is the unique combination of complex blending, higher ABV 51.4% and "marriage" process.

The iconic square bottle reflects its concept "a small block of whisky" and embodies the intense and rich flavors of the whisky inside. Long after its launch, this bottle is still timeless and recognized for its ultimate simplicity."

name: Glenmorangie A Tale Of Tokyo 2023 Release
description: Combining bright, bold flavours with soft sweetness, Glenmorangie A Tale of Tokyo is a Highland single malt Scotch whisky as full of delicious sensory contrasts as Tokyo itself.     Inspired to capture his experience of Tokyo’s many sensory dimensions and to experiment with rare Japanese Mizunara oak casks for the first time, Dr Bill united Glenmorangie part-aged in Mizunara oak with whisky that had spent time in both sherry and bourbon casks, for a unique limited-edition that’s perfectly balanced with Glenmorangie’s house-style.     The whisky fuses notes of pepper with bitter cherries and mouth-watering orange zest with incense and sweet oak – a unique and complex flavour profile resulting from the recipe of Mizunara oak, Bourbon and Sherry casks.
baxus_class_name: Glenmorangie A Tale Of Tokyo 2023 Release

name: Macallan Edition No. 1
description: From the distiller: "Edition No. 1 is the first in a series of annual limited releases showcasing our skill and expertise in selecting and maturing our precious spirit in the very best oak casks...eight European and American cask style."

name: Buffalo Trace Kosher Rye 7 Year
description: From the distillery: "In partnership with the Chicago Rabbinical Council (cRc), Buffalo Trace Distillery produced this Rye Recipe Bourbon Whiskey. Made with the same high quality grains as Buffalo Trace Bourbon Whiskey, this Kosher spirit was aged in specifically designated Kosher barrels. In order to satisfy Passover requirements, these barrels were sold to a non-Jewish executive in a ceremony witness by a representative from the cRc. After aging for seven years, this Rye Recipe Bourbon was bottled at 94 proof after ensuring the bottling lines were cleaned beforehand and that no contact was made by non-Kosher spirits. Released after Passover each year, this Rye Recipe Bourbon is bold and independent, celebrating its heritage from America’s oldest continually-operating distillery."

name: Rare Hare "1953" 17 Year
description: In tribute to the year Playboy was founded, “1953” is Rare Hare’s inaugural product release. Bottled at 111 proof, this 17-year-old straight bourbon whiskey was finished in Cognac casks from the Champagne region of France. Because of the whiskey’s rarity, only 1,953 bottles were produced.

name: Yamazaki 12 Year 100th Anniversary
description: From the distiller: "The Yamazaki 12 Years Old Single Malt is comprised of meticulously selected malt whiskies all cask-aged aged for a minimum of 12 years. This special limited-edition bottling was created in honor of Suntory Whisky's centenary. Part of the Yamazaki family, Japan’s quintessential whisky, it is made in Japan’s first and oldest malt distillery which was founded in 1923. Yamazaki means “mountain cape”, referencing its unique geographic location – secluded amongst a range of forest covered mountains. The bottle design pays tribute to Yamazaki, the birthplace of Japanese Whisky, captures this legendary distillery in deep copper tones, and is a reminder to always honor our past."

name: Ardbeg Rollercoaster - 2009
description: A mix of malt cold wood smoke and a hint of new make. Has a very young feel - similar to Talisker 10 in this respect. Balanced striking sweetness. Quite big with a peat tingle though it doesn't quite take off as expected. Instead it rests on its laurels in a sea of spices tangy starburst sweets and oily smoke. Light new make character remains. More coastal at the finish sweetness cool smoke medium to short.

name: Caol Ila 1984 32 Year Single Cask Langside Distillers
description: A 1984 vintage single cask expression of Caol Ila matured for 32 years in a refill hogshead. It was bottled at 50.9% Abv in 2016 by Langside distillers as part of their Distiller’s Art series.
baxus_class_name: Caol Ila 1984 32 Year Single Cask Langside Distillers

name: Nikka Pure Malt 17 year
description: A 17 year old vatted malt from Nikka named in honour of the company`s founder. Produced using a blend of whiskies sourced from Nikka`s Yoichi and Miyagikyo distilleries, this is a truly unique and historic bottle.

name: Gordon & MacPhail Linkwood 25 Year - 2022
description: This fine dram has aromas of sweet sherry, with notes of demerara sugar and orange peel. A smooth palate, it has notes of dark chocolate and roasted hazelnuts. The finish is medium-long, with warm spices and toasted oak.

name: Four Roses Super Premium
description: The Four Roses Super Premium bourbon whiskey is an exclusive offering sold only in Japan, distinguished by its elegant bottle with a silver cap and a rose motif on the label. This whiskey is a blend of various Four Roses recipes, with 80% of the bourbon aged a minimum of 8 years and 20% aged 10 years or greater. It is bottled at 86 proof (43% ABV) and is known for its light copper color and a flavor profile that includes floral and sweet notes, vanilla, and a touch of oak. The finish is described as starting light and sweet with honey and vanilla, then transitioning to a drier side with aged oak and leather, along with a dash of white pepper. The Four Roses Super Premium is sometimes referred to as Four Roses "Platinum" due to the color of the embossed roses on the bottle, which are made of light metal. This bourbon is a product of the Kirin Brewery Company, which acquired the Four Roses brand trademark from Diageo in February 2002. While it is a Japan-only bourbon, it is bottled at 750ml, unlike many other export-only bourbons, including Four Roses Black Label, which are typically bottled at 700ml. The Four Roses Super Premium is a unique novelty for bourbon enthusiasts and a must-have for diehard Four Roses fans looking to complete their collection.

name: Talisker 1975 25 Year Cask Strength 2001 Release
description: Distilled in 1975 this special edition 25 year old release from Talisker was bottled in 2001 at a cask strength of 59.9% Abv. This vintage was produced just shortly after Talisker switched from their own maltings to outside sourced malt from the mainland.

name: Nikka Gold & Gold
description: An older era bottling of Nikka's Gold & Gold blend crafted from malt whisky likely imported from Scotland as well as domestically produced. Gold & Gold first saw release in 1968 and was primarily for the export market, with much of the outturn destined for the USA.

name: Kentucky Owl St. Patrick's Edition
description:
Kentucky Owl St. Patrick's Limited Edition Bourbon is a unique expression that celebrates the connection between Irish and Kentucky whiskey-making traditions. This special release is the result of a collaboration between Kentucky Owl's Master Blender John Rhea and Irish Whiskey Bonder Louise McGuane.

On the nose, this bourbon offers an inviting bouquet of aromas. Sweet notes of caramel and honey are prominent, balanced by just enough spice to tease the palate. There's also a subtle hint of fruit, adding complexity to the overall scent profile.

The palate delivers a harmonious blend of flavors. Long notes of caramel, butterscotch, and frosted cinnamon roll form the foundation, complemented by hints of chocolate and orange. A touch of candy floss and citrus peel adds brightness, while bright forest fruit notes emerge on the mid-palate. The blend showcases the best of both worlds - the rich caramel and vanilla notes from rare older bourbons, spice and fruit from higher rye bourbons, and sweetness and citrus from wheated bourbons.

The finish is long and satisfying, with lingering notes of vanilla pod and a balanced wood influence. There's also a subtle hint of nutmeg and clove spice, adding depth to the conclusion.

This St. Patrick's Edition features Kentucky straight bourbons aged 4 to 11 years, carefully selected and blended to create a robust, well-balanced bourbon experience. It successfully marries the bold, spicy character of Kentucky bourbon with the fruit-forward profiles beloved in Irish whiskey, resulting in a unique and enjoyable expression that appeals to enthusiasts of both styles.

name: Ben Holladay 7 Year Bottled-in-Bond - 2023
description:
Rooted in time-honored methods, this bourbon is produced using original two-grain cooker system, maintaining consistent distillation proofs and barrel entry proof to preserve its distinctive character.

Handcrafted with care, each batch of Ben Holladay Bourbon is a testament to dedication to quality. Monthly, the master distiller selects barrels from different floors of two seven-story rickhouses, carefully blending them to meet stringent flavor profile criteria.

Primarily sourced from barrels aged on the fifth floor of Warehouse C, the largest rickhouse on-site, approximately 80% of the very first batch embodies the essence of this storied location. The remaining 20% hails from barrels on the first floor of the same rickhouse.

Embracing the unique aging conditions of each floor, subsequent batches of Ben Holladay Bourbon feature varying ratios, reflecting the diverse flavors imparted by temperature variations and humidity levels. From the cooler, more humid conditions of the first floor to the warmer, drier atmospheres of the higher floors, each barrel contributes distinct nuances to the final blend.

To honor the individuality of each batch, the Ben Holladay Bourbon label showcases a blending chart, guiding consumers through the intricate blending process and enabling them to discern the unique characteristics of each expression. Experience the artistry and tradition of Ben Holladay Bourbon—a true embodiment of quality and craftsmanship.

name: Barton's Ancient Bond 1949 Bottled 1957 Bottled In Bond
description: A 1949 vintage expression of Barton's Ancient Bond matured for roughly 8 years and bottled in bond at 100 proof in 1957.
baxus_class_name: Barton's Ancient Bond 1949 Bottled 1957 Bottled In Bond

name: Caol Ila 1984 30 Year Single Cask #6261 The Ultimate
description: A 1984 vintage single cask expression of Caol Ila mature for 30 years in hogshead. It was bottled at 52.8% Abv by The Ultimate, a legendary independent bottler run by Maurice Van Wees. The Ultimate has been bottling casks since 1994 and has been the premier destination for Scotch whisky knowledge in the Netherlands since the 1960s.
baxus_class_name: Caol Ila 1984 30 Year Single Cask #6261 The Ultimate

name: Wild Turkey 8 Year 1983 Bottling
description: An older bottling of Wild Turkey's signature 8 year old age statement bottled at 101 proof in 1983. Older editions of Wild Turkey are particularly sought after amongst enthusiasts, notably for their remarkably different taste profile to modern Wild Turkey bottles. The distillery originally produced bourbon using cypress wood tanks but these were slowly phased out from 1984 until 1990. The other notable production change came in 2004 when the barrel entry proof was changed to 110, up from 107. The combination of these changes have resulted in serious demand for older vintage bottlings from the much loved distillery, with some believing 1990s era bottlings to be the distillery’s best ever.

name: Macallan 1990 Elegancia Bottled 2002
description: A litre bottle of The Macallan 1990 Elegancia. The expression was distilled in 1990 and bottled in 2002. The whisky was matured in a combination of Oloroso and Fino sherry casks and was released as a travel exclusive.

name: Hibiki Japanese Harmony 100th Anniversary - 2023
description: The bottle design of Hibiki Japanese Harmony 100th Anniversary Edition is inspired by our relentless pursuit of quality, ingenuity and expressiveness – rooted in “Monozukuri” craftsmanship and Japanese culture. A celebration of Suntory Whisky's centennial milestone, ​the design features a bridge with the traditional Japanese ​ art of Setsugekka – snow, moon and flowers to showcase ​the passing of seasons. The bridge is a connection to ​each of the four seasons connecting our past and future, ​in the hope that tradition and history won’t be forgotten, ​always to be respected as we look forward. The unique 24-faceted bottle represents 24 hours in a day, with 24 Japanese seasons in a year.

name: Macallan 1974 18 Year Sherry Oak
description: Distilled at a standard 43% ABV after aging for at least 18 years in sherry wood, this Macallan 18-year-old is from one of Speyside's most prolific and prestigious distilleries. Truly the first word in Scotch whisky, Macallan has been producing some of the finest spirits in the world since 1824.

name: Kentucky Owl Batch 12 - 2022
description:
Kentucky Owl Bourbon Batch #12 is a highly anticipated release from the renowned Kentucky Owl brand, now under the stewardship of Master Blender John Rhea. This expression continues the legacy of Kentucky Owl's premium blended bourbons, showcasing a carefully curated mix of aged whiskeys.

On the nose, Batch #12 offers a pleasing bouquet of aromas. Initial notes of aged leather and smoked oak chips provide a robust foundation, complemented by the sweetness of butterbeer and light caramel. There's also a hint of light brown sugar and white peppercorn, creating an inviting and complex scent profile.

The palate delivers a harmonious blend of classic bourbon flavors. A prominent rye spice is balanced by the sweetness of caramel and light brown sugar, creating a satisfying interplay between spicy and sweet notes. The dry aged oak contributes depth and complexity, while a peppercorn spice mix adds an intriguing layer to the overall taste experience.

The finish is bold and lingering, characterized by a spicy kick that's tempered by subtle notes of leather and a touch of brown sugar. A hint of whipped cream adds a creamy texture to the conclusion, while a light, lingering heat provides a satisfying warmth.

Kentucky Owl Batch #12 is a full-bodied bourbon that exemplifies the art of blending. It offers a quintessential bourbon experience, balancing traditional flavors with a complexity that will appeal to enthusiasts. While the price point may be a consideration for some, those who appreciate a well-crafted, premium bourbon will find much to enjoy in this release.

name: Augusta Buckner's Single Barrel 10 Year Hand Selected - 2023
description:
Representing the pinnacle of maturity within this distinguished family, this expression offers a depth of character and complexity rarely seen in younger distillates.

At full cask strength, Buckner’s 10-year Single-Barrel Bourbon demands reverence, yet remains inviting to bourbon enthusiasts seeking to delve into the realm of top-tier offerings. With its balanced profile and approachable nature, it serves as an ideal entry point for those looking to elevate their bourbon experience to new heights.
baxus_class_name: Augusta Buckner's Single Barrel 10 Year Hand Selected - 2023

name: Nikka Gold & Gold '80 Hiroshima Carp 1980 Release
description:
Indulge in a timeless moment with the Nikka Whisky G & G 1980 Hiroshima Toyo Carp Victory edition—an exquisite masterpiece that pays homage to a historic triumph. Meticulously crafted with precision and expertise, this Japanese whisky reveres the victory of the Hiroshima Toyo Carp, encapsulating the very essence of that remarkable year.

Embark on a journey through time with each sip. The intricate bouquet of flavors serves as a testament to craftsmanship and heritage, where the finest ingredients meld harmoniously to create a taste that transcends ordinary boundaries.

Delight in the symphony of flavors within every drop—an exquisite blend of aged whisky where oak and spices intertwine gracefully with subtle hints of caramel and dried fruits. Each sip reverberates with the spirit of the Hiroshima Toyo Carp's victory, embodying the essence of triumph and unwavering determination.

Though unadorned by a box, this edition stands as a testament to the illustrious history of Japanese whisky-making. Its genuine and impeccable quality speaks volumes, rendering it a treasure worthy of admiration and reverence.

Claim this remarkable whisky as your own or bestow it upon a discerning connoisseur who cherishes the fusion of history and whisky craftsmanship.
baxus_class_name: Nikka Gold & Gold '80 Hiroshima Carp 1980 Release

name: Buffalo Trace Kosher Rye Recipe - 2020
description: From the distillery: "In partnership with the Chicago Rabbinical Council (cRc), Buffalo Trace Distillery produced this Rye Recipe Bourbon Whiskey. Made with the same high quality grains as Buffalo Trace Bourbon Whiskey, this Kosher spirit was aged in specifically designated Kosher barrels. In order to satisfy Passover requirements, these barrels were sold to a non-Jewish executive in a ceremony witness by a representative from the cRc. After aging for seven years, this Rye Recipe Bourbon was bottled at 94 proof after ensuring the bottling lines were cleaned beforehand and that no contact was made by non-Kosher spirits. Released after Passover each year, this Rye Recipe Bourbon is bold and independent, celebrating its heritage from America’s oldest continually-operating distillery."

name: Van Winkle 12 Year Special Reserve Lot "B" 2015 Bottling
description: This quite fabulous 12 year old straight Kentucky Bourbon whiskey was produced at the Old Rip Van Winkle distillery and was bottled at 45.2% ABV for the Van Winkle Special Reserve series. Drawn from charred American oak barrels, this limited edition Bourbon is released in very small batches annually and is described as a full-bodied, smooth and mature whiskey. First released in 1991, this series had just one release from Lot A before Lot B followed on.
baxus_class_name: Van Winkle 12 Year Special Reserve Lot "B" 2015 Bottling

name: Hibiki 17 Year 750ml
description:
A world renowned Japanese blend, Hibiki 17 Year Old is made with aged malt and grain whiskies from Suntory's distilleries. Initially released in 1989, the blend is matured in Japanese mizunara oak casks at Yamazaki. Hibiki means harmony, which has certainly been achieved in this wonderful and iconic blend.
Nose Quite full. There are notes of honey and wax, resin and oak. There are notes of gentle smoke and cacao, hints of cooked fruit and a nutty note.

Palate Sweet and rich. There are crisp notes of mixed peels, raisin and custard with a little zest and plenty of oak.

Finish Long with notes of oak and cocoa and sherried peels.

name: Martin Mills - 1991
description: Martin Mills is a brandname used by Heaven Hill to bottle Bourbon for the Japanese domestic market. Heaven Hill Distilleries, Inc. is a private, American family-owned and operated distillery founded in 1935 and headquartered in Bardstown, Kentucky, that produces and markets the Heaven Hill brand of Kentucky Straight Bourbon Whiskey and a variety of other distilled spirits. Its current distillery facility, called the Heaven Hill Bernheim distillery, is in Louisville, Kentucky. It is the seventh-largest alcohol supplier in the United States, the second-largest holder of bourbon whiskey inventory in the world, the largest, independent, family-owned and operated producer and marketer of distilled spirits in the United States, and the only large family-owned distillery company headquartered in Kentucky (not counting Brown-Forman Corporation, which is publicly traded but more than two-thirds family-controlled, or Sazerac Company, which is family-owned but headquartered in Louisiana).

name: SMWS G7.7 Girvan 1984 30 Year
description: A 1984 single cask expression of single grain whisky from the Cambus distillery matured for 30 years in a refill bourbon hogshead. It was bottled at 59.4% Abv by the Scotch Malt Whisky Society.
series: Old Codger With A Jammy Dodger

name: Kentucky Owl Confiscated
description:
Kentucky Owl Confiscated is a unique bourbon that pays homage to a significant event in the distillery's history. In 1916, just before Prohibition, the entire Kentucky Owl Distillery whiskey inventory of 250,000 gallons was seized by the Federal Government, never to be seen again. This expression serves as a tribute to those vanished barrels and the opportunities lost during that tumultuous time.

On the nose, Confiscated offers an enticing bouquet of aromas. Notes of gardenia and banana bread provide a sweet, floral introduction, complemented by the toasty scent of sourdough bread crust. There's also a hint of red apple, adding a touch of fruity freshness to the overall aroma profile.

The palate delivers a harmonious blend of flavors. Initial notes of graham crackers and citrus give way to rich toffee and a muted sweet cinnamon spice. These flavors are beautifully balanced with white grape notes, creating a complex and satisfying taste experience. 

The finish is long and warming, with a subtle hint of cayenne pepper adding a gentle spicy kick to the conclusion. This final note of heat provides an interesting contrast to the sweeter elements present throughout the sip.

Kentucky Owl Confiscated is a full-flavored and full-bodied bourbon that offers a rich drinking experience. It successfully captures the spirit of its historical inspiration while delivering a thoroughly modern and enjoyable bourbon. This expression would appeal to both bourbon enthusiasts and those interested in the storied history of American whiskey.

name: Baker's 7 Year Single Barrel 2023 Release
description: The nose on Baker’s Single Barrel opens with just a bit of light alcohol, followed by rich, chewy caramel and dry oak. There are also wafts of baking spices, including nutmeg and vanilla, like a freshly opened package of Nilla Wafers. Finally, there’s a hint of light fruit, perhaps apple. The nose is really fantastic, with no signs of 107 proof heat.  On the palate, Baker’s delivers sweet butterscotch and light oak. Again, like the nose, any proof heat on the palate is hidden. A little bit of chewing evokes raw peanut and toffee in the form of peanut brittle. There’s also the note of a chalky pink bubblegum stick, like from the old Topps baseball cards. Finally, the proof heat peaks its head out for just a second with a nip of black pepper.  The finish is medium-short, at best. And while it’s pleasant with more toffee and a touch of sweet corn, I expected it to have a bit more proof pop and length.

name: Wild Turkey Cheesy Gold Foil 12 Year 1991 Bottling
description: First released in 1985, this is a 1991 bottling of Wild Turkey's highly sought after cheesy gold foil edition. This 12 year old bourbon is bottled at their signature 101 proof and lasted until 1992 when it was changed to a split label. Older editions of Wild Turkey are particularly sought after amongst enthusiasts, notably for their remarkably different taste profile to modern Wild Turkey bottles. The distillery originally produced bourbon using cypress wood tanks but these were slowly phased out from 1984 until 1990. The other notable production change came in 2004 when the barrel entry proof was changed to 110, up from 107. The combination of these changes have resulted in serious demand for older vintage bottlings from the much loved distillery, with some believing 1990s era bottlings to be the distillery’s best ever.
baxus_class_name: Wild Turkey Cheesy Gold Foil 12 Year 1991 Bottling

name: Port Ellen 1982 19 Year Provenance Douglas McGibbon
description: A small batch offering of the once closed distillery Port Ellen. This expression was distilled in 1982 and matured for 19 years before being bottled by Douglas McGibbon, a subsidiary of Douglas Laing, in their Provenance label. Port Ellen has become some of the most sought after single malt whisky after the distillery closed in 1983, before being revived in 2024.
baxus_class_name: Port Ellen 1982 19 Year Provenance Douglas McGibbon

name: Chicken Cock Red Stave
description:
Chicken Cock Red Stave is a unique bourbon that celebrates the harmonious blend of two iconic American industries: Kentucky bourbon and California wine. This expression is crafted from Kentucky Straight Bourbon Whiskey and finished in carefully selected J. Wilkes Petite Sirah barrels, resulting in a spirit that appeals to both whiskey and wine enthusiasts.

On the nose, Red Stave presents enticing aromas of dark chocolate, toasted oak, and dried fruit, creating an inviting introduction. The palate reveals a delightful evolution of flavors, starting with traditional notes of dark chocolate, bold caramel, and vanilla. These initial flavors transition into vibrant fruit notes of pear, apple, cherry, and red currant, culminating in a long finish marked by bright cranberry tartness and a hint of black pepper.

The complexity continues on the finish, where lingering notes of nutmeg and clove spice add depth to the overall experience. Chicken Cock Red Stave exemplifies the distillery's commitment to quality and innovation, making it a standout choice for those seeking a rich and multifaceted bourbon experience. With its unique barrel finishing process and expertly crafted flavor profile, this bourbon invites exploration and appreciation from both whiskey lovers and newcomers alike.

name: Glenfarclas London 25 Year 2019 Release
description:
Nose: natural and elegant whisky, with a firm bready base and plenty of tiny nuances. Orange peel, baked apples, various herbal notes (rosemary for instance) and light menthol. Floral honey. Whiffs of wood polish and just a light leafy, earthy touch.

Mouth: rich, now slightly sweeter and more sherry influenced. Toast with chestnut honey, a little gingerbread and walnut cake. Raisins and (blood) oranges. Moving towards spiced chocolate and hints of espresso. Blackberries and herbal notes again (thyme). Nicely integrated oak.

Finish: long, with sweet spices, chocolate, a little oak char and raisins.

name: SMWS G3.8 Caledonian 1979 35 Year
description: A 1979 vintage single cask expression of single grain Scottish whisky produced at the Caledonian distillery. It was matured for 35 years in a refill bourbon hogshead and bottled at 53.9% Abv by the Scotch Malt Whisky Society.

name: David Nicholson 1964 7 Year Bottled In Bond
description: A 1964 vintage expression of David Nicholson distilled at the Stitzel-Weller distillery. Matured for 7 years it was bottled in bond at 100 proof in 1971. This original recipe Stitzel-Weller was distilled just one year before the legendary Pappy Van Winkle passed away. It will have been crafted with wet jug yeast carefully cultivated and with the higher wheat mashbill pioneered by Pappy.
baxus_class_name: David Nicholson 1964 7 Year Bottled In Bond

name: Pappy Van Winkle 20 Year Family Reserve 2012 Bottling
description: A 2012 bottling of Pappy Van Winkle 20 year old bourbon. This era of Pappy was crafted from barrels produced at the Stitzel-Weller distillery, the legendary closed distillery that produced Old Fitzgerald. This 2012 era release was bottled at Buffalo Trace after Julian Van Winkle moved his operations to there. This is the final year that Stitzel-Weller barrels could be included in the vatting as the distillery closed in 1992.
baxus_class_name: Pappy Van Winkle 20 Year Family Reserve 2012 Bottling

name: Springbank 1999 16 Year Old Local Barley
description: The first edition in the modern series of Springbank’s local barley label, this 1999 vintage was crafted from the Prisma barley strain grown at Machrimore farm. Matured for 16 years it was bottled in 2016 at 54.3% Abv. The local barley series is, as the name suggests, a line of bottlings crafted exclusively from barley grown on the Kintyre peninsula where Springbank is located. Various barley types and farms have contributed to this series, creating a unique style of spirit that is then left to quietly mature for decades to come.

name: Michter's Single Barrel Fort Nelson Select Rye
description:
Michter's US*1 Single Barrel Straight Rye Whiskey is a highly regarded expression that showcases the distillery's commitment to quality and craftsmanship. This rye whiskey is made from select American rye grain that is sheared to maximize flavor absorption during fermentation and aged in a heated warehouse.

On the nose, Michter's Rye offers an inviting bouquet of aromas. Sweet notes of caramel and vanilla are complemented by subtle floral touches, creating a complex and enticing scent. There's also a hint of coconut that adds an intriguing dimension to the aroma profile.

The palate delivers a harmonious blend of flavors. Initial waves of vanilla and caramel give way to more complex notes of black pepper, marmalade, and plum. The rye's signature spiciness is present but well-balanced, offering a gentle warmth rather than an overwhelming heat. Light hints of coconut and baking spices add depth and complexity to the overall flavor profile.

The finish is long and satisfying, with lingering notes of spicy grain and light caramel. There's a pleasant interplay between the sweetness and the rye spice, creating a balanced and enjoyable conclusion to each sip.

Michter's Rye has garnered critical acclaim, with The Tasting Panel awarding it an impressive 99 points. They praised its "cinnamon-covered butterscotch candy" character and noted subtle background notes of summer peach and apricot nectar.

This whiskey exemplifies Michter's dedication to producing premium rye, offering a rich and nuanced drinking experience that appeals to both rye enthusiasts and those new to the category. Its balance of sweetness and spice makes it versatile enough to enjoy neat, on the rocks, or as a premium base for cocktails.
baxus_class_name: Michter's Single Barrel Fort Nelson Select Rye

name: Ardbeg Uigeadail 2004 Bottling
description: An older/early batch of Ardbeg's Uigeadail edition crafted from older age stated stocks produced before the distillery's closure and eventual reopening. Bottled at 54.2% Abv.

name: Blue Run Double Oak Rye - 2023
description:
Blue Run Double Oak Rye is an innovative expression that highlights the distillery's commitment to pushing the boundaries of traditional whiskey-making. This unique rye whiskey undergoes a double oak aging process, resulting in a complex and richly flavored spirit.

On the nose, Blue Run Double Oak Rye offers a captivating blend of aromas. Initial notes of cinnamon and nutmeg are complemented by hints of vanilla and caramel, likely enhanced by the second oak aging. There's also a subtle undercurrent of fresh fruit, perhaps apple or pear, adding depth to the bouquet.

The palate delivers a harmonious balance of spice and sweetness. The signature rye spiciness is present with notes of black pepper and clove, but it's tempered by the additional oak influence. Flavors of toasted oak, dark chocolate, and maple syrup intermingle, creating a rich and full-bodied mouthfeel. The double oaking process imparts a noticeable layer of complexity, with hints of char and subtle tannins enhancing the overall flavor profile.

The finish is long and warming, with lingering notes of baking spices, oak, and a touch of dark fruit. There's a pleasant interplay between the spicy rye character and the sweet, oaky notes from the second barrel, creating a satisfying conclusion to each sip.

Blue Run Double Oak Rye exemplifies the distillery's innovative approach, appealing to both rye enthusiasts and those seeking new flavor experiences in their whiskey.

name: Augusta 8 Year Single Barrel #39 Old Route 8 For Justin's House Of Bourbon
description: The Augusta Distillery is located in the charming, historic river town of Augusta, Kentucky, sitting on the limestone banks of the picturesque Ohio River.
