This large 1.75 litre format handle was bottled in 1981, a period of time where the distillery utilised wooden vats for their mash and a lower barrel entry proof of 107. Rare to see in such a large format, early 1980's bottlings from Wild Turkey are held in high regard amongst enthusiasts.

name: Old Spring 4 Year 1970s Bottling
description: Distilled at the Hoffman /Old Commonwealth distillery, this 4 year old bourbon was exported for the German market in the 1970s. Old Spring was a historic brand produced by the Hoffman/Old Commonwealth distillery in Lawrenceburg Kentucky. The site would later be known as the Ezra Brooks distillery before being shuttered in the late 1970s. Julian Van Winkle would then move in, using the site for all of his bottling operations until 2002 when he moved to Buffalo Trace.

name: Martingale Lot 1 2023 Release
description: COGNAC FOR A NEW GENERATION Martingale. The French word for doubling down. The emblem of a refreshingly new style of Cognac. A blend of four of the most sought-after crus, with a high Borderies content. Fresh, fragrant, and refined, it offers an exquisite balance of complexity and smoothness.  A FRESH TAKE ON COGNAC THE NUANCED STRUCTURE OF A GREAT WHISKY MEETS THE FRAGRANT AROMA OF A FINE WINE  A fresher, more fragrant style of Cognac Crafted from a blend of four of the most sought-after crus The result of more than 100 years of Cognac making tradition and craft  FROM GRAPE TO GLASS Maison Thomas is rare among Cognac producers; having complete control of the entire process from the vineyards to the final liquid enjoyed today. We like to think of this as being closer to the cycle of nature. Controlling the process means we don’t need to standardize the liquid with additives like boisé. Martingale is pure and fresh for your enjoyment.  Crafted from a blend of four of the most sought-after crus, with a notable Borderies content, Martingale embodies freshness, fragrance, and refinement.  COLOR: A bright, precious amber with deep golden and honeyed reflections. NOSE: Elegant and refined with notes of spring flowers, acacia, light vanilla, almonds and madeleine. TASTE: Well-rounded with an abundance of freshness. Hints of tannins and oak balance perfectly with subtle floral and fruity notes. FINISH: Soft, long, with lingering notes of elegant sandalwood denoting maturity and refinement.  ABOUT MARTINGALE: A CENTURY IN THE MAKING Martingale Cognac is the result of more than 100 years of Cognac making tradition and craft. From the fourth-generation custodians of one of the most envied domaines in the region comes a new style of Cognac, which honors a proud family’s endless pursuit of excellence while pushing the boundaries of creativity. Martingale is fresh, fragrant, and refined; offering an exquisite balance of complexity and smoothness.  Raymond Thomas—grandfather of founders Guillaume and Amaury Thomas—was a true entrepreneur; relentless, brave and undeterred by risks and setbacks. Martingale is a tribute to Raymond’s legacy and his belief in doubling down rather than backing down.  The Thomas family has been making Cognac for over a century, supplying the most prestigious brands with outstanding quality product, and in doing so has built one of the largest vineyards and distilleries throughout the famed appellation. Their products have, until now, been enjoyed anonymously.  The 2023 release of Martingale Cognac marks a very important milestone for this proud and determined family. The uniqueness of the liquid and packaging are testament to Raymond’s vision and entrepreneurial spirit, which lives on in his grandsons.

name: Glenfarclas 15 Year Trio Selection Taiwan Exclusive
description: A limited release botting from Glenfarclas. Fully matured in Sherry Casks, this bottle contains 15 year old Glenfarclas, and was released as part of the 'Trio Selection', a Taiwanese exlusive designed to showcase the best of the distilleries liquid at 13, 14, and 15 years old. Bottled on 21st April 2016, each age statement was limited to 1800 bottles.
baxus_class_name: Glenfarclas 15 Year Trio Selection Taiwan Exclusive

name: Blanton's Single Barrel 2021 Bottling
description: Blanton’s Original was the first bourbon to be bottled from a single barrel back in 1984, revolutionising American whiskey and bringing it back to its former glory. Every batch is unique and the bottling strength of 46.5% helps maintain the authentic character of each barrel.

name: Elijah Craig 8 Year Single Barrel For Loch & Key Society
description: A single barrel expression of Elijah Craig bourbon matured for 8 years on the 6th floor of warehouse R. This barrel was chosen by The Loch & Key Society and is bottled at 94 proof.
baxus_class_name: Elijah Craig 8 Year Single Barrel For Loch & Key Society

name: Caol Ila 13 Year Discovery Series Gordon & Macphail
description: The Gordon & MacPhail Discovery range examines the core flavours at the heart of Scotch single malt whisky, and this is the headline of the Smoky side of things. A 13-year-old Caol Ila from the island of Islay, this is as typical a dram as you can get from the island, packed with sweet fruit and dark peat smoke.
baxus_class_name: Caol Ila 13 Year Discovery Series Gordon & Macphail

name: Suntory Old Whisky
description: Suntory Old whisky is a series of whiskies from Suntory, first released in the 1950's when it was considered the classiest of all of Suntory’s whiskies. Labelled The Finest Old whisky and A Taste of Japanese Tradition, this is a beautifully presented bottle of Suntory’s finest blended Japanese malt whisky

name: Glenfarclas 14 Year Trio Selection Taiwan Exclusive
description: A limited release botting from Glenfarclas. Fully matured in Sherry Casks, this bottle contains 14 year old Glenfarclas, and was released as part of the 'Trio Selection', a Taiwanese exlusive designed to showcase the best of the distilleries liquid at 13, 14, and 15 years old. Bottled on 19th May 2016, each age statement was limited to 1800 bottles.
baxus_class_name: Glenfarclas 14 Year Trio Selection Taiwan Exclusive

name: Found North Peregrine First Flight 20 Year - 2023
description: Peregrine First Flight is the first 20 year old age-stated whisky we have released and is the culmination of a whisky-making process that we have been developing for the last several years. Our love for Canadian whisky is rooted in blending. Canadian whisky is made by distilling and aging individual grains in order to maximize the creative flexibility of the blender. With Peregrine we took this process a step further. We created a blend and then recasked it into French Limousin, American ex-Cognac and new American oak casks for a 5-month further maturation. After 5 months we took the best 7 casks and reblended them to create Peregrine.  Peregrine started as a blend of 20 year old rye aged in ex-Speyside scotch casks, 22 year old corn in new American oak, 23 year old corn in refill oak, 24 year old corn in ex-bourbon and 27 year old corn in Hungarian oak. Before we further matured this whisky it was blended to create a balanced whisky with a clean palate. The nose was bright with milk chocolate, honeysuckle, orchard fruits, caramel and black pepper. The palate and body were light and fresh. In a synesthetic way, we planned for the original blend to consist of bright, vibrant colors, knowing the further maturation would darken, enliven and enrich the entire profile and tenor of the whisky.  After its further maturation in three different oak types and its reblend, the final whisky is elegant and decadent. The marvel of this whisky is the perfect integration of all the flavors across the entire palate, deep into the finish.  Flavor Notes The moment you pour Peregrine, candied peaches, exotic wood spice, lavender, milk chocolate and ground cashews flow from the glass in one harmonious chord. The combination of fruit, spice, wood, vanillin and citrus are exceptionally balanced with only a slight emphasis on the bouquet of glazed fruit notes - a symphony of clementine, raspberry and red apple.  Peregrine lands on the palate with a wintry freshness, followed almost immediately by a surging, fruity oiliness. The elegant mid palate thickens into a viscous combination of chocolate, orange and vanilla bean. As it spreads to the side palates, it transitions into cinnamon and herbaceous spice. The back of the palate erupts with sandalwood, lavender, shortbread and a touch of black pepper, barely hinting at its 126.2 proof. The momentary tannic warmth precedes a three stage finish. First comes a sweet gingerbread baking spice, followed by rich tonka bean and orange blossom water and finally, a lingering shortbread with mint leaf that echoes eternal.  Why We Made This Whisky The word “peregrine” derives from the medieval Latin “falco peregrinus” which translates to “pilgrim falcon.” In medieval times, falconers who wanted to train peregrines could not access their incredibly high nests. In order to train a peregrine, a falconer had to capture one on its “first flight,” its first migratory pilgrimage. Hence the name “falco peregrinus.”  We created Peregrine because we love the process of shaping and reshaping whisky through blending and maturation. When you recask a whisky you allow it to change its trajectory, move in a new direction. By blending the whisky before further maturation, we controlled the starting point. Good maturation of whisky requires matching the wood to the distillate, but we thought - what if we shape the liquid itself to best match a particular maturation regimen?  We named this whisky “Peregrine” because it resonates with our ethos and our belief that Found North is an ongoing exploration, a continual journey. And we named this collection “The High Altitude Collection” because we believe this process of creating a blend for the purpose of further maturation will take great whisky to new heights.
baxus_class_name: Found North Peregrine First Flight 20 Year - 2023

name: Glenfarclas 13 Year Trio Selection Taiwan Exclusive
description: A limited release botting from Glenfarclas. Fully matured in Sherry Casks, this bottle contains 13 year old Glenfarclas, and was released as part of the 'Trio Selection', a Taiwanese exlusive designed to showcase the best of the distilleries liquid at 13, 14, and 15 years old. Bottled on the 19th May 2016, each age statement was limited to 1800 bottles
baxus_class_name: Glenfarclas 13 Year Trio Selection Taiwan Exclusive

name: Old Elk 2018 Gold Spirits Winner
description:
From the distiller: "Everybody knows our Master Distiller Greg Metze is the man behind the mash, and there’s an entire team of passionate, hard-working whiskey lovers working right by his side. Here at Old Elk we’re proud to say everyone is equally dedicated to crafting the best experience for our customers near and far.
From the distillery, barrel room and bottling line, to our warehouse, sales teams and servers at The Reserve, each award-winning spirit we put out into the world is infused with decades of experience and skill from one of the most dedicated teams in the whiskey game."

name: B.J. Evans Very Rare Old Sour Mash 10 Year
baxus_class_name: B.J. Evans Very Rare Old Sour Mash 10 Year

name: Macallan 1996 18 Year Sherry Oak
description: The 1996 vintage Macallan is a complex cohesion of dried fruits, ginger, orange peel and leathery sherry. The latter influence is no surprise, after all, since the nectar matured exclusively in sherry casks from Jerez. An easy-drinking whisky that errs on the side of luxurious. Old Overholt still exists today, produced alongside Old Grand-dad by Jim Beam, who acquired both of 'The Olds' from National Distillers in 1987.

name: Bushmills 2012 Burgundy Casks Bottled 2022 For The Whisky Club
description: A 2012 vintage expression of Bushmills Irish single malt whisky matured until 2018 then recasked into ex-Burgundy red wine casks. After another 4 years of maturation it was bottled in 2022 exclusively for The Whisky Club in Australia at 41.8% Abv.
baxus_class_name: Bushmills 2012 Burgundy Casks Bottled 2022 For The Whisky Club

name: Eagle Rare 10 Year
description: Crafted using Buffalo Trace's low-rye Mash Bill #1 and aged for a minimum of 10 years in new, charred American oak barrels, this 90-proof bourbon is a crowd favourite.

name: Very Old Barton Hand Crafted 8 Year
description:
Very Old Barton is a distinguished bourbon whiskey renowned for its rich heritage, exceptional quality, and timeless appeal. Crafted with meticulous attention to detail and an unwavering commitment to tradition, Very Old Barton stands as a testament to the artistry and expertise of American whiskey-making.

The journey of Very Old Barton begins with the selection of the finest corn, rye, and barley grains, sourced from the heart of Kentucky's bourbon country. These premium ingredients form the foundation of a bourbon that embodies the essence of the American South.

Very Old Barton is aged to perfection in charred oak barrels, allowing the whiskey to mature gracefully and develop its signature depth and complexity. As it rests in the rickhouses, nestled among the rolling hills of Kentucky, the bourbon absorbs the nuances of its surroundings, infusing it with the spirit of the land.

Pouring a warm amber hue, Very Old Barton entices the senses with its inviting aromas of caramel, vanilla, and oak. On the palate, layers of rich butterscotch, toasted nuts, and spicy cinnamon unfold, creating a harmonious balance of flavors that linger long after each sip.

Smooth and full-bodied, Very Old Barton epitomizes the quintessential bourbon experience, offering a taste of Southern hospitality in every glass. Whether enjoyed neat, on the rocks, or as the foundation for classic cocktails, Very Old Barton is a whiskey that transcends time, inviting you to savor the moment and embrace the legacy of America's native spirit.
baxus_class_name: Very Old Barton Hand Crafted 8 Year

name: Invergordon 1974 43 Year Single Cask #20 Single Cask Nation
description: A single cask expression of single grain Scotch whisky from the Invergordon distillery. This cask was produced in 1974 and spent a massive 43 years maturing in a refill bourbon barrel. It was then bottled in 2017 at 43.9% Abv by American bottler Single Cask Nation with just 196 bottles produced.
baxus_class_name: Invergordon 1974 43 Year Single Cask #20 Single Cask Nation

name: Bowmore 1990 30 Year Single Cask #3974 For Japan East Asia Whisky Company
description: A 1990 vintage single cask expression of Bowmore matured for 30 years in a 1st fill sherry oak cask. It was bottled at 50.1% Abv exclusively for the Japanese market by East Asia Whisky Company.
baxus_class_name: Bowmore 1990 30 Year Single Cask #3974 For Japan East Asia Whisky Company

name: Old Crow Sour Mash
description: Old Crow Kentucky Straight Bourbon Whiskey is a historic and iconic bourbon, renowned for its pioneering use of the sour mash process, which was developed by Dr. James C. Crow in the 1830s. This process involves using a portion of the previous fermentation's mash to start the new batch, ensuring consistency and quality. The bottle features a classic design with the "Old Crow" branding prominently displayed, along with the text "Kentucky Straight Bourbon Whiskey" and "Sour Mash." The amber-colored liquid inside reflects its rich heritage. Old Crow was once the top-selling bourbon in the United States and was favored by notable figures such as President Ulysses S. Grant and writer Mark Twain. Today, it is produced by Jim Beam and remains a value-oriented bourbon, known for its light caramel, oak, and grain flavors with subtle vanilla and banana notes. Despite its decline in prestige, Old Crow continues to be a significant name in the world of bourbon, representing a storied legacy in American whiskey history.

name: Invergordon 1974 46 Year Single Cask Single Cask Nation
description: A single cask expression of single grain Scotch whisky from the Invergordon distillery. This cask was produced in 1974 and spent a massive 46 years maturing in a refill bourbon barrel. It was then bottled in 2020 at 46.2% Abv by American bottler Single Cask Nation with just 153 bottles produced.
baxus_class_name: Invergordon 1974 46 Year Single Cask Single Cask Nation

name: Macallan 1990 30 Year Single Hogshead #7393 For Japan East Asia Whisky Company
description: A 1990 vintage single cask expression of Macallan matured for 30 years in a 1st fill sherry oak hogshead. It was bottled in 2020 at 56.1% Abv exclusively for the Japanese market by East Asia Whisky Company.
baxus_class_name: Macallan 1990 30 Year Single Hogshead #7393 For Japan East Asia Whisky Company

name: Sempe Armagnac 1952
description: Sempé is one of Armagnac's most known houses. It was founded in 1934 by Abel Sempé, a Gascon tirelessly working in the service of his country and region. He was a recognised member of the resistance for the Armagnac batallion then Senator for the Gers for many years.

name: Heaven Hill 20 Year Corn Whiskey Heritage Collection 2023 Release
description: A huge 20 year old expression of corn whiskey from Heaven Hill crafted from an 80% corn mashbill with 8% rye and 12% malted barley. It was bottled at 57.5% Abv as part of their Heritage Collection.
baxus_class_name: Heaven Hill 20 Year Corn Whiskey Heritage Collection 2023 Release

name: Ardbeg 1991 25 Year Old Single Cask Hunter Laing
description: Distilled in 1991 this exceptionally rare named Ardbeg single cask was matured for 25 years in a refill hogshead. Casks sold by Ardbeg are usually required to be sold as “Secret Islay”, so a single cask with the Ardbeg naming rights is a unique rarity. Bottled in 2016 at 51.9% Abv 20 bottles were produced of this magnum version of this release. That’s a 1500ml bottle of 25 year old single cask Ardbeg!
baxus_class_name: Ardbeg 1991 25 Year Old Single Cask Hunter Laing

name: Rabbit Hole Dareringer Artist Series A Midsummer Night’s Dream - 2023
series: Artist Series A Midsummer Night’s Dream
baxus_class_name: Rabbit Hole Dareringer Artist Series A Midsummer Night’s Dream - 2023

name: Invergordon 1987 31 Year Single Cask #88721 The Distinctive Spirits Co
description: A single cask expression of single grain Scotch whisky from the Invergordon distillery. This cask was produced in 1987 and spent 31 years quietly maturing in a refill bourbon barrel. It was then bottled in 2019 at 54.8% Abv by The Distinctive Spirits Co and given the nickname “She Said Smoothie”.
baxus_class_name: Invergordon 1987 31 Year Single Cask #88721 The Distinctive Spirits Co

name: Johnnie Walker Blue Label Ghost & Rare Port Ellen Blend
description: A sweet and fruity release in Johnnie Walker's Blue Label Ghost & Rare series featuring casks from Islay ghost distillery Port Ellen and 7 other rare whiskies in the Johnnie Walker stable.
baxus_class_name: Johnnie Walker Blue Label Ghost & Rare Port Ellen Blend

name: Lenell's Black Unicorn - 2024
description:
Black Unicorn Whisky is a remarkable creation by LeNell Camacho Santa Ana, the owner of LeNell’s Beverage Boutique in Birmingham, Alabama. This inaugural expression is not merely a product launch; it represents a transformative vision inspired by a deep appreciation for art and a desire to foster genuine connections with distillers. Camacho Santa Ana emphasizes that her approach transcends typical barrel pick programs, focusing instead on the emotional and artistic resonance of the whiskey-making process.

The whisky itself is a high-proof spirit with an alcohol by volume (ABV) of 74.7%, distilled at Charbay Distillery in California. It features a unique mash bill of 52% corn and 48% two-row barley, carefully crafted using a custom-made alembic pot still. This meticulous distillation process enhances the whisky's malty richness, resulting in a complex flavor profile that has garnered attention from enthusiasts worldwide.

Camacho Santa Ana’s journey to create Black Unicorn began at the Birmingham art festival, where she encountered John Lytle Wilson's evocative painting, "Enter the Unicorn." This experience ignited her creative spirit and led to a collaboration that would see Wilson's artwork featured on the bottle. The production process was intricate, involving legal negotiations and artistic refinements to ensure that the final product was not only a high-quality whisky but also a work of art.

Each bottle of Black Unicorn is hand-filled, labeled, and sealed with a unique wax featuring glittering hearts and stars, making it a collectible item. With only 248 bottles produced, this limited release is priced at $500 per 750-ml bottle, reflecting its artisanal nature and the care invested in its creation.

Looking ahead, Camacho Santa Ana plans to continue her mission of collaborating with distillers to create innovative expressions of Black Unicorn, with future releases expected to retail at more accessible prices. Her commitment to artistry and community is further demonstrated through her support for local initiatives, including her corporate charity, TAKE Birmingham, which serves the needs of the local black transgender community. Black Unicorn Whisky is not just a drink; it embodies a heartfelt connection between the creator, the distillers, and the consumers, celebrating the spirit of creativity and collaboration in the world of whisky.

name: Michter’s Barrel Strength Bourbon 2018 Release
description: A 2018 special release from Michter’s featuring their signature bourbon at a barrel proof strength of 53.4% Abv. This limited offering was exclusively distributed in Kentucky.

name: Old Weller Antique 107 Single Barrel #100 Warehouse Liquors
description: An older dumpy format bottling of Old Weller bottled prior to 2016. This 107 proof bourbon is a rare single barrel chosen by the staff at Warehouse Liquors and bottled at the classic Weller 107 proof.
baxus_class_name: Old Weller Antique 107 Single Barrel #100 Warehouse Liquors

name: Woodford Reserve Personal Selection
description: A store pick custom blend of Woodford Reserve bottled exclusively for a client in a 1 litre format.

name: Door Knocker 5 Year Barrel XVI
description: The 16th barrel from Door Knocker this high rye bourbon was matured in a #4 char barrel for 5 years before being bottled at 105 proof. Just three barrels of this mashbill and cask type were produced.

name: Wild Turkey 101  8 Year 1999 Bottling
description:
The Wild Turkey 8 Year 101 Proof, a Japan-exclusive release, offers bourbon enthusiasts a unique opportunity to experience a carefully aged expression of this iconic Kentucky whiskey. Bottled at the classic 101 proof (50.5% ABV), this bourbon showcases the distillery's commitment to crafting high-quality spirits for the discerning Japanese market. The 8-year age statement sets it apart from the standard Wild Turkey 101 available in the United States, promising a more refined and complex flavor profile.

On the nose, this bourbon presents a rich bouquet of aromas, including caramel, vanilla, and toasted oak, with subtle hints of dried fruit and spices. The palate delivers a robust flavor experience, featuring a harmonious blend of sweet and spicy notes. Expect to taste layers of butterscotch, cinnamon, and nutmeg, underpinned by the characteristic Wild Turkey "funk" that enthusiasts have come to love. The 8 years of aging in heavily charred American oak barrels imparts a depth and maturity that elevates this expression above its younger counterparts, resulting in a smoother, more balanced sip with a long, warming finish that lingers with notes of oak and sweet spices. While not as rare or sought-after as its 12-year-old sibling, the Wild Turkey 8 Year 101 Proof remains a prized find for bourbon collectors and a testament to Wild Turkey's global appeal.

name: Kavalan Artist Virgin Oak - 2020
description: The first edition of Kavalan Artist Series has been created in collaboration with international artist Paul Chiang. Deeply inspired by classical music and the natural beauty of his homeland Taiwan, this limited series showcases Paul’s vibrant and expressive brushstrokes translated into four elements – Ocean, Sunlight, Air, and Mother Earth. Each element plays and essential role in crafting each and every cask at Kavalan Distillery. New American oak barrels from the backbone of this Kavalan Symphony, sweet notes of tropical fruits and honey are interwoven into this breathtaking masterpiece. The subtropical climate breathes balance into the water molecules and alcohol that evaporate into the air; paired with just the right amount of toasting and recharring, a Lanyang Plain masterpiece is born.

name: Lagvulin SMS Lg6 8 Year 2016 Release
description: Lagavulin Lg6 SMS is a NAS Single Malt whisky from Scotland. Bottled in 2016 at 53.7% this bottle will make a fine addition to any Scotland Single Malt whisky lover. Please note that this Speciality Drinks Ltd (SMS) is Refill Hogsheads. It is also worth mentioning that this is uncolored, non-chillfiltered, cask strength edition of Lagavulin.

name: Old Crow Chessmen Dark Pawn
description: Back in the 1960s through the 80s, distilleries were having trouble selling their whiskey in bottles so they started creating unique bottlings through the use of Decanters. Old Crow, which was owned and produced by National Distillers created a full chess set of decanter bottles, complete with all pieces and the ability to send them postage to receive a carpeted chessboard as well. The whiskey inside is 86pf and age stated 10 years, but is among some of the highest rated whiskey by vintage enthusiasts that has ever been produced.

name: Bernheim 7 Year Barrel Proof 2022 Release
description: An early batch of Bernheim barrel proof matured for 7 years. Crafted from wheat, this Kentucky wheat whiskey is bottled at 64% Abv in 2022 before the wider launch of Bernheim as a batched barrel proof offering.

name: Wild Turkey Batch WT-01-95 Rare Breed
description: A 1995 release of Wild Turkey Rare Breed, a barrel proof expression of bourbon. Older editions of Wild Turkey are particularly sought after amongst enthusiasts, notably for their remarkably different taste profile to modern Wild Turkey bottles. The distillery originally produced bourbon using cypress wood tanks but these were slowly phased out from 1984 until 1990. The other notable production change came in 2004 when the barrel entry proof was changed to 110, up from 107. The combination of these changes have resulted in serious demand for older vintage bottlings from the much loved distillery, with some believing 1990s era bottlings to be the distillery’s best ever.
baxus_class_name: Wild Turkey Batch WT-01-95 Rare Breed

name: Kavalan Artist Collective Peated Malt
description: The first edition of Kavalan Artist Series has been created in collaboration with international artist Paul Chiang. Deeply inspired by classical music and the natural beauty of his homeland Taiwan, this limited series showcases Paul’s vibrant and expressive brushstrokes translated into four elements – Ocean, Sunlight, Air, and Mother Earth. Each element plays and essential role in crafting each and every cask at Kavalan Distillery.

name: WilD Turkey 101 Proof 12 Year
description: This special release has been carefully selected from the distillers' favorite reserve, barreled at a lower proof and slowly matured to create a bourbon of exceptional quality. With notes of vanilla, rich caramel, hints of spice and a long chocolate orange finish.

name: Rare Character 6 Year Single Barrel Mash & Journey Whiskey Club
description: A 2016 vintage single barrel bourbon from Rare Character using sourced bourbon from Indiana. Matured for 6 years and bottled in 2022, it was crafted from a mashbill of 75% corn, 21% rye, 4% malted barley. Chosen by Mash & Journey Whiskey Club this barrel was bottled at 56.77% Abv.
baxus_class_name: Rare Character 6 Year Single Barrel Mash & Journey Whiskey Club

name: Jefferson's Reserve Derby Day 2023 Limited Edition
description: A 2023 special edition from Jefferson bottled to celebrate the Kentucky Derby.
baxus_class_name: Jefferson's Reserve Derby Day 2023 Limited Edition

name: Kavalan Artist Collective French Wine Cask - 2020
description: The first edition of Kavalan Artist Series has been created in collaboration with international artist Paul Chiang. Deeply inspired by classical music and the natural beauty of his homeland Taiwan, this limited series showcases Paul’s vibrant and expressive brushstrokes translated into four elements – Ocean, Sunlight, Air, and Mother Earth. Each element plays and essential role in crafting each and every cask at Kavalan Distillery. Red wine barrels from the finest wineries in France are instrumental to this artistic masterpiece. A rich aroma paired with an understated and full-bodied texture leaves a lasting impression. Soft tannins and warmth add zest to this creation, bringing out the rich complexity of flavours slumbering within; gaze upon the liquid amber in tranquil reflection as it mirrors the last golden rays of sunset.
baxus_class_name: Kavalan Artist Collective French Wine Cask - 2020

name: Bunnahabhain Mòine 7 Year Single Cask #3180 Feis Ile 2004
description: A heavily peated expression of Bunnahabhain, this single cask was matured for 7 years and bottled at 59.6% Abv exclusively for the 2004 edition of the annual Feis Ile Islay festival.
baxus_class_name: Bunnahabhain Mòine 7 Year Single Cask #3180 Feis Ile 2004

name: Wild Turkey Batch W-T-03-94 Rare Breed
description: A 1994 release of Wild Turkey Rare Breed, a barrel proof expression of bourbon. Older editions of Wild Turkey are particularly sought after amongst enthusiasts, notably for their remarkably different taste profile to modern Wild Turkey bottles. The distillery originally produced bourbon using cypress wood tanks but these were slowly phased out from 1984 until 1990. The other notable production change came in 2004 when the barrel entry proof was changed to 110, up from 107. The combination of these changes have resulted in serious demand for older vintage bottlings from the much loved distillery, with some believing 1990s era bottlings to be the distillery’s best ever.
baxus_class_name: Wild Turkey Batch W-T-03-94 Rare Breed

name: Elijah Craig Barrel Proof 13 Year C923 - 2023
baxus_class_name: Elijah Craig Barrel Proof 13 Year C923 - 2023

name: 1792 Full Proof Single Barrel Select
description:
Established in 1879, Barton 1792 is the oldest fully operational distillery in Bardstown, one of the Kentucky's most prominent cities in bourbon production.

The Full Proof release, bottled at a hardy 62.5% ABV, is a non chill-filtered release that aims to please those looking for a rich flavor in their whiskey. The Single Barrel Select series allows individuals or organizations to sample different casks until one is chosen, and bottle a batch for themselves.

name: Willett 2006 7 Year XCF Version 1
description: For this first release of our Exploratory Cask Finish Project, select barrels of seven-year-old American Rye Whiskey were finished in Curacao Casks, sourced from France, for approximately 90 days.

name: Blackout 15 Year Single Barrel #6 American Straight Whiskey
description: A 15 year old single barrel expression of American whiskey distilled in Indiana. Bottled at 68.1% Abv by Blackout.
baxus_class_name: Blackout 15 Year Single Barrel #6 American Straight Whiskey

name: Kavalan Artist Collective Puncheon
description: The first edition of Kavalan Artist Series has been created in collaboration with international artist Paul Chiang. Deeply inspired by classical music and the natural beauty of his homeland Taiwan, this limited series showcases Paul’s vibrant and expressive brushstrokes translated into four elements – Ocean, Sunlight, Air, and Mother Earth. Each element plays and essential role in crafting each and every cask at Kavalan Distillery. Puncheon traversed ocean and three great continents before arriving in Yilan, revealing a liquor as rare as long-hidden deep ocean treasure. Whisky aged in Puncheon have smooth textures that belie an ocean of depth and complexity. Savour a deliciously tantalizing, multilayered flavour that will leave you intrigued and captivated.

name: Wild Turkey Batch W-T-01-96 Rare Breed
description: A 1996 release of Wild Turkey Rare Breed, a barrel proof expression of bourbon. Older editions of Wild Turkey are particularly sought after amongst enthusiasts, notably for their remarkably different taste profile to modern Wild Turkey bottles. The distillery originally produced bourbon using cypress wood tanks but these were slowly phased out from 1984 until 1990. The other notable production change came in 2004 when the barrel entry proof was changed to 110, up from 107. The combination of these changes have resulted in serious demand for older vintage bottlings from the much loved distillery, with some believing 1990s era bottlings to be the distillery’s best ever.
baxus_class_name: Wild Turkey Batch W-T-01-96 Rare Breed

name: Blackout 11 Year Single Barrel #20
description: An 11 year old expression of straight American whiskey distilled in Kentucky. This single barrel was finished in a honey barrel and bottled at 58% Abv by Blackout.

name: Laphroaig 1987 30 Year Single Cask #DL11834 Douglas Laing
description: This wonderful 30 year old Islay single malt was laid to sleep at the Laphroaig distillery in May 1987 and bottled in June 2017 for Douglas Laing's Xtra Old Particular series - together with new premium packaging for the 2017 season; which includes a smart glass stopper, wooden presentation case and COA.
baxus_class_name: Laphroaig 1987 30 Year Single Cask #DL11834 Douglas Laing

name: Wild Turkey Batch W-T-01-91 Rare Breed
description: The first ever batch of Rare Breed from Wild Turkey, a barrel proof bourbon blended from barrels aged 6 to 12 years. This 1991 batch was bottled at 54.8% Abv. Older editions of Wild Turkey are particularly sought after amongst enthusiasts, notably for their remarkably different taste profile to modern Wild Turkey bottles. The distillery originally produced bourbon using cypress wood tanks but these were slowly phased out from 1984 until 1990. The other notable production change came in 2004 when the barrel entry proof was changed to 110, up from 107. The combination of these changes have resulted in serious demand for older vintage bottlings from the much loved distillery, with some believing 1990s era bottlings to be the distillery’s best ever.
baxus_class_name: Wild Turkey Batch W-T-01-91 Rare Breed

name: Balvenie Tun 1509 Batch 2 2015 Release
description: Batch #2 of the Tun 1509 features a marriage of 32 different  casks, selected by David Stewart (23 American oak casks and nine European oak sherry casks), spending a few months in the huge Tun as they harmonize, to create this whisky. What is very cool in those Tun releases is the transparency, the Balvenie have attached an info graphic containing data and info about each and every of those 32 casks which went into the vatting, each with a cask # and characteristics (it is forbidden by SWA laws to indicate age, as we’ve seen done in the latest Compass Box feud).

name: Four Roses Single Barrel Reserve
description: This featured release is the Four Roses Single Barrel Reserve Kentucky Straight Bourbon - an older iteration of Four Roses' highly popular single-barrel bourbon. It is the first single barrel product released by Four Roses. It is an OESV mashbill and was released exclusively in the Asian market in the early 1990's. Extremely rare and much-coveted for its collectability, this premium whiskey is composed of an undisclosed mash bill estimated to contain similar ratios of corn, rye, and malted barley as Four Roses’ current single barrel recipe (60%/35%/5%).

name: Wild Turkey Batch W-T-01-97 Rare Breed
description: A 1997 release of Wild Turkey Rare Breed, a barrel proof expression of bourbon. Older editions of Wild Turkey are particularly sought after amongst enthusiasts, notably for their remarkably different taste profile to modern Wild Turkey bottles. The distillery originally produced bourbon using cypress wood tanks but these were slowly phased out from 1984 until 1990. The other notable production change came in 2004 when the barrel entry proof was changed to 110, up from 107. The combination of these changes have resulted in serious demand for older vintage bottlings from the much loved distillery, with some believing 1990s era bottlings to be the distillery’s best ever.
baxus_class_name: Wild Turkey Batch W-T-01-97 Rare Breed

name: Laphroaig 1997 18 Year Single Hogshead #8370 Signatory Vintage
description: A 1997 vintage single cask expression of Laphroaig matured for 18 years in a hogshead. Bottled in 2015 at 51.2% Abv by Signatory Vintage.
baxus_class_name: Laphroaig 1997 18 Year Single Hogshead #8370 Signatory Vintage

name: Fettercairn 1988 30 Year Single Hogshead #2042 Signatory Vintage
description: A 1988 vintage of the lesser seen Fettercairn matured for 30 years in a hogshead. It was bottled at a cask strength of 59.2% Abv by Signatory Vintage.
baxus_class_name: Fettercairn 1988 30 Year Single Hogshead #2042 Signatory Vintage

name: High West Yippee Ki-Yay
description: A double rye matured in oak barrels originally used to age two different types of wine. Californian Vermouth Barrels  and Californian Qupé Syrah barrels. A marriage of two straight rye whiskies, one was a 2 year old with a mashbill of 95% rye, 5% barley malt from MGP, and the older rye has a mashbill of 53% rye and 37% corn and was distilled at Barton Distillery.

name: Wild Turkey "Kentucky Spirit" Pewter Top - 1996
description:
The Wild Turkey Kentucky Spirit with the pewter top, produced from 1994 to 2001, represents a significant and highly sought-after expression in the distillery's history. This single barrel bourbon, bottled at 101 proof (50.5% ABV), was Wild Turkey's answer to the growing premium bourbon market of the 1990s, particularly in response to the success of Blanton's. The distinctive bottle design, shaped like a turkey with fanned feathers, and the weighty pewter stopper made it stand out on shelves and in collections.

What makes the pewter top Kentucky Spirit releases particularly special is their connection to Wild Turkey's heritage. These bottles were often filled with bourbon from Warehouses A, B, and C on the original Tyrone campus, which were personal favorites of Master Distiller Jimmy Russell. The age of the whiskey in these bottles is believed to range from 8 to 14 years, with some early releases potentially containing even older stocks. Tasting notes for these vintage Kentucky Spirits often describe a rich, complex flavor profile featuring the classic Wild Turkey "funk" - a combination of robust oak, vanilla, caramel, and spice, with a distinctive fruity and sometimes medicinal character that sets it apart from other bourbons of the era. Today, these pewter top releases are highly prized by collectors and enthusiasts, not just for their historical significance, but for the quality and unique character of the bourbon they contain.

name: Blackout 8 Year Single Barrel Bourbon #18
description: An 8 year old expression of bourbon from Indiana bottled at barrel proof by Blackout. This single barrel was bottled at 52% Abv.

name: Douglas Laing Port Ellen XOP 34 Year - 2016
description: his sensational 34 year old Islay single malt was laid to rest in May 1982 at Port Ellen, one of Scotland's legendary long lost distilleries, and bottled for Douglas Laing's Xtra Old Particular range in November 2016. Charged from refill hogshead number 11481 at a cask strength 48.5% ABV, this is one of only 219 very limited bottlings that comes complete with smart wooden presentation case and COA.
baxus_class_name: Douglas Laing Port Ellen XOP 34 Year - 2016

name: The Yamazaki NAS
description: Hailing from Japan's oldest malt distillery, the Yamazaki Single Malt Whisky is an embodiment of craftsmanship and the spirit of Japanese tradition. This exquisite whisky offers a harmonious symphony of flavors, from fruity undertones to subtle hints of smoke and spice. Matured in a unique combination of American, Spanish, and Japanese oak casks, each sip promises a journey through the serene landscapes of Kyoto. With its amber hue and velvety finish, the Yamazaki Single Malt is not just a drink, but an experience, making it a must-have for both seasoned connoisseurs and those new to the world of Japanese whiskies.

name: Benriach 25 Year 2020 Bottling
description: A 25 year old expression of Benriach bottled 2020. Matured in four unique casks including sherry, bourbon, madeira and virgin oak it is bottled at 46% Abv.

name: Suntory Yamazaki Excellence 1970s Bottling
description: Crafted from Yamazaki distilled malt & grain whisky this pot still based blend was bottled in the 1970s. Matured in sherry treated casks it was bottled in a 760ml format at 43% Abv.

name: Weller Antique 107 Single Barrel Select 2017 Bottling
description: Formerly known as Old Weller, the "old" has been dropped on the new packaging. This has been bottled at 107 proof and used to carry a 7 year age statement but this has now been removed. This bourbon however was distilled at Buffalo Trace by the Sazerac company, who purchased the brand from United distillers in 1999. In her book But Always Fine Bourbon, Sally Van Winkle Campbell claims they did not have the exact Weller recipe until their partnership with her brother, Julian Van Winkle III was agreed in 2002. Undoubtedly a nod of approval from the family for the modern day product. This is a special single barrel release, selected by The Loch and K(e)y Society and bottled from "microbatch #3135."
baxus_class_name: Weller Antique 107 Single Barrel Select 2017 Bottling

name: Redwood Empire 14 Year Haystack Needle Single Barrel
description: Nose: Honey, bold caramel-oak, star anise, a damp earthy funk as it opens up. Initially it reminds me of a butterscotch treat. It has a kind of lemon-brightness. Not lemon nose, but if you can imagine that brightness but with an oak note. After a good 5-10 minutes, the nose is exploding with caramel, its absurd. It's very oily as I swirl it around the glass, lots of streaks.  Palate: Burst of caramel, cinnamon. Extremely light and airy. There is a bit of ethanol from the alcohol, but it fades extremely quickly and shoots back to the caramel note. Its very one-dimensional. I want to say "short" but this is really more thin and airy, not brief. The palate is there, but far more subdued than the nose would suggest and its just not complex at all. In my notes I wrote "watery?", because it just kinda coats your mouth. Those oils from the glass are all over immediately and you feel it. An initial small burst of flavor from something sitting in an oak barrel for a decade+, but no nuance at all.  Finish: Oh baby. OH BABY. There it is. There's the 10+yr MGP. Its crazy because the palate ends for just a moment you think "is that it?", then BAM. Stunning bold oak that is remarkably smooth as it goes down. Honey-ed oak with baking spices. Im honestly amazed by how hard the finish is hitting. Wow. Oak, caramel, cinnamon in that order on repeat for a good 5+ minutes. Wonderful meld of cinnamon and oak for a good few minutes after it goes down. God damn.
baxus_class_name: Redwood Empire 14 Year Haystack Needle Single Barrel

name: Blackout 11 Year Madeira Finish Batch 2
description: An 11 year old expression of Kentucky sourced American whiskey finished in maderia casks. This is the second batch and is bottled at 63% Abv by Blackout.

name: Prometheus 1988 27 Year Cache 2 The Glasgow Distillery
description: A peated Speyside expression chosen by The Glasgow Distillery Company. This release was distilled in 1988 and matured for 27 years in 1st fill Spanish oak sherry casks. Bottled in 2015 at 47% Abv with 1500 bottles produced.
baxus_class_name: Prometheus 1988 27 Year Cache 2 The Glasgow Distillery

name: Peerless Single Barrel 108.6 Proof
description: The nose features citrus, cedar, and honeysuckle as well as a nice balance of spicy oak. The first sip is that of caramel and toasted oak before a multitude of notes from around the flavor wheel show up on the palate. The finish showcases an enduring duel between sweet and spicy notes as citrus, florals, and sweet oak tussle with dry cocoa, cinnamon, and spicy oak.

name: Benriach 1997 24 Year Single Puncheon #15058
description: A 1997 vintage single cask expression of Benriach matured in an Oloroso sherry puncheon. It was aged for 24 years and bottled at 55.4% Abv.

name: Macallan Harmony Rich Cacao - 2021
description: Macallan Rich Cacao is an exceptionally rich single malt whisky characterised by its deep, dark chocolate profile. With sustainability at the heart, Macallan's The Harmony Collection Rich Cacao is an exploration and celebration of the complementary worlds of whisky and chocolate.

name: Jefferson's Ocean - 2014
description: Barrels of Jefferson’s Ocean Aged at Sea® Bourbon travel aboard ships that visit ports all around the globe. The constant motion of the sea churns the whiskey, increasing its interaction with the wood of the barrel. Extreme weather ranging from the coldest of coldest to the warmest of temperatures hyper-ages the liquid in ways no rickhouse could. Jefferson’s Ocean Aged at Sea® Bourbon is Aged At The Mercy of The Sea. Experience a voyage yourself.

name: Hickory Hill Cask Strength
description: Texas Bourbon made with 100% Texas corn aged in carefully selected American oak charred barrels. Every sip hits you with a hint of chocolate and a note of citrus.

name: Willowbank 25 Year
description: The New Zealand Whisky Company South Island 25 Year 2017 is a premium single malt whisky that has been aged for a quarter of a century, reflecting the craftsmanship and natural beauty of New Zealand's South Island. The bottle's label is elegantly designed, featuring the distillery's logo and the clear indication of the whisky's 25-year maturation, promising a complex and nuanced flavor profile. The dark amber liquid inside the bottle suggests a rich tapestry of tastes developed over years of careful aging. As part of The New Zealand Whisky Collection, this expression is a testament to the distillery's dedication to producing high-quality whisky and is a sought-after item for collectors and enthusiasts of fine spirits.

name: Yamazaki 10 Year Pre-2015 Bottling
description: First introduced in 1995, the 10 year old expression of Yamazaki was the entry level offering from the Japanese distillery. Bottled at 40% Abv, as stocks of Suntory produced whiskies became more and more scarce the 10 year old was discontinued in 2015. Although intended as the entry level and most approachable of the Yamazaki single malts, this 10 year old expression proved to be a serious fan favourite and was often praised higher than the 12 and even 18 year old age statements.

name: Smoke Wagon Malted Rye Batch 16
description: A 2022 bottling from Smoke Wagon of a malted grain rye whiskey. Bottled at 58.07% Abv Smoke Wagon sourced these barrels from Indiana and then further aged them in the hot climate of Nevada.

name: Bunnahabhain 1975 40 Year Single Butt #10704 Douglas Laing
description: This very limited 40 year old Islay single malt was distilled at Bunnahabhain in January 1975 and bottled for Douglas Laing's Xtra Old Particular series in February 2015. Drawn from single cask number 10704 at a natural cask strength 51% ABV, this is one of just 258 bottling's that comes complete with stunning wooden presentation case and COA.
baxus_class_name: Bunnahabhain 1975 40 Year Single Butt #10704 Douglas Laing

name: Dalmore 1995 Castle Leod
description: Dalmore Castle Leod is a limited edition single malt whisky released by The Dalmore distillery. Named after Castle Leod, the ancestral seat of Clan Mackenzie, this expression was created to support the restoration of the historic castle, which dates back to 1606 and is located near Strathpeffer in the Scottish Highlands. The Mackenzie clan has a deep connection with The Dalmore, having owned the distillery in the past and contributed their clan symbol, the 12-point Royal Stag, to the brand. This whisky was matured initially in American white oak and Spanish sherry casks before spending its final 18 months in barriques from a renowned Bordeaux house, adding a layer of complexity and luxury. Only 5,000 bottles of Dalmore Castle Leod were produced, making it a sought-after release among whisky enthusiasts.
series: Castle Leod Home of Clan Mackenzie

name: Willowbank 1987 30 Year Single Cask #8
description: The New Zealand Whisky Company's Otago 30 Year whisky is a rare and exceptional single malt that has been aged for three decades, encapsulating the essence of the Otago region's terroir. Distilled in 1987 and bottled in 2017, this whisky is part of the Otago Commemorative Casks series, representing some of the last and oldest casks from the Willowbank Distillery. The bottle's black label with white text elegantly conveys the whisky's age and heritage, while the American Oak Single Cask maturation is indicative of the rich and complex flavor profile one can expect. This 350ml bottle, with its deep golden hue, is a testament to the meticulous aging process and the craftsmanship that goes into producing a whisky of this caliber. The Otago 30 Year is a celebration of New Zealand's whisky-making tradition and a tribute to the now-closed Willowbank Distillery, making it a coveted addition to any whisky connoisseur's collection.

name: Macallan 25 Year Old Sherry Oak Pre-2018 Bottling
description: A pre-2018 bottling of Macallan’s signature sherry oak series matured for 25 years in exceptional quality sherry casks. This presentation of the 25 year old age statement was first launched in 2012 before being changed in 2018. Presented in a wooden box this era featured whisky tints, an innovation from Macallan whisky maker Bob Dalgarno which highlighted the natural dark colour of the sherry matured spirit.
baxus_class_name: Macallan 25 Year Old Sherry Oak Pre-2018 Bottling

name: Thomas S. Moore Port Cask Finish
description: A special cask finish edition from the Barton 1792 distillery bottled under their Thomas S. Moore label. This release sees 1792 distillate finished in port casks before being bottled at 49.45% Abv.
baxus_class_name: Thomas S. Moore Port Cask Finish

name: Macallan 1980 18 Year Old Gran Reserva
description: Heralded as one of the best series from Macallan, the Gran Reserva label featured a small number of deeply sherried expressions from the award winning Speyside distillery. This edition was distilled in 1980 and matured for 18 years in sherry wood. It was bottled in 1999 at 40% Abv and has become one of the most sought after series of bottlings amongst enthusiasts.

name: Augusta 13 Year Buckner’s Single Barrel #76
description:
Situated in the heart of bourbon country, Augusta Distillery is dedicated to celebrating the community and building upon Augusta's enduring legacy. With a prime location on the Ohio River, Augusta is a stone's throw away from five major markets, making it a natural first stop on the renowned B-Line Bourbon Trail. The distillery's commitment to quality and tradition is evident in every bottle, ensuring that each sip is a journey into the soul of Kentucky. 

Buckner's 13 Year Old Single Barrel Bourbon is a fitting tribute to a decorated revolutionary war hero. This Kentucky bourbon, aged for 13 years, is as intricate and captivating as its namesake. A true embodiment of Kentucky's rich bourbon heritage, this limited-release whiskey captures your senses from the very first sip and offers a rewarding experience from start to finish. With impeccable balance, it pays homage to both the spirit of adventure and the benevolence of Augusta, Kentucky's esteemed founder and statesman.

A true Kentucky bourbon, this limited release whiskey unmistakably captures your attention and rewards you from nose-to-finish. Aged 13 years in new, charred oak barrels, Buckner’s single barrel offers an understated potency with exceptional balance, commemorating the distillery’s inaugural bottling. 

Color & Nose - An inviting amber color is the conclusion of an intense 13-year relationship between the mash and its new American oak barrel. The warm, mahogany hue characterizes Buckner’s understated potency that has been deservedly earned as patience gives way to perfection.

Palate - A haunting combination of antique wood, wet soil and dry corn pulls forward from a honeyed vanilla palate. This introduction immediately suggests a rare complexity that can only be found in a true Kentucky bourbon with properly aged maturity.

Finish - Exotic spice and caramel notes are directly complimented by hints of buttery cream and cured tea leaves. Each sip provides an unforgettable experience that instantly returns you to the limestone hills of Kentucky only to demand further exploration.

name: Glenmorangie The Lasanta "The Giraffe" 12 Year - 2020
description:
From the distiller: "In every corner of the world, the setting of the sun is magical, mused Dr Bill, our Director of Whisky Creation and an inveterate traveller.
This whisky is Dr Bill’s attempt to bottle the magic of sunset, with its endless horizon of reds, oranges and purples.
The Lasanta begins with our giraffe-high stills, which yield a deliciously delicate and fruity spirit. Next, we mature it in bourbon and sherry casks for 12 years, transforming it into a mouth-watering odyssey bursting with rich spiciness and sun-drenched sweetness."

name: Longmorn 16 Year 2010 Bottling
description: A 16 year old expression from Longmorn distillery in Speyside. Bottled at 48% Abv and non-chill filtered.

name: Linkwood 1974 42 Year Signatory Vintage
description: A 1974 vintage small batch expression of Linkwood matured in two hogsheads. It was matured for a huge 42 years and bottled at 40.9% Abv in 2017 by Signatory Vintage.

name: Old Perth 2004 14 Year Single Cask Blended Malt
description: Another release of Morrison & MacKay's Old Perth blended malt, which was named in honour of Perth  Scotland and its historical connection to whisky. This fascinating vintage 2004 blended malt features Macallan & Highland Park malt whiskies that were matured in a single sherry cask. It was bottled with an outturn of 675 bottles.
baxus_class_name: Old Perth 2004 14 Year Single Cask Blended Malt

name: Macallan 40 Year Sherry Oak 2016 Release
description: A huge 40 year age statement from the Macallan distillery. This 2016 special release was crafted from a vatting of casks from 9 different vintages. When vatting the 30 year old expression in 2006  the Macallan filled 10 barrels with mature whisky to gently marry before bottling. They dumped 9 of these marrying casks for the 30 year old release but identified one cask that they felt could be further matured. The refill butt was assessed in 2011 at 35 years of age, but with more left to give the team left it be. In 2016, at a minimum of 40 years old the cask was finally dumped and bottled. As this vatting contained 9 different vintages the spirit in this release is minimum 40 years, with up to approximately 49 year old spirit contained as well. The long marriage has allowed for the spirit to be perfectly integrated, with the 2016 release heralded as one of the distillery's best.

name: Glengoyne 21 Year
description: A fabulously sherried single malt from Glengoyne, matured predominantly in first-fill European oak sherry casks for 21 long years. Its time in the cask has bestowed upon it lovely rich fruity notes with an exceptionally long finish. This fantastic whisky was the winner of a Double Gold medal at the San Francisco World Spirits Competition 2018.

name: Maker's Mark American Pharoah 2015 Grand Slam
baxus_class_name: Maker's Mark American Pharoah 2015 Grand Slam

name: Larceny Barrel Proof 6 Year
description: From the distiller: "Larceny Barrel Proof offers a new opportunity to experience our acclaimed wheated Bourbon mashbill in its purest form: non-chill filtered and bottled at full barrel proof. Released three times per year in January, May, and September, each offering is a bold yet balanced special Small Batch Bourbon rich with depth and distinction. Much like Larceny Small Batch and Old Fitzgerald Bottled-in-Bond, Larceny Barrel Proof is a welcome reminder of just how good wheated Bourbons can be."

name: Yamazaki 12 Year
description: Yamazaki is Suntory's flagship single malt whisky, from Japan's first and oldest malt distillery. This 12 year old first came onto the market in 1984 and was the first seriously marketed Japanese single malt whisky. Since then, it has acquired something of a cult following.

name: Staves & Grain 7 Year Single Barrel Rye
description:
Staves & Grain, based in northwest New Jersey, is a boutique bourbon bottler specializing in cask strength single barrels for clubs, connoisseurs, and retailers. They typically use MGP's bourbon and rye recipes, and help bring premium whiskey to enthusiasts all over the USA.

This Single Barrel Rye's high proof and premium packaging is emblematic of the Staves & Grain Single Barrel series.
baxus_class_name: Staves & Grain 7 Year Single Barrel Rye

name: Signatory Vintage Bunnahabhain 42 Year - 2016
description: An independently bottled Bunnahabhain single malt Scotch whisky, aged for 42 years in a refill Sherry butt, from December 1973 to January 2016. This was bottled by Signatory for their Cask Strength Collection Rare Reserve.

name: Bunnahabhain 2008 12 Year Single Hogshead #1158 For Norfolk Whisky Group Signatory Vintage
description: This is an independent bottling of spirit distilled by Bunnahabhain by Signatory Vintage. Matured for 12 years in a first fill sherry butt, this dram was distilled in 2007 and bottled in 2019 at cask strength with no coloring or filtering. It was bottled from cask #1158.
baxus_class_name: Bunnahabhain 2008 12 Year Single Hogshead #1158 For Norfolk Whisky Group Signatory Vintage

name: Kavalan Vinho Barrique 6 Year - 2019
description: From the distiller: "Vinho is fully matured in used American oak wine barrels that have been toasted and recharred in a way that brings out fruity vanilla notes from the wood into the whisky overlaid on a delicate background of complex fruitiness. It has a complex and multi-dimensional background of pepper, spice, dates and other fruits, such as ripe melon and mango together with kiwi and a delicate blend of bursting citrus fruits."

name: Buffalo Trace 1992 14 Year Experimental Collection Cabernet Franc Aged
description: Distilled in 1992 this single barrel from Buffalo Trace was crafted from their #1 rye mashbill. Matured for 6 years in a charred white oak cask it was then rebarreled in 1998 into a used Frech oak ex-Cabernet Franc wine cask. It was then bottled in 2007 at 14 years of age at 45% Abv as part of the experimental collection.
baxus_class_name: Buffalo Trace 1992 14 Year Experimental Collection Cabernet Franc Aged

name: Van Winkle 12 Year Special Reserve Lot "B" 2014 Bottling
description: A 12 year old expression of wheated bourbon carefully chosen by Julian Van Winkle, the grandson of the original Pappy Van Winkle. Early Van Winkle offerings were crafted from barrels sourced from the legendary closed Stitzel-Weller distillery, but in 2002 Julian struck a deal with Buffalo Trace to use their wheated bourbon once his stored barrels ran empty. This 2023 bottling will have been crafted from Buffalo Trace's wheated bourbon mashbill and carefully blended by Julian Van Winkle.
baxus_class_name: Van Winkle 12 Year Special Reserve Lot "B" 2014 Bottling

name: High Coast Alv - 2019
description: From the High Coast distillery in Sweden comes Älv, also dubbed Delicate Vanilla, released as part of the Origins Series. Älv, which translates to ‘River’ in Swedish, is also the name for the river Ångermanälven, on which the distillery sits. The single malt spent six years in first-fill bourbon casks which explains the name, as it's full of those buttery vanilla flavors we know and love from bourbon casks. In 2016  the whisky was bottled at 46% ABV  with a release of 8,259 bottles.

name: Buffalo Trace 1988 18 Year Experimental Collection Chardonnay Aged
description: Distilled in 1988 this single barrel from Buffalo Trace was crafted from their #1 rye mashbill. Matured for 10 years in a charred white oak cask, it was then rebarreled in 1998 into a used French oak ex-Chardonnay wine cask. Bottled at 18 years of age in 2007 at 45% Abv as part of the experimental collection.
baxus_class_name: Buffalo Trace 1988 18 Year Experimental Collection Chardonnay Aged

name: Compass Box Lady Luck
description: A very special bottling from Compass Box. Lady Luck is a vatting of three casks - two old Caol Ilas (from 1980 and 1984) plus a 1995 Imperial. The result is described by creator John Glaser as 'deeply smoky, mind-bogglingly complex...a whisky of ethereal beauty'.

name: Glenlivet Nadurra 16 Year - 2013
description: Nàdurra is Gaelic for natural. In the case of this whisky, it is referring to the fact that it is not chill-filtered and bottled at cask strength. As they release them in batches, the abv ranges from 54-58%. The barrels used for aging were only used once before for bourbon aging.

name: Macallan Concept 2
description: From the distiller: "The Macallan Concept Number 2 calls on exceptional casks to produce a rich and rewarding multi-sensory experience, where a powerful foundation is brought to life with flourishes and tones woven together to create a harmonious and vibrant work of art."

name: Staves & Grain 7 Year Single Barrel Rye
description:
Staves & Grain, based in northwest New Jersey, is a boutique bourbon bottler specializing in cask strength single barrels for clubs, connoisseurs, and retailers. They typically use MGP's bourbon and rye recipes, and help bring premium whiskey to enthusiasts all over the USA.

This Single Barrel Rye's high proof and premium packaging is emblematic of the Staves & Grain Single Barrel series.
baxus_class_name: Staves & Grain 7 Year Single Barrel Rye

name: John Walker & Sons Odyssey
description: John Walker & Sons Odyssey is made from just three extraordinary Single Malts carefully blended and married together in oak casks to enhance the intricate layering of flavors and impart an exquisite smoothness. This elegant whisky has a deep and distinctive russet-red hue that hints at the rich tannins to come. With the first sip toffee and honey emerge followed by cooked berries roast walnuts and top notes of delicate citrus. The finish is sublime - an impeccable rich smokiness that seems to linger forever.

name: Old Rip Van Winkle 10 Year Squat
description: From the distillery: "This wonderful bourbon is bottled as close to barrel proof as possible. We add just a splash of our Kentucky limestone well-water when we empty the barrels for bottling. Thus, this whiskey is as smooth as any you will find."
baxus_class_name: Old Rip Van Winkle 10 Year Squat

name: New Riff 2017 4 Year Single Barrel Bourbon #2409 For West Virginia Whiskey Collective
description: A 2017 vintage single barrel release from New Riff matured for 4 years and bottled at 52.75% Abv. This single barrel was chosen by West Virginia Whiskey Collective.
baxus_class_name: New Riff 2017 4 Year Single Barrel Bourbon #2409 For West Virginia Whiskey Collective

name: Michter's Barrel Strength Toasted Barrel Rye - 2020
description: While our Michter’s team distills according to tried and true Kentucky practices, it continually experiments as it pursues Michter’s goal of making the greatest American whiskeys. Following years of research on different barrel finishes for rye whiskey, we are proud to offer this release of our Michter’s US1 Toasted Barrel Rye. To make it we take our US1 Kentucky Straight Rye at barrel strength and then age it for an additional period in a second custom barrel. This second barrel is assembled from 24 month air-dried wood and then toasted to our specifications. The result is a unique rye whiskey that we take pride in offering to you. The strength of the majority of the barrels selected for the 2020 release ranges from 107.2 to 111.2 proof.
baxus_class_name: Michter's Barrel Strength Toasted Barrel Rye - 2020

name: Buffalo Trace 1997 15 Year Experimental Collection #7 Heavy Char Barrel
description: Distilled in 1997 this expression from Buffalo Trace was crafted from their #2 rye mashbill. 7 barrels were pulled from the 8th floor of warehouse K after maturing in #7 heavily charred barrels. These barrels were charred with a natural open flame for 3½ minutes, almost four times longer than the standard 55-second char typically used for Buffalo Trace barrels. Left to mature for 15 years this release was bottled in 2012 at 45% Abv as part of the experimental collection.
baxus_class_name: Buffalo Trace 1997 15 Year Experimental Collection #7 Heavy Char Barrel

name: Jameson Limited Reserve 18 Year - 2016
description: Matured for 18 years in hand-selected oak casks from Europe and America, this rare whiskey is finished in first-fill bourbon barrels. This rite of passage introduces subtle traces of vanilla to an exceptionally balanced, mellow whiskey with a lingering finale of wood, spice and toffee.

name: Buffalo Trace 1992 14 Year Experimental Collection Chardonnay Aged
description: Distilled in 1992 from their #1 rye mashbill, this expression from Buffalo Trace was matured for 6 years in charred American oak casks before being rebarreled into a French oak ex-Chardonnay wine cask. It was matured for a further 8 years and bottled in 2007 at 45% Abv as part of the experimental collection.
baxus_class_name: Buffalo Trace 1992 14 Year Experimental Collection Chardonnay Aged

name: Smoke Wagon Small Batch Bourbon
description: A small batch core offering from Smoke Wagon crafted from Indiana sourced bourbon. Smoke Wagon stores these sourced casks in their exceptionally warm warehouses in Nevada before blending this straight bourbon and bottling at 50% Abv.

name: Buffalo Trace 2001 12 Year Experimental Collection Floor 5
description: Distilled in 2001 from their #1 rye mashbill, this expression from Buffalo Trace was crafted from just four barrels pulled exclusively from the 5th floor of warehouse K. Matured for 12 years this release was bottled in 2014 at 45% Abv as part of the experimental collection.
baxus_class_name: Buffalo Trace 2001 12 Year Experimental Collection Floor 5

name: Yamazaki 2022 Limited Edition
description: A non age stated expression of Yamazaki released in 2022, this edition of the year stated release is reportedly matured in Mizunara oak casks. The vatting is rumoured to be at least 12 years old but Suntory has never fully confirmed this fact.

name: Yamazaki Sherry Cask - 2016
description: This Yamazaki 2016 release is a single malt Scotch whisky that's been aged for no less than 18 years in sherry casks after being aged for 12 years in oak casks before being bottled. This aging process gives it a rich, complex flavor that's truly unique and memorable.

name: Lagavulin Distiller’s Edition 16 Year 2008 Release
description: Lagvulin's Double Matured Special Release Distillers Edition from the year 2008. This stunning 16-years-old Islay single malt whisky of the Classic Malts Selection from the Islay legend Lagavulin was distilled in the year 1991, double matured for up to 6 months in European Pedro Ximenez Sherry oak casks - these give the whisky more fruit, such as raisins and dry fruits and a syrupy character.

name: Blood Oath Pact No. 7 - 2021
description: For Blood Oath Pact No. 7 Rempe combined a 14-year-old ryed bourbon with two eight-year ryed bourbons one of which was finished in Sauternes casks. Sauternes is Bordeaux’s sweet late-harvest white wine mostly made up of sémillon with some sauvignon blanc and muscadelle. What sets Sauternes apart is the grapes have been infected with Botrytis cinerea – AKA noble rot. Why does that matter? Botrytis draws water out of the grapes making their juice yield low but that juice very concentrated. Combine the timing of late harvest when grapes have developed all the sugar they can with dehydration and you get a syrupy starting point. Noble rot also fosters flavors like honey ginger and beeswax likely due to increased levels of an aroma compound phenylacetaldehyde. This liquid is a very clear medium copper that beads and forms slow fat tears. Sweet and spicy stone fruit and gingersnaps with vanilla perfume woven through. Full on the palate in both flavor and texture. Oaky vanilla comes through strongly backed up with black pepper cinnamon and considerable heat. Sweet white flowers and apricot surface with the addition of a little water. Spiciness lingers on the long finish.

name: Hakushu 18 Year
description: Located at the foothills of the Japanese Alps, Suntory’s second distillery has always stood in the shadow of Yamazaki. Not surprisingly  Hakushu 18 attempts to be a bit like his famous brother. Notes of sherry subdue floral freshness and whiffs of smoke and the nose unfolds beautifully with unripe papaya incense and a touch of plum wine. Rich and intense, the taste combines fruity, herbal, and spicy flavors with just a hint of peat. Lingering spices, licorice, and re-emerging freshness characterize the semidry finish.

name: Maker's Mark Private Selection - 2020
description: From the distiller: "At Maker's Mark, our wood-finishing series was created to explore new, unique expressions of our signature whisky. Beginning as fully matured Maker's Mark at cask strength, Private Selection is created by adding 10 custom wood finishing staves to each barrel. It's then aged in our limestone cellar to extract a unique, flavorful taste profile. Participants in this special barrel program get their say in the selection of these wooden staves. The finishing staves can be any combination of five flavor profiles chosen especially for this program. With 1 001 possible stave combinations, each expression of Private Selection has a customized finish and taste profile that is unique, yet undeniably Maker's. Maker's Mark Private Selection is available in select markets and also at our distillery."

name: Buffalo Trace 1996 16 Year Experimental Collection Hot Box
description: Distilled in 1996 this expression from Buffalo Trace was crafted from their #2 rye mashbill. Matured for 16 years in "hot box" barrels, which are barrels which saw their staves placed inside of a “Hot Box” at 133 degrees Fahrenheit and steamed before being fashioned into a barrel. The goal was to determine if this steaming process would drive more or different flavors into the wood that would in turn be imparted on the whiskey aged inside. This release was bottled in 2012 at 5% Abv as part of the experimental collection.
baxus_class_name: Buffalo Trace 1996 16 Year Experimental Collection Hot Box

name: Michter's 10 Year Single Barrel Bourbon 2007 Bottling
description: An early release of Michter's 10 year old single barrel bourbon bottled in 2007. The source of these barrels was never confirmed but for the earliest editions from Michter's Joe Magliocco collaborated with Julian Van Winkle, bottling barrels at his Lawrenceburg site. Once Van Winkle moved to Frankfort in 2002, Magliocco engaged KBD (now Willett) to bottle for him, suggesting this 2007 era release was likely crafted from barrels stored in the KBD warehouses. As Michter's only started contract distillation in 2004 much of their early expressions were bottled using sourced barrels that Magliocco hand selected.
baxus_class_name: Michter's 10 Year Single Barrel Bourbon 2007 Bottling

name: Bowmore Sherriff's 1970s Bottling
description: A 1970s era bottling of Bowmore bottled under the iconic Sherriff's sailing boat label. Sherriff's had owned the Bowmore distillery until Stanley P Morrison purchased the fledgling distillery in 1963. Old Sherriff's labelled bottles like this are particularly sought after amongst Islay enthusiasts.

name: Buffalo Trace 2004 5 Year Experimental Collection Rye'N Barrel
description: Distilled in 2004 from their rye whiskey mashbill, this release was matured for 5 years in charred oak casks before being recasked into a French oak botrytis wine cask from Napa Valley. Marured for another 4 months it was bottled in 2009 at 61.2% Abv as part of the experimental collection.
baxus_class_name: Buffalo Trace 2004 5 Year Experimental Collection Rye'N Barrel

name: Michter's 10 Year Single Barrel Bourbon 2004 Bottling
description: An early release of Michter's 10 year old single barrel bourbon bottled in 2004. The source of these barrels was never confirmed but for the earliest editions from Michter's Joe Magliocco collaborated with Julian Van Winkle, bottling barrels at his Lawrenceburg site. Once Van Winkle moved to Frankfort in 2002, Magliocco engaged KBD (now Willett) to bottle for him, suggesting this 2004 era release was likely crafted from barrels stored in the KBD warehouses. As Michter's only started contract distillation in 2004 much of their early expressions were bottled using sourced barrels that Magliocco hand selected.
baxus_class_name: Michter's 10 Year Single Barrel Bourbon 2004 Bottling

name: Macallan 1983 18 Year Old Sherry Oak
description: Distilled in 1983 this fully sherry matured expression from Macallan was aged for 18 years. Beginning with a 1965 vintage, the 18 year old sherry oak is an annual release from the esteemed Speyside distillery that has rocketed to fame and become the most collectible series in Scotch whisky. Vintage expressions of the distillery are sought after due to the use of golden promise barley, a strain noted for creating a robust spirit able to withstand sherry cask maturation.

name: Buffalo Trace 1998 15 Year Old Experimental Collection Extended Stave Dry Time
description: Distilled in 1998 from their #1 rye mashbill, this expression from Buffalo Trace was matured for 15 years in a 13 month air dried charred white oak casks. Typically BT air dries their staves for 6 months, so this release saw almost double that period. Bottled in 2013 at 45% Abv as part of the experimental collection.
baxus_class_name: Buffalo Trace 1998 15 Year Old Experimental Collection Extended Stave Dry Time

name: Four Roses Single Barrel Reserve Numbered
baxus_class_name: Four Roses Single Barrel Reserve Numbered

name: Port Ellen 1974 Connoisseurs Choice Bottled 1991 Gordon & Macphail
description: Arguably the most famous independent bottler of Scotch whisky there is, Gordon & MacPhail was founded in Elgin in 1895 by James Gordon and John Alexander MacPhail. Some of their labels include ‘Connoisseurs Choice’, ‘Cask Strength’, ‘Rare Old’ and ‘Speymalt’. This release from the closed Port Ellen distillery was distilled in 1974 and bottled in 1991 as part of the ‘Connoisseurs Choice’ range.
baxus_class_name: Port Ellen 1974 Connoisseurs Choice Bottled 1991 Gordon & Macphail

name: Ohishi Distilled From Rice
description: Ohishi Whisky is distilled entirely from rice and aged primarily in brandy or sherry casks with many expressions finished in port Islay Scotch or Sakura casks. Ohishi has been a family-owned business for six generations primarily known for its sake and shochu production.

name: Imperial 1990 30 Year Single Cask #1048 Single Cask Nation
description: A 1990 vintage single cask expression of Imperial matured for 30 years in a bourbon barrel. Bottled in 2020 at 46.6% Abv by Single Cask Nation.
baxus_class_name: Imperial 1990 30 Year Single Cask #1048 Single Cask Nation

name: The Senator 6 Year - 2021
description: The Senator and The Ambassador are two whiskies made by MGP and bottled by Proof and Wood Ventures in Bardstown, Kentucky. The brand seems to honor American tradition by finding inspiration in the deep roots of the American political system.

name: Jameson Double Char Select
description: Double charring the wood fires up the barrels and gives them new life. Untold richness and complexity awaits in every drop of Jameson Black Barrel. It’s perfect on its own or on the rocks, but it’s also commonly known as the best whiskey for an Old Fashioned.

name: Smooth Ambler 9 Year Old Single Barrel #16261 Old Scout
description: A single barrel expression of straight bourbon whiskey from Smooth Ambler bottled as part of their Old Scout label. This 9 year old barrel was distilled in Indiana and bottled at 58.8% Abv.
baxus_class_name: Smooth Ambler 9 Year Old Single Barrel #16261 Old Scout

name: Tomatin 1988 25 Year
description: This 1988 vintage limited release whisky is sweet and fresh. The contents have been vatted from a combination of ex-Bourbon and ex-Port casks to create a delicious whisky which was released in April 2014.

name: Ballantine's 30 Year
description: A 30 year old blended scotch Ballantines 30 is given an impressive 92 points in the Whisky Bible by Jim Murray and has won Gold at the International Spirit Challenge. This exquisite blended scotch is a combination of some of the rarest whiskies from now closed distilleries. With a juicy fruity taste it’s easy to see why this selection is popular.

name: Kavalan Solist Oloroso Cask Strength- 2018
description:
The Kavalan Solist Oloroso Sherry Cask Strength Single Malt Whisky is a distinguished offering from Taiwan's renowned Kavalan distillery. This expression is part of Kavalan's "Solist" line, which represents the upper tier of their offerings. Matured entirely in Oloroso Sherry Casks, this whisky showcases the distillery's commitment to crafting rich and flavorful spirits. With its cask strength nature, it delivers an intense and enveloping experience, capturing the essence of Oloroso sherry cask maturation.

Originating from the King Car Distillery in Taiwan, this whisky is non-age stated and boasts an ABV of 59.4%. The Solist Oloroso Sherry Cask release is known for its raisins, marzipan, and dry fruits on the palate, culminating in a finish of coffee beans. It's a popular release, reflecting Kavalan's expertise in crafting exceptional whiskies. This was produced exlusively for Eagle for Rock, and features a brash decal on the bottle itself.

name: Ardbeg 1963 30 Year Old White Crest Sestante
description: Crafted during a unique time in Ardbeg's history, this 1963 distillate was matured for a huge 30 years! Bottled by Sestante, a highly prized Italian independent bottler, this cask hails from an era when Ardbeg was an independent distillery and utilised its own malting floors.
baxus_class_name: Ardbeg 1963 30 Year Old White Crest Sestante

name: Kavalan Solist Port Cask "Cask Strength"- 2016
description:
The Kavalan Solist Port Cask Strength Single Malt Whisky is a premium offering from Taiwan's esteemed Kavalan distillery. This expression is part of Kavalan's "Solist" series, which represents the pinnacle of their craftsmanship. Matured entirely in high-quality Port casks, this whisky captures the essence of both the rich, fruity character of Port and the distinctive nature of Kavalan's spirit. The result is a whisky that is both intense and harmoniously balanced.

Originating from Taiwan's King Car Distillery, this whisky is bottled at cask strength, with an ABV of 58.6%. The Solist Port Cask is a testament to the synergy between Kavalan's unique spirit and the rich influence of Port casks. The result is a whisky of great complexity, where the Port characteristics shine without overshadowing Kavalan's signature profile.

name: Buffalo Trace 2001 11 Year Experimental Collection Wheat 90
