Paddy Irish Whiskey, produced by Cork Distilleries Company, has a rich and storied history that dates back to the late 19th century. The company was founded in 1867 through the amalgamation of four distilleries in Cork city: North Mall, The Green, Watercourse Road, and Daly's, with Midleton Distillery joining soon after in 1868. This consolidation aimed to stabilize and enhance the quality of Irish whiskey production during a challenging period for the industry.

In 1882, a young salesman named Paddy Flaherty joined the company and began marketing the company's whiskey, then known as "Cork Distilleries Company Old Irish Whiskey." Flaherty's innovative sales techniques, which included giving out free rounds of drinks, made him a beloved figure in the pubs of Cork. His efforts were so successful that publicans began referring to the whiskey as "Paddy Flaherty's whiskey," leading to the official renaming of the brand to "Paddy Irish Whiskey" in 1912 to honor his legacy.

During the 1920s and 1930s, Cork Distilleries Company became one of the first to bottle their own whiskey, a move aimed at preventing quality fluctuations caused by middlemen diluting casks. This decision helped solidify Paddy's reputation for consistency and quality. The whiskey is triple distilled and matured in oak casks for up to seven years, known for its smooth, light, and balanced profile with a high malt content compared to other Irish whiskeys.

In 1988, Irish Distillers, which had formed through a merger involving Cork Distilleries Company, was acquired by Pernod Ricard. Paddy Whiskey continued to thrive under this ownership until 2016, when it was sold to the Sazerac Company. Today, Paddy remains one of the top-selling Irish whiskey brands globally, celebrated for its accessibility and the legendary spirit of its namesake, Paddy Flaherty.

name: Four Roses Elliot's Select 14 year - 2016
description:
The Four Roses Elliot's Select 14 Year 2016 is a remarkable bourbon curated by Four Roses' Master Distiller Brent Elliott. This expression is particularly special as it marks Brent Elliott's first limited edition bottling since assuming the position of master distiller in September 2015. It's a single barrel bourbon from the OESK recipe, aged for 14 years, and bottled at barrel strength. With 10,224 bottles of this exquisite bourbon produced, each reflects the meticulous craftsmanship and passion of Four Roses' distilling tradition.

Tasting Experience: The adventure of savoring the Four Roses Elliot's Select 2016 unveils a sophisticated blend of flavors, carefully balanced to deliver a unique tasting journey.

Nose: Your aromatic journey begins with the gentle whispers of peach jam, magnolia blossoms, and light oak, setting a serene yet inviting prelude to the flavors awaiting to dance on your palate.

Palate: As you delve deeper, the palate is graced by elegantly-balanced flavors of spiced vanilla, fresh nutmeg, and delicate, ripe fruits. It's a harmonious blend that speaks volumes about the expertise encapsulated in every drop of this bourbon.

Finish: The narrative of flavors culminates in a sweet resonance of honey and light apricot that lingers, a gentle reminder of the exquisite journey you've embarked upon with each sip.

name: Old Forester 1917 12 Year Old Bottled In Bond
description: The Old Forester 12 Summers Old Bottled In Bond 1929 is a remarkable snapshot of bourbon history, encapsulating the quality and tradition of one of America's oldest bourbon brands. Bottled in bond under strict government supervision, this whisky adheres to the standards set forth in the Bottled-in-Bond Act of 1897, ensuring its purity and authenticity. The label on this well-preserved bottle proudly declares its 12-year aging process and the commitment of the Brown-Forman Distillery to its craft. The amber color of the whisky hints at its maturity and depth of flavor, likely offering a rich, complex profile typical of bourbons from this era. This bottle is not only a testament to the enduring legacy of Old Forester but also a rare collectible that represents the storied past of American whiskey-making.
baxus_class_name: Old Forester 1917 12 Year Old Bottled In Bond

name: Four Roses Private Selection OBSV New York 10.42 year
description:
Bottled at 55.5% ABV, the Four Roses OBSV 10 Years 5 Months is a splendid expression of the 'B' mash bill mingled with the 'V' yeast strain, celebrated for its delicate fruitiness alongside a spicy and creamy profile.

Tasting Experience: An inviting venture into the balanced yet complex flavor narrative of Four Roses.

Nose: A medley of dark fruit, caramel, and warm spice, setting a promising prelude to a flavorful journey.

Palate: The spicy forefront is balanced with hints of caramel, vanilla, and overripe fruits like apple and lemon, showcasing a versatile flavor spectrum.

Finish: A long, spicy finish delicately balanced with hints of caramel and vanilla, leaving a satisfying warmth and a longing for the next sip.
baxus_class_name: Four Roses Private Selection OBSV New York 10.42 year

name: Kentucky Owl Mardi Gras XO Cask 11 Year - 2022
description: The Kentucky Owl 11 Year Old Mardi Gras XO Cask Release is a limited-edition rye whiskey that was distilled in Kentucky and finished in ex-Bayou Rum XO casks. It was bottled at 102.8 proof (51.4% ABV) and released in 2022 to celebrate Mardi Gras.
baxus_class_name: Kentucky Owl Mardi Gras XO Cask 11 Year - 2022

name: Brora 35 Year 13th Release
description: This Brora 35 Year Old is the thirteenth of a limited series, taken from refill American Oak and European Oak casks that were filled in 1978.

name: Ardbeg Supernova Advance Committee Release
description: An advanced release of the Ardbeg special release Supernova which sees Ardbeg peated to a huge 100ppm! This edition was released exclusively to Ardbeg Committee members ahead of the mainline release.

name: Edition Spirits Port Ellen The First Edition Alfred Tennyson 33 Year - 2016
description: This Authors’ Series is a range of exclusive single malt whiskies, created by the prestigious blenders and bottlers, Hunter Laing & Co. This is a limited edition expression, inspired by the life and work of Alfred Tennyson.
baxus_class_name: Edition Spirits Port Ellen The First Edition Alfred Tennyson 33 Year - 2016

name: Ardbeg Ardbog
description: The 2013 Ardbeg Day whisky is called Ardbog, released on June 1st initially as an Embassy exclusive. Taking inspiration from their last few releases, this is a down-to-earth whisky, concerned with the history uncovered as you dig deep into the peat bogs of Islay. The whisky is a vatting of 10 year old spirit, some matured in bourbon casks and some in manzanilla casks for a balanced of soft, sweet and earthy flavours.

name: East Asia Whisky Company Macallan Relic 33 Year - 2020
description: The Relic was distilled in 1986 and aged for 33 years before bottling in 2020. Its box is a marvel of details, with all the hallmarks of a true luxury good. Its FSC-certified Cocobolo Rosewood and engraved in Celtic runes detailing the story of this particular malt impress both through their precision and minimalistic design. Developed for a private customer, this release is bound to break records at auctions in the years to come given its sheer lack of global availability.
baxus_class_name: East Asia Whisky Company Macallan Relic 33 Year - 2020

name: Gordon & MacPhail Port Ellen Rare Old 33 year - 2013
description: The 'Rare Old' range includes the bold flavours of the Highland distillery Brora and the beautifully subtle smokiness of the now legendary Islay distillery, Port Ellen; both distilleries permanently closed in the latter part of the twentieth century.
baxus_class_name: Gordon & MacPhail Port Ellen Rare Old 33 year - 2013

name: Diamond Versailles Still 14 Year Batch 3 That Boutique-y Rum Company
description: A 14 year old expression of pot still rum from Diamond distillery crafted using their Versailles single wooden pot still. This is the third batch bottled by That Boutique-y Rum Company and it is bottled at 55.6% Abv.
baxus_class_name: Diamond Versailles Still 14 Year Batch 3 That Boutique-y Rum Company

name: Miltonduff 1967 Single Cask #5414 Mackillop's Choice
description: A 1967 vintage single cask expression of Miltonduff bottled by Mackillop's Choice at 43% Abv. Although no date is given we anticipate this cask was bottled circa 2001 making it approx 34 years of age. This era of Miltonduff is unique as 1967 was prior to a large reconstruction of the distillery which took place in 1974, modifying how their spirit was produced.

name: Buffalo Trace 1993 25 Year Old Fashioned Copper
description: Distilled in 1993 at the distillery now known as Buffalo Trace, this 25 year old bourbon was bottled at 45% Abv. The O.F.C series features exceptional vintage barrels from Buffalo Trace and is so named to honour the Old Fire Copper distillery which was an original name for the site where Buffalo Trace sits.
baxus_class_name: Buffalo Trace 1993 25 Year Old Fashioned Copper

name: Basil Hayden Toast
description:
Basil Hayden Toast is a groundbreaking bourbon release from the Beam Suntory portfolio, launched in August 2021 as a permanent addition to the Basil Hayden lineup. Crafted by eighth-generation Beam family distiller Freddie Noe, Toast represents a significant departure from the brand's traditional high-rye recipe.

The bourbon introduces an innovative approach by replacing rye grain with US-grown brown rice, creating a unique mashbill that delivers a softer, sweeter profile. A secondary toasted barrel finish further distinguishes this expression, drawing out notes of caramelized sugar and toasted wood. Noe developed the bourbon as a continuation of his grandfather Booker Noe's mission to make bourbon more approachable and exploratory.

Alongside the liquid innovation, Toast also marked a significant packaging update for the Basil Hayden brand. The new design features an enlarged, prominent metal "belt buckle" inspired by the metal hoops that encircle bourbon barrels, symbolizing the brand's connection to bourbon-making tradition.

name: Rock Hill Farms Single Barrel Chain Label - 1990
description:
Bottled at 50% ABV, the Rock Hill Farms Single Barrel embodies the spirit of Kentucky's rich farmland along the river, its name paying homage to the fertile lands of the region. This bourbon was introduced as a single-barrel expression, showcasing the remarkable quality and distinctiveness of bourbon unblended from multiple barrels.

Tasting Experience: A journey into the heart of bourbon crafting, each sip of Rock Hill Farms Single Barrel echoes the traditional bourbon-making prowess.

Nose: The first whiff offers a sweet and spicy aroma, with hints of leather and a subtle touch of roasted marshmallow adding to the complexity.

Palate: Contrary to the sweet notes in the aroma, the first sip presents a drier taste profile with flavors of dark chocolate and tobacco. The bourbon has a dry character, making it reminiscent of a fine single malt but without the peat, appealing especially to Scotch drinkers exploring bourbon.

Finish: The finish is unique, with a gentle burn that travels in reverse, from the chest back up to the throat, lingering until the next sip. This trait makes it a desirable choice for sipping in cold weather, warming up the senses with each sip.

The Rock Hill Farms Single Barrel, with its higher-rye mash bill (believed to consist of 12% to 15% rye), showcases a different facet of bourbon, offering a taste that is as rich in history as it is in flavor. The bourbon was available in both 100 proof and 80 proof versions, and it resonated well with critics, scoring an impressive 98 points in some circles.
baxus_class_name: Rock Hill Farms Single Barrel Chain Label - 1990

name: Duncan Taylor Bunnahabhain 34 year - 2013
description: A limited edition expression from Bunnahabhain with only 92 bottles available, this has been aged for a hefty 34 years.

name: Booker’s Little Book Chapter 1 2017 Bottling
description: From the producer: “The first and highly anticipated product release from Freddie Noe, eighth generation Beam family member and son of current Beam master distiller, Fred Noe. The debut of Little Book marks an exciting step forward for the next generation of Beam family whiskey makers. Named after the childhood nickname given to Freddie by his grandfather, legendary master distiller, Booker Noe, Little Book is an annual, limited release series that will feature a new and unique blend each year, presented uncut and unfiltered. Guiding each year’s release will be Freddie’s passion for crafting high-quality, interesting blends different from anything else on the market.”

name: Glenlossie Flora & Fauna 10 Year - 2009
description: Flora and Fauna, nicknamed by the late whisky writer, Michael Jackson, was a themed series of distillery only single malt whisky releases. The Glenolossie release offers sweet, slightly briny whisky.

name: Yellowstone Limited Edition - 2022
description: The Yellowstone 2022 Limited Edition Kentucky Straight Bourbon Whiskey is a special release that celebrates the 150th anniversary of Yellowstone National Park. This limited edition bourbon is a blend of 7-year, 15-year, and 16-year-old bourbons, with some of the 7-year-old barrels finished in Marsala Superiore casks from Sicily. The Marsala cask finishing imparts unique flavors of dried fruits, citrus, and a touch of sweetness, enhancing the bourbon's complexity. The bottle features a custom design with embossing and a high-end natural cork, making it a standout addition to any collection. Bottled at 101 proof (50.5% ABV), this bourbon offers a rich and balanced profile with notes of dark brown sugar, dried fruit, walnut, dates, and a lingering finish of palm sugar and tamarind. This release is a testament to the craftsmanship and innovation of the Limestone Branch Distillery.

name: Cock of the Walk Proprietors Reserve
description:
Cock of the Walk Proprietors Reserve is a premium bourbon whiskey that stands out for its rich heritage and exceptional quality. This limited-release expression is crafted from carefully selected older stocks, reflecting a commitment to traditional bourbon-making techniques and the artistry of distillation.

Upon pouring, Cock of the Walk Proprietors Reserve reveals a deep amber hue, hinting at its maturity and depth. The aroma is inviting, with notes of caramel, vanilla, and toasted oak, accompanied by subtle hints of spice and dried fruit. On the palate, this bourbon delivers a harmonious blend of flavors, showcasing rich caramel sweetness balanced by warm baking spices and a touch of nuttiness. The complexity is further enhanced by layers of dark fruit and a whisper of leather, creating a well-rounded tasting experience.

The finish is long and satisfying, leaving a warm, lingering sweetness that encourages another sip. With its thoughtful craftsmanship and careful aging, Cock of the Walk Proprietors Reserve is not just a whiskey; it’s a celebration of the bourbon tradition.

This expression is often regarded as a great value for its quality, making it a prized addition to any whiskey collection. Whether enjoyed neat, on the rocks, or in a classic cocktail, Cock of the Walk Proprietors Reserve promises to deliver a memorable and enjoyable experience for bourbon aficionados.
baxus_class_name: Cock of the Walk Proprietors Reserve

name: Ardbeg 1998 10 Year Renaissance
description: Renaissance is the final instalment in a quartet of whiskies bottled to mark Ardbeg’s resurrection and subsequent return to form after being purchased and re-opened in 1997, following a six-year hibernation. The first ten-year-old bottling of the distillery’s ‘new’ spirit, this is as potent an expression of Ardbeg whisky as you’re likely to find – a must for collectors and connoisseurs.

name: Taconic Maple Release 7
description: From the distiller: "In this bottle is the product of two American classics -- Bourbon and maple syrup. We empty our bourbon barrels then fill them with maple syrup. After a few months we empty the bourbon-infused syrup and refill the same barrels with Dutchess Private Reserve. This sweet and floral whiskey then becomes our annual limited edition release of double barrel maple bourbon.

name: Basil Hayden's 10 Year
description:
Basil Hayden's 10 Year is a premium expression from the Jim Beam Small Batch Bourbon Collection, introduced in 2018 as a limited annual release. This bourbon builds upon the legacy of the standard Basil Hayden's, known for its high-rye mashbill and approachable flavor profile.

Crafted at the Jim Beam Distillery in Clermont, Kentucky, Basil Hayden's 10 Year uses the same distinctive mashbill as its younger counterpart: 63% corn, 27% rye, and 10% malted barley. This high-rye recipe is also shared with Old Grand-Dad bourbons, creating a family of spirits with a spicy character.

The 10 Year expression represents Basil Hayden's oldest release to date, aiming to offer a more mature and complex version of the brand's signature light and approachable style. It's bottled at the same 80 proof (40% ABV) as the standard offering, maintaining the brand's reputation for smooth, easy-drinking bourbon.

Presented in an elegant bottle with Basil Hayden's characteristic metal bib, the 10 Year variant is positioned as a premium option for both longtime fans of the brand and bourbon enthusiasts seeking a refined, aged expression. While it commands a higher price point than its younger sibling, it remains competitively priced within the aged bourbon market.

This limited release typically appears on shelves during the holiday season, adding a special touch to Basil Hayden's lineup and offering consumers a chance to experience how extended aging affects the brand's distinctive flavor profile.

name: Booker's Little Book Chapter 6 2022 Bottling
description: Little Book Chapter 6: "To The Finish," crafted by Freddie Noe, the eighth generation distiller from the Beam family, is a distinctive blend from the 2022 release of the Little Book series. This innovative blend combines four 4-year-old straight malt whiskeys, each finished in different types of wood—cherrywood staves, applewood smoked barrels, hickory smoked barrels, and maplewood staves—with a 5-year-old Kentucky straight bourbon. Bottled at a cask strength of 117.4 proof, this whiskey showcases a complex flavor profile that includes notes of honeysuckle, cherry, caramelized brown sugar, earthy moss, wild mushrooms, and a hint of barbeque smoke. "To The Finish" exemplifies Freddie Noe's creative approach to whiskey blending, using unique wood finishes to enhance the depth and character of the whiskey, making it a standout addition to the Little Book series.

name: Glen Grant 1959 63 Year Mr George Legacy Third Edition Gordon & Macphail
description: The Gordon & MacPhail Glen Grant Mr. George Legacy 3 63 Year - 2022 is a remarkable single malt whisky that pays homage to the legacy of George Urquhart, a visionary in the Scotch whisky industry. Distilled on October 15, 1959, and matured for 63 years in a first-fill sherry butt, this exceptional whisky offers a unique profile that reflects the character of Glen Grant in the 1950s, when the spirit was slightly smoky due to floor maltings and a small level of peat being used.
baxus_class_name: Glen Grant 1959 63 Year Mr George Legacy Third Edition Gordon & Macphail

name: Wild Turkey 17 Year 2001 Japan Exclusive
description: A 2001 special edition bottling of Wild Turkey matured for a huge 17 years and bottled at 101 proof. This limited edition was the oldest age stated Wild Turkey released at the time, and was limited to just 5000 bottles. Originally thought to be a Japanese exclusive, a small number were reportedly sold domestically in the US but no numbers or confirmation were given by the distillery. This edition will have been distilled in the early 1980s, when the distillery still had its cypress wood fermenters and used the lower 107 barrel entry proof.

name: Caol Ila Distillery Exclusive 2017 Release
description: A special release from Caol Ila bottled in 2017 at 58.8% Abv and available exclusively to visitors of the distillery.

name: Green River 4 Year (1 Pint) - 1930s
description: Green River 4 Year Old Kentucky Straight Bourbon, bottled in the 1930s.  Green River, distilled by Oldetyme and bottled by Schenley, was a famous pre-Prohibition brand that was revived after the repeal of the Volstead Act in 1933. It was famous for its 'The Whiskey Without A Headache' slogan; by the 1930s it had changed to 'The Whiskey Without Regrets.' I personally drink my whiskey without regret anyway....

name: Knob Creek Select 15 Year - 2019
description: The Knob Creek Single Barrel Select Series is a line of single barrel bourbons that are hand-picked by Knob Creek's Master Distiller, Chris Morris. Each barrel is selected for its unique flavor profile and bottled at 120 proof (60% ABV). This selection was distilled in January of 2004 and bottled almost exactly 15 years later in January of 2019.

name: Rosebank 1990 30 Year Release 1
description: This limited edition 30 year old Lowland single malt was laid down at the Rosebank distillery in 1990, just a few years before the distillery was mothballed in 1993, and bottled in 2020 as part of the 'Renaissance' by Ian Macleod Distillers, the company responsible for bringing the 'King of the Lowlands' back to life. Triple distilled and un-chillfiltered with an ABV of 48.6%, this is one of 4350 bottles.

name: Bowmore Limited Release 26 year - 2012
description: This limited release Bowmore Vintage 1985 edition has been nurtured in hand-selected Sherry and Bourbon casks during its long maturation in the legendary Bowmore No.1 Vaults - The warehouses below sea-level.

name: Booker’s 7 Year "Storyteller Batch" 2023 Bottling
description: Booker's "The Storyteller Batch" 2023-04 is a Kentucky Straight Bourbon Whiskey that pays homage to the legendary storytelling prowess of Booker Noe, the sixth-generation Beam Master Distiller. This batch, aged for 7 years, 2 months, and 29 days, is a blend of barrels from four different production dates and warehouses, resulting in a rich and complex flavor profile. The bourbon boasts a high proof of 127.8, making it the highest-proof batch of 2023. Its rich amber hue and inviting aroma of brown sugar, vanilla, and wood set the stage for a delightful tasting experience. On the palate, it offers a harmonious blend of crème brulée, brown sugar, butterscotch, and a variety of herbal and fruity notes, complemented by a warm, spicy finish. Named in honor of Booker Noe's ability to captivate audiences with his engaging tales, this batch encourages bourbon enthusiasts to share stories and create lasting memories, just as Booker would have done. Each sip of the Storyteller Batch is a tribute to the art of storytelling and the legacy of one of bourbon's most beloved figures.

name: Old Taylor 6 Year 1992 Bottling
description: Bottled in 1992 this 6 year old expression of Old Taylor was bottled shortly after Jim Beam purchased National Distillers in 1987. Beam closed down the Old Taylor distillery and began bottling remaining stocks before using its own Beam spirit for the labels. This 1992 era bottling falls under that transitionary phase and could be using spirit from either the Old Taylor distillery of Jim Beam. The UPC code from the barcode on the rear of the bottle indicates this was likely bottled at the Old Grand Dad distillery and likely will have used left over Old Taylor stocks, however Beam has never given confirmation as to which years they began using their own produced Jim Beam product for these labels.

name: Macallan 1997 21 Year Single Hogshead #628 Signatory Vintage 30th Anniversary
description: A 1997 vintage single cask expression of Macallan matured for 21 years in a hogshead. It was bottled in 2018 at 54% Abv as part of Signatory Vintage's 30th anniversary celebrations.
baxus_class_name: Macallan 1997 21 Year Single Hogshead #628 Signatory Vintage 30th Anniversary

name: Knob Creek Select 14 Year - 2019
description: The Knob Creek Single Barrel Select Series is a line of single barrel bourbons that are hand-picked by Knob Creek's Master Distiller, Chris Morris. Each barrel is selected for its unique flavor profile and bottled at 120 proof (60% ABV). This selection was distilled in March of 2004 and bottled almost exactly 15 years later in January of 2019.

name: Benrinnes 1996 22 Year Single Hogshead #11690 Signatory Vintage For Binny’s
description:
This bottling from Signatory Vintageof a remarkable 22-year-old Benrinnes was exclusively selected for Binny's Beverage Depot. This exquisite expression from one of Scotland's esteemed distilleries captures the essence of tradition and excellence in every sip.

Nestled in the heart of Speyside, Benrinnes Distillery is renowned for its exceptional craftsmanship and commitment to quality, qualities that are evident in this meticulously aged whisky. Distilled with precision and patience, this 22-year-old bottling embodies the depth and complexity that only years of maturation can bestow.

Bottled at its natural strength, this Benrinnes release offers a symphony of flavors that dance gracefully on the palate. Delicate notes of honeyed malt, dried fruits, and subtle spices intertwine harmoniously, leading to a lingering finish that leaves a lasting impression.

Crafted exclusively for Binny's Beverage Depot by Signatory Vintage, this 22-year-old Benrinnes is a testament to the artistry and dedication of both the distillery and the independent bottler. Rare and revered, each bottle is a treasure trove of history and heritage, inviting enthusiasts to savor the richness of Speyside whisky-making.
baxus_class_name: Benrinnes 1996 22 Year Single Hogshead #11690 Signatory Vintage For Binny’s

name: Compass Box The Peat Monster Cask Strength 1.75L
description: A peated blended malt Scotch whisky from Compass box bottled at a cask strength of 57.3% Abv in a 1.75 liter format.
baxus_class_name: Compass Box The Peat Monster Cask Strength 1.75L

name: Booker's 6 Year "Shiny Barrel Batch" 2019 Bottling
description:
Booker's Bourbon is a pioneering small-batch bourbon brand founded by Jim Beam's grandson, Booker Noe, in 1988. Launched during a challenging period for bourbon sales, the brand revolutionized the whiskey industry by introducing the concept of "small batch" bourbon and popularizing barrel-proof whiskey.

Rooted in seven generations of bourbon-making tradition, Booker's is known for its unfiltered, uncut approach to bourbon production. Each batch is carefully selected from barrels aged at the center of the rickhouse, where temperature and humidity conditions are most favorable. Typically aged between six and eight years, the bourbon is bottled straight from the barrel without dilution, maintaining its robust, full-strength character.

The brand remains a family affair, with Booker's son Fred Noe continuing his father's legacy as Master Distiller. Booker Noe's original vision was to create a bourbon that honored traditional craftsmanship while offering whiskey enthusiasts a more authentic, intense drinking experience. Today, Booker's continues to release limited edition batches, each with its own unique story and characteristics, while staying true to its founder's original philosophy of producing bourbon "the way it should be."

name: Booker's 6 Year "Pigskin Batch" 2020 Bottling
description:
Booker's Bourbon is a pioneering small-batch bourbon brand founded by Jim Beam's grandson, Booker Noe, in 1988. Launched during a challenging period for bourbon sales, the brand revolutionized the whiskey industry by introducing the concept of "small batch" bourbon and popularizing barrel-proof whiskey.

Rooted in seven generations of bourbon-making tradition, Booker's is known for its unfiltered, uncut approach to bourbon production. Each batch is carefully selected from barrels aged at the center of the rickhouse, where temperature and humidity conditions are most favorable. Typically aged between six and eight years, the bourbon is bottled straight from the barrel without dilution, maintaining its robust, full-strength character.

The brand remains a family affair, with Booker's son Fred Noe continuing his father's legacy as Master Distiller. Booker Noe's original vision was to create a bourbon that honored traditional craftsmanship while offering whiskey enthusiasts a more authentic, intense drinking experience. Today, Booker's continues to release limited edition batches, each with its own unique story and characteristics, while staying true to its founder's original philosophy of producing bourbon "the way it should be."

name: Finch's Red Satin 13 Year - 1929
description: Finch's Red Satin 13 Year - 1929 is a vintage whiskey produced by the Finch distillery, a notable name in the American whiskey industry during the early 20th century. This particular bottle, dating back to 1929, showcases the distillery's commitment to quality and craftsmanship. The bottle itself is distinctive, featuring a unique red and amber glass design with intricate patterns, which was typical of the era's decorative approach to whiskey packaging. The label highlights its 13-year aging process, emphasizing the brand's dedication to producing well-matured spirits. Finch's Red Satin was known for being carefully sealed to ensure the preservation of its quality, a testament to the meticulous standards of the Finch distillery.

name: Jim Beam Small Batch
description:
Jim Beam Small Batch is a distinguished bourbon that embodies the rich heritage and craftsmanship of one of America’s most iconic distilleries. Crafted from a selection of carefully chosen barrels, this bourbon offers a unique blend that showcases the depth and complexity of the Jim Beam legacy.

Upon pouring, Jim Beam Small Batch reveals a warm amber hue, inviting enthusiasts to explore its character. The nose is a delightful mix of sweet vanilla, caramel, and toasted oak, with hints of spice and a touch of dried fruit that add to its aromatic complexity. 

On the palate, this bourbon delivers a well-rounded flavor profile, where the sweetness of corn is complemented by layers of rich caramel and warm baking spices. The influence of the oak barrels is evident, providing a subtle smokiness that enhances the overall experience. The finish is smooth and lingering, with notes of vanilla and spice that leave a satisfying warmth.

Bottled at 40% ABV, Jim Beam Small Batch is versatile enough to be enjoyed neat, on the rocks, or as a base for classic cocktails. Its approachable yet sophisticated character makes it an excellent choice for both seasoned bourbon aficionados and those new to the world of whiskey. 

With its commitment to quality and tradition, Jim Beam Small Batch stands as a testament to the distillery's dedication to producing exceptional bourbon, making it a cherished addition to any whiskey collection.

name: Strathisla 1955 Gordon & Macphail
description: A 1955 vintage expression of Strathisla, one of Scotland's oldest distilleries. This edition was bottled by Gordon & Macphail who were purchased sizeable amounts of Strathisla spirit throughout the 20th century. Strathisla was primarily a component of the Chivas Brothers blended Scotch whiskies but the distillery contracted bottling of their malt to Gordon & Macphil, who retained deep stocks of vintage casks. This bottling was likely done in the mid to late 1980s or early 1990s and is bottled at 40% Abv.

name: Volcan De Mi Tierra X.A Reposado Formula 1 - 2023
description: Volcan De Mi Tierra X.A Reposado Formula 1 is a limited edition tequila crafted to celebrate its designation as the Official Tequila of the Formula 1 Las Vegas Grand Prix. This premium tequila is a unique blend of Reposado, Añejo, and Extra-Añejo tequilas, all made from 100% Blue Weber Agave and free of additives. The three-layer aging process imparts a smooth profile, with the Reposado base providing sweetness and smoothness, while the Añejo and Extra-Añejo add aromatic elegance and complexity. The bottle features a striking black and gold design with vertical lines and a metal cap, embodying both luxury and the thrill of Formula 1 racing. Only 3,800 bottles were produced, each commemorating the 3.8-mile track of the Las Vegas Grand Prix, making it a rare and collectible.
baxus_class_name: Volcan De Mi Tierra X.A Reposado Formula 1 - 2023

name: Glenmorangie 25 Year Pommard Cask Finish Traveler’s Exclusive
description: The Glenmorangie 25 Year Pommard Cask Finish Traveler's Exclusive is a distinguished Highland single malt Scotch whisky, showcasing the brand's dedication to craftsmanship and innovation. This limited-edition release, available exclusively at travel retail outlets, features a striking copper-colored glass bottle adorned with intricate swirling patterns and a gold-colored metal cap. The label prominently displays the Glenmorangie name and the "25 Year" age statement, emphasizing its premium status. This expression has undergone a unique maturation process, spending 10 years in bourbon barrels before being finished for 15 years in Pommard wine casks from the Burgundy region, known for its powerful Pinot Noir wines. This secondary maturation imparts complex flavors and a rich, fruity character to the whisky. With only 1,000 bottles produced, this exclusive release is a testament to Glenmorangie's innovative spirit and commitment to creating exceptional whisky experiences.
baxus_class_name: Glenmorangie 25 Year Pommard Cask Finish Traveler’s Exclusive

name: Signatory Vintage 13 Year - 2020
description: Glenlivet 2006 SV is a 13 year old Single Malt whisky from Scotland. Bottled in 15.07.2020 at 60.8% this bottle will make a fine addition to any Scotland Single Malt whisky lover. It is also worth mentioning that this is uncolored, non-chillfiltered, single cask whisky edition of Glenlivet. This is one of only 612 bottles ever produced. A fact that makes this edition even more desirable.

name: Stillman’s Dram Tullibardine 27 Year
description: This individually numbered 27 year old bottle of Tullibardine, bottled for the Stillman's Dram range. This is a range of limited edition single malts of superior quality and specially chosen by the Stillman as one of the finest examples of his craft.

name: Caol Ila 1984 32 Year Single Cask Hunter Laing 1.5L
description: A large format bottling of Caol Ila distilled in 1984 and matured for 32 years in a refill hogshead. Bottled at 51.2% Abv by Hunter Laing in a large 1500ml magnum size, just 18 of these bottles were produced!
baxus_class_name: Caol Ila 1984 32 Year Single Cask Hunter Laing 1.5L

name: Balmenach 2001 14 Year Single Cask Save Lars Homestead
description: Bottled as part of an initiative to save Lars Ranch, an iconic set from the "Star Wars" movies, this bottle is part of an extremely limited run, with only 100 being produced. Each bottle is hand-numbered and signed by Mark and Manny, the two behind the project.
baxus_class_name: Balmenach 2001 14 Year Single Cask Save Lars Homestead

name: Keeper's Heart Irish+American Whiskey 4 Year
description: IRISH + AMERICAN WHISKEY Our first release, Keeper’s Heart Irish + American Whiskey, marries the unique characteristics of smooth and rich Irish Grain & Pot Still whiskeys with bold and flavorful American Rye for a unique taste experience.   This expression highlights notes of baking spices which pair beautifully with the American whiskey‘s sweetness and lingering notes of charred oak.  43% ALC/VOL – 86 PROOF  NOSE Bright, floral, baking spices  TASTE Candied ginger, vanilla, lemon zest, sweet biscuits, stewed fruit. Long and lingering with notes of spices, candy sweetness and freshly charred oak.  FINISH Long and pleasant spiced caramel

name: Old Charter The Classic 90 12 year
description:
Old Charter The Classic 90, 12 Years Old, is a type of Bourbon whiskey from Kentucky. This expression has an alcohol by volume (ABV) of 45% and is described as a well-made, serious bourbon suitable for pairing with cigars. The bourbon is noted for its tasting profile which includes the aroma of cooked fruits, bitter orange, rum and raisin, with almost leathery notes, pipe smoke, and allspice. The palate is described as sweet and deep, but with very pure flavors, including grilled nut and old-fashioned rose. It has a finish that begins to dry and shows some good maturity. This bourbon has been rated 7.8 by Dave Broom and Michael Jackson, with tasting notes mentioning flavors of almond essence, vanilla, and corn muffins on the palate, with a toasty and crisp finish.

The Old Charter brand has a rich history dating back to the late 19th century when it was created by the Chapeze brothers. It survived the Prohibition era and was bought by the Bernheim distillery at the close of Prohibition in 1933, which later became part of the Schenley empire in 1937. The Classic 90, 12 Years Old expression was historically produced by Schenley at the Bernheim distillery and is aged in Virgin American Oak barrels.

Moreover, it's noted that this expression is no longer in production, making it a potentially collectible item. 

Would you like to know more about where you might purchase this bourbon or any other details?

name: Sazerac 1984 18 Year Rye Fall 2004 Release
description: A huge 1984 vintage expression of Kentucky rye whiskey matured for 18 years and bottled in 2004 at 90 proof. Bottled as part of the annual Buffalo Trace Antique Collection.

name: Glenesk-Hillside 1970 25 Year Rare Malts
description: The Rare Malt Selection was a historic selection of single malt whiskies from operational and lost distilleries that were released by Diageo between 1995 and 2005. As with the Flora & Fauna series, they were often from lesser-seen single malt distilleries. This is a Hillside single malt, distilled in 1970 and bottled at 25 years of age. Known as Glenesk from 1980-85, and prior to that as Hillside since 1964, this distillery produced both malt and grain at different stages in its history. It is not often seen officially bottled, but has contributed to several Rare Malt releases. Distilling ceased there entirely in 1985, and the site operates exclusively as a maltings now.

name: Convalmore 1977 36 Year Old Cask Strength
description: Sourced from the closed Speyside distillery Convalmore, this 1977 vintage was matured for 36 years and bottled in 2013 as part of the Diageo special releases. It was bottled at a natural cask strength of 58% Abv. Convalmore spent much of the 20th century as a malt component in DCL’s blended whiskies like Johnnie Walker. The site closed in 1985 and remaining stocks have slowly found their way into releases from Diageo.

name: Glenury Royal 1971 23 Year Rare Malts
description: Glenury Royal was founded by Robert Barclay in 1825, taking its name from the glen that runs through the Ury district. Weeks after opening in Stonehaven, a fire destroyed stocks of barley, along with the kiln and parts of the malting floor. Two weeks after the fire, worker James Clark died in an accident with the boiler. Robert Barclay died in 1854, and the distillery was auctioned to William Richie three years later. The maltings of Glenury Royal were closed in 1968. The distillery then kept producing malt whisky for almost two more decades, but eventually it was mothballed on May 31, 1985. In 1992 the owners decided to cease the malt whisky production at Glenury Royal for good. The buildings of the distillery were sold in 1993 to a property company who turned part of these buildings into apartments.

name: Very Olde St. Nick Unicorn Cask 17 Year
baxus_class_name: Very Olde St. Nick Unicorn Cask 17 Year

name: Johnnie Walker Blue Label James Jean Limited Edition Design
description:
Johnnie Walker has released a special limited edition of their premium Blue Label blended Scotch whisky to celebrate the Lunar New Year. This edition features a bottle design created by the renowned Asian-American artist James Jean to commemorate the Year of the Dragon.

The Blue Label is Johnnie Walker's most prestigious blend, crafted from some of the rarest and most exceptional whiskies in their reserves, including irreplaceable casks from long-closed "ghost" distilleries. It is known for its velvety smooth and vibrant flavor profile, with layers of fruit, spice, and a long, luxurious smokiness.

For this limited edition, James Jean drew inspiration from the complex flavors of Blue Label, creating a visually striking dragon design that represents respect for tradition while looking optimistically towards the future. The bottle's artwork showcases Jean's innovative and influential style, making it a highly collectible item for whisky enthusiasts and art lovers alike.
baxus_class_name: Johnnie Walker Blue Label James Jean Limited Edition Design

name: Dailuaine 16 Year Flora & Fauna
description: Flora and Fauna, a series affectionately nicknamed by the late whisky writer Michael Jackson, represents a themed collection of distillery-only single malt whisky releases. Each distillery within the series was bestowed with a specific creature as its emblem, elegantly showcased on the label of every bottle. As time progressed, the landscape of the whisky industry underwent changes, with distilleries facing commercialization, closure, or acquisition. Consequently, the Flora and Fauna range gradually dwindled, leaving behind a curated selection of highly sought-after bottles. Whisky enthusiasts cherish these remaining treasures as they offer a glimpse into the essence of each distillery. Rarely bottled as single malt, each bottle from this esteemed collection holds a unique and coveted status, adding to its allure and collectability. Among these revered releases is the distinguished Dailuaine 16 Year, a testament to the rich heritage and exquisite craftsmanship of Scotch whisky.

name: Loch Lomond 2000 22 Year The Open 151st
description:
The Loch Lomond 22 Year Old (2000 Vintage) is a special limited edition single malt Scotch whisky released in 2023 as part of The Open Course Collection. It was distilled in 2000 and bottled to commemorate the 151st Open Championship held at Royal Liverpool Golf Club.

This expression honors the historic Royal Liverpool venue, which has hosted The Open, one of golf's most prestigious major tournaments, on multiple occasions. The 22-year-old age statement ensures a well-matured and refined whisky that captures the essence of Loch Lomond's renowned single malt production.

The 2000 vintage is the second release in The Open Course Collection, following the 1999 vintage bottled in 2022 to celebrate the 150th Open at St. Andrews. This highly limited and collectible whisky pays tribute to the rich heritage and tradition of The Open Championship.

name: Bowmore 30 Year Sea Dragon 70cl
description: Light and sweet on the nose  with whiffs of sherry and smoke. Palate: A smoky entry that begins bursting with rich, tropical flavors and some sherry notes. Finish: A wonderful and engaging finish.

name: Bunnahabhain 43 Year Old The Single Malts Of Scotland
description: Reportedly distilled in 1975, this 43 year old expression of Bunnahabhain was matured in a refilled bourbon hogshead. Bottled as part of the Director’s Special range at 41.4% Abv by Elixir Distillers as part of their Single Malts Of Scotland label.
series: Single Malts of Scotland - Director's Special
baxus_class_name: Bunnahabhain 43 Year Old The Single Malts Of Scotland

name: Taketsuru 21 Year
description: A marriage of 21 year old whiskies from both the Yoichi and Miyagikyo distilleries, the Pure Malt 21 is a stunning display of incredible balance, sweetness of barley, richness of malt, and depth of flavor. One of Japan's true treasures.

name: Wild Turkey Master's Keep Voyage 10 Year 2023 Release
description: The Wild Turkey Master's Keep Voyage 10 Year - 2023 is a Kentucky Straight Bourbon Whiskey that has been aged for 10 years and finished in Jamaican rum casks. This special edition is part of the Master's Keep series and is the first rum cask finish in Wild Turkey's history. The collaboration between Master Distiller Eddie Russell and Master Blender Dr. Joy Spence of Appleton Estate rum has resulted in a whiskey that combines the hallmarks of both bourbon and rum-making. The whiskey is bottled at 106 proof (53% ABV) and is non-chill filtered, offering a palate of fruits, caramel, and aged oak, with a warm, long-lasting finish of chocolate and spice. The bottle design is premium, with a distinctive red color and the Wild Turkey logo prominently displayed, reflecting the high-end nature of this release.
baxus_class_name: Wild Turkey Master's Keep Voyage 10 Year 2023 Release

name: Very Olde St. Nick Lost Barrel 17 Year
baxus_class_name: Very Olde St. Nick Lost Barrel 17 Year

name: Macallan Concept 3
description: From the distiller: "The Macallan Concept Number 3 brings together whisky and design through this latest collaboration with David Carson, one of the most influential and revolutionary contemporary graphic designers. Carson brought his perspective and unique style to the design of Concept Number 3. He was inspired by his time spent at The Macallan Estate working alongside The Macallan’s Whisky Maker, Polly Logan. Best known for his innovative magazine design, and use of distinctive experimental typography, David has designed the pack and label for the third and final addition to the Concept range."

name: Balvenie Single Cask 34 year - 2005
description: The Balvenie Distillery has been owned and managed by an Independent Family Company for five generations. This has ensured that the distillery remains dedicated to the traditional care and craftsmanship of Malt Whisky Making.

name: Mortlach 1972 22 Year Rare Malts 200ml
description: The Rare Malts Selection was a historic selection of single malt whiskies from operational and lost distilleries that were released by Diageo between 1995 and 2005. As with the Flora & Fauna series, they were often from lesser-seen single malt distilleries. This very rare Mortlach was distilled in 1972 and bottled in 1995. Mortlach was founded in 1823 and was the first of Dufftown's "Seven Stills" to be licensed. It rose to pre-eminence under George Cowie & Son, who's unique distillation regime produced a famously "meaty" whisky, which was highly prized by blenders. It was for this reason that it was acquired by John Walker & Sons, and so important to them was it that little stock was left available for bottling as a single malt. The Flora & Fauna release was the first official distillery bottling, but it was not until 2014 that a permanent range was finally added.

name: Wild Turkey 12 Year Pseudo-Split Label 2002 Bottling
description: First released in 1980, the 12 year old age statement from Wild Turkey has become a serious fan favourite. This is the Pseudo-Split label edition released from 1999 onwards. This specific bottle was produced in 2003. Older editions of Wild Turkey are particularly sought after amongst enthusiasts, notably for their remarkably different taste profile to modern Wild Turkey bottles. The distillery originally produced bourbon using cypress wood tanks but these were slowly phased out from 1984 until 1990. The other notable production change came in 2004 when the barrel entry proof was changed to 110, up from 107. The combination of these changes have resulted in serious demand for older vintage bottlings from the much loved distillery, with some believing 1990s era bottlings to be the distillery’s best ever.
baxus_class_name: Wild Turkey 12 Year Pseudo-Split Label 2002 Bottling

name: Bourbon Lore Ben Holladay 18 Barrels 7 Year
baxus_class_name: Bourbon Lore Ben Holladay 18 Barrels 7 Year

name: Macduff 1989 29 Year Old Single Cask Cadenhead’s
description: Distilled in 1989 this single cask expression of the lesser seen Scottish distillery Macduff was matured for 29 years in a refill sherry butt. Bottled at 55.1% Abv by Cadenhead’s as part of their authentic collection range, this series of bottlings is usually only available to visitors of the Cadenhead’s shops.
baxus_class_name: Macduff 1989 29 Year Old Single Cask Cadenhead’s

name: Glenrothes 1976 Single Cask #2677 Bottled 2015 UK Exclusive
description: A 1976 vintage Glenrothes. This was filled into second-fill American oak hogshead #2677 in February 1976 and allowed to age until December 2015, when it was bottled with an outturn of just 238 bottles.
baxus_class_name: Glenrothes 1976 Single Cask #2677 Bottled 2015 UK Exclusive

name: Wild Turkey Cheesy Gold Foil 12 Year 1990 Bottling
description: First released in 1985, this is a 1990 bottling of Wild Turkey's highly sought after cheesy gold foil edition. This 12 year old bourbon is bottled at their signature 101 proof and lasted until 1992 when it was changed to a split label. Older editions of Wild Turkey are particularly sought after amongst enthusiasts, notably for their remarkably different taste profile to modern Wild Turkey bottles. The distillery originally produced bourbon using cypress wood tanks but these were slowly phased out from 1984 until 1990. The other notable production change came in 2004 when the barrel entry proof was changed to 110, up from 107. The combination of these changes have resulted in serious demand for older vintage bottlings from the much loved distillery, with some believing 1990s era bottlings to be the distillery’s best ever.
baxus_class_name: Wild Turkey Cheesy Gold Foil 12 Year 1990 Bottling

name: Tobermory 42 year - 2016
description: A 42 year old single malt Scotch whisky from Tobermory. An extraordinarily well-aged whisky from this distillery on the Isle of Mull, which even contains some of the first spirit produced when the distillery was reopened in 1972. A release of only 650 bottles.

name: A Midwinter Night’s Dram Act 11 Scene 3
description: A Midwinter Night's Dram Act 11 Scene 3 is a captivating expression from High West Distillery, inspired by the enchanting whimsy of Shakespeare's "A Midsummer Night's Dream" and the serene beauty of a starlit winter's night. This limited annual release is distinguished by its unique finishing in port wine barrels, which imparts a rich complexity and a delightful interplay of sweet and spicy notes. Each bottle's Act and Scene notation not only marks its release year and batch but also adds a collectible charm to this rye whiskey. With its deep ruby hue and a palate rich with dark fruits and warm spices, A Midwinter Night's Dram is a perfect companion for reflective, cozy evenings by the fire, making it a sought-after treasure for whiskey enthusiasts each winter season.
baxus_class_name: A Midwinter Night’s Dram Act 11 Scene 3

name: Mortlach Crystal Decanter 25 Year
description: The first thing you'll notice about this award-winning Millenial is the insanely beautiful crystal decanter it comes in. But that's not where the extravagance ends. What's inside is even more astonishing. The Spirit that spent a quarter of a century in refill American oak casks offers a complex melange of notes, including those of vanilla, oak, chocolate, and spices. It was made for sophisticated palates, promising a five-star tasting experience.

name: Glendronach 18 Year 2021 Bottling
description: An 18 year old expression of single malt from Glendronach matured in high quality sherry casks and bottled at 46% Abv.

name: Duncan Taylor Ardbeg 20 Year - 2018
description:
The Dimensions Collection from Duncan Taylor Scotch Whisky Limited is an outstanding range of single malt and single grain whiskies sourced from various regions of Scotland. Bottled from individual casks at cask strength, these unique whiskies highlight the diversity and impact of each distinct cask, offering unrepeatable expressions from both renowned and lesser-known distilleries. Devoid of chill filtration or artificial coloring, only the finest whiskies earn a place in the Dimensions Collection, ensuring that each release embodies the nuanced character of the distillery, in line with the ethos: “Whisky Without Compromise.”

The balance of craftsmanship and meticulous attention to detail lies at the core of Duncan Taylor’s acclaimed reputation, evident in the intricacy and richness of every offering within the Dimensions Collection. Within this exceptional range, one standout gem shines—the Islay Blended Malt, from Ardbeg Distillery. This distinguished bottle encapsulates the rugged spirit of Islay, blending the bold peatiness of the island's malts with the finesse and complexity characteristic of Duncan Taylor Scotch Whisky Limited. Crafted with precision and passion, the Islay Blended Malt stands as a testament to the artistry and dedication that define the Dimensions Collection, offering enthusiasts a truly unforgettable tasting experience that pays homage to the iconic flavors of Islay's whisky heritage.

name: Balvenie 16 Year Triple Cask
description: Originally released for Travel Retail, Balvenie 16 Year Old Triple Wood is aged in a combination of wood types – refill American oak casks, first-fill bourbon barrels and first-fill oloroso sherry butts – resulting in a sweet and spicy whisky.

name: Very Olde St. Nick The O.G. 17 Year
baxus_class_name: Very Olde St. Nick The O.G. 17 Year

name: Glenrothes 1968 Single Cask #13504 Bottled 2018 The Last Drop
description: A 1968 vintage single cask expression of Glenrothes matured for almost five decades in a bourbon barrel. Bottled in 2018 at 51.2% Abv by The Last Drop Distillers Limited.
baxus_class_name: Glenrothes 1968 Single Cask #13504 Bottled 2018 The Last Drop

name: Douglas Laing Bowmore XOP 30 Year - 2019
description: Douglas Laing's XOP (Xtra Old Particular) is the best of the best from the Douglas Laing family vaults. This range of rare aged Single Malt and Single Grain Scotch Whiskies is bottled exactly the way the distiller intended: without colouring or chill-filtration, and at cask strength.

name: Tomatin 1975 Single Hogshead #36834 Warehouse 6 Collection Bottled 2019
description: A single cask expression of Tomatin distilled in 1975 and matured in a Spanish oak Oloroso sherry hogshead. Bottled in 2019 ay 46.5% Abv as part of the distillery's ultra premium Warehouse 6 Collection.
baxus_class_name: Tomatin 1975 Single Hogshead #36834 Warehouse 6 Collection Bottled 2019

name: Bruichladdich Ochdamh-mor 5 Year
description: Like some other single malt whiskeys from the cult distillery Bruichladdich on the Islay Islands, the Octomore 07.3 Ochdamh-mór is one of the most heavily peated representatives of its guild. This is characteristic of the Octomore series and also grants the 07.3 a whopping 169 ppm. The barley for this limited and very rare whiskey comes exclusively from the Octomore Farm and matured for 5 years in both bourbon and Spanish red wine casks. This drop reflects the philosophy of the distillery. Authentic and uncompromising. Craftsmanship is the focus here. Unfiltered and uncolored whiskey enjoyment.

name: Macallan 52 Year 2018 Release
description: A 2018 special release from Macallan, this huge 52 year old age statement was matured in sherry casks and bottled at a higher than typical strength of 48% Abv. Just 250 bottles were produced in this fantastic five decade old expression.

name: Macallan 1958/59 25 Year Anniversary Malt
description: A 1958 & 1959 vintage expression of Macallan matured for 25 years in sherry oak casks. Bottled in 1985 as part of their anniversary malt series, this line of vintage dated bottles was marketed as a bottle to be gifted or consumed to celebrate an anniversary. Early 2000s editions dropped their vintage but releases such as this 1950s are highly sought after for the exceptional quality of sherry matured spirit. The 1958/1959 vatting is two vintages blended together as Macallan did not hold sufficient stocks of 1959 spirit and so extra casks from the 1958 vintage were required.

name: Bowmore 2000 Single Hogshead Bottled 2015 Malts Of Scotland
description: A 2000 vintage single cask expression of Bowmore matured in a sherry hogshead. It was bottled in 2015 at 55.2% Abv by Malts Of Scotland.
baxus_class_name: Bowmore 2000 Single Hogshead Bottled 2015 Malts Of Scotland

name: Michter's Single Barrel 25 Year Rye - 2008
description: From the distiller: "Our exceptionally rare 25 Year Single Barrel Kentucky Straight Rye release continues the legacy of America's first whiskey variety (rye) from America's first whiskey company (Michter's, originally known as Shenk's). Subject to the costly evaporation of a quarter century of "Angel's Share," our 25 Year Single Barrel Rye continues the Michter's tradition of sparing no expense in striving to offer the finest whiskey possible."

name: Wild Turkey Master’s Keep 17 Year Signed
baxus_class_name: Wild Turkey Master’s Keep 17 Year Signed

name: Wild Turkey Real Kentucky Rye Old Label - 2007
description: The Wild Turkey 101 Straight Rye is characterized by its balanced profile blending sweet and spicy notes. When tasted neat, it displays a citrine color and offers aromas of light vanilla, lemon cookie, and fresh bread with hints of musty oak and faint mint. The palate is greeted with flavors of vanilla, lemon-lime soda, and light musty oak, alongside baked goods notes reminiscent of lemon squares and sugar cookies with a slight floral and minty spice. The finish is medium in duration with a gentle warmth, featuring vanilla, simple syrup, and fading citrus accompanied by waves of light baking spice.
baxus_class_name: Wild Turkey Real Kentucky Rye Old Label - 2007

name: Glenmorangie 1993 Grand Vintage Bottled 2018
description: A 1993 vintage expression from Glenmorangie crafted from spirit matured in bourbon casks before a finishing period in madeira wine casks. Released as part of the Grand Vintage series this edition was bottled in 2018 at 43% Abv.

name: Glen Mhor 1975 34 Year Single Cask #6034 Duncan Taylor
description: A single cask whisky from the closed Glen Mhor distillery, bottled by Duncan Taylor for the Tantalus range. The whisky was distilled in 1975 and matured for 34 years in cask #DT6034. It was bottled in 2009 at 43.7%.
baxus_class_name: Glen Mhor 1975 34 Year Single Cask #6034 Duncan Taylor

name: Glenmorangie 1976 Concord Commemorative Bottling
description: A rare bottling of Glenmorangie using whisky distilled on 21st January 1976, the day of Concorde's first ever commercial flight. Presented in an elegant wooden box, this is a hard to find whisky.

name: IB Bruichladdich 20 Year "Save Lars Whisky" - 2013
description: Bottled as part of an initiative to preserve the Lars Homestead in Tunisia, an iconic Star Wars set from the original movie, this is an incredibly rare bottle. Only 100 of these bottles were produced, and each is numbered and signed by Mark and Manny, the two behind the botting.

name: Clynelish 2008 10 Year Bourbon Barrels Artist Collective #2.7 LMDW
description: A 2008 vintage small batch of 9 casks of Clynelish matured for 10 years in refill bourbon barrels. Bottled as the 7th cask in the 2nd round of artist collective bottlings, this edition is released at 43% Abv by French retailer La Maison Du Whisky.
baxus_class_name: Clynelish 2008 10 Year Bourbon Barrels Artist Collective #2.7 LMDW

name: Laphroaig 25 Year Cask Strength 2015 Edition
description: A 2015 special edition release of Laphroaig matured for 25 years in American oak and Oloroso sherry casks. It was bottled at a cask strength of 46.8%

name: Rare Character Single Barrel "Justin's House of Bourbon"
description:
Rare Character's Single Barrel Series represents the flagship offering from Rare Character Whiskey, showcasing unique and rare American whiskey expressions sourced from distilleries across the country. Each barrel in this series is meticulously hand-selected by co-founder Pablo Moix, ensuring that only whiskeys of exceptional quality make the cut.

The Single Barrel Series is characterized by its diversity and individuality, with each release reflecting a distinct flavor profile and character. These whiskeys are typically sourced from well-known distilleries, including those in Indiana, and feature a range of mash bills. For instance, one bourbon in the series has a mash bill of 60% corn, 36% rye, and 4% malted barley, delivering a flavorful experience with notes of sweet vanilla, baking spices, and a hint of rye spice.

The packaging of the Single Barrel Series adds to its allure, with each bottle adorned with a unique painting and sealed with a wax top, creating an engaging unboxing experience. The proof of these bourbons often hovers around 120, showcasing a bold character that appeals to enthusiasts who appreciate higher-proof offerings.

Overall, the Single Barrel Series by Rare Character is a celebration of craftsmanship, creativity, and the rich heritage of American whiskey, making it a sought-after choice for collectors and connoisseurs alike.
baxus_class_name: Rare Character Single Barrel "Justin's House of Bourbon"

name: Port Ellen 1983 30 Year Single Cask #671 Duncan Taylor
description: Cask 671 of Port Ellen was distilled in 1983, the year the distillery was closed. This Tantalus release is housed in a hand-blown glass decanter which sits in an elegant Tantalus made from the cask that aged this Port Ellen single malt Scotch whisky for 30 years.
baxus_class_name: Port Ellen 1983 30 Year Single Cask #671 Duncan Taylor

name: Blanton's Takara Red 2022 Release
description:
Blanton's Takara Red is a special edition of the celebrated Blanton's Single Barrel Bourbon, exclusively released for the Japanese market. Part of the Takara series, which also includes Takara Black and Takara Gold, this expression is highly sought after by bourbon enthusiasts and collectors around the world.

Takara Red is distinguished by its unique characteristics, including an aging process that is rumored to be a minimum of eight years, although this is not officially confirmed on the label. It is bottled at 93 proof (46.5% ABV), the same as the standard Blanton's Single Barrel, ensuring a robust flavor profile.

The packaging of Takara Red adds to its allure, featuring a distinctive red box with a woven texture and a deep maroon bag that contrasts with the brown bag of domestic Blanton's. The bottle is adorned with a gold-colored wax seal, similar to that found on Blanton's Straight From The Barrel. The label showcases light brown handwritten and printed portions, along with Japanese script spelling out "Whiskey," further emphasizing its exclusivity.

The Takara Red series is particularly interesting for collectors due to its limited availability and the variations that can arise from individual barrel selections. Some special releases within this series, such as the HBA (Hotel Barmen Association Japan) Single Barrel picks, offer even more unique expressions.

While many enthusiasts speculate about the potential superiority of the Takara series due to its rumored longer aging process, recent reviews suggest that modern releases may be more comparable in quality to standard Blanton's. Nevertheless, Takara Red remains a highly coveted expression in the bourbon world, often commanding premium prices on the secondary market.

name: Wild Turkey 8 Year 1990 Bottling
description: An older bottling of Wild Turkey's signature 8 year old age statement bottled at 101 proof in 1990. Older editions of Wild Turkey are particularly sought after amongst enthusiasts, notably for their remarkably different taste profile to modern Wild Turkey bottles. The distillery originally produced bourbon using cypress wood tanks but these were slowly phased out from 1984 until 1990. The other notable production change came in 2004 when the barrel entry proof was changed to 110, up from 107. The combination of these changes have resulted in serious demand for older vintage bottlings from the much loved distillery, with some believing 1990s era bottlings to be the distillery’s best ever.

name: Fettercairn 1995 19 Year Single Hogshead Master Of Malt
description: A 1995 vintage single cask expression of Fettercairn matured for 19 years in a refill sherry hogshead. Bottled at 60.1% Abv by UK retailer Master Of Malt.
baxus_class_name: Fettercairn 1995 19 Year Single Hogshead Master Of Malt

name: Blanton's Black 2022 Bottling
description: Produced exclusively for the Japanese export market at 80 proof, Blanton's Black Label is one of the rarest bourbon whiskeys in the world. Remarkably similar to the green-labeled Special Reserve, the main difference is an 8-year minimum aged barrel selection process (as opposed to the standard 6), which produces a more complex, robust, and refined tasting experience. Like the Takara Red edition, the Black Label is a statement piece for any serious collector and a must-try for any keen Blanton's enthusiast.

name: Bruichladdich 30 Year - 1986
description: The Magnificent Seven" expression is comprised of seven casks of delicate, floral Bruichladdich that have been subject to intense, full-term sherry maturation. Nose: Dried fruit - raisins, prunes and Christmas cake. Palate: Sweet PX notes, raisins, dried figs, dates, grape sugar.

name: Bowmore 1971 34 Year Old Sherry Wood
description: This spectacular limited edition 34 year old Islay single malt that was produced at the Bowmore distillery in 1971 and bottled in 2005 for the distillery's Vintage Distillation series.

name: Macallan Sir Peter Blake
description: The Anecdotes of Ages Collection is an extraordinary art and whisky collaboration with globally renowned British pop artist, Sir Peter Blake. The collaboration is The Macallan’s third with the iconic artist, and is part of a relationship that has spanned almost four decades. The partnership celebrates our rich legacy and Sir Peter Blake’s remarkable contribution to the art world. This special single malt whisky has been created to commemorate Sir Peter Blake’s visit to The Macallan Estate on the legendary River Spey. An Estate, A Community, and A Distillery tells the story of some of the colourful characters from The Macallan’s past and present and features a label digitally designed by Sir Peter himself. The Macallan Lead Whisky Maker, Sarah Burgess, was inspired by Sir Peter Blake’s character to create a whisky classic in style with surprising notes of treacle and black pepper.

name: Ardbeg Fermutation Committee Release 13 Year - 2021
description: From the distiller: "In November 2007, when a broken boiler threatened six washbacks filled with precious liquid, Dr Bill (Ardbeg’s Director of Distilling and Whisky Creation) sensed an opportunity. He quickly instructed the Distillery folk to throw open the washback lids and expose the liquid to the air. Tiny beings descended from the sky and landed in the spirit… The ‘Fermutation’ process had begun. An epic 3 week-long fermentation – the longest in Ardbeg’s history – eventually gave rise to this wild, zingy and vibrant spirit."

name: Legend of Kremlin
description: Legend of Kremlin Vodka is produced from the special grain spirit Lux (containing 96 5% pure alcohol). Soft water from its own artesian well and all-natural ingredients give Legend of Kremlin Vodka a special taste and an unique refined vodka scent.

name: Springbank 2002 15 Year Fresh Sherry Cage Sample
description: A distillery exclusive cask sample from Springbank distilled in 2002 and matured for 15 years in a fresh sherry hogshead. Duty paid samples are commonly referred to as cage samples as they are sold exclusively at the distillery shop from a locked cage. These expressions are cask progress samples that are hand selected by the distillery manager and less than two dozen bottles are usually produced in each cage bottling.
baxus_class_name: Springbank 2002 15 Year Fresh Sherry Cage Sample

name: Port Ellen 1978 34 Year Old 13th Release
description: Port Ellen 34 year (13th Release) was distilled in 1978, aged for 34 years, and bottled in 2013. Port Ellen is the lost jewel in the Islay crown. Closure in 1983 has enabled this distillery to receive a near mythical amount of love and respect. As stocks get thinner on the ground, these bottles become rarer and rarer.

name: East Asia Whisky Company Bowmore 30 Year - 2021
description: Bowmore is an iconic distillery founded in 1779 by John P. David Simpson in the eponymous town on the east coast of Loch Indaal. The Islay whisky producer's limited edition bottlings are among the most sought-after on the market, but this special edition from East Asia Whisky Co. is even rarer.
baxus_class_name: East Asia Whisky Company Bowmore 30 Year - 2021

name: Bunnahabhain 1979 32 Year Single Cask #1793 Berry Bros & Rudd
description: A 1979 vintage single cask expression of Bunnahabhain matured for 32 years and bottled at 51.8% Abv by historic wine merchants Berry Bros & Rudd.
baxus_class_name: Bunnahabhain 1979 32 Year Single Cask #1793 Berry Bros & Rudd

name: Elijah Craig 8 Year Barrel Select Distillery Exclusive
description: A small format expression of Elijah Craig matured for 8 years and bottled in a unique barrel shaped bottle. This 125 proof offering of bourbon is available exclusively to visitors to the distillery.
baxus_class_name: Elijah Craig 8 Year Barrel Select Distillery Exclusive

name: Wild Turkey Batch W-T-02-95 Rare Breed
description: A 1995 release of Wild Turkey Rare Breed, a barrel proof expression of bourbon. Older editions of Wild Turkey are particularly sought after amongst enthusiasts, notably for their remarkably different taste profile to modern Wild Turkey bottles. The distillery originally produced bourbon using cypress wood tanks but these were slowly phased out from 1984 until 1990. The other notable production change came in 2004 when the barrel entry proof was changed to 110, up from 107. The combination of these changes have resulted in serious demand for older vintage bottlings from the much loved distillery, with some believing 1990s era bottlings to be the distillery’s best ever.
baxus_class_name: Wild Turkey Batch W-T-02-95 Rare Breed

name: Dalmore 12 Year 1980s Bottling
description: An older 1980s era bottling of Dalmore Highland single malt matured for 12 years and bottled at 43% Abv.

name: Glen Grant 1952 70 Year Old Single Cask #381 Platinum Jubilee Gordon & Macphail
description: To celebrate the Queen's Platinum Jubilee, Gordon & MacPhail have released a fantastic bottling from Glen Grant distillery - distilled on the 26th of January 1952, just 11 days before Queen Elizabeth ascended to the throne and bottled by Gordon & MacPhail for their Private Collection series on the 6th of February 2022, which is the the date of the Queen’s accession.
baxus_class_name: Glen Grant 1952 70 Year Old Single Cask #381 Platinum Jubilee Gordon & Macphail

name: East Asia Whisky Company Macallan Japan 30 Year - 2020
description: A unique high-proof first fill sherry single cask released exclusively for the Japanese Market. This Single Malt Scotch Whisky was distilled in November of 1990 at the Macallan Distillery and then aged for over 30 years in a first fill Oloroso sherry hogshead. In 2020 the whisky was bottled a staggering 56.1% ABV. The resulting spirit was deemed extraordinary to the extent that the team behind East Asia Whisky Company decided to include it in the prestigious Japan Series
baxus_class_name: East Asia Whisky Company Macallan Japan 30 Year - 2020

name: Bowmore 15 Year Feis Ile 2018
description: A 2018 special edition of Bowmore matured for 15 years in 1st fill Oloroso sherry casks. It was bottled at 52.5% Abv exclusively for the 2018 Feis Ile Islay festival.

name: Tormore 1988 28 Year Single Cask #0602 The Single Malts Of Scotland
description: A 1988 vintage single cask expression of Tormore matured for 28 years and bottled at 63.3% Abv. Chosen by Elixir Distillers it was bottled as part of their Single Malts Of Scotland label.
baxus_class_name: Tormore 1988 28 Year Single Cask #0602 The Single Malts Of Scotland

name: Bowmore Bicentenary
description: One of the legendary Bowmore bicentenary releases, bottled in 1979 as part of their 200th birthday celebrations. Created from whisky distilled in the 1950s and 1960s, with the oldest from 1950, and matured in some rather excellent sherry casks this is still considered to be one of the best Bowmores ever produced.

name: Glen Avon 25 Year 1980s Bottling
description: A 1980s era bottling of Highland single malt Scotch whisky bottled by Gordon & Macphail. The Glen Avon brand was a primarily exported brand from the Elgin based independent bottler and has been rumoured to contain Macallan, Glenfarclas or Glen Grant due to the extensive stocks Gordon & Macphail possessed from these distilleries. This 25 year old expression is bottled in a unique tall necked square bottle which has been imported to the Japanese market.

name: Tequila Casa Dragones - 2015
description: Each bottle of Casa Dragones is individually crafted by hand in Mexico City, using pure, lead-free crystal. Skilled artisans place the red-hot crystal in molds, one by one, until the shape takes hold. The crystal is then sculpted, bathed and polished by hand until it develops a lustrous shine, and finished with a traditional Mexican technique of glass engraving called Pepita, to carve out a small “seed-like” shape in the glass.

name: Macallan 1977 40 Year Old Single Cask #DL11835 Douglas Laing
description: This sensational 40 year old Speyside single malt was laid to rest at The Macallan distillery in May 1977 and bottled in June 2017 for Douglas Laing's Xtra Old Particular series together with new premium packaging; which includes a glorious glass stopper, timber presentation case and COA. Drawn from single refill hogshead number 11835 at a cask strength 45.2% ABV, this is one of just 240 limited bottles. This magnificent expression will always garner high attention, it's not very often a Macallan of this vintage and magnitude stays on the shelf for long!
baxus_class_name: Macallan 1977 40 Year Old Single Cask #DL11835 Douglas Laing

name: Glentauchers 1997 21 Year Old Single Cask #402 Whisky Exchange
description: A 1997 vintage single cask expression of the Speyside distillery Glentauchers. Matured for 21 years in a single barrel it was bottled at 54.5% Abv by The Whisky Exchange as part of their own independent bottling label. The Whisky Exchange is one of the UK’s premier whisky retail outlets as well as bottling its own line of unique casks of spirits from across the globe.
baxus_class_name: Glentauchers 1997 21 Year Old Single Cask #402 Whisky Exchange

name: Johnnie Walker Blue Label First Bottling
description: With its distinctive square bottle, its label angled precisely at 24° and the iconic Striding Man, Johnnie Walker is the world's best selling Scotch whisky. It was created in Kilmarnock in 1865 and is now available in almost every country in the world. Between 1906 & 1909 John Walker's grandsons introduced the colour names which the bottles still bear to this day. Johnnie Walker's most prestigious whisky. Probably THE most famous super-premium blend, made up of the finest old-aged malt and grain whiskies. This bottle is a Blue Label First Bottling.
baxus_class_name: Johnnie Walker Blue Label First Bottling

name: Ardbeg Dark Cove Committee Release
description: A 2015 special edition Ardbeg matured in bourbon and heavily charred dark sherry casks. This Feis Ile bottling was released exclusively for members of the Ardbeg committee and is bottled at 55% Abv.

name: Glenfarclas 1967 50 Year Single Butt #DL12786 Douglas Laing
description: One of the most respected and highly acclaimed independent bottlers of Scotch Whisky there is, Douglas Laing & Co has been established since 1948. This is one of only 248 bottles from cask #DL12786. This bottling was distilled in November 1967 and bottled in 2018. Filled at Glenfarclas, this liquid matured in a refill sherry butt for over 50 years.
baxus_class_name: Glenfarclas 1967 50 Year Single Butt #DL12786 Douglas Laing

name: Blanton's Black 1994 Bottling
description: Blanton's Black 1994 is a special release that was first introduced in that year, marking it as a significant entry in the Blanton's lineup, particularly for its appeal to the Japanese market. This bourbon is noted for its complex flavor profile, which includes buttery notes, char, and spice. Adding a tiny drop of water is recommended to enhance these flavors further.   The 1994 release is part of the Blanton's Black Edition, which is known for being aged for eight years, providing it with a rich and mature character. This edition was specifically bottled for the Japanese market and is characterized by a smooth texture and a powerful, complex palate. The finish of this whiskey is described as unique, rich, and long-lasting, making it a memorable experience for those who taste it.

name: Yamazaki 18 Year Mizunara Cask 2017 Release
description: A 2017 special release of Yamazaki 18 year old exclusively matured in rare Japanese oak Mizunara casks. This 2017 is presented in a heavy duty wooden box and is one of the earliest age stated offerings of this entirely Mizunara matured spirit.

name: Wild Turkey 8 Year 1987 Bottling 1 Liter
description: An older bottling of Wild Turkey's signature 8 year old age statement bottled at 101 proof in 1987. Older editions of Wild Turkey are particularly sought after amongst enthusiasts, notably for their remarkably different taste profile to modern Wild Turkey bottles. The distillery originally produced bourbon using cypress wood tanks but these were slowly phased out from 1984 until 1990. The other notable production change came in 2004 when the barrel entry proof was changed to 110, up from 107. The combination of these changes have resulted in serious demand for older vintage bottlings from the much loved distillery, with some believing 1990s era bottlings to be the distillery’s best ever.

name: Ardbeg Lord of the Isles 25 Year - 2006
description: Given the success and cult-like fan base that Ardbeg has recently enjoyed, it is almost impossible to imagine that the distillery was closed, on and off, for 15 years until it was purchased by Glenmorangie.Sitting on the southern coast line, the current distillery was founded in 1815, the original having been destroyed by excise men. The Ardbeg spirit still is fitted with a purifier which many believe accounts for its fruity, zesty character. The Lords of the Isles ruled the Western Isles of Scotland from the 12th to the 15th centuries. This is a spectacular 25 year old Ardbeg. Stunning packaging, which includes a collectable scroll. One of the more scarce Ardbeg bottles.
baxus_class_name: Ardbeg Lord of the Isles 25 Year - 2006

name: Ardbeg 1998 Single Cask #1190 Bottled 2008
description: A rare single cask expression of Ardbeg distilled in 1998 and bottled in 2008. Matured in a unique new toasted oak hogshead it was bottled at 54.7% Abv and made available to visitors to the distillery during the 2009 Feis Ile Islay festival.

name: Wild Turkey Diamond Anniversary - 2014
description: The Diamond Anniversary is a blend of 13 to 16 year old whiskies hand-selected by Jimmy Russell’s son, Eddie Russell, as tribute to Jimmy’s 60 years making whiskey. 36,000 bottles were released in the United States.

name: Aberlour 10 Year 1990s Bottling
description: A 1990s era bottling of Aberlour Highland single malt matured for 10 years and bottled at 43% Abv.

name: Maker's Mark Private Selection 2023 Bottling
description: The Maker's Mark Private Selection - 2023 is a unique and customizable bourbon experience that allows participants to create their own distinct flavor profile.
