This special edition is crafted by adding 10 custom wood finishing staves to fully matured Maker's Mark at cask strength, which is then aged in the distillery's limestone cellar for an additional nine weeks. The 2023 edition, known as the "Morton Family C&K Edition," features a rich amber liquid and is bottled at 54.35% ABV (108.7 proof). The label details the specific stave profile used, which includes a combination of Baked American Pure, Seared French Cuvee, Maker’s Mark 46, Roasted French Mendiant, and Toasted French Spice staves. This process results in over 1,001 possible combinations, ensuring each bottle offers a unique tasting experience.

name: Glenkinchie 1991 Distillers Edition Bottled 2005
description: A 1991 vintage expression of Glenkinchie double matured in bourbon and Amontillado sherry casks. It was bottled in 2005 at 43% Abv.

name: Gordon & MacPhail Port Ellen 40 Year - 2019
description: From Gordon & Macphail's Private Collection. From the now-closed Port Ellen Distilled in 1979, aged for 40 years in a Refill Sherry Puncheon, before being bottled in 2019, yielding just 407 bottles.

name: Inverarity 10 Year
description: From the producer: "The Inverarity is a Speyside malt, classified as one of the top ten Single Malts, and is aged in selected oak casks for a minimum of ten years. Our craft in ageing allows the real delicacy, smoothness and finesse of the whisky to emerge undiminished."

name: Gold Bond Rum Pre-1933 Bottling
description: An old expression of rum distilled by the Everett Distilling Co in Massachusetts before 1917. Bottled at George T Stagg distillery in Frankfort between 1929 and 1933 this medicinal rum was produced exclusively for medicinal purposes at 100 proof.

name: Glenmorangie Elegance 21 Year
description: An elegant decanter bottle and stopper designed in homage to the Glenmorangie stills (the tallest in Scotland) and filled with 21 year old Glenmorangie Highland single malt.

name: Lagavulin 18 Year Feis Ile 2016
description: A special edition release from Lagavaulin bottled to celebrate the annual Feis Ile Islay festival in 2016. This release was matured for 18 years in refill American oak hogsheads and European oak bodega sherry casks before being bottled at 49.5% Abv.

name: Old Charter 1917 Bottled In Bond 1929
description: A 1917 vintage expression of Old Charter bottled in 1929 using barrels from the Wright & Taylor distillery. Previously the Old Charter Distillery, the Wright & Taylor firm acquired Old Charter in 1896 and expanded the site. Prohibition closed the distillery in 1920 but Wright & Taylor moved all of their existing stocks to the A.PH. Stitzel distillery who were able to bottle these barrels throughout prohibition. Old Charter would then be sold in 1933 to the Bernheim distillery, which itself would be bought in 1937 by Schenley.

name: Early Times 150th Anniversary
description: The Early Times 150th Anniversary Edition is a special commemorative release celebrating the rich history of the Early Times brand, which was established in 1860 by John Henry "Jack" Beam. This edition, bottled in 2010, marks 150 years of the brand's legacy in the American whiskey industry. The bottle features a distinctive yellow and red label with the "Early Times" branding prominently displayed, and it proudly states "Old Style Sour Mash" to highlight its traditional production method. Distilled and bottled by the Early Times Distillery Co. in Louisville, Kentucky, this whiskey is bottled at 100 proof (50% alcohol by volume) and comes in a 375 milliliter size. The label also includes the phrase "The Whisky That Made Kentucky Whiskies Famous," underscoring its historical significance and enduring popularity.

name: Glengoyne 28 Year
description: Nose: Rich and complex notes of dark chocolate, marmalade and spice. Palate: Smooth and nutty with spiced cherries, cocoa and fresh red berries. Finish: Long and dry with a definite sherry influence, coconut and warm spices.

name: Glendronach 15 Year 1990s Bottling
description: This 15 year old Glendronach Highland Single Malt Scotch Whisky matured 100% in selected sherry casks, butts and puncheons and was bottled without chill filtration in the late 1990s or early 2000s.

name: Glenfarclas 43 Year Cognac Casks 2010 Release
description: A 43 year old expression of single malt from Glenfarclas matured in Cognac casks, an uncommon cask type for the Speyside distillery who typically use only sherry casks. Bottled in 2010 at 40.7% Abv this is a unique style of the family run Speyside giant.

name: Ladyburn 40 Year - 2014
description: Ladyburn was the shortest-lived distillery in Scotland and is therefore one of the rarest malt whiskies in the world.Built by William Grant & Sons on the same site as their Girvan grain distillery, Ladyburn produced malt whisky for less than ten years from 1966 to 1975 and was then demolished. This is one of the last remaining casks of Ladyburn. Filled in 1974 and aged in the warehouses at Girvan until its 40th birthday on the 25th of November in 2014.

name: Rosebank 1989 11 Year Single Cask #841 Blackadder
description: A 1989 vintage single cask from the once closed Lowland distillery Rosebank. Matured for 11 years cask #841 was bottled at 43% Abv by Blackadder.

name: Old Grand Dad 114 Mini
description: A rare bottle to find as a mini, the Old Grand Dad 114 Proof is by itself an elusive release to come across. Now owned by Jim Beam, the brand was originally associated with Basil Hayden.

name: Wild Turkey 8 Year 1993 Bottling
description: An older bottling of Wild Turkey's signature 8 year old age statement bottled at 101 proof in 1993. Older editions of Wild Turkey are particularly sought after amongst enthusiasts, notably for their remarkably different taste profile to modern Wild Turkey bottles. The distillery originally produced bourbon using cypress wood tanks but these were slowly phased out from 1984 until 1990. The other notable production change came in 2004 when the barrel entry proof was changed to 110, up from 107. The combination of these changes have resulted in serious demand for older vintage bottlings from the much loved distillery, with some believing 1990s era bottlings to be the distillery’s best ever.

name: Bruichladdich 1990 24 Year Single Butt #160 Signatory Vintage
description: A 1990 vintage single cask expression of Bruichladdich matured for 24 years in a refill sherry butt. Bottled in 2015 at 56.7% Abv by Signatory Vintage with 467 bottles produced.
baxus_class_name: Bruichladdich 1990 24 Year Single Butt #160 Signatory Vintage

name: Wild Turkey 8 Year 1989 Bottling
description: An older bottling of Wild Turkey's signature 8 year old age statement bottled at 101 proof in 1989. Older editions of Wild Turkey are particularly sought after amongst enthusiasts, notably for their remarkably different taste profile to modern Wild Turkey bottles. The distillery originally produced bourbon using cypress wood tanks but these were slowly phased out from 1984 until 1990. The other notable production change came in 2004 when the barrel entry proof was changed to 110, up from 107. The combination of these changes have resulted in serious demand for older vintage bottlings from the much loved distillery, with some believing 1990s era bottlings to be the distillery’s best ever.

name: Lowland 1977 Single Cask #V1 Bottled 1991 Society Of Scotch Malt Connoisseurs
description: A 1977 vintage single cask expression of Lowland single malt whisky. Bottled at 58% Abv in October 1991 exclusively for the Society Of Scotch Malt Connoisseurs in the US. Single malt Lowland producers are a rarity today but in 1977 options include Rosebank, Auchentoshan, St Magdalene, Glenkinchie and Bladnoch.
baxus_class_name: Lowland 1977 Single Cask #V1 Bottled 1991 Society Of Scotch Malt Connoisseurs

name: Auchroisk 1976 12 Year
description: A 1976 vintage of the Speyside distillery Auchroisk matured for 12 years and bottled at 43% as part of the Singleton label.

name: Brown-Forman Dry White Frost 8/80
description: A unique dry white whiskey from Brown-Forman, the "8/80" label refers to the 8 years aged in oak barrels before being filtered to lose most of its color and flavor, and the proof accompanying this rather eccentric offering. Though an interesting experiment, this was not a popular whiskey.

name: Lagavulin 1976 37 Year Cask Strength
description: The oldest official bottling of Lagavulin ever released. This rare, natural cask strength gem of limited release was distilled back in 1976 before being matured in refill American Oak and European Oak casks. A mucky whisky with ash and smoke that couldn't be tamed even after 37 years! Tremendous stuff, only 1,868 highly coveted bottles have been released.

name: Wild Turkey 12 Year Beyond Duplication 1989 Bottling
description: First released in 1980, the 12 year old Beyond Duplication edition from Wild Turkey was bottled at their signature 101 proof. Older editions of Wild Turkey are particularly sought after amongst enthusiasts, notably for their remarkably different taste profile to modern Wild Turkey bottles. The distillery originally produced bourbon using cypress wood tanks but these were slowly phased out from 1984 until 1990. The other notable production change came in 2004 when the barrel entry proof was changed to 110, up from 107. The combination of these changes have resulted in serious demand for older vintage bottlings from the much loved distillery, with some believing 1990s era bottlings to be the distillery’s best ever.
baxus_class_name: Wild Turkey 12 Year Beyond Duplication 1989 Bottling

name: Blue Grass Whisky 1916 Bottled 1931
description: A 1916 distilled expression of whisky bottled in 1931 by American Medicinal Spirits Co from barrels sourced from the E.J. Curley distillery. Curley built a hugely positive reputation in the late 1800s for his high quality whiskies produced at the Blue Grass distillery, later building the Boone's Knoll distillery at Camp Nelson. Blue Grass was a small distillery with quite a limited output, resulting in Curley struggling to grow his business past the two distilleries he had built. In 1889 his horses and wagons were impounded for not paying his taxes, and so he decided to sell up to The Whiskey Trust. The Trust would continue operating the distilleries until prohibition closed them, but continued to sell the bonded barrels leftover from production throughout the prohibition period.

name: Very Very Old Fitzgerald 1957 15 Year Bottled In Bond
description: A crazy old bottling from Stitzel-Weller distilled in 1957 and matured for a huge 15 years! Bottled in bond in 1972 this exceptionally mature bourbon was produced from the original higher wheat and jug yeast recipe pioneered by William Larue Weller and was distilled under the supervision of Pappy Van Winkle himself.
baxus_class_name: Very Very Old Fitzgerald 1957 15 Year Bottled In Bond

name: Old Fitzgerald 1956 10 Year Bottled In Bond
description: A 1956 vintage expression of Old Fitzgerald produced by Pappy Van Winkle himself at the Stitzel-Weller distillery. This Very Old bourbon was matured for 10 years and bottled in bond at 50% Abv in 1966.
baxus_class_name: Old Fitzgerald 1956 10 Year Bottled In Bond

name: Old Fitzgerald 1952 10 Year Bottled In Bond
description: A 1952 vintage expression of Old Fitzgerald produced by Pappy Van Winkle himself at the Stitzel-Weller distillery. This Very Old bourbon was matured for 10 years and bottled in bond at 50% Abv in 1962.
baxus_class_name: Old Fitzgerald 1952 10 Year Bottled In Bond

name: Hazelburn 2006 11 Year Sherry Hogshead Cage Sample
description: A distillery exclusive cask sample of Hazelburn distilled in 2006 and matured for 11 years in a sherry hogshead. Duty paid samples are commonly referred to as cage samples as they are sold exclusively at the distillery shop from a locked cage. These expressions are cask progress samples that are hand selected by the distillery manager and less than two dozen bottles are usually produced in each cage bottling.
baxus_class_name: Hazelburn 2006 11 Year Sherry Hogshead Cage Sample

name: Orkney 14 Year Single Cask #OMH2006/2 Bottled 2006 Blackadder
description: A 14 year old expression of single malt sourced from an undisclosed Orkney distillery. Bottled in 2006 at 43% Abv by Blackadder as part of their Orcadian label.
baxus_class_name: Orkney 14 Year Single Cask #OMH2006/2 Bottled 2006 Blackadder

name: Glenmorangie 1981 28 Year Pride
description: A 1981 vintage special edition from Glenmorangie featuring their signature Highland single malt whisky matured for 28 years! This edition was finished in Sauternes casks from the fabled vineyard of Chateau d'Yquem. It was bottled in 2010 at a cask strength of 56.7% ABV. Just 1000 bottles were produced in this 1 litre crystal decanter format.

name: Speyside Distillery 10 Year Early 2000s Bottling
description: Now discontinued, this is a rare bottle from The Speyside distilley. Though many bottles carry the word "Speyside," in general it describes the region in which the whisky was produced. In this case, the bottle was produced by the Speyside Distillery, and was likely bottled in the early 2000s.

name: A.PH. Stitzel Old Mock 1916 18 Year Old
description: Old Mock Whiskey, a storied  whiskey from the pre-Prohibition era, is a testament to the resilience and craftsmanship of early 20th-century American distillers. Bottled in 1933 by A. Ph. Stitzel Inc., this whiskey was distilled in 1916 and aged for 18 summers, a phrase synonymous with the Stitzel-Weller legacy. The label proudly states "Made in Old Kentucky," reflecting its heritage and origin. During Prohibition, select distilleries, including the Davies County Distillery from which this whiskey originated, were allowed to bottle existing stocks for medicinal purposes. A. Ph. Stitzel Inc. acquired these stocks and continued the tradition under the Old Mock brand, which later merged with Julian 'Pappy' Van Winkle's W.L. Weller company to form the legendary Stitzel-Weller Distillery. The green and red label, adorned with intricate designs and historic references, encapsulates a rich history and a dedication to quality that has endured through the ages.
baxus_class_name: A.PH. Stitzel Old Mock 1916 18 Year Old

name: Glengoyne 18 Year
description:
Nestled amidst the serene landscapes of Dumgoyne Hill in the Southern Highlands, Glengoyne Distillery has meticulously crafted this remarkable whisky, aging it to perfection for a minimum of 18 years.

Radiating a rich amber hue, Glengoyne 18 Year entices the senses with its captivating aroma, offering a harmonious blend of sweet toffee, ripe fruits, and subtle hints of oak. As each drop cascades into the glass, it unveils a journey of depth and complexity that beckons to be explored.

On the palate, Glengoyne 18 Year unfolds with elegance and grace, delivering a symphony of flavors that dance across the taste buds. Notes of creamy vanilla, luscious caramel, and decadent dark chocolate intertwine seamlessly, balanced by gentle spices and a whisper of sherry sweetness, culminating in a luxuriously smooth finish that lingers long after each sip.

Crafted with the utmost care and attention to detail, Glengoyne 18 Year embodies the essence of tradition and heritage that defines Scottish whisky-making. Whether enjoyed neat, on the rocks, or as the foundation of a classic cocktail, it offers an unparalleled whisky experience that is sure to captivate aficionados and novices alike.

name: Bruichladdich Lochindaal 10 Year 1990s Bottling
description: A 10 year old expression of unpeated Bruichladdich bottled in the 1990s. Although the name Lochindaal has since been used by the modern Bruichladdich distillery for a medium peated spirit, this 1990s era bottling was produced whilst the distillery did not use peat.

name: Hill & Hill 1914 9 Year
description: A 1914 vintage expression of whiskey matured for 9 years and bottled in bond in 1923. This spirit was sourced from the Silas Rosenfeld distillery in Owensboro, Kentucky. As the distillery closed at the start of prohibition in 1920 they were forced to sell their barrels, with Otto Wathen of The Whiskey Trust, later The American Medicinal Spirits Co, acquiring all of the Rosenfeld distillery stocks. AMS would release this spirit under the Hill & Hill brand, a nod to the original operators of the Silas Rosenfeld distillery Perkins and Alexander Hill. The brand would later be used for spirit produced by National Distillers in the later 20th century.

name: Old Fitzgerald 1951 10 Year Bottled In Bond
description: A 1951 vintage expression of Old Fitzgerald produced by Pappy Van Winkle himself at the Stitzel-Weller distillery. This Very Old bourbon was matured for 10 years and bottled in bond at 50% Abv in 1961.
baxus_class_name: Old Fitzgerald 1951 10 Year Bottled In Bond

name: Suntory Whisky 80th Anniversary - 1979
description: Suntory is the oldest whisky making company in Japan. Its origins stretch back to a small shop, started in 1899 by Torii Shinjiro, which specialized in selling imported wines. Today, it is the country’s largest and most recognizable producer of quality whisky. This particular Suntory whisky was specially selected from malt and grain whiskies. It is for Keizo Saji’s 80th Memorial anniversary in 1979.

name: Bruichladdich PC7 7 Year - 2008
description: The PC7, named the Sin Doigh Ileach (translated: "it's the Islay way"), celebrates the people of Islay who contributed to the reopening of Bruichladdich. The whisky is seven years old, non-chill filtered, and bottled at the casks' strength of 61% ABV. 100% malted barley from a single distillery. Dried with peat.

name: Hard Truth High Road Rye Sweet Mash 3 Year
description: High Road features a deep copper appearance, with an aroma of apricot jam, honey, baking spice and graham cracker. Its taste offers up rich vanilla, maple, custard, and spices that coat the tongue. Its finish is bold with a lingering caramel that fades to honey, coffee and nougat.
baxus_class_name: Hard Truth High Road Rye Sweet Mash 3 Year

name: Bowmore 1969 Sherry Casks
description: A 1969 vintage expression of Bowmore matured in selected sherry casks and bottled at 43% Abv in the late 1980s.
series: Matured in Specially Selected Sherry Casks

name: Jefferson’s 1991 18 Year Batch 31 Presidential Select
description: A 1991 vintage expression of Stitzel-Weller bourbon matured for 18 years. It was bottled in 2010 by Jefferson's as part of their Presidential Select series at 47% Abv.

name: Macallan 40 Year Sherry Oak 2017 Release
description: A huge age statement from the Macallan distillery, this is a 40 year old single malt whisky from the Speyside giant. Matured in sherry oak casks from Jerez, this 2017 release is bottled at 44% Abv with just 465 bottles produced.

name: Rare Old Fitzgerald 1940 Bottled In Bond 1950
description: A unique personalised label of Old Fitzgerald produced in the fall of 1940 at the Stitzel-Weller distillery. Bottled in the fall of 1950 and therefore matured for 10 years, this rare label was chosen exclusively for Wilbur C. Fisher.
baxus_class_name: Rare Old Fitzgerald 1940 Bottled In Bond 1950

name: Bardstown Steve Nallys Legacy Release 50th Anniversary Straight Bourbon Whiskey
description: This year marks the 50th year of Steve Nally’s storied career in the bourbon industry. Steve is one of the few remaining Bourbon Hall of Fame Master Distillers currently working in this capacity, and along with his wife Donne, are the only living husband and wife couple in the Bourbon Hall of Fame.
baxus_class_name: Bardstown Steve Nallys Legacy Release 50th Anniversary Straight Bourbon Whiskey

name: Tomintoul 1976 36 Year
description: The 2013 bottling of Tomintoul's stupendous 1976 vintage single malt Scotch whisky, distilled two years after the number of stills at Tomintoul doubled, from two to four. The 2007 bottling of the 1976 vintage have been very well met, receiving a score of 93.5 in Jim Murray's Whisky Bible and a Gold medal at the International Spirits Challenge 2008.

name: Benromach 35 Year Old 2019 Bottling
description: A limited release from Benromach distillery, this 35-year-old whisky was distilled in the early 1980s and aged in first-fill sherry casks. Released in two tranches during 2016, this has notes of honey, chocolate, menthol and clove. The whisky was bottled from some of the few remaining casks from the distillery's original operation, prior to its shuttering in 1983. The distillery was purchased by Gordon & MacPhail and began producing whisky again in 1998.

name: Amrut 2015 Single Cask #708 Bottled 2020 For Norfolk
description: A 2015 vintage single cask expression of single malt whisky from Amrut in India. This cask was matured in an ex-rye barrel and was bottled in 2020 at 60% Abv exclusively for Norfolk Wine & Spirits.
baxus_class_name: Amrut 2015 Single Cask #708 Bottled 2020 For Norfolk

name: Ardbeg Blaaack 20th Anniversary
description: A special edition release from Ardbeg to celebrate 20 years since the Ardbeg committee began. This sheep themed bottling contains Ardbeg spirit finished in Pinot Noir wine casks sourced from the also sheep heavy country New Zealand. Both a 50.7% Abv and a 46% Abv versions were released, with the higher proof bottling exclusively for committee members and the 46% offering seeing global release.

name: Mortlach 1994 21 Year Single Hogshead Cadenhead's
description: A fantastic example of a whisky originally laid down in 1994 before being bottled in 2016 by Cadenhead’s. This single cask release offers the opportunity to experience a 21-year-old whisky, distilled at Mortlach Distillery. You know this whisky is special when it is adorned with gold labelling that Cadenhead’s only reserve for their most cherished releases.

name: Remi Martin Black Pearl - 2014
description: In 2007, as an homage to these very beginnings of LOUIS XIII, Black Pearl was created. It is the stunning result of a close collaboration with crystal-maker Baccarat, an unusual tête-à-tête between two sensibilities and two temporalities. The edition is an exclusive, individually numbered series produced from a century-old tierçon.

name: Gold Seal 1917 Bottled 1930
description: A 1917 vintage expression of whiskey from the Mellwood distillery bottled in bond in 1930 before prohibition was repealed. Mellwood was acquired by The Whiskey Trust in 1899, a firm that would later become the American Medicinal Spirits Co. Mellwood closed in 1918 but was one of the few old sites to reopen post prohibition, operating as General Distilling Company for National Distillers before once again closing in the 60s, this time for good.

name: Royal Lochnagar 12 Year 1990s Bottling
description: A 1990s era bottling of 12 year old Royal Lochnagar bottled at 40% Abv. The smallest member of Diageo's collection of distilleries, Royal Lochnagar nevertheless produces some of the most complex and impressive Single Malts in the Highland region.

name: Amrut 2014 Single Cask #5149 Bottled 2020 For Norfolk
description: A 2014 vintage single cask expression of Indian single malt whisky from Amrut. Matured in a Caroni rum cask it was bottled in 2020 exclusively for Norfolk Whisky Group at 60% Abv.
baxus_class_name: Amrut 2014 Single Cask #5149 Bottled 2020 For Norfolk

name: Bardstown Fusion #8
description: According to Bardstown Bourbon Company, “The Fusion Series celebrates the blending of newer and older bourbons to create something unique. The younger spirits are 100% our own product mellowed with hand- selected, supremely aged bourbon that beautifully complements our specific recipes. As we grow, our bourbon ages — a difference you can taste with each Fusion release.”

name: Yamazaki 55 Year
description:
The oldest whisky produced to date by Suntory, the Yamazaki 55 year old represents the absolute pinnacle of rare whisky.

Crafted from two unique styles of Yamazaki, one distilled in 1960 and matured in Mizunara casks as well as a 1964 vintage matured in white oak casks, it was delicately blended and bottled in 2020.

The bottle itself is a work of art, encased in a crystal bottle adorned with gold dust and lacquer, wrapped in handmade washi paper, and presented in a bespoke Mizunara wood box.

Yamazaki was the first whisky distillery in Japan, founded in 1924 by Shinjiro Torri’s firm Kotobukiya under the helm of Masataka Taketsuru, who had just returned from Scotland after a three year trip learning how to make whisky. Torri signed Taketsuru to a 10 year contract and tasked him with production of a Japanese made whisky. It would take till 1929 before Suntory white label would be released, ultimately failing due to its peated style. The pair would split at the end of Taketsuru’s contract, but Yamazaki would ultimately prosper once the unpeated Kakubin was released. 

For much of the 20th century Japanese whisky was relegated to cheap blended products, with Yamazaki making grain and malt whisky for its blends as well as likely using cheap imported Scotch whisky. But in 1984 the firm pivoted, and began releasing Yamazaki as a pure malt whisky. This was risky as the wider whisky market was still almost entirely drinking blended whiskies, but Suntory wanted to differentiate. They launched Hibiki in 1989 to satisfy the blended market and even launched an 18 year old and 25 year old Yamazaki malt whisky as the 1990s ticked along.

As the turn of the millennium crept around Japanese whisky was winning more and more awards. And by the 2010s demand for the spirit had pivoted and age stated expressions of Japanese whisky were rapidly being discontinued. Yamazaki especially suffered and the 18 has become a super premium offering in the last decade. Old stocks of this esteemed distillery are few and far between, and those that do survive are now amongst the most sought after bottles in the world.

The use of Mizunara oak came out of necessity as imported American white oak became difficult to acquire post WWII. The Japanese whisky makers turned to local oak to try and satisfy their need for casks. Mizunara is notoriously difficult to work with, often being used instead for furniture. These endemic Japanese trees need 200 years on average to meet requirement for cask making and so are both expensive and highly allocated. Despite this difficulty the Japanese makers at Suntory found the oak to impart a wholly unique flavour, often drawing parallels to notes of coconut and sandalwood. Suntory continued the use of these precious oak casks and they have been a core component of what makes Yamazaki single malt so special.

name: Tullibardine 1992 Vintage Edition Bottled 2006
description: A 1992 vintage expression of Tullibardine bottled at 46% Abb in 2006 as part of their vintage edition label.

name: Glenugie 1978 19 Year Single Cask #2407 Signatory Vintage
description: A 1978 vintage single cask expression of the closed distillery Glenugie. Matured for 19 years it was bottled in 1997 at 57.4% Abv by Signatory Vintage as part of their silent stills collection. Glenugie spent much of its life producing malt whisky for blended Scotch whiskies and was sadly closed in 1983 amid the large-scale downturn of the Scotch whisky industry.
baxus_class_name: Glenugie 1978 19 Year Single Cask #2407 Signatory Vintage

name: Fettercairn Rare 40 year - 2018
description: This 40 year old single malt was distilled at Fettercairn in the Scottish Highlands in December 1977. Aged in white oak ex-bourbon barrels and finished in Apostoles sherry casks, only 818 bottles of this limited edition have been produced, each one at a strength of 48.9% abv.

name: Miltonduff 10 Year Single Firkin Cask For Cadenhead's Edinburgh Shop
description:
Situated in Speyside, Miltonduff distillery boasts a storied history, renowned as a cornerstone malt in the illustrious Ballantine's blends. Acquired by Hiram Walker in the 1930s, Miltonduff witnessed the installation of Lomond stills, which briefly birthed the coveted Mosstowie single malts in 1964 before their removal in 1981. Transitioning through Allied Distillers' ownership, the distillery now rests under the stewardship of Pernod-Ricard. Despite its steadfast contribution to Ballantine's blends, Miltonduff's single malt expressions have earned acclaim, both from its proprietors and independent bottlers.

This particular whisky emerges from a harmonious vatting of three bourbon hogsheads, subsequently transferred to nine 50-liter sherry firkins after nearly a decade of maturation. These casks were then carefully nestled in a dunnage warehouse for an additional six months, allowing the whisky to develop its distinctive character.

Established in 1842 by George Duncan, Wm. Cadenhead stands as Scotland's oldest independent bottler. With William Cadenhead assuming leadership post-1958, the company burgeoned into the whisky bottling realm after 1904 under Robert Duthie's guidance. Since its acquisition by J&A Mitchell in 1972, Wm. Cadenhead has become a revered name in whisky circles. While the Authentic Collection remains its flagship brand, the company's portfolio has expanded to include labels such as this one, a testament to its enduring commitment to quality and tradition.
baxus_class_name: Miltonduff 10 Year Single Firkin Cask For Cadenhead's Edinburgh Shop

name: Bourbon Supreme Mini
description: Now owned by Luxco, the Bourbon Supreme brand was originally produced by the American Distilling Company out of Illinois. A rare sight, bottles from the brand claim to be the "world's only charcoal distilled whiskey."

name: Fettercairn 1973 43 Year Port Finish
description: Matured in American white oak ex-bourbon barrels and finished in tawny port pipes, this incredible Highland single malt was distilled on 8th May 1973. Bottled aged 46 years old at a strength of 42.5% abv, only 55 bottles have been produced globally.

name: Sam Thompson 1917 11 Year Pure Rye
description: A 1917 vintage bottling of Sam Thompson pure rye whiskey bottled during prohibition for medical use only. This was matured for 11 years and bottled in 1928. The distillery was located on the banks of the Monongahela river in West Brownsville, PA. Sam Thompson was a native of Brownsville, PA and acquired the plant in 1844. He produced Sam Thompson Monongahela Rye Whiskey there until Prohibition. The brand continued to be sold for medicinal purposes until Repeal and later was acquired and produced elsewhere by Schenley.

name: Blanton's Single Barrel 1993 Bottling
description: Blanton’s Original was the first bourbon to be bottled from a single barrel back in 1984, revolutionising American whiskey and bringing it back to its former glory. Every batch is unique and the bottling strength of 46.5% helps maintain the authentic character of each barrel.

name: Blanton's Single Barrel 375ml 2023 Bottling
description:
Blanton's Single Barrel Bourbon is a pioneering expression in the world of American whiskey, renowned for being the first commercially available single barrel bourbon. Introduced in 1984 by Elmer T. Lee at Buffalo Trace Distillery, Blanton's has become a benchmark for quality and craftsmanship in the bourbon industry.

Each bottle of Blanton's is drawn from a single barrel, allowing for unique flavor profiles that can vary from one barrel to another. This meticulous process ensures that every release offers a distinct character while maintaining the brand's signature smoothness and complexity. The bourbon is typically aged for six to eight years in charred American oak barrels, which contributes to its rich flavor.

Blanton's is easily recognizable thanks to its iconic bottle design, featuring a distinctive horse and jockey topper that has become a symbol of the brand. The bourbon is available in several variations, including the original 93-proof version, the higher-proof Blanton’s Gold, and the special Reserve edition.

Over the years, Blanton's has garnered a devoted following among whiskey enthusiasts and collectors, often commanding high prices on the secondary market due to its limited availability and consistent quality. Its reputation as a classic bourbon makes it a staple in bars and homes alike, appealing to both seasoned connoisseurs and those new to the world of bourbon.

name: Glen Garioch 8 Year 1980s Bottling
description: A 1980s era bottling of Glen Garioch matured for 8 years and bottled at 43% Abv. This era of Glen Garioch was under the ownership of Morrison Bowmore, the proprietors of the Bowmore distillery who also held the Auchentoshan distillery.

name: Matsui The Tottori 21 Year
description: Made in honor of the art of Japanese whiskey production and to the Tottori province, home of the distillery since 1910, this is a very limited artisan production that owes its high quality to clean and fresh water from Tottori's natural sources.

name: Glenlivet 2006 13 Year Single Butt #901005 For Norfolk Signatory Vintage
description: A 2006 vintage single cask expression of Glenlivet matured for 13 years in a 1st fill sherry butt. It was bottled at a cask strength of 60.8% Abv by Signatory Vintage exclusively for Norfolk Whisky Group.
baxus_class_name: Glenlivet 2006 13 Year Single Butt #901005 For Norfolk Signatory Vintage

name: Jefferson's Presidential Select 21 Year
description: Blended from just 15 casks of Bourbon aged 21 to 24 years, Jefferson's 21 Year Old bourbon pays homage to one of America's most important founding fathers, Thomas Jefferson. A distiller in his own right, Jefferson routinely turned excess grains from his farm into drinkable spirits.

name: Jack Daniel’s High Angel's Share Tennessee Tasters
description: A Tennessee exclusive series, this selection from Jack Daniel's features their signature whiskies in experimental form. This is a high angel's share offering which takes barrels from the high portions of the rickhouse where they experienced lots of evaporation.
baxus_class_name: Jack Daniel’s High Angel's Share Tennessee Tasters

name: Found North Hell Diver First Flight
baxus_class_name: Found North Hell Diver First Flight

name: Milagro Tequila Select Barrel
description: Select Barrel Reserve Silver is an estate-grown, 100% blue agave tequila. Unlike most silver tequilas, it is then mellowed in both American and French oak barrels for 30 days, resulting in a fine sipping tequila that is perfectly balanced and full-bodied.

name: Blanton's Gold 2021 Bottling
description: A superb single barrel bourbon. Blanton's Gold is distilled from a mashbill of corn, rye and malted barley. Each bottle is hand filled, sealed, labelled and individually numbered.

name: Pappy Van Winkle 23 Year Family Reserve 2007 Bottling
description: A 2007 bottling of Pappy Van Winkle 23 year old bourbon. This era of Pappy was crafted from barrels produced at the Stitzel-Weller distillery, the legendary closed distillery that produced Old Fitzgerald. This 2007 era release was bottled at Buffalo Trace after Julian Van Winkle moved his operations to there.
baxus_class_name: Pappy Van Winkle 23 Year Family Reserve 2007 Bottling

name: Blanton's Single Barrel Special Reserve - 2022
description: Blanton's Single Barrel Special Reserve, often referred to as the "Green Label," is a distinguished bourbon crafted for connoisseurs who appreciate a smoother, more approachable whiskey. This particular bottle, dumped on 8-7-22 from Barrel No. 28 and stored in Warehouse H on Rick No. 28, is hand-selected, filtered, and bottled by hand at 80 proof. The bottle's design is iconic, featuring a round body and a metal stopper adorned with a horse and jockey figurine. The label details the meticulous craftsmanship and heritage behind this bourbon, making it a prized addition to any collection. Blanton's Green Label offers a light, airy palate with notes of caramel, vanilla, and subtle spices, making it an ideal choice for those new to single barrel bourbons or those seeking a refined, easy-sipping experience.

name: Auchentoshan 10 Year 1980s Bottling
description: A 1980s era bottling of Auchentoshan, the triple distilled Lowland malt whisky. This 10 year old was bottled at 43% Abv.

name: Glenury Royal 1953 50 Year Cask Strength
description: A huge vintage expression of the demolished Scottish distillery Glenury Royal. Distilled just post WWII in 1953, this cask strength single malt was matured for an incredible 50 years. Glenury Royal spent much of its life providing malt whisky for blended Scotch whiskies such as the King William blend, but also saw small release as a malt whisky in the 1980s. The distillery was demolished in 1983 amid the Scotch whisky downturn of the era, and the site was turned into flats a decade later.

name: Blanton's Single Barrel 1990 Bottling
description: Blanton’s Original was the first bourbon to be bottled from a single barrel back in 1984, revolutionising American whiskey and bringing it back to its former glory. Every batch is unique and the bottling strength of 46.5% helps maintain the authentic character of each barrel.

name: Barton's QT Mini
description: A very elusive brand, not much is known about Barton's "QT" line. The name comes from the slogan "quiet taste," which the label proudly ascribes to the 86 proof whiskey, but other than that very little information is voulnteered.

name: Glendronach 15 Year 2021 Bottling
description: A signature core release from Glendronach matured 15 years in Oloroso & PX sherry casks before being bottled at 46% Abv.

name: E.H. Taylor, Jr. Warehouse C Tornado Surviving
description: This ten-year-old Bottled in Bond bourbon was aged in Warehouse C, built by Col. Taylor in 1885, and the barrel warehouse he was most proud of – the final piece in his “model distillery.”  Like some of the previous releases, this one-time-only bottling of E.H. Taylor, Jr Warehouse C Bourbon is very limited.
baxus_class_name: E.H. Taylor, Jr. Warehouse C Tornado Surviving

name: Macallan 1974 25 Year Anniversary Malt
description: A 1974 vintage expression of Macallan matured for 25 years in sherry oak casks. Bottled in 1999 as part of their anniversary malt series, this line of vintage dated bottles was marketed as a bottle to be gifted or consumed to celebrate an anniversary. Early 2000s editions dropped their vintage but releases such as this 1974 are highly sought after for the exceptional quality of sherry matured spirit.

name: Very Olde St. Nick 25 Year - 2000
description: Originally created to appeal to the Japanese export market, Very Olde St. Nick is a whiskey label that has since gained acclaim throughout the larger market.

name: Douglas of Drumlanrig 33 Year - 2010
description: Each of the bottlings in this initial release of the Douglas of Drumlanrig range is from a specially selected single cask and is non chill-filtered with an alcoholic strength of 46% ABV. The selection process has an emphasis on whiskies from cult, boutique or closed distilleries.

name: Stagg JR Single Barrel #001 For Warehouse Liquors
description: A single barrel expression of Buffalo Trace’s low rye mashbill Stagg JR. This cask was chosen by Warehouse Liquors and was bottled at 67.2% Abv.
baxus_class_name: Stagg JR Single Barrel #001 For Warehouse Liquors

name: Blanton's Single Barrel 1994 Bottling
description: Blanton’s Original was the first bourbon to be bottled from a single barrel back in 1984, revolutionising American whiskey and bringing it back to its former glory. Every batch is unique and the bottling strength of 46.5% helps maintain the authentic character of each barrel.

name: Bunnahabhain 12 Year 1990s Bottling
description: A pre-2003 era bottling of Bunnahabhain matured for 12 years and bottled at 43% whilst still under the ownership of Highland Distillers.

name: Blanton's Single Barrel 1992 Bottling
description:
Bottled at 46.5% ABV, the Blanton's Single Barrel from 1992 is a cherished expression from the Blanton's distillery, embodying the excellence of single barrel bourbon. This vintage edition has become a collector's item over the years, retaining a rich legacy within the bourbon community.

Tasting Experience: Blanton's Single Barrel - 1992 offers a voyage through a spectrum of flavors, truly representing the quintessence of Blanton’s craftsmanship.

Nose: The olfactory introduction brings forth a delightful blend of aromas, with a notable presence of sweet and fruity notes, paired with a subtle spice undertone.

Palate: As the journey continues, the palate is graced with a harmonious blend of sweet and spicy flavors. The spicy rye undertones beautifully complement the sweetness, leading to a well-rounded taste profile.

Finish: The narrative comes to a warm and satisfying conclusion, as the flavors gently fade, leaving a memorable impression that beckons for another sip.

The Blanton's Single Barrel - 1992 is not just a bourbon; it's a nostalgic journey back to a time of bourbon-making mastery, making it a coveted piece for enthusiasts and collectors.

name: Redbreast Tawny Port Cask Edition - 2023
description: Starts straight away with clear notes of plum cake, cherries and blueberries and comes with a good portion of pot still spices right from the start in the form of chervil, tarragon and allspice. After some time in the glass, the aromas become more subtle and what was initially noticeable next to each other is now firmly interwoven.

name: Ardbeg 1967 30 Year Old Single Butt #1140 Signatory Vintage
description: This Islay malt was distilled on the 22nd March 1967 and matured in sherry butt #1140 for 30 years, before being bottled by Signatory Vintage on the 15th December 1997. This is one of just 536 limited bottlings.
baxus_class_name: Ardbeg 1967 30 Year Old Single Butt #1140 Signatory Vintage

name: Macallan Rare Cask No. 2 - 2019
description: Rare Cask combines knowledge, skill, passion, commitment and creativity to create a remarkable whisky worthy of its name. Crafted to showcase complexity and depth, Rare Cask is drawn from the broadest spectrum of casks used in maturation on The Macallan Estate.

name: Macallan 1966 18 Year Sherry Oak
description: The Macallan 18 Years Old, a perfectly balanced single malt whisky matured for 18 years in both American and European sherry seasoned oak casks. Sherry seasoned American oak adds delicate vanilla to the subtle spice of European oak, delivering a whisky with a sweeter, warmer taste and character.

name: Blanton's Single Barrel 1989 Bottling
description: Blanton’s Original was the first bourbon to be bottled from a single barrel back in 1984, revolutionising American whiskey and bringing it back to its former glory. Every batch is unique and the bottling strength of 46.5% helps maintain the authentic character of each barrel.

name: Stagg Single Barrel For Warehouse Liquors
description: A single barrel expression of Buffalo Trace’s low rye mashbill Stagg JR. This cask was chosen by Warehouse Liquors and was bottled at 65.4% Abv.
baxus_class_name: Stagg Single Barrel For Warehouse Liquors

name: Very Olde St. Nick 18 Year
description: Originally created to appeal to the Japanese export market, Very Olde St. Nick is a whiskey label that has since gained acclaim throughout the larger market.

name: Macallan 1987 18 Year Sherry Oak
description: The Macallan 18 Years Old, a perfectly balanced single malt whisky matured for 18 years in both American and European sherry seasoned oak casks. Sherry seasoned American oak adds delicate vanilla to the subtle spice of European oak, delivering a whisky with a sweeter, warmer taste and character.

name: Bruichladdich Infinity
description: A strong Islay whisky matured in a sherry cask, this unique whisky from Bruichladdich is typical of the distillery's willingness to stand out.

name: Mortlach 1969 Single Butt #92001201 Bottled 2019 Gordon & Macphail
description: A stunning 1969 vintage single cask expression of Mortlach matured for 50 years in a 1st fill sherry butt! Filled into cask on the 7h of October 1969 this sherry hogshead was then bottled at 50.7% Abv on the 10th of October 2019 by Gordon & Macphail. This 1969 vintage hails from a transitionary period at Mortlach, as they experienced a large refurbishment in 1964 and then closed their malting floors in 1968. Hence this cask will be crafted from purchased malted barley but distilled using the most up to date equipment. This cask is a part of Gordon & Macphail's Private Collection, a label that features only the highest of age statement and quality casks available in the deep warehouses of the Elgin based retailer.
baxus_class_name: Mortlach 1969 Single Butt #92001201 Bottled 2019 Gordon & Macphail

name: Kilchoman Machir Bay - 2014
description: Machir Bay is Kilchoman's core expression, built from the same malt specifications as Ardbeg and bought in from Port Ellen Maltings on Islay. It's matured in a combination of bourbon and sherry casks, and carries no age statement.

name: Macallan 1986 18 Year Sherry Oak
description: The Macallan 18 Years Old, a perfectly balanced single malt whisky matured for 18 years in both American and European sherry seasoned oak casks. Sherry seasoned American oak adds delicate vanilla to the subtle spice of European oak, delivering a whisky with a sweeter, warmer taste and character.

name: Perrier-Jouet Belle Epoque 2013
description: From the producer: "Perrier-Jouët Belle Époque is a rare and elegant champagne, which embodies the excellence of the know-how of the House and its vineyard."

name: Dallas Dhu 1969 Single Hogshead #1656 Bottled 2019 Gordon & Macphail
description: A stunning 1969 vintage single cask expression of the closed distillery Dallas Dhu matured for 50 years in a refill sherry hogshead! Bottled at 43.1% Abv in June 2019, this cask is a part of Gordon & Macphail's Private Collection, a label that features only the highest of age statement and quality casks available in the deep warehouses of the Elgin based retailer. Dallas Dhu was closed in 1983 amid the downturn of the Scotch whisky industry and mature stocks this old are few and far between, so a 50 year old expression from the Speyside distillery is fantastic!
baxus_class_name: Dallas Dhu 1969 Single Hogshead #1656 Bottled 2019 Gordon & Macphail

name: William Larue Weller 10 Year
description: In the early 1990s, United Distillers & Vintners, the company that would later become Diageo, released The Bourbon Heritage Collection. The Heritage Collection was a series of five bottles from the company's US distilleries. This bottle was released as part of that set.

name: Very Olde St. Nick 20 Year
description: Originally created to appeal to the Japanese export market, Very Olde St. Nick is a whiskey label that has since gained acclaim throughout the larger market.

name: Linkwood 1966 Single Hogshead #790 Bottled 2020 Gordon & Macphail
description:
A stunning 1966 vintage single cask expression of Linkwood matured for 54 years in a 1st fill sherry hogshead! Filled into cask on the 19th of February this sherry hogshead was then bottled at 51.2% Abv on the 16th of December 2020 by Gordon & Macphail. Notably just 32 bottles were yielded from this hogshead after 54 years of waiting!

This 1966 era vintage hails from the original Linkwood distillery which expanded to an A & B site in 1971. It was crafted just shortly after the site saw a sizeable expansion in 1962. This cask is a part of Gordon & Macphail's Private Collection, a label that features only the highest of age statement and quality casks available in the deep warehouses of the Elgin based retailer.
baxus_class_name: Linkwood 1966 Single Hogshead #790 Bottled 2020 Gordon & Macphail

name: Single Cask Nation M.G.P 11 Year 2017 Release
baxus_class_name: Single Cask Nation M.G.P 11 Year 2017 Release

name: William Heavenhill 2006 13 Year Bottled In Bond
description: A 2006 vintage expression of William Heavenhill, a premier offering from the Heaven Hill distillery. Just 35 barrels were selected for this special vatting, all of which were aged for 13 year son the 4th floor of Rickhouse AA at their old Schenley warehouse space. Bottled in bond at 50% Abv.
baxus_class_name: William Heavenhill 2006 13 Year Bottled In Bond

name: Macallan 1989 18 Year Sherry Oak
description: The Macallan 18 Years Old, a perfectly balanced single malt whisky matured for 18 years in both American and European sherry seasoned oak casks. Sherry seasoned American oak adds delicate vanilla to the subtle spice of European oak, delivering a whisky with a sweeter, warmer taste and character.

name: Orphan Barrel Gifted Horse
description: From the producer: "Never one to be the butt of the joke, THE GIFTED HORSE™ American Whiskey is a bold, outspoken whiskey one shouldn’t look in the mouth. Always racing straight to the punch, we only ask that you politely accept The Gifted Horse for what it is – its own unique offering. Some time ago at the historic Stitzel-Weller Distillery, the unthinkable happened. A batch of beautiful 17-year-old Kentucky straight bourbon was accidently mixed with barrels of much younger whiskey. This error turned out better expected as the older bourbon wasn’t marred, but transformed into something surprisingly special. Beginning with a nose hinting at apple skin, almond, toffee, raisins and slight milk chocolate, The Gifted Horse has unique tastes of creamy caramel, Bosc pear and fruit cake. This unusual blend’s fruity notes become more apparent with a splash of water."

name: Rare Character Brook Hill "Emerson K. Shotwell" 10 Year - 2024
description:
Rare Character Whiskey Company is reviving the historic Brook Hill Whiskey brand, first established around the turn of the 20th century. This revival marks a significant milestone in honoring Kentucky's rich distilling heritage and the golden era of American whiskey craftsmanship.

The flagship release in this revival is the Rare Character Brook Hill 10 Year Straight Bourbon. This expression is a heartfelt tribute to Kentucky's distilling pioneers, blending tradition with innovation. It is the result of Pablo Moix's deep respect for the state's whiskey legacy and his passion to continue it through meticulous attention to detail and an unwavering commitment to quality.

The 10-year-old straight bourbon, bottled at barrel proof of 126.46 (63.23% ABV), is a labor of love that seeks to rekindle the flames of heritage, passion, and craftsmanship that have defined Kentucky whiskey for centuries. Each bottle is a unique piece of history, with details like the barrel number (D3C) proudly displayed.

By reintroducing Brook Hill Whiskey, Rare Character not only honors the brand's storied past but also reimagines it for today's whiskey enthusiasts, offering a modern twist on a cherished whiskey legacy. This revival represents Rare Character's commitment to challenging norms and introducing remarkable spirits that celebrate American whiskey heritage while pushing boundaries through creativity and innovation.
baxus_class_name: Rare Character Brook Hill "Emerson K. Shotwell" 10 Year - 2024

name: Willett 1984 22 Year Single Barrel Rye #618 For Doug Phillips
description: Distilled in 1984 and sourced from an undisclosed Kentucky distillery, this rye whiskey was left to mature for 22 years! Stored in new charred oak casks barrel #618 was matured in warehouse G on rick S3 and was selected for Doug Phillips Bottled at a huge 136.7 proof this almost hazmat rye whiskey hails from a legendary period of Willett's history, a period when their warehouses were stuffed full of heavily matured stocks from many closed Kentucky distilleries.
baxus_class_name: Willett 1984 22 Year Single Barrel Rye #618 For Doug Phillips

name: Mortlach 1954 Single Puncheon #491 Bottled 2019 Gordon & Macphail
description: A stunning 1954 vintage single cask expression of Mortlach matured for 65 years in a 1st fill sherry puncheon. Filled into cask on the 27th of January 1954 this sherry puncheon was then bottled at 43% Abv on the 27th of March 2019 by Gordon & Macphail. This 1954 vintage hails from a unique period of Mortlach's production as the spirit will have been crafted from malt produced on their own malting floors, and was just before their large renovation in 1964. This cask is a part of Gordon & Macphail's Private Collection, a label that features only the highest of age statement and quality casks available in the deep warehouses of the Elgin based retailer.
baxus_class_name: Mortlach 1954 Single Puncheon #491 Bottled 2019 Gordon & Macphail

name: George Dickel 10 Year
description: In the early 1990s, United Distillers & Vintners, the company that would later become Diageo, released The Bourbon Heritage Collection. The Heritage Collection was a series of five bottles from the company's US distilleries. This bottle was released as part of that set.

name: Macallan 1984 18 Year Sherry Oak
description: Distilled in 1984 this fully sherry matured expression from Macallan was aged for 18 years. Beginning with a 1965 vintage, the 18 year old sherry oak is an annual release from the esteemed Speyside distillery that has rocketed to fame and become the most collectible series in Scotch whisky. Vintage expressions of the distillery are sought after due to the use of golden promise barley, a strain noted for creating a robust spirit able to withstand sherry cask maturation.

name: Cats Eye Obtainium Cask Strength 28 Year Bottled for Baxus - 2024
description:
Cat’s Eye Distillery is a small family-owned micro-distillery with a mission to craft truly epic tasting products and uniquely sourced items. John Baker, an owner, honed his distilling skills at Honey Creek Distillery in Van Buren County. Subsequently, extensive research and consultations with 22 micro-distillery owners in Colorado informed their approach. After thorough experimentation, the distillery introduced its inaugural whiskey, “Essence of Iowa,” followed by “Krupnik.”

A special release of the distillery's flagship Obtainium line, this expression was bottled for Baxus in honor of the 150th Kentucky Derby. While the original bottling stands at a hearty 150 proof to reflect that anniversary, this Cask Strength edition comes it at an astounding 162.4 Proof, or 81.2% ABV.
baxus_class_name: Cats Eye Obtainium Cask Strength 28 Year Bottled for Baxus - 2024

name: Mortlach 1961 Single Hogshead #1972 Bottled 2019 Gordon & Macphail
description: A stunning 1961 vintage single cask expression of Mortlach matured for 58 years in a 1st fill sherry hogshead! Filled into cask on the 13th of March 1961 this sherry hogshead was then bottled at 44.4% Abv on the 18th of March 2019 by Gordon & Macphail. This 1961 vintage hails from a unique period of Mortlach's production as the spirit will have been crafted from malt produced on their own malting floors, and was just before their large renovation in 1964. This cask is a part of Gordon & Macphail's Private Collection, a label that features only the highest of age statement and quality casks available in the deep warehouses of the Elgin based retailer.
baxus_class_name: Mortlach 1961 Single Hogshead #1972 Bottled 2019 Gordon & Macphail

name: Redemption Rye  Bardstown Barrel Selections 7 Year - 2014
baxus_class_name: Redemption Rye  Bardstown Barrel Selections 7 Year - 2014

name: The Bitter Truth 24 Year - 2009
description: A rye whiskey distilled in 1984 at Bernheim Distillery and bottled in 2009 by The Bitter Truth, a German bottler now known better for producing bitters.

name: Orphan Barrel Pittyvaich 26 Year Old Forager's Keep
description: A special edition release from Orphan Barrel sourced from the closed Scottish distillery Pittyvaich. Pittyvaich was a very short-lived Speyside distillery built in 1975 to supply extra malt whisky for Arthur Bell & Sons blended Scotch whiskies. It was closed in 1993 and then demolished shortly after amid the downturn for Scotch whisky first started in the 1980s.
baxus_class_name: Orphan Barrel Pittyvaich 26 Year Old Forager's Keep

name: Blanton's Black 1997 Bottling
description: Produced exclusively for the Japanese export market at 80 proof, Blanton's Black Label is one of the rarest bourbon whiskeys in the world. Remarkably similar to the green-labeled Special Reserve, the main difference is an 8-year minimum aged barrel selection process (as opposed to the standard 6), which produces a more complex, robust, and refined tasting experience. Like the Takara Red edition, the Black Label is a statement piece for any serious collector and a must-try for any keen Blanton's enthusiast.

name: Glenlivet 1968 45 Year Alexander Murray
description: A 1968 vintage vatting of casks distilled at Glenlivet and matured for a huge 45 years! Bottled at 40% Abv by US importer Alexander Murray & Co. This 1965 vintage is especially of note as it will have been crafted with malt directly from Glenlivet's malt floors, which were closed in 1966.

name: Black Maple Hill 23 Year Cask #7
description: A rye whiskey with a cult following, this very rare Kentucky Straight Rye was matured in a single charred white oak cask for over 23 years, and bottled at 95 proof at the famous Willett Distillery.

name: Very Special Old Fitzgerald 12 Year
description: Introduced in 1996 as part of the bourbon heritage collection, this 12 year old expression of wheated bourbon was sourced from the Stitzel-Weller distillery and bottled at 45% Abv. The BHC series was launched by United Distillers during their short lived interest in bourbon. Once United merged to form Diageo that enthusiasm disappeared, leading to them selling their Bernheim distillery in Louisville to Heaven Hill, also selling the Old Fitzgerald brand to Heaven Hill. This is a United Era release using spirit from Stitzel-Weller that was bottled at their Bernheim distillery in Louisville. The 12 year was produced at Heaven Hill until the late 2010s.

name: Balvenie 1993 23 Year DCS Compendium Chapter #3
description: David C. Stewart MBE is one of the longest serving malt masters in the Scotch whisky industry, having worked with The Balvenie for 54 years. As he contemplates retirement it’s important to David that he passes on his knowledge so others can follow in his footsteps and continue to produce a whisky of exceptional quality. The Balvenie DCS Compendium is David’s handover of this knowledge in both written and liquid form. David has selected 25 extremely rare and significant vintage single cask whiskies to be released over five years, capturing the breadth of his achievement and contributions to his craft.

name: Blanton's Single Barrel 1990 Bottling 375ml
description: A 1990 bottling of the high rye mashbill Blanton's bottled from a single barrel. Please note this is a 375ml half bottle size format.

name: Old Bay Water 5 Year
description: Truly a unique whiskey, this bourbon aged for 5 years before being bottled.

name: Orpan Barrel Forged Oak
description: Orphan Barrel Whiskey Distilling Company is a dedicated cause, acquiring some of the rarest casks from some of the finest whiskey cellars, and releasing them into the world a cascade of limited edition, barrel aged ambrosia. In 2013 bourbon and Tennessee whiskey were labeled the fastest growing product category by volume in the U.S. alcohol business. The Orphan bottling project was more or less an ingenious response to this boom in the whiskey industry, and an effort to accommodate the vast quantities of leftover product from their monopoly of acquisitions. When Diageo didn't have a place for the acquired product in their blends, they set the spirits aside. Time transformed this new spirit into aged delicacies. In 2013, Orphan Barrel Whiskey was created by Diageo, commercializing a large stock of ultra-aged American whiskeys that it had been maturing at the Stitzel-Weller distillery in Shively Kentucky. The fifth expression of Diageo's Orphan Barrel line, Forged Oak is crafted from a mashbill of 86% corn, 7% barley, and 6% rye and aged for 15 years. “ A statuesque whiskey with aromas of cedar, maple and vanilla bean that give way to seasoned woody notes of cocoa and young berries, ultimately leading to a long, dry finish of black pepper” (producer).

name: Glenlossie 1993 24 Year Old Single Hogshead Cadenhead’s
description: A 1993 vintage single cask expression of Speyside whisky from the Glenlossie distillery. Matured for 24 years in a hogshead it was bottled as part of the Cadenhead’s warehouse tasting experience. This special tasting allows visitors to Cadenhead’s in Campbeltown to taste a variety of hand picked casks and then purchase a favourite. As such they are usually only available to those who make the trip to the bottler’s warehouses.
baxus_class_name: Glenlossie 1993 24 Year Old Single Hogshead Cadenhead’s

name: Macallan 1949 50 Year Old Millennium Decanter
description: Distilled in January 1949 this incredible age statement from the Macallan distillery was matured for 50 years! Crafted from three sherry butts, this decanter was filled in 1999 to celebrate the turn of the millennium. Presented in a unique round decanter and stored inside a wooden display box with a spare stopper.

name: Heaven Hill 1996 20 Year Single Cask Cadenhead’s
description: Distilled in 1996 this single cask expression of Heaven Hill was matured for 20 years and bottled at 50.8% Abv by Cadenhead’s. This rare single cask bourbon was bottled in 2017 as part of Cadenhead’s 175th anniversary celebration.
baxus_class_name: Heaven Hill 1996 20 Year Single Cask Cadenhead’s

name: Blanton's Red Takara 1998 Release
description: This unique American whiskey starts its journey in white oak barrels, where it is aged for over 8 years before being finished in Takara red wine casks. The additional aging process adds further complexity to the flavor profile, giving the bourbon rich dark chocolate, roasted pecan, caramelized sugar, orange zest and tobacco notes that linger on the palate until the next sip. Whether enjoyed neat or in a cocktail, this exceptional spirit will delight any palate! The bourbon is then bottled at 46.5% ABV, making it a high-proof whiskey that is full of character.Blanton's Cream Label Takara Red Single Barrel Straight Bourbon Whiskey has a truly unique flavor profile that consists of deep and rich flavors. Caramelized sugar, dark chocolate, roasted pecan, orange zest and tobacco notes make up the delightful flavor layers that linger on the palate until the next sip. The additional aging process in Takara red wine casks adds an extra layer of complexity to the whiskey, making it stand out from other spirits. Whether enjoyed neat or in a cocktail, this exceptional spirit will tantalize your taste buds!

name: Macallan 30 Year Old Fine Oak Pre-2008 Bottling
description: An older pre-2008 era bottling of Macallan’s 30 year old expression from their fine oak series. This line of bottlings saw Macallan’s high quality spirit matured in a combination of bourbon and sherry casks before being bottled at 43% Abv.
baxus_class_name: Macallan 30 Year Old Fine Oak Pre-2008 Bottling

name: The John Walker - 2010
description: Presented in a unique, individually numbered Baccarat crystal decanter that is hand blown, polished and engraved by one of only three Master-craftsmen in the world; The John Walker contains whisky blended from 9 hand selected casks. Building from the predecessors “Johnnie Walker Blue Label” and “King George V”, this blend takes the idea of hand selection of extraordinary casks, and takes that to new levels of rarity and craft. Every care has been made to recreate the authentic flavours of a 19th Century blend in John Walker’s original style and the whisky has been taken from a range of distilleries, some of which are now closed; making this whisky quite literally priceless.

name: Wild Turkey Tradition 1997 Bottling
description: Released for the duty free market, this 1997 expression of Wild Turkey was bottled at their signature 101 proof in a unique kidney bean/jellybean shaped bottle. Older editions of Wild Turkey are particularly sought after amongst enthusiasts, notably for their remarkably different taste profile to modern Wild Turkey bottles. The distillery originally produced bourbon using cypress wood tanks but these were slowly phased out from 1984 until 1990. The other notable production change came in 2004 when the barrel entry proof was changed to 110, up from 107. The combination of these changes have resulted in serious demand for older vintage bottlings from the much loved distillery, with some believing 1990s era bottlings to be the distillery’s best ever.

name: Hoffman Rare Selection 1980s
description: A very interesting bourbon bottled exclusively for the Japanese export market in the late 1980s. The Hoffman distillery was purchased by Julian Van Winkle III after the death of his father had terminated the agreement with Stitzel-Weller distillery that allowed them to bottle Van Winkle bourbon there.

name: Glenrothes Oldest Reserve 30 year - 2017
description: A long-aged release from The Glenrothes, Oldest Reserve is a blending of whiskies from 1967, 1972, 1977, 1979 and 1980 resulting in a whisky that is over 30 years of age.

name: Willett 7 Year Single Barrel Rye #9687 Step Brothers Barrel
description: A 7 year old expression of single barrel rye whiskey from Willett. Barrel #9687 was bottled at 53.3% Abv and was chosen exclusively for Australian retailers Barrel & Batch as well as Whiskey Hunt Australia.
baxus_class_name: Willett 7 Year Single Barrel Rye #9687 Step Brothers Barrel

name: Macallan 55 Year Old Lalique Six Pillars Collection
description: A stunning 2007 release from Macallan of 55 year old spirit bottled in a perfectly crafted Lalique crystal decanter. This specially aged single malt is one of six releases in the Macallan’s “Six Pillars” collection, with each pillar representing a different component of the whisky making process that the distillery believes sets them apart from the competition. This 55 year old expression represents the Macallan’s natural deep colour, with the crystal stopped made in a unique amber colour which is amongst the hardest of colours to create with this type of glass.
baxus_class_name: Macallan 55 Year Old Lalique Six Pillars Collection

name: Glenfiddich 40 Year Release 15
description: The 15th release of Glenfiddich's huge 40 year age statement. This edition is bottled at 47.8% Abv with 852 bottles produced.

name: Glentauchers 2009 11 Year Single Cask #700420 Ooshkie
description: A 2009 vintage single cask expression from Glentauchers matured for 11 years in a 1st fill bourbon barrel. Bottled at 57.5% Abv by Ooshkie just 389 bottles were produced in this 500ml format.

name: Wild Turkey Stampede ‘55 Early 2000s Bottling
description: An early 2000s release of Wild Turkey's Stampede 55 expression. Bottled for the duty free market at 52.5% Abv. Two editions of Wild Turkey Stampede were released, a pre 1999 bottle featuring the Turkey looking forward and this post 1999 edition with the Turkey in profile looking left.

name: Paul John 2011 6 Year Single Hogshead Cadenhead's
description: Distilled in 2011 this single cask expression of Indian whisky from Paul John was matured for 6 years in a refill bourbon hogshead. This cask was bottled as part of the Cadenhead’s warehouse tasting experience. This special tasting allows visitors to Cadenhead’s in Campbeltown to taste a variety of hand picked casks and then purchase a favourite.
baxus_class_name: Paul John 2011 6 Year Single Hogshead Cadenhead's

name: Booker Noe's 7 Year Batch #C-C-16-82
description: This is 7 years old and bottled at cask strength. The Booker's brand is a subsidiary of Jim Beam and was named after former master distiller, Booker Noe. His son Fred is now the current master distiller and is on record as having said, if you’re drinking Booker’s, you better have your pajamas on!” Jim Beam have two distilleries in Kentucky where they produce their bourbon, but Booker's is the only brand produced exclusively at one of them; the Boston Road plant, now also known as the Booker Noe distillery. Booker's was launched in 1992 and is part of the Jim Beam Small Batch collection, alongside Baker's, Knob Creek and Basil Hayden.

name: Glenmorangie 12 Year Old Amontillado Finish For The Whisky Club
description: A 12 year old expression of Glenmorangie released as part of their barrel select series. This edition was finished in rare Amontillado sherry casks and bottled at 46% Abv for The Whisky Club in Australia.
series: Barrel Select Release - The Whisky Club
baxus_class_name: Glenmorangie 12 Year Old Amontillado Finish For The Whisky Club

name: Johnnie Walker Blue Label Year Of The Monkey
description: The Year of the Monkey Special Release truly marries the best of Chinese ceramic art with the very finest blend of Scottish Whisky. The Chinese character for the Monkey is of ancient lineage and endowed with profound cultural implications. Johnnie Walker Blue Label is the stable of their range.
baxus_class_name: Johnnie Walker Blue Label Year Of The Monkey

name: Highland Park 1966 40 Year Single Cask #11009 Duncan Taylor
description: Distilled in 1966 this single cask expression of the esteemed Island distillery Highland Park was matured for a huge 40 years! It was bottled in 2006 at 40.7% Abv by Scottish independent bottler Duncan Taylor.
baxus_class_name: Highland Park 1966 40 Year Single Cask #11009 Duncan Taylor

name: Kilkerran 2006 11 Year Single Cask Cadenhead's
description: Distilled in 2006 this single cask expression of Kilkerran was matured in a rum barrel for 11 years. This cask was bottled as part of the Cadenhead’s warehouse tasting experience. This special tasting allows visitors to Cadenhead’s in Campbeltown to taste a variety of hand picked casks and then purchase a favourite.

name: Johnnie Walker Blue Label Decanter
description: Johnnie Walker Blue Label 200th Anniversary Edition celebrates John and Alexander Walker’s pioneering spirit and groundbreaking style. This special limited edition has been created to commemorate the anniversary of John Walker’s birthday, on 25th July 1805. As a cask strength blend of Blue Label, the full power of the flavors can be experienced. This exclusive Johnnie Walker Blue Label is bottled in a special anniversary crystal decanter that has been specially created for Johnnie Walker by Baccarat.

name: Linkwood 2009 12 Year Single Barrique #14572 Bellaire & Day
description: The first US release from Bellaire & Day sourced from the Linkwood distillery in Speyside. Distilled in 2009 it was matured for 12 years in a ruby port barrique. Bottled at a cask strength of 46% Abv.
baxus_class_name: Linkwood 2009 12 Year Single Barrique #14572 Bellaire & Day

name: Caperdonich 1997 21 Year Single Cask #128022 Distillery Reserve Collection
description: A 1997 vintage single cask expression from Caperdonich, the closed sister distillery to Glen Grant that was once named 'Glen Grant 2'. Cask #128022 was matured in a 1st fill barrel and bottled in 2019 at 49% Abv in a 500ml format as part of The Distillery Reserve Collection. This series of bottlings sees Chivas owned distilleries bottling their best casks in a single cask format, with these 500ml bottles available exclusively at their distillery doors.
baxus_class_name: Caperdonich 1997 21 Year Single Cask #128022 Distillery Reserve Collection

name: Booker's 7 Year Batch B94-E-15
description: This is 7 years old and bottled at cask strength. The Booker's brand is a subsidiary of Jim Beam and was named after former master distiller, Booker Noe. His son Fred is now the current master distiller and is on record as having said, if you’re drinking Booker’s, you better have your pajamas on!” Jim Beam have two distilleries in Kentucky where they produce their bourbon, but Booker's is the only brand produced exclusively at one of them; the Boston Road plant, now also known as the Booker Noe distillery. Booker's was launched in 1992 and is part of the Jim Beam Small Batch collection, alongside Baker's, Knob Creek and Basil Hayden.

name: Longrow 2001 15 Year Old Single Chardonnay Cask Cadenhead’s
description: A remarkably rare cask type from Springbank, this warehouse tasting exclusive offering of Longrow was distilled in 2001 and matured for 15 years. After 7 years it was transferred to a chardonnay wine cask where it matured until 2017 where it was bottled at 56.2%. Longrow is the most heavily peated expression produced at Springbank, crafted from peat dried malt that is then double distilled. The warehouse tasting allows visitors to Cadenhead’s in Campbeltown to taste a variety of hand picked casks and then purchase a favourite. As such they are usually only available to those who make the trip to the bottler’s warehouses.
baxus_class_name: Longrow 2001 15 Year Old Single Chardonnay Cask Cadenhead’s

name: Wild Turkey Tradition 1996 Bottling
description: Released for the duty free market, this 1996 expression of Wild Turkey was bottled at their signature 101 proof in a unique kidney bean/jellybean shaped bottle. Older editions of Wild Turkey are particularly sought after amongst enthusiasts, notably for their remarkably different taste profile to modern Wild Turkey bottles. The distillery originally produced bourbon using cypress wood tanks but these were slowly phased out from 1984 until 1990. The other notable production change came in 2004 when the barrel entry proof was changed to 110, up from 107. The combination of these changes have resulted in serious demand for older vintage bottlings from the much loved distillery, with some believing 1990s era bottlings to be the distillery’s best ever.

name: Springbank 1997 22 Year Single Cask #80004 For Alexandra & Jack's Wedding
description: A 200ml format bottling of 1997 vintage Springbank matured for 22 years. Bottled at 46% Abv it was chosen to celebrate the wedding of Alexandra & Jack in November 2019.
baxus_class_name: Springbank 1997 22 Year Single Cask #80004 For Alexandra & Jack's Wedding

name: Jameson St. Patrick's Day - 2017
description: A highly anticipated annual launch, Jameson’s limited edition St Patrick’s Day bottle brings the brand’s heritage together with inspirational design to mark Ireland’s biggest cultural celebration. This year’s bottle – a collaboration between Jameson, Pearlfisher and Dublin designer Steve McCarthy – is inspired by the Jameson family motto Sine Metu, or ‘without fear’, which has been at the heart of the company since it was founded in 1780 and goes hand in hand with the commonly used saying Irish saying ‘to chance your arm’.

name: Blanton's Straight From the Barrel 2002 Bottling
description: Not only one of the world’s best bourbons, Blanton’s Straight from the Barrel is one of the world’s best whiskeys. Created for connoisseurs familiar with cask strength whiskeys, this enormous taste profile reaches depths of flavor found only in the rarest of spirits. On the nose we get notes of dark chocolate, caramel and butter with earthy undertones of walnut and hazelnut. The palate delivers intrepid notes of warm vanilla, oak, toasted nuts and a rich spiciness with hints of butterscotch or honey. The high alcohol by volume is intense and powerful yet inviting. The deep and resonate finish on this bourbon is nothing short of legendary. Straight from the barrel is best served neat or with a splash of water. Un-filtered, un-cut, unbelievable.
baxus_class_name: Blanton's Straight From the Barrel 2002 Bottling

name: Willett 1990 19 Year Society Of Bourbon Connoisseurs
baxus_class_name: Willett 1990 19 Year Society Of Bourbon Connoisseurs

name: Kilchoman US Exclusive Small Batch #6
description: The basis of the whiskies in the 2019 introduced new series of Small Batch Releases for selected markets is always an already finished Machir Bay vatting or Machir Bay Collaborative Vatting, i.e. a whisky with 46% alcohol strength, which was previously matured for 3-5 years predominantly in bourbon barrels and 5-15% in oloroso sherry casks. This vatting is then married with an additional special cask. In the case of the “USA Small Batch No. 6” listed here, the additional cask is a Pedro Ximénez Sherry Hogshead. The proportions are given as 70% Bourbon, 5% Oloroso sherry and 25% PX sherry.

name: Macallan 1967 Speymalt Bottled 2007 Gordon & Macphail
description: An old school vintage Gordon & Macphail crafted from spirit distilled at Macallan in 1967. The new make was then stored in their own chosen sherry casks and left to mature before being bottled in 2007 at 43% Abv as part of their Speymalt label. Gordon & Macphail spent much of the 20th century as the bottlers for Macallan’s spirit and as such have amassed quite an archive of the esteemed Speyside distillery’s liquid. The Speymalt label features both young and old small batch and single cask releases from Macallan.

name: G.H. Mumm Cordon Rouge Brut
description: Matured in spectacular cellars beneath Reims, this is a smooth and easy-drinking celebration Champagne. G.H. Mumm’s new generation of winemakers seem to make a better blend with each successive year.

name: Pappy Van Winkle 20 Year Family Reserve 2011 Bottling
description: A 2011 bottling of Pappy Van Winkle 20 year old bourbon. This era of Pappy was crafted from barrels produced at the Stitzel-Weller distillery, the legendary closed distillery that produced Old Fitzgerald. This 2011 era release was bottled at Buffalo Trace after Julian Van Winkle moved his operations to there.
baxus_class_name: Pappy Van Winkle 20 Year Family Reserve 2011 Bottling

name: Willett 1984 24 Year Single Barrel Rye #637 For Bonili Japan Co
description: Distilled in 1984 and sourced from an undisclosed Kentucky distillery, this rye whiskey was left to mature for 24 years! Stored in new charred oak casks barrel #637 was matured in warehouse G on rick N1 and chosen exclusively for Japanese importer Bonili Japan Co. This barrel hails from a legendary period of Willett's history, a time when their warehouses were stuffed full of heavily matured stocks from many closed Kentucky distilleries.
baxus_class_name: Willett 1984 24 Year Single Barrel Rye #637 For Bonili Japan Co

name: Glenfarclas 2005 Oloroso Cask Bottled 2020 For The Whisky Club
description: A 2005 vintage small batch release of Glenfarclas crafted exclusively from Oloroso sherry matured whisky. Bottled in 2020 at 48% Abv it was chosen for The Whisky Club in Australia.
baxus_class_name: Glenfarclas 2005 Oloroso Cask Bottled 2020 For The Whisky Club

name: Booker’s 8 Year Lot B-H-01-83
description: The Booker's brand is a subsidiary of Jim Beam and was named after former master distiller, Booker Noe. His son Fred is now the current master distiller and is on record as having said, if you’re drinking Booker’s, you better have your pajamas on!” Jim Beam have two distilleries in Kentucky where they produce their bourbon, but Booker's is the only brand produced exclusively at one of them; the Boston Road plant, now also known as the Booker Noe distillery. Booker's was launched in 1992 and is part of the Jim Beam Small Batch collection, alongside Baker's, Knob Creek and Basil Hayden.

name: Blanton's Straight From the Barrel 2002 Bottling
description: Not only one of the world’s best bourbons, Blanton’s Straight from the Barrel is one of the world’s best whiskeys. Created for connoisseurs familiar with cask strength whiskeys, this enormous taste profile reaches depths of flavor found only in the rarest of spirits. On the nose we get notes of dark chocolate, caramel and butter with earthy undertones of walnut and hazelnut. The palate delivers intrepid notes of warm vanilla, oak, toasted nuts and a rich spiciness with hints of butterscotch or honey. The high alcohol by volume is intense and powerful yet inviting.
