With only 18 barrels in our Spring 2023 release this Single Barrel, bottled at 92 proof, is the holy grail of American Single Malt.

name: Hiram Walker's Ten High 4 Year
description:
Originally produced by Hiram Walker, the Ten High brand is now owned by the Sazerac Company, like many storied brands of American whiskey. 

The name "Ten High" refers to a barrel storage technique where the barrel is stored at least ten ricks high in order to cause faster maturation. Despite the promise of the name, no guarantees were made by the producer that this technique was actually used for these barrels.

name: Maker’s Mark Party Horses Edition 2
description: A special edition release from Maker's Mark collaborating with generative NFT artworks. This party horse edition envisions the horses from the Kentucky Derby instead attending the race track as patrons. Bottled at 45% Abv in a 1 litre format.

name: Caroni 1997 25 Year Single Cask #121 Silver Seal
description: Distilled in 1997 this heavy full proof Trinidad rum was sourced from the closed distillery Caroni. Matured for 25 years it was bottled in 2023 by Italian independent bottler Silver Seal at 60.4% Abv. This cask, named the Manta Ray Genesis, is a collaboration between Silver Seal Whisky Company and the East Asia Whisky Company in support of the Manta Trust in the UK.
baxus_class_name: Caroni 1997 25 Year Single Cask #121 Silver Seal

name: Jack Daniels Old Number 7 Inaugural Decanter 1984 Release 1.5L
description: This bottling was originally planned for release in 1908 to celebrate the forthcoming election of Theodore Roosevelt for his second term in office. However, the President decided not to seek re-election that year, and he lost the subsequent election of 1912, so plans were postponed indefinitely.  This decanter was finally commissioned and released in 1984 to celebrate 80 years since Theodore Roosevelt was elected President, by the largest popular vote in US history.
baxus_class_name: Jack Daniels Old Number 7 Inaugural Decanter 1984 Release 1.5L

name: 2XO Gem Of Kentucky Single Barrel #01
description: A single barrel expression of Kentucky bourbon hand selected by esteemed master blender Dixon Dedman of Kentucky Owl fame. This single barrel was chosen for the gem of Kentucky series and is bottled at 108 proof.

name: Old Forester Warehouse H Barrels 117 Series
description: A distillery exclusive expression from Old Forester in their experimental 117 series. This edition sees a Kentucky straight bourbon crafted from barrels drawn exclusively from their heat cycled warehouse H. Bottled in a 375ml format at 49% Abv.
baxus_class_name: Old Forester Warehouse H Barrels 117 Series

name: Balcones Gentle Giant Batch 2022 BAL-1 Lost Lantern
description: An independent bottling of Balcones Texas single malt crafted from 5 casks matured in refill oak and apple brandy casks. Matured for approximately 3 years this batch was bottled at 57.6% Abv by Lost Lantern, an American independent bottler.
baxus_class_name: Balcones Gentle Giant Batch 2022 BAL-1 Lost Lantern

name: Bardstown 7 Year Single Barrel Private Selection
description: A 7 year old expression of bourbon from Bardstown Bourbon Co bottled from a single barrel. Crafted from a high wheat masshbill of 68% corn, 20% wheat and 12% malted barley it was bottled at 66.2% Abv.
baxus_class_name: Bardstown 7 Year Single Barrel Private Selection

name: Knob Creek 2016 Single Barrel Rye For BHG#237 Bottled 2021
description: Distilled in 2016 this single barrel rye whiskey was produced by Jim Beam under their Knob Creek label. Bottled in 2021 this single barrel select was chosen by BHG from the third floor of warehouse 1. It was bottled in 2021 at 115 proof.
baxus_class_name: Knob Creek 2016 Single Barrel Rye For BHG#237 Bottled 2021

name: Knob Creek 2011 9 Year Single Barrel Bourbon For RVA Bourbon Tasters
description: Distilled in 2011 this single barrel bourbon from Jim Beam's Knob Creek label was matured for 9 years and bottled in 2021 at 120 proof. This barrel was chosen by RVA Bourbon Tasters.
baxus_class_name: Knob Creek 2011 9 Year Single Barrel Bourbon For RVA Bourbon Tasters

name: Alberta Premium Cask Strength Rye
description: A limited edition expression of Canadian rye whiskey from Alberta Premium bottled at a cask strength of 63.7% Abv.

name: Glendronach Cask Strength Batch 11
description: The 11th expression of Glendronach bottled at cask strength. Matured in sherry casks this release was bottled at 59.8% Abv.

name: Old Fitzgerald 2013 10 Year Old Bottled In Bond Decanter
description: A 2013 vintage expression of wheated bourbon from Heaven Hill matured for 10 years. This fan favourite release is bottled in bond at 50% Abv as part of the Old Fitzgerald label and comes packaged in a stunning heavy glass decanter.
baxus_class_name: Old Fitzgerald 2013 10 Year Old Bottled In Bond Decanter

name: Cierto Anejo Private Collection Tequila
description: A 100% agave anejo matured tequila from Cierto bottled at 40% Abv. *Please note a minor tear to the plastic of this asset. The seal is still intact.

name: Coppercraft 9 Year Single Barrel
description: Founded in 2012 in Holland, Michigan, Coppercraft Distillery draws inspiration from the state's legacy of hardworking Americans in the industrious manufacturing sector. The distillery produces small-batch spirits, infusing every release with craftsmanship indicative of the passion present within the young distillery's stills.

name: Elijah Craig 9 Year Barrel Proof Single Barrel #6578148 For Speakeasy
description: A single barrel expression of Elijah Craig from Heaven Hill matured for 9 years. This special store pick offering was chosen by Speakeasy and is bottled at 67.1% Abv.
baxus_class_name: Elijah Craig 9 Year Barrel Proof Single Barrel #6578148 For Speakeasy

name: Starward Lagavulin Cask
description: A special collaboration from Starward and Islay whisky distillery Lagavulin. First matured in Australian red wine barrels this release was finished in peated Scotch whisky casks from Lagavulin. Both a cask strength and this 48% Abv edition were released.

name: Angel’s Envy OMWP Kansas City
description: A single barrel select from Angel's Envy crafted from a Kentucky straight bourbon finished in port wine barrels. Selected by OMWP this single barrel was bottled at 59.35% Abv. The rear of the bottle features a custom sticker with Kansas City NFL quarterback Patrick Mahomes as well as a custom wax seal.

name: Maker's Mark Cellar Aged 2024 Release
description: The 2024 release of Maker's Mark's cellar aged expression. This series sees extra matured wheated bourbon moved to their unique limestone cellar, a temperature-controlled environment that allows for slower, more consistent aging. This edition is a blend of 15% 12-year-old and 85% 13-year-old Maker's Mark bourbon, bottled at a robust 59.65% ABV (119.3 proof).

name: Balvenie 30 Year
description: A 30 year old expression of Speyside single malt whisky from Balvenie. Matured in traditional oak casks, bourbon barrels and sherry casks it was bottled at 47.3% Abv.

name: Beam’s Choice 8 Year Diamond Quilted Gold 1970s Bottling
description: A late 1960s/early 1970s era bottling of Jim Beam matured for 8 years. This unique gold decanter comes in a 4/5th quart format making this a pre-1976 bottling. The distillate used for this decanter will have been distilled in the 1960s.
baxus_class_name: Beam’s Choice 8 Year Diamond Quilted Gold 1970s Bottling

name: High West Bourye Batch 16A12
description: An early batch of High West's signature "Bourye", a blend of bourbon and rye whiskies. Early editions of this release contained sizeable amounts of well aged whiskies sourced from MGP in Indiana and are highly praised amongst High West enthusiasts.

name: Courvoisier VS Early 1970s Bottling
description: A 1960s into early 1970s era bottling of Courvoisier's Very Special (V.S) Cognac. This half size bottling was imported to the US and bottled at 80 proof.

name: Blanton's Takara Red 2023 Release
description:
Blanton's Takara Red is a special edition of the celebrated Blanton's Single Barrel Bourbon, exclusively released for the Japanese market. Part of the Takara series, which also includes Takara Black and Takara Gold, this expression is highly sought after by bourbon enthusiasts and collectors around the world.

Takara Red is distinguished by its unique characteristics, including an aging process that is rumored to be a minimum of eight years, although this is not officially confirmed on the label. It is bottled at 93 proof (46.5% ABV), the same as the standard Blanton's Single Barrel, ensuring a robust flavor profile.

The packaging of Takara Red adds to its allure, featuring a distinctive red box with a woven texture and a deep maroon bag that contrasts with the brown bag of domestic Blanton's. The bottle is adorned with a gold-colored wax seal, similar to that found on Blanton's Straight From The Barrel. The label showcases light brown handwritten and printed portions, along with Japanese script spelling out "Whiskey," further emphasizing its exclusivity.

The Takara Red series is particularly interesting for collectors due to its limited availability and the variations that can arise from individual barrel selections. Some special releases within this series, such as the HBA (Hotel Barmen Association Japan) Single Barrel picks, offer even more unique expressions.

While many enthusiasts speculate about the potential superiority of the Takara series due to its rumored longer aging process, recent reviews suggest that modern releases may be more comparable in quality to standard Blanton's. Nevertheless, Takara Red remains a highly coveted expression in the bourbon world, often commanding premium prices on the secondary market.

name: Bacardi 151 Proof 1 liter 1990s Bottling
description: A 1990s era bottling of Bacardi's huge 151 overproof rum. This 75.5% Abv spirit is classified as flammable and is therefore used in mixed drinks to allow the spirit to be lit on fire.

name: Orphan Barrel 16 Year Copper Tongue 2021 Release
description: A 2021 special release from Diageo as part of their Orphan Barrel label. This 16 year old straight bourbon was distilled at Cascade Hollow, the home of the George Dickel brand. Crafted from two parcels of bourbon it was bottled at 44.9% Abv.
baxus_class_name: Orphan Barrel 16 Year Copper Tongue 2021 Release

name: G4 Extra Anejo Reserva Especial 7 Year
description:
G4 Extra Añejo Tequila is a remarkable expression that showcases the artistry of Felipe Camarena and the unique character of the G4 brand. 

On the nose, G4 Extra Añejo presents inviting aromas of cooked agave, caramel, and vanilla, complemented by subtle notes of dried fruits such as fig and apricot. Hints of cinnamon and allspice add depth, while a light oak presence ensures the agave remains at the forefront.

The palate is rich and complex, featuring flavors of warm pineapple, brown butter, and a gentle sweetness. The agave character shines through, accompanied by layers of baking spices and a smooth mouthfeel. The finish is long and satisfying, with lingering notes of vanilla and floral undertones.

G4 Extra Añejo stands out for its exceptional craftsmanship and smoothness, making it an ideal choice for sipping neat or enjoying in premium cocktails. This tequila exemplifies the harmonious blend of traditional techniques and innovative methods that define the G4 brand, appealing to both aficionados and those new to the world of fine tequila.
baxus_class_name: G4 Extra Anejo Reserva Especial 7 Year

name: Canadian Lord Calvert 1970s Bottling
description: A blend of Canadian whiskeys from six distilleries by Calvert distilling. This 80 proof expression was bottled in the 1970s. *Please note no size is stated but we estimate this is a full sized 750ml bottle.

name: Canadian Club 1973 6 Year
description: A 1973 vintage 6 year old expression of Canadian Club produced by Hiram Walker and bottled in a 1 quart format.

name: Clase Azul The Loft
description:
An exclusive bottle only available at Clase Azul's Loft in Brooklyn, this tequila stands not only as a testament to the company's dedication to the craft of distilling but also as a love letter to the Big Apple.

Aged over the course of 20 months, first in American whiskey casks and then finished in casks of Calvados, a traditional apple brandy from Normandy, France, this bottle contains a premium tequila that is bursting with nuance and flavor.

The decanter, inspired by the Chrysler Building—a masterpiece of Art Deco design—pays homage to Manhattan’s iconic skyline. Hand-painted brushstrokes in verdigris gracefully mirror the skyscraper’s unique silhouette, while the contrasting verdigris body and hammered copper cap symbolize the evolving architectural landscape of New York City.

name: Old Forester Barrel Strength Single Barrel Warehouse H Floor 2
description: A single barrel expression from Brown-Forman's Old Forester distillery bottled at barrel strength.
baxus_class_name: Old Forester Barrel Strength Single Barrel Warehouse H Floor 2

name: Martell V.S.P Cognac Early 1970s Bottling
description: A vey special pale expression of Cognac from Martell bottled in the 1960s/early 1970s at 80 proof in a 4/5th quart format.

name: Heaven Hill Bottled In Bond 7 Year
baxus_class_name: Heaven Hill Bottled In Bond 7 Year

name: Canadian Club 1970 6 Year
description: A 1970 vintage 6 year old expression of Canadian Club produced by Hiram Walker and bottled in a 1 quart format.

name: E.H. Taylor, Jr. Single Barrel
description: The aroma carries lightly toasted oak, with dried figs and butterscotch. One sip brings flavors of sweetness balanced with tobacco and dark spices. The finish is just long enough to prepare the palate for another sip. The bottle itself is a likeness to Colonel Taylor's original design used over a century ago.

name: Ledaig 21 Year Manzanilla Cask Finish
description: A 21 year old expression of Ledaig, the heavily peated spirit produced at Tobermory distillery. This special edition was finished in rare Manzanilla sherry casks and bottled at 52.9% Abv.

name: Remy Martin Extra Perfection Cognac 1990s Bottling
description: A 1989 to 1998 bottling of extra fine Cognac from Remy Martin.
baxus_class_name: Remy Martin Extra Perfection Cognac 1990s Bottling

name: Booker's 7 Year "The Beam House Batch" 2024 Bottling
description:
Booker's Bourbon "The Beam House Batch" 2024-02 is a robust and flavorful expression from the renowned Jim Beam distillery. Named after the Noe family home in Bardstown, Kentucky, this release pays homage to the rich history and traditions of the Beam family. Aged for 7 years, 2 months, and 22 days, this bourbon is bottled at a potent cask strength of 62.3% ABV (124.6 proof).

The nose of The Beam House Batch is powerful and inviting, offering a complex array of aromas. Rich notes of caramel, vanilla, and peanut brittle are complemented by hints of dried fruit, particularly caramel apple and raisin. There's also a subtle touch of charred oak and a whisper of brûléed sugar, creating an enticing bouquet that beckons you to take a sip.

On the palate, this Booker's release delivers a bold yet surprisingly balanced experience. The high proof is evident but not overwhelming, allowing the rich flavors to shine through. Intense caramel and toffee notes lead the charge, followed by layers of brown butter, vanilla cake, and butterscotch. The signature Beam nuttiness is present but not dominant, harmonizing well with the sweeter elements. As the bourbon develops on the tongue, spice notes of cinnamon, nutmeg, and black pepper emerge, adding depth and complexity to the profile.

The finish is long and satisfying, with the interplay of sweet and spicy notes lingering pleasantly. Oak tannins provide a gentle dryness that balances the residual sweetness, while hints of leather and tobacco add a sophisticated touch to the conclusion. The Beam House Batch showcases the craftsmanship and heritage of Booker's Bourbon, offering a full-flavored and nuanced drinking experience that will delight bourbon enthusiasts and collectors alike.
baxus_class_name: Booker's 7 Year "The Beam House Batch" 2024 Bottling

name: Beam's Choice 6 Year Genie Decanter 1964 Bottling
description: A 1964 bottling of Jim Beam matured for 6 years and bottled in a smoke green genie bottle decanter. This 1964 glass decanter was the same one used for the hit series 'I Dream Of Jeannie'. More info about the production history of the series and the bottles association can be found in this Forbes article: https://www.forbes.com/sites/robertanaas/2017/04/25/i-dream-of-jeannie-home-a-jim-beam-whiskey-bourbon-bottle-expected-to-fetch-100000-at-auction/
baxus_class_name: Beam's Choice 6 Year Genie Decanter 1964 Bottling

name: Beam's Choice 8 Year Irish Setter Decanter 1977 Bottling
description: A 1977 bottling of Beam bourbon matured for 8 years and bottled at 80 proof. Bottled approximately in 1976-1978 this decanter was one of many featuring James Lockhart's artworks.
baxus_class_name: Beam's Choice 8 Year Irish Setter Decanter 1977 Bottling

name: Blanton's Single Barrel 2024 Bottling
description:
Blanton's Single Barrel Bourbon is a celebrated expression that holds the distinction of being the first single-barrel bourbon ever produced, introduced in 1984 by Buffalo Trace Distillery. Known for its rich heritage and craftsmanship, Blanton's has become a sought-after favorite among bourbon enthusiasts.

Each bottle of Blanton's comes from a single barrel, resulting in unique flavor profiles that can vary from one release to another. Typically bottled at 93 proof, this bourbon is aged in charred American white oak barrels, allowing it to develop a complex character over time. 

On the nose, Blanton's Single Barrel offers inviting aromas of honey, caramel, and ripe fruit, complemented by hints of citrus and spice. The palate is full-bodied and vibrant, featuring flavors of cinnamon, vanilla, and dark chocolate. A subtle spiciness adds depth, while the finish is smooth and lingering, leaving behind notes of oak and sweet toffee.

Blanton's iconic packaging includes a distinctive bottle shape and a horse-and-jockey stopper that has become a collector's item in its own right. With its combination of quality, rarity, and craftsmanship, Blanton's Single Barrel remains a benchmark for bourbon aficionados and continues to capture the hearts of whiskey lovers around the world.

name: Weller 12 Year French Edition
description:
Weller 12 Year bourbon, produced by Buffalo Trace Distillery, is a celebrated expression in the world of wheated bourbons. Known for its rich history, this bourbon is named after William Larue Weller, a pioneer in using wheat as a secondary grain in bourbon production. The whiskey is aged for 12 years, allowing it to develop a complex flavor profile that balances sweetness and depth. With a proof of 90, Weller 12 offers a smooth drinking experience that appeals to both seasoned bourbon enthusiasts and newcomers alike.

The aroma of Weller 12 is inviting, featuring prominent notes of caramel, vanilla, and charred oak. As you sip, flavors of dried fruits such as apple and apricot emerge, complemented by hints of leather and sweet oak. The finish is notably satisfying; it begins gently before crescendoing with notes of sweet oak, cinnamon, and toasted pecans. This harmonious blend of flavors showcases the bourbon's craftsmanship and the unique characteristics imparted by its wheated mash bill. While it may not be the most complex bourbon available, Weller 12 excels in delivering a well-rounded and enjoyable tasting experience that has earned it a loyal following among whiskey lovers.

name: Seagram's 1776 American Whiskey Tiffany Decanter 1976 Bottling
description: A blended American whiskey from Seagram's bottled in 1976 to celebrate 200 years of the US. Bottled in a crystal Tiffany decanter it is presented in their signature blue bag.
baxus_class_name: Seagram's 1776 American Whiskey Tiffany Decanter 1976 Bottling

name: Virginia Gentleman 4 Year
description: Distilled in Kentucky and re-distilled in Virginia, this antique bourbon sports the motto "The Aristocrat of Them All."

name: Old Overholt 1935 5 Year Bottled In Bond 1/2 Pint
description: An original Old Overholt rye whiskey produced in 1935 at the Broad Ford distillery in West Overton Pennsylvania. This 1935 distilled rye whiskey was matured for 5 years and bottled in bond in 1940 at 100 proof. This half pint size bottle was distributed by National Distillers who purchased the Old Overholt brand in 1932. The Broad Ford distillery produced Old Overholt until 1951 when the heavy decline of rye whiskey forced the distillery to close.
baxus_class_name: Old Overholt 1935 5 Year Bottled In Bond 1/2 Pint

name: Macallan 1988 18 Year Sherry Oak
description: Distilled in 1988, this was was bottled in 2006. The 1987 vintage was the final outing for the rare matte purple carton that was was discontinued in favour of a shiny metallic box the same year. This vintage was sold in both packaging styles.

name: Rothschild VSOP Napoleon Extra Fine Brandy Late 1970s/Early 1980s Bottling
description: A 1977-1982 era bottling of brandy from Rothschild imported to the US at 80 proof.
baxus_class_name: Rothschild VSOP Napoleon Extra Fine Brandy Late 1970s/Early 1980s Bottling

name: Macallan 1990 18 Year Sherry Oak
description:
A very rare vintage 1990 18 years-old Macallan Sherry Oak Highland Single Malt Scotch Whisky with the shiny-purple box, bottled in the year 2008 at 43.0% abv in a limited edition at 750ml for the importer Remy Cointreau New York and the US market.
The 18-year-old Macallan Sherry Oak Highland Single Malt Scotch Whisky is part of the series that gave Macallan its almost legendary reputation: the pure sherry cask bottlings. It was not until the mid-1960s that Macallan concentrated on sherry cask-matured single malts and was able to gain great recognition among whisky connoisseurs worldwide in a short space of time with its unusual cask policy. At that time, they experimented with different sherry casks and then decided to use European Oloroso casks, in which the world-famous Spanish liqueur wine had previously been seasoned. Despite the crisis in the 1980s among sherry producers, the Speyside distillery Macallan managed to secure a supply of selected sherry casks and to continue bottling the coveted sherry cask matured whiskies.

name: I.W. Harper 1964 Bottled 1970
description: Distilled in 1964 at the original Old Bernheim distillery, this expression of I.W. Harper was bottled in bond for export at 43% Abv. Bottled in 1970 this 4/5th quart sized bottle was exported to Japan.

name: Macallan 1985 18 Year Sherry Oak
description:
The Macallan 18 year old Speyside single malt distilled in 1985 and laid down at The Macallan distillery, was exclusively matured for more than 18 years in sherry wood casks from Jerez, Spain, before being bottled for the US market in 2003.

The older iconic 18 year old, and earlier, offerings from The Macallan always continue to see a high demand and consistent rise in popularity, and this one is no exception. Prices rise year on year making this a great whisky for any collector and as an investment.

name: Macallan 1983 18 Year Sherry Oak
description:
The start of this series began in 1982 and quite possibly the most recognisable malt in the world, The Macallan 18 Year Old. The 18 year old in the tube packaging is one of 6 releases of this kind, depicting Sara Middletons view of the estate on the front.

This 1983 vintage single malt was, matured exclusively in sherry casks for 18 years and was bottled in 2000. These released have acquired many fans over the years, and are becoming increasingly hard to find.

name: Blanton's Single Barrel Special Reserve 2022 Release
description:
Blanton's Special Reserve is a unique expression in the Blanton's lineup, designed to offer a more approachable entry point into the world of single barrel bourbons. Bottled at a lower proof of 80 (40% ABV), this expression is particularly popular in international markets and is not typically available in the United States.

Created to cater to those new to single barrel bourbons or those who prefer a milder flavor profile, Blanton's Special Reserve maintains the brand's commitment to quality and craftsmanship. Like its higher-proof counterparts, it is aged in Warehouse H at Buffalo Trace Distillery, the same warehouse favored by Colonel Albert B. Blanton.

The Special Reserve offers a softer, more delicate flavor profile compared to the Original Single Barrel. It features a slightly floral nose with subtle hints of cedar and raisin. On the palate, drinkers can expect a smooth, easy-drinking bourbon with notes of vanilla, caramel, and light oak, balanced by a gentle spiciness.

While it may not have the intensity of other Blanton's expressions, the Special Reserve is valued for its accessibility and smooth character. It's presented in the iconic Blanton's bottle, complete with the signature horse and jockey stopper, making it a sought-after addition for collectors and bourbon enthusiasts, especially those outside the United States.
om/review/blantons-special-reserve
baxus_class_name: Blanton's Single Barrel Special Reserve 2022 Release

name: Blanton's Single Barrel 2023 Bottling
description:
Blanton's Single Barrel Bourbon is a celebrated expression that holds the distinction of being the first single-barrel bourbon ever produced, introduced in 1984 by Buffalo Trace Distillery. Known for its rich heritage and craftsmanship, Blanton's has become a sought-after favorite among bourbon enthusiasts.

Each bottle of Blanton's comes from a single barrel, resulting in unique flavor profiles that can vary from one release to another. Typically bottled at 93 proof, this bourbon is aged in charred American white oak barrels, allowing it to develop a complex character over time. 

On the nose, Blanton's Single Barrel offers inviting aromas of honey, caramel, and ripe fruit, complemented by hints of citrus and spice. The palate is full-bodied and vibrant, featuring flavors of cinnamon, vanilla, and dark chocolate. A subtle spiciness adds depth, while the finish is smooth and lingering, leaving behind notes of oak and sweet toffee.

Blanton's iconic packaging includes a distinctive bottle shape and a horse-and-jockey stopper that has become a collector's item in its own right. With its combination of quality, rarity, and craftsmanship, Blanton's Single Barrel remains a benchmark for bourbon aficionados and continues to capture the hearts of whiskey lovers around the world.

name: Golden Wedding 1898 Old Rye Whiskey 1914 Bottling
description:
A stunning 19th century vintage rye whiskey distilled in 1898 at the Joseph S. Finch distillery in Pennsylvania. This batch of rye whiskey was purchased from bond in 1903 before being bottled in 1914 by C.A. Van Rensselaer & Co in New York. Golden Wedding is a historic label that started before prohibition and has been resurrected by Buffalo Trace in recent years. 

Joseph S. Finch distillery was built in 1856 just outside of Pittsburgh, Pennsylvania and the Golden Wedding trademark was officially reigstered in 1884. In nearby Schenley, Pennsylvania Henry Bischoff and his partners the Sinclaires built the Schenley distillery in 1892. The Schenley site would be closed in 1918 before it was later bought by D.K. Weiskopf & Lewis Rosenstiel, the pair creating Schenley Products Company. With prohibition looming the Finch distillery applied for and was granted one of the very limited licenses to create medicinal whiskey. In 1924 Sol Rosenbloom, the owner of the Joseph S. Finch distillery sold the site to Schenley products. This would be the catalyst for Schenley growing into a behemoth of 20th century distilling, acquiring distilleries like George T Stagg, Ross & Squibb and Old Oscar Pepper. 

The history becomes slightly more blurry into the 20th century as one source states the Joseph S. Finch distillery was left to rot after the sale of its license, with all Pennsylvania distilled products now being made at the Schenley site. Another source suggests the original Finch distillery was simply renamed to the Schenley distillery, and that it survived until Lews Rosenstiel's death in the late 1960s. 

Either way Schenley Products were well positioned for prohibition thanks to the 10,000 barrels of Golden Wedding rye whiskey acquired as part of the Finch sale as well as the license to continue distilling. They continued the Golden Wedding brand after prohibition was lifted but as the market shifted to lighter styles of whiskey it was soon an American blended whiskey, with approximately 70% of the blend just neutral grain spirit. The brand was also used for young Canadian distilled whiskey by Schenley and this steep decline in quality all but destroyed its reputation. 

In late 2023 Buffalo Trace resurrected the rye grain Golden Wedding brand as a 375ml bottling of 107 proof rye whiskey produced at their Frankfort distillery in Kentucky.
baxus_class_name: Golden Wedding 1898 Old Rye Whiskey 1914 Bottling

name: Macallan 1975 20 Year Signatory Vintage
description: A 1975 vintage expression of Macallan matured for over 20 years and bottled in 1995 by Signatory Vintage at 43% Abv for the US market.

name: Blanton's Single Barrel Special Reserve 2023 Bottling
description:
Blanton's Special Reserve is a unique expression in the Blanton's lineup, designed to offer a more approachable entry point into the world of single barrel bourbons. Bottled at a lower proof of 80 (40% ABV), this expression is particularly popular in international markets and is not typically available in the United States.

Created to cater to those new to single barrel bourbons or those who prefer a milder flavor profile, Blanton's Special Reserve maintains the brand's commitment to quality and craftsmanship. Like its higher-proof counterparts, it is aged in Warehouse H at Buffalo Trace Distillery, the same warehouse favored by Colonel Albert B. Blanton.

The Special Reserve offers a softer, more delicate flavor profile compared to the Original Single Barrel. It features a slightly floral nose with subtle hints of cedar and raisin. On the palate, drinkers can expect a smooth, easy-drinking bourbon with notes of vanilla, caramel, and light oak, balanced by a gentle spiciness.

While it may not have the intensity of other Blanton's expressions, the Special Reserve is valued for its accessibility and smooth character. It's presented in the iconic Blanton's bottle, complete with the signature horse and jockey stopper, making it a sought-after addition for collectors and bourbon enthusiasts, especially those outside the United States.

name: Knob Creek Single Barrel Reserve - Small Batch 9 year - 2022
description: From the distiller: "Our distillers handpick exceptional barrels to be enjoyed in their full, unblended glory."
baxus_class_name: Knob Creek Single Barrel Reserve - Small Batch 9 year - 2022

name: Blanton's Single Barrel 375ml 2022 Bottling
description:
Blanton's Single Barrel Bourbon is a pioneering expression in the world of American whiskey, renowned for being the first commercially available single barrel bourbon. Introduced in 1984 by Elmer T. Lee at Buffalo Trace Distillery, Blanton's has become a benchmark for quality and craftsmanship in the bourbon industry.

Each bottle of Blanton's is drawn from a single barrel, allowing for unique flavor profiles that can vary from one barrel to another. This meticulous process ensures that every release offers a distinct character while maintaining the brand's signature smoothness and complexity. The bourbon is typically aged for six to eight years in charred American oak barrels, which contributes to its rich flavor.

Blanton's is easily recognizable thanks to its iconic bottle design, featuring a distinctive horse and jockey topper that has become a symbol of the brand. The bourbon is available in several variations, including the original 93-proof version, the higher-proof Blanton’s Gold, and the special Reserve edition.

Over the years, Blanton's has garnered a devoted following among whiskey enthusiasts and collectors, often commanding high prices on the secondary market due to its limited availability and consistent quality. Its reputation as a classic bourbon makes it a staple in bars and homes alike, appealing to both seasoned connoisseurs and those new to the world of bourbon.

name: Old Overholt 1940 Bottled In Bond 1945 Bottling
description: An original Old Overholt rye whiskey produced in 1940 at the Broad Ford distillery in West Overton Pennsylvania. This 1940 distilled rye whiskey was matured for 5 years and bottled in bond in 1945 at 100 proof. This 4/5th quart sized bottle was distributed by National Distillers who purchased the Old Overholt brand in 1932. The Broad Ford distillery produced Old Overholt until 1951 when the heavy decline of rye whiskey forced the distillery to close.
baxus_class_name: Old Overholt 1940 Bottled In Bond 1945 Bottling

name: J.B. Beam 1911 Pendennis Club
description: A 1911 release of J.B Beam bourbon whiskey produced by Jim Beam at the original Claremont distillery in Nelson County. This special bottling was done exclusively for the Pendennis Club in Louisville, Kentucky. Pendennis is often referenced as the origin of the Old Fashioned cocktail but there is considerable pushback against this claim, but the club has a long standing history with offering premium cocktails to its members long before the cocktail boom. Although no bottling date is given for this release a number of 1911 batch Pendennis club bottles have been produced and the lack of medicinal notes or tax stamps suggest this was likely bottled prior to prohibition. It also cannot be guaranteed if 1911 is the vintage or bottling era as these bottles were produced as personal offerings for members, so minimal information about vintage or proof were given. The spirit from this release will have been crafted at the original Claremont site for Jim Beam, whilst the distillery was using the Old Tub branding and long before the second distillery was built in the 1950s at Boston, Kentucky.

name: Blanton's Black 2023 Bottling
description:
Blanton's Black Edition is an exclusive variant of the renowned Blanton's bourbon, specifically crafted for the Japanese market. The brand has its roots in the legacy of Colonel Albert B. Blanton, who was instrumental in the development of bourbon at the George T. Stagg Distillery, now known as Buffalo Trace Distillery. In 1984, Master Distiller Elmer T. Lee introduced Blanton's as the world's first commercially available single barrel bourbon, honoring Colonel Blanton's tradition of handpicking "honey barrels" from the center cut of Warehouse H.

The creation of Blanton's Black Edition reflects the brand's commitment to quality and innovation while catering to the preferences of bourbon enthusiasts in Japan. This edition is characterized by its lower proof and extended aging process, which differentiates it from other Blanton's expressions. The Black Edition was designed to provide a smoother and more approachable experience, aligning with the flavor profiles favored in Japanese whisky culture.

Blanton's has become one of the most sought-after bourbons globally, celebrated for its unique packaging and consistent quality. Each bottle features a distinctive horse and jockey stopper, with different positions representing various letters that spell "BLANTON'S." The brand's popularity has only grown over the years, making it a staple among collectors and bourbon aficionados alike.

name: Glenfiddich Centenary 1987 Release
description: A special release from Glenfiddich released in 1987 to celebrate 100 years of production by the famous Speyside distillery. Bottled at 43% Abv on Christmas day in 1986.

name: Wild Turkey 101 Proof 8 Year - 2001
description:
The early 2000s Wild Turkey 101 Proof 8 Year Old bourbon represents a cherished expression from a pivotal time in the distillery's history. Bottled at the iconic 101 proof (50.5% ABV), this age-stated release showcases the depth and complexity that Wild Turkey achieved during a period when aged stocks were still plentiful.

This bourbon offers a rich and robust flavor profile that exemplifies the classic Wild Turkey character. On the nose, it typically presents a harmonious blend of caramel, vanilla, and toasted oak, complemented by hints of dried fruit, leather, and the signature Wild Turkey spice. The palate delivers a full-bodied experience with flavors of butterscotch, dark cherry, and maple syrup, balanced by notes of cinnamon, nutmeg, and a touch of tobacco. The 8-year aging process in heavily charred American oak barrels imparts a noticeable maturity and depth, resulting in a smooth yet complex sip. The finish is long and warming, with lingering notes of vanilla, spice, and a subtle oakiness that doesn't overwhelm. This early 2000s bottling is particularly valued by enthusiasts and collectors, as it represents a time just before significant changes in the bourbon industry led to the phasing out of many age-stated expressions. It serves as a benchmark for the quality and consistency that Master Distiller Jimmy Russell maintained throughout his tenure, showcasing the rich heritage of Wild Turkey bourbon.

name: Jim Beam Hardin's Creek 184 Month Old
description: A 2022 special release from Jim Beam bottled under the Hardin's Creek Jacob's Well label. This edition was matured for 184 months or 15 years and 4 months. This is blended from 15 year old high rye bourbon and 16 year old traditional Jim Beam bourbon.
baxus_class_name: Jim Beam Hardin's Creek 184 Month Old

name: Wild Turkey 8 Year 2010 Bottling
description: An older bottling of Wild Turkey's signature 8 year old age statement bottled at 101 proof in 2010. Older editions of Wild Turkey are particularly sought after amongst enthusiasts, notably for their remarkably different taste profile to modern Wild Turkey bottles. The distillery originally produced bourbon using cypress wood tanks but these were slowly phased out from 1984 until 1990. The other notable production change came in 2004 when the barrel entry proof was changed to 110, up from 107. The combination of these changes have resulted in serious demand for older vintage bottlings from the much loved distillery, with some believing 1990s era bottlings to be the distillery’s best ever.

name: Bruichladdich 29 Year Black Art 10.1
description: The tenth edition of this limited edition series, Black Art Edition 10 encapsulates the enigmatic alchemy of whisky making; with a reliance on nature, craftsmanship and the passing of time. The barley and cask type remain a mystery, with the final recipe undisclosed.    Whisky making is an ancient art, one that has intrigued and captivated for centuries. Black Art 10 is testament to this elusive mastery.     Pulling exclusively from Bruichladdich Distillery pre renaissance casks which have been patiently maturing on our island home for almost three decades, this finite single malt is secretly created by our Head Distiller, Adam Hannett. What happens inside each cask, under the darkness of the warehouse, remains a mystery.   Putting our trust in Adam, he is given complete creative freedom to create this incredible whisky. With no rules and no restrictions, Black Art Edition 10.1 is unique and unrepeatable. A chance to experiment and push the boundaries of possibility, only Adam knows what has gone into crafting the precious 29 year old single malt.  Unpeated and matured in the finest quality oak, this tenth edition of Black Art is a captivating marriage of faith and ingenuity.

name: Hazelburn 2007 15 Year Fresh Sherry Cage Sample
description: A distillery exclusive cask sample of Hazelburn distilled in 2007 and matured for 15 years in a fresh sherry cask. Duty paid samples are commonly referred to as cage samples as they are sold exclusively at the distillery shop from a locked cage. These expressions are cask progress samples that are hand selected by the distillery manager and less than two dozen bottles are usually produced in each cage bottling.
baxus_class_name: Hazelburn 2007 15 Year Fresh Sherry Cage Sample

name: Stillman's Dram Bruichladdich 26 year
description: An exceptional Bruichladdich Single Malt Scotch Whisky from the esteemed Scotland distiller, Bruichladdich Stillmans Dram 26 Year Old Single Malt Scotch Whisky is a high-quality Single Malt Scotch Whisky. This product is bottled at 45% ABV and packaged in a 700ml bottle. Renowned for its distinctive Whiskey character and one of the finest, most discernible styles produced in Scotland, this iteration of Stillmans Dram 26 Year Old Single Malt Scotch Whisky represents the height of Single Malt Scotch Whisky excellence.

name: Trump Super Premium Vodka
description:
Trump Super Premium Vodka is a distinctive spirit that was once associated with the brand of former U.S. President Donald Trump. Created in Holland by Wanders Distillers, this vodka is crafted from select European wheat and undergoes a meticulous production process.

The vodka is distilled five times, with four of these distillations utilizing activated carbon for enhanced purity. Following distillation, it's rested for six months in stainless steel vats, allowing the flavors to meld and develop complexity.

On the nose, Trump Super Premium Vodka offers dry, earthy scents of grain and paraffin, complemented by subtle notes of jasmine, flowers, moss, and a hint of soot. The palate presents a better-than-average grain focus and viscosity, evolving into an off-dry profile with intense breakfast cereal and biscuit-like flavors. The finish is described as oily/creamy with a snack cracker-like quality.

Launched in 2005 with the slogan "Success Distilled," this vodka was initially promoted as a luxury brand aimed at competing with established premium vodkas. However, despite its initial fanfare, Trump Vodka was discontinued in the United States in 2011 due to poor sales performance. It's worth noting that the brand continues to have a presence in certain international markets, particularly in Israel, where it has found popularity around the Jewish holiday of Passover.

name: Booker's 7 Year "Apprentice Batch" 2023 Bottling
description:
Booker's "Apprentice Batch" is the second release in the 2023 Booker's Bourbon Collection, paying homage to the early days of Booker Noe's career at Jim Beam Distillery. This small batch bourbon is named in honor of Booker's apprenticeship under his cousin and mentor, Carl Beam, who guided him in the art of bourbon-making starting in 1952.

Bottled at a robust 125.5 proof (62.75% ABV), Apprentice Batch is aged for 7 years, 1 month, and 2 days. True to Booker's tradition, it is uncut and unfiltered, allowing the full flavor profile to shine through. The batch is a blend of barrels from six different warehouses, showcasing the complexity that comes from varied aging locations within the distillery.

Tasting notes for Apprentice Batch typically include a rich nose with aromas of caramel, vanilla, and oak, complemented by hints of fruit and spice. On the palate, it offers a full-bodied experience with flavors of brown sugar, toasted nuts, and leather, balanced by a warm, spicy finish characteristic of high-proof bourbons.

As with all Booker's releases, Apprentice Batch is a limited edition, highly sought after by bourbon enthusiasts for its bold flavor profile and the story it tells about Booker Noe's journey in bourbon-making. It represents both a tribute to tradition and a showcase of the quality and craftsmanship that defines the Booker's brand.

name: Michter's Shenk's 2023 Release
description: From the producer: "Shenk's Homestead Sour Mash Whiskey honors the legacy of American whiskey figure John Shenk, who in1753 founded a distillery that was to become known as Michter's in the 20th Century. Please join us in toasting and celebrating American Whiskey History."

name: Vintage Rye 23 Year
description: Kentucky Bourbon Distillers and sourced from Willett Distillery. This is super high age for a rye, difficult to find, secret backstory given it's sourced.  On the nose, there is tobacco, burnt wood, rich vanilla, and caramel. Robust and fairly complex. On the front, there are many wood flavors - old wood, tobacco, cigar box, burnt caramel, and vanilla. A mix of dark chocolate, a hint of leather, and the tail end of a cigar at the finish, which is rather long and complex.

name: Macallan Classic Cut 2022
description:
Macallan Classic Cut 2022 is a limited-edition single malt Scotch whisky from the esteemed Macallan Distillery, renowned for its commitment to quality and craftsmanship. Bottled at 52.5% ABV, this expression showcases the distillery's signature sherry cask influence and rich flavor profile. The Classic Cut series is designed to highlight the distillery's unique character and craftsmanship, with each release offering a distinct interpretation of Macallan's celebrated style.

The 2022 release reflects the distillery's dedication to using exceptional oak casks, which impart deep flavors and complexity to the whisky. Macallan's Classic Cut expressions are typically celebrated for their balance of sweetness, spice, and rich fruit characteristics. As a limited release, this whisky appeals to collectors and enthusiasts alike, making it a highly sought-after addition to any whisky collection. The Macallan Classic Cut 2022 exemplifies the brand's legacy while inviting drinkers to experience the depth and richness that defines Macallan single malts.

name: Very Olde St. Nick Harvest Rye - Cask Strength
description: Each expression is made in 3 barrel batches. Utilizing a variety of rare rye whiskies, this bottling is meant to celebrate the annual fall harvest season. Uncut, unfiltered, and bottled at cask strength.
baxus_class_name: Very Olde St. Nick Harvest Rye - Cask Strength

name: Stillman's Dram Tamnavulin 24 Year
description: Nose: Initial whiffs of alcohol, then soon the smoke and a very pleasant mix of dryness and sweetness. After some times it evolves with banana and some orange zests.  Taste: Round, really well balanced, dry. A little bit too light (not weak) in the middle, but remarkably clean and balanced. Citrus (lemon, orange) and dry wine clearly come out.  Finish: Definitely long, sweet and clean. It comes out more clearly the wood (even some resin). The lemon and the orange never leave your palate.

name: Glenglassaugh 2012 Knife & Fiddle Private Select Bottled 2018
description: A 2012 vintage expression of Glenglassaugh chosen by Knife & Fiddle. This release was likely bottled from a single cask in 2018 and is a private cask release, not typically available for resell. Bottled at 47% Abv with 264 bottles produced.

name: Cameronbridge 1978 32 Year Single Cask #11 Duncan Taylor

name: Dallas Dhu 1981 29 Year Single Cask #388 Duncan Taylor
description: Distilled at Dallas Dhu in April 1981 and aged for 29 years in cask 388 before bottling by Duncan Taylor in May 2010 as part of a release of 271 individually numbered, cask strength bottles.
baxus_class_name: Dallas Dhu 1981 29 Year Single Cask #388 Duncan Taylor

name: Weller Full Proof Single Barrel Select
description:
Weller Full Proof Single Barrel Select is a premium expression from Buffalo Trace Distillery's renowned Weller line of wheated bourbons. This offering showcases the full potential of individual barrels, bottled at a robust 114 proof (57% ABV) without chill filtration. As a single barrel selection, each bottle represents the unique characteristics of its source barrel, providing a one-of-a-kind tasting experience that can vary subtly between selections.

Typically chosen by retailers, bars, or whiskey clubs, Weller Full Proof Single Barrel Select allows connoisseurs to explore the nuances of Buffalo Trace's wheated bourbon mashbill at its full, uncut strength. While not age-stated, these selections are generally aged for 5 to 8 years, developing a complex flavor profile that balances the sweetness of wheat with the depth of well-aged bourbon.

The Full Proof expression is particularly prized for its intensity and rich mouthfeel, offering a more robust experience compared to other Weller offerings. Its high proof and lack of chill filtration preserve the bourbon's natural oils and flavor compounds, resulting in a full-bodied whiskey that showcases the distillery's craftsmanship. Due to its limited availability and the reputation of the Weller brand, Weller Full Proof Single Barrel Select has become highly sought after by bourbon enthusiasts, often commanding premium prices and generating significant excitement when released.
baxus_class_name: Weller Full Proof Single Barrel Select

name: Hibiki Blender's Choice - 2018
description: Introduced in 1989, the Hibiki range of whiskies from Suntory consists of phenomenal blends of different Japanese whiskies. The Hibiki Blender's Choice from Suntory in Japan is described as a harmonious blend of the finest selection of diverse whiskies.

name: Wilderness Trail Single Barrel Bourbon
description:
Wilderness Trail Single Barrel Bourbon is a meticulously crafted expression that showcases the distillery's commitment to quality and innovation in Kentucky whiskey-making.

This high-rye bourbon is distilled using Wilderness Trail's unique sweet mash process. This technique, while more challenging to execute consistently, results in a cleaner, more nuanced spirit that sets it apart from many traditional Kentucky bourbons.

On the nose, the bourbon offers a complex bouquet of aromas. Rich caramel and vanilla notes mingle with fresh orchard fruits, particularly apple and peach. There's an intriguing undercurrent of baked bread and licorice, adding depth and complexity to the olfactory experience.

The palate is bold and flavorful, with an initial burst of sweetness from honey and caramel. This is quickly followed by layers of cinnamon, nutmeg, and black pepper spice. The high rye content shines through, providing a pleasant herbal quality and a touch of grassiness. Despite its relative youth, the bourbon displays a surprising fruitiness and depth of flavor.

It offers a full-bodied mouthfeel with a pleasant warmth that doesn't overwhelm. The finish is long and satisfying, with lingering notes of oak, vanilla, and a subtle hint of dark chocolate.

Wilderness Trail Single Barrel Bourbon demonstrates the distillery's expertise in fermentation and distillation, resulting in a whiskey that punches above its age. It offers bourbon enthusiasts a chance to experience a meticulously crafted, unique expression of Kentucky bourbon that balances traditional flavors with innovative production methods.

name: Bowmore 25 Year Pre-2007 Bottling
description: A pre-2007 era bottling of Bowmore matured for 25 years and bottled at 43% Abv. This seagull's label was used from the late 1990s/early 2000s until it was redesigned in 2007.

name: Glenlochy 1979 Rare Old Bottled 2012 Gordon & Macphail
description: A 1979 vintage small batch expression of Glenlochy, the demolished Highland distillery located just opposite Ben Nevis in Fort William. Bottled in 2012 as part of the "rare old" label from Gordon & Macphail at 46% Abv.
baxus_class_name: Glenlochy 1979 Rare Old Bottled 2012 Gordon & Macphail

name: Weller Single Barrel
description:
W.L. Weller Single Barrel is a premium expression from the renowned Weller line of wheated bourbons, produced by Buffalo Trace Distillery in Frankfort, Kentucky. Introduced in 2020, this release expanded the Weller portfolio, offering bourbon enthusiasts a single barrel experience of the beloved wheated recipe. Bottled at a consistent 97 proof (48.5% ABV), this expression strikes a balance between approachability and intensity, showcasing the unique characteristics of individual barrels.

Each bottle of W.L. Weller Single Barrel comes from a single, hand-selected barrel, ensuring a unique tasting experience that can vary subtly between selections. While not age-stated, the bourbon is typically aged for several years, allowing it to develop complexity while maintaining the smooth, wheat-forward profile that Weller is known for. The single barrel format highlights the nuances in flavor that can occur between barrels, offering connoisseurs the opportunity to explore the depth of Weller's craftsmanship.

Named after William Larue Weller, who pioneered the use of wheat instead of rye in the bourbon mash bill, this expression continues his legacy of producing smooth, flavorful whiskey. W.L. Weller Single Barrel has quickly become a sought-after bottle among bourbon enthusiasts, praised for its rich flavor profile and the unique experience it offers with each barrel selection. Its limited availability and connection to the highly regarded Weller lineage have cemented its status as a prized addition to many whiskey collections.

name: Glenmorangie Traditional 57.2% 10 Year
description: From The Distiller: This handcrafted Glenmorangie malt whisky is matured for 10 years and comes straight from casks of mountain oak at its traditional strength without any chill filtering. At the strength of 57.2% the bouquet is robust but distinctly GLENMORANGIE. The addition of a little water releases a fascinating range of subtle aromas: cloves, vanilla, honey and citrus fruits all entwined with a hint of peat smoke. GLENMORANGIE 'TRADITIONAL' - malt whisky in its original and most natural form.

name: Glen Grant 1967 33 Year Single Cask Douglas Laing
description: A 1967 vintage single cask expression of Glen Grant matured for a huge 33 years. Bottled from a single barrel this release comes from Douglas Laing as part of their Old Malt Cask series at their signature strength of 50% Abv. This cask hails from an era when Glen Grant had just four stills.
baxus_class_name: Glen Grant 1967 33 Year Single Cask Douglas Laing

name: E.H. Taylor, Jr. Barrel Proof Rye
description:
Buffalo Trace Distillery's Colonel E.H. Taylor, Jr. Barrel Proof Rye Whiskey is an exciting new addition to the esteemed E.H. Taylor lineup, released in June 2024. This uncut, unfiltered rye expression pays homage to Colonel Taylor's legacy of innovation and quality in American whiskey production.

Bottled at a robust 126 proof (63% ABV), this rye whiskey offers a bold and complex flavor profile. On the nose, it presents aromas of white pepper and nutty undertones, complemented by fresh floral notes and hints of candied apricot. The palate delivers a harmonious balance of sweet dried stone fruit and peppery spice, with an underlying oakiness that adds depth and structure.

The finish is notably long and satisfying, starting with a full-bodied sweetness reminiscent of honey before transitioning to a complex interplay of spices and oak. This barrel proof offering showcases the true character of Buffalo Trace's rye whiskey, allowing enthusiasts to experience it in its purest form.

As the 13th release in the Colonel E.H. Taylor, Jr. Collection, this whiskey continues the tradition of excellence associated with the brand. It's presented in the iconic E.H. Taylor canister, featuring a vintage label that nods to the whiskey's historical roots.
baxus_class_name: E.H. Taylor, Jr. Barrel Proof Rye

name: Compass Box The Circus
description: "The Circus" by Compass Box is a limited edition blended Scotch whisky, with only 2,490 bottles released worldwide. This unique blend is characterized by a lithe frame and opulent mouthfeel, showcasing the softness of mature grain and the complexity of aged blended Scotch. It presents a rich tapestry of dried fruit character, luscious maltiness, and notes of almond and hazelnut. Bottled in March 2016 at 49% ABV, it is not chill-filtered and maintains its natural color. The blend comprises old parcels of blended Scotch and grain whisky, aged pre-blended in cask for many years, resulting in a seamless and complex profile. The specific distilleries involved in these blends remain undisclosed, emphasizing the unique and extraordinary nature of the whisky itself. This whisky is recommended for celebrations and one-of-a-kind events, embodying the ephemeral and precious nature of special moments.

name: Macallan Sherry Oak 30 Year Pre-2006 Bottling
description: A 2004-2006 era bottling of Macallan's huge 30 year age stated sherry oak expression. This design was launched in 2004 and was discontinued in 2006 before later returning in 2010. This small window of release years makes this pre-2006 quite a rarity amongst Macallan collectors. Distilled in the later 1970s this 30 year sherry oak hails from the golden era of Macallan production, with the use of golden promise barley and only the highest possible quality sherry casks used.
baxus_class_name: Macallan Sherry Oak 30 Year Pre-2006 Bottling

name: Craigellachie Small Batch 33 Year - 2018
description: This rare and fine 33 year old Craigellachie Single Malt Scotch Whiskey from Speyside started life in worm tub condensers which are guaranteed to produce complex character driven spirits. Meaty you might say!  The barley is oil-fired in the kiln adding more flavour to the profile.  For 33 years, this amazing whisky has slept inside bourbon hogshead barrels and sherry casks which have refined, toned down and balanced out the flavours.

name: Heaven Hill 12 Year Cadenhead's
description: A 12 year old american bourbon from heaven hill bottled in scotland by Cadenhead's.

name: Bruichladdich Rare Cask 27 Year - 2017
description: Bruichladdich 27 Years Old Rare Cask Series 1990 is a limited-edition Islay single malt. It was distilled in 1990 and left to age in ex-bourbon casks for 17 years. In 2007, Master Distiller Jim McEwan transferred the spirit into French wine casks from a legendary chateau of the highest provenance. After another 10 years, the whisky was bottled in 2017 at 49.5% ABV. The fine French oak has added layers of buttered toast complexity to the caramel and vanilla notes of the American oak. A rare and exceptionally aged Bruichladdich single malt.

name: Heaven Hill Select Stock - 44828
description: Shortly after Prohibition ended in the United States, Heaven Hill Distilleries, Inc., was founded in Bardstown, Kentucky by the Shapira family to produce and market Bourbon and premium American Whiskeys. At the time, it was as speculative a new business venture as the dot com start-ups of the 1990's - a company founded with no brands, no available stocks of Whiskey, and at the height of the Great Depression. Today, the company is the largest independent, family-owned and operated distilled spirits supplier in the country. According to industry analysts, Heaven Hill is now the fifth-largest spirits supplier in the United States and second largest holder of aging Bourbon Whiskey in the world with an inventory in excess of 1,600,000 barrels.

name: Sherbrook 14 Year Barrel Proof Rye Batch 3
description: A legacy brand of rye whiskey, Sherbrook is a historical label produced by various distilleries throughout its history. This revived label is a 14 year old expression of 95/5 Indiana rye whiskey bottled at a barrel proof of 54.9% Abv. Sherbrook was traditionally a Maryland produced rye but has also been produced in Illinois.
baxus_class_name: Sherbrook 14 Year Barrel Proof Rye Batch 3

name: Milam & Greene Single Barrel Bourbon #518 White-Tailed Buck
description: A single barrel bourbon sourced from Tennessee bottled at a huge 65.6% Abv. Bottled by Miam & Greene this barrel is a part of their wildlife collection and is named the white-tailed buck.
baxus_class_name: Milam & Greene Single Barrel Bourbon #518 White-Tailed Buck

name: Madam Whiskey
description: A blended American whiskey from Republic Restoratives distillery, a woman owned and operated spirits producer. This Madam release celebrates the 2020 inauguration of America’s first female vice president Kamala Harris. The whiskey is a blend of 8 year bourbon and 6 year rye bottled at 46% Abv.

name: Heaven Hill Select Stock 4826 - 2013
description: This particular batch of select stock features a silver wax top seal. The whiskey is8 year old wheated bourbon finished in cognac barrels for 19 months.

name: Springbank 1996 23 Year Single Cask #156 Calvert Woodley
description: Distilled in Campbeltown at Springbank distillery, this release was bottled by Calvert Woodley for sale on the American market. This expression was distilled in 1996 and was put down to mature in a single oak cask for 23 years. Part of a limited release of 408 bottles, this whisky has been bottled free from chill filtration at a strength of 42.5% abv.
baxus_class_name: Springbank 1996 23 Year Single Cask #156 Calvert Woodley

name: Garrison Brothers Cowboy Bourbon 2023 Release
description: Distilled in 2017 this highly praised Texas bourbon was bottled in 2023 at a monster hazmat strength of 70.45% Abv. Cowboy bourbon is crafted from barrels earmarked as the distillery's best, carefully pulling them aside for this annual offering.

name: Ardbeg Scorch Committee Release
description: A 2021 special edition release from Ardbeg exclusive to members of the Ardbeg Committee. This edition was matured in heavily charred bourbon casks and bottled at 51.7% Abv.

name: Clase Azul Sarabia "Dos Pesos"
description:
The Clase Azul Tequila Encuentros by Eduardo Sarabia is a limited edition release that beautifully marries the art of tequila-making with contemporary Mexican art. This collaboration showcases Clase Azul's commitment to celebrating Mexican culture and craftsmanship.

The decanter itself is a work of art, designed by renowned Mexican-American artist Eduardo Sarabia. It comes in two variations: the Dorado edition, which features decorative elements accentuated with lustrous 24-karat gold, and a second version with its own unique artistic flair. These hand-crafted decanters serve as stunning centerpieces that reflect the premium nature of the tequila within.

The tequila inside is described as having a pale gold color with golden highlights. On the nose, it offers aromas of agave nectar, walnut, tangerine peel, and light herbal undertones. The palate continues these flavors, presenting notes of agave nectar, spearmint, and ripe tangerine. The finish is long, with earthy tones and a toasted walnut character.

This limited edition release exemplifies Clase Azul's philosophy of showcasing Mexican artistry both in its presentation and in the quality of the tequila itself. The collaboration with Eduardo Sarabia adds an extra layer of exclusivity and artistic value to an already premium product, making it a coveted item for both tequila enthusiasts and art collectors alike.

name: Evan Williams 2008 Single Barrel Bottled 2016
description:
Evan Williams Single Barrel Vintage 2008, bottled in 2016, is a distinguished expression from Heaven Hill Distillery that showcases the art of single barrel bourbon production. As the only vintage-dated single barrel bourbon on the market, this release offers a unique tasting experience that captures a specific moment in time.

Distilled in 2008 and aged for approximately 8 years before bottling in 2016, this bourbon has developed a complex flavor profile during its maturation in American white oak barrels. Bottled at 86.6 proof (43.3% ABV), it strikes a balance between flavor intensity and approachability.

On the nose, this vintage likely presents aromas of caramel, vanilla, and oak, complemented by hints of dried fruits and subtle spices. The palate may offer flavors of honey, toasted nuts, and cinnamon, with undertones of leather and tobacco. The finish is expected to be smooth and lingering, with a pleasant warmth and notes of oak and sweet corn.

Each bottle of Evan Williams Single Barrel Vintage is marked with the date it was put into oak, the bottling year, and the exact barrel number, allowing enthusiasts to trace the bourbon's journey from grain to glass. This attention to detail and transparency has made the Evan Williams Single Barrel Vintage series a favorite among bourbon connoisseurs and collectors alike.

name: Oakley Spirits 20 Year Single Barrel First Release
description: The first release from Oakley Spirits, a brand inspired by the boundary breaking Annie Oakley, this 20 year old single barrel bourbon was sourced from an esteemed Kentucky distillery in Louisville. This single barrel was carefully nurtured by founder Molly Kingston who was able to secure stocks of well aged Kentucky bourbon, waiting until this barrel was at its absolute peak of maturity. This first release is being launched on Baxus in collaboration with Oakley spirits and Iridia. As part of this release Iridia has developed unique technology allowing each bottle to be embedded with its own digital molecular signatures. This industry leading anti-fraud will help to guarantee each individual bottle is legitimate.
baxus_class_name: Oakley Spirits 20 Year Single Barrel First Release

name: Ardbeg Supernova SN2015 Committee Release
description: Ardbeg, in case you didn't know, sent some maturing spirit into space. Or, more accurately, tubes of "Ardbeg-crafted molecules" that also contained sticks of charred oak. The idea was to compare their interactions to those of control samples on earth.  To celebrate the conclusion of Ardbeg’s experiment in space, it released this final Committee release of the super-duper-peated Supernova single malt. At 100PPM (phenolic content measured in parts per million) compared to Ardbeg's usual 55PPM, this was one of the most heavily-peated whiskies in the world back when it was released.

name: Springbank 24 Year Single Private Cask #309 Florentine's
description: It was mid 1993. Florentine’s uncle was awaiting his first niece. Back then, he lived in Scotland and enjoyed the beautiful surroundings. With his big passion for whisky, especially for the famous Springbank Distillery in Campbeltown, he decided to buy his future niece a very exclusive gift. From the day she was born, she would be the owner of the Springbank cask 409. However, she wouldn’t be allowed to have access to the cask until she turned 21 years old.  After the whisky was able to ripen in the cask for 24 years, she decided to take further action with this unique product. In June 2017, the whisky was bottled with a personalized label, and was shipped to The Netherlands.
baxus_class_name: Springbank 24 Year Single Private Cask #309 Florentine's

name: Linkwood 2008 12 Year Single Barrique #1805478 DS Tayman
description: A 2008 vintage single cask expression of Linkwood matured in a hogshead for 12 years and finished in a Bordeaux red wine barrique. Bottled in 2021 at 53.36% Abv by DS Tayman.
baxus_class_name: Linkwood 2008 12 Year Single Barrique #1805478 DS Tayman

name: Johnnie Walker Oldest '90s
description:
The history of Blue Label can be drawn back further than its official release in 1992. Johnnie Walker’s Oldest pays more than a passing resemblance to what would go on to become one of the world’s most famous whiskies. And indeed, the makeup of this forerunner expression, noted as containing whiskies aged up to 60 years, and rumoured to included liquids from DCL’s (the forerunner to Diageo) distilleries Port Ellen and Brora have led to persistent rumours about the actual composition of Blue Label decades later– most of which increasingly don’t stand up to scrutiny.

The development of Blue Label is alleged to have stemmed from Alexander Walker’s (son of Johnnie Walker) “Old Highland Whisky” created in 1867 whose composition contained whiskies from “the four corners of Scotland”. A romantic notion for a product released over 100 years later, but still holding some water given the diversity of Diageo’s distillery portfolio and its geographic disparity.

You’ll already have noted that this Blue Label – named “Highest Awards” due to the text listing a selection of competition wins (the expression wasn’t always quite so well known) – is bottled at 43% ABV. This is not a one-off aberration similar to some of the ‘Casks Editions’ of Blue Label that are also offered at a higher (considerably) ABV. No – back in the day, Johnnie Walker Blue Label was simply bottled at this slightly higher alcoholic strength – likely as a market differential to the other JW bottles within the range.

Nose: White grapes and green apple slices sit alongside crunchy toffee. Developing in the glass, dry earthiness, tobacco leaf and rose petals present together with sunflower oil and touch of dried mango.

Taste: Holds its stated ABV well with a selection of waxes and oils, all of which provide body and structure. Antique orange liqueurs and cinnamon spiced toffee are joined by old style sherry, sour pineapple chunks and sponge. The mid and back palate brings additional oakiness together with a citric pang and shaving of stem ginger.

Finish: Medium in length with a selection of syrupy tinned fruits and drying, somewhat tannic wood.

Compared to its present-day manifestation, this 90s Blue Label feels less refined and polished. But what is lacks in elegance, it more than makes up with in character. Vibrancy, structure and cohesion are offered alongside occasional welcome asides into either the distillate base or cask constituents. And whilst none of this feels particularly intricate it still manages to offer a uniqueness that has been either lost or deliberately discarded from this bottling over the decades. The additional 3% ABV doesn’t feel significantly more generous in the mouth than the current day Blue Label – however the malt base most certainly includes weightier elements which really ground the expression in terms of its ‘feel’ – never anything less than “smooth”, but with plenty of presence throughout.

name: Linkwood 2007 12 Year Single Wine Cask #180803906 DS Tayman
description: A first edition release from independent bottler DS Tayman. This cask from Linkwood was distilled in 2007 and matured for 12 years in a refill bourbon barrel. It was then recasked into a Galil Mountain wine barrel and bottled in December 2019 at 46% Abv.
baxus_class_name: Linkwood 2007 12 Year Single Wine Cask #180803906 DS Tayman

name: The Blend Of Nikka Maltbase 17 Year
description: The Blend of Nikka Maltbase Whisky 17 Years Old 660mL - This super rare and luxurious 17 year old blended whisky is made with malt as it’s primary ingredient. Using malt whisky rather than grain whisky as a base has allowed Nikka to create a blended whisky with the distinctive character found in malt-only whiskies. This whisky gives drinkers both the unique attributes of malt whisky, such as nose and palate, and the smooth drinkability of grain whisky. The Nikka Malt Base 17 year old whisky will appeal to connoisseurs and collectors of Japanese whiskies.
baxus_class_name: The Blend Of Nikka Maltbase 17 Year

name: Four Roses 6 Year
description: An old Four Roses Yellow Label bottle that likely dates back to the 1970s. This bourbon has aged until bottling for a full 6 years.

name: Macallan 12 Year Single Cask #19 Montrose & Son
description: A 12 year old expression of Macallan bottled from a single cask by Montrose & Son. Imported for the US market, single cask #19 was bottled at 47.1% Abv and features in Montrose's Fine & Rare label.
baxus_class_name: Macallan 12 Year Single Cask #19 Montrose & Son

name: Booker's Little Book: The Infinite Edition 1
description:
Booker's Little Book: The Infinite is an exceptional and innovative release from the James B. Beam Distilling Co., crafted by 8th Generation Master Distiller Freddie Noe. This inaugural edition marks the beginning of a new series within the Little Book family, honoring over two centuries of Beam and Noe family whiskey-making heritage.

The Infinite: Edition 1 is a unique blend of Kentucky Straight Bourbon Whiskeys, each component carefully selected from barrels laid down by three generations of Master Distillers: Booker Noe, Fred Noe, and Freddie Noe himself. This multi-generational approach creates a complex and harmonious flavor profile that showcases the best of each distiller's craft.

Bottled at a robust 59.65% ABV, this uncut and unfiltered bourbon offers a rich tapestry of aromas and flavors. On the nose, expect notes of charred oak and dark stone fruits, while the palate reveals layers of vanilla, caramel, brown sweets, and a subtle hint of smoke. The blend includes whiskeys aged up to 20 years, contributing depth and maturity to the overall profile.

What sets The Infinite apart is its concept of continuous evolution. Each year, Freddie Noe plans to add new whiskey to the blend, creating an ever-changing expression that honors the past while looking to the future. This innovative approach ensures that each
baxus_class_name: Booker's Little Book: The Infinite Edition 1

name: Parker's Heritage Collection 14 Year
description:
Parker's Heritage Collection 14 Year Old Heavy Toast Cognac Finish is a distinguished release from Heaven Hill Distillery, showcasing their expertise in innovative barrel finishing techniques. This 18th edition in the series features a Kentucky Straight Malt Whiskey aged for 14 years, then finished in heavily toasted cognac barrels.

Bottled at 107 proof (53.5% ABV), this expression offers a full-bodied and complex tasting experience. 

On the nose, this whiskey presents rich aromas of molasses and bittersweet chocolate, complemented by notes of cloves and nutmeg. The palate is described as velvety, featuring flavors that mirror the nose with additional depth from the cognac barrel influence. The finish is long and satisfying, with a perfect balance of sweetness, spice, and oak influence.

As with all Parker's Heritage Collection releases, a portion of the proceeds from each bottle sold is donated to ALS research and patient care, honoring the legacy of late Master Distiller Parker Beam.

name: Ardbeg Perpetuum
description: A 2015 limited release from Ardbeg crafted from both young and old spirit. This release celebrates the 200th anniversary of the distillery and was crafted from bourbon and sherry matured spirit from before the distillery's 1990s closure and more recent younger whsky.

name: Smoke Wagon Winter Oak
description: A small batch release from Nevada based bottler Smoke Wagon. This experimental batch was crafted from 20% 11 year old bourbon, 26% 9 year old bourbon, 13% 7 year old bourbon and 41% 5 year old bourbon. This limited batch was bottled at 57.97% Abv with just 1527 bottles produced.

name: Heaven Hill 2009 12 Year Single Cask Liquid Treasures
description: A 2009 vintage single cask expression of Heaven Hill matured for 12 years. Bottled in 2021 at 53.5% Abv by Liquid Treasures. The 2009 parcel of Heaven Hill casks are rumoured to either be primarily corn whiskey or bourbon that has been primarily aged in Europe, hence the lighter colour of this release.
baxus_class_name: Heaven Hill 2009 12 Year Single Cask Liquid Treasures

name: Three Ships 6 Year Chenin Blanc Finish
description: A 6 year old expression of South African whisky from Three Ships finished in Chenin Blanc wine casks and bottled at 46.3% Abv.
baxus_class_name: Three Ships 6 Year Chenin Blanc Finish

name: Irish Mist Liqueur
description:
Irish Mist Liqueur is a celebrated Irish whiskey-based liqueur that combines the rich traditions of Irish distillation with a unique blend of honey, herbs, and spices. First produced in 1947 at the Tullamore Distillery in County Offaly, it holds the distinction of being the first liqueur made in Ireland. The recipe is rooted in an ancient tradition of heather wine, which was enjoyed by chieftains and nobles for centuries. This historical connection adds a layer of depth to the liqueur, making it not just a drink but a taste of Ireland's storied past.

Crafted from aged Irish whiskey, Irish Mist features a harmonious balance of flavors, including the sweetness of clover and heather honey complemented by aromatic herbs. The result is a smooth and rich liqueur with a deep golden hue, perfect for sipping neat or mixing into cocktails. Its versatility has made it popular in various drinks, from classic whiskey cocktails to modern mixes. With its heritage and quality, Irish Mist continues to be a favorite among those who appreciate the artistry of Irish liqueurs.

name: Wild Turkey 8 Year 70th Anniversary 2024 Release
description: A 2024 special release of Wild Turkey's signature 8 year old expression bottled at 101 proof. This release celebrates the 70th anniversary of master distiller Jimmy Russell, the world's longest serving master distiller. This release was crafted from 8 to 9 year old bourbon sourced from Jimmy's favourite rickhouses. Jimmy has always believe that Wild Turkey tastes best at 8 years and at 101 proof, committing to that style of bourbon for much of the 20th century. This release is a return to the much loved style of WIld Turkey that Jimmy helped to make world famous.

name: Mauritius 11 Year Batch 1 That Boutique-y Rum Company
description: The first batch of rum from this secret Mauritius distillery aged for 11 years. Crafted on a column still it was bottled at 61.7% Abv by That Boutique-y Rum Company.
baxus_class_name: Mauritius 11 Year Batch 1 That Boutique-y Rum Company

name: Old Bushmills
description:
Old Bushmills Whiskey hails from the Old Bushmills Distillery, the oldest licensed whiskey distillery in the world, located in the picturesque village of Bushmills, County Antrim, Northern Ireland. Established in 1784, the distillery has a rich history intertwined with the craft of whiskey-making, producing a range of exceptional Irish whiskeys that have garnered international acclaim. The distillery is known for its commitment to quality and tradition, utilizing pure water sourced from the nearby Saint Columb's Rill, which flows through the lush landscapes of the region.

Visitors to the distillery can explore its storied past and witness the meticulous production process firsthand. The distillery offers guided tours that delve into the art of whiskey-making, showcasing the triple distillation method that gives Bushmills its signature smoothness. With a welcoming atmosphere and an emphasis on heritage, Old Bushmills Distillery attracts whiskey enthusiasts from around the globe, inviting them to experience the warmth and charm of this historic site while enjoying tastings of their renowned offerings. The legacy of Old Bushmills is not just about producing whiskey; it’s about celebrating a time-honored tradition that has stood the test of centuries.

name: Heaven Hill Grain to Glass Wheated 2024 Release
description:
Heaven Hill Grain to Glass 2024 release is an innovative and meticulously crafted series that showcases the distillery's commitment to quality and transparency from seed to bottle. This inaugural release features three distinct expressions: a Kentucky Straight Bourbon Whiskey, a Kentucky Straight Wheated Bourbon Whiskey, and a Kentucky Straight Rye Whiskey.

Each expression in the series uses a unique corn varietal, Beck's 6158, developed in collaboration with Beck's Hybrids and grown locally by Peterson Farms within a few miles of Heaven Hill's facilities in Nelson County, Kentucky. This focus on locally sourced, high-starch corn sets the foundation for a truly grain-to-glass experience.

The Wheated Bourbon, bottled at a robust 121 proof, uses a mash bill of 52% corn, 35% wheat, and 13% malted barley. This expression pushes the boundaries of Heaven Hill's traditional wheated bourbon recipes, resulting in a rich and complex flavor profile.
baxus_class_name: Heaven Hill Grain to Glass Wheated 2024 Release

name: E.J. Curley Single Barrel
description:
