EJ Curley Single Barrel is a distinctive bourbon whiskey that showcases the artistry of Master Blender Ashley Barnes. This expression is part of a limited release, with each batch offering a unique tasting experience that highlights the most exceptional characteristics of the brand.

Bottled at a robust proof, this bourbon delivers a bold and flavorful profile. On the nose, it presents an enticing blend of peanut brittle, cinnamon, and vanilla, complemented by notes of dates and dried stone fruits. The palate is equally complex, featuring a harmonious mix of sweet and spicy elements. Rye-forward notes of peppermint oil and earthy spices make themselves known, while hints of chocolate add depth to the flavor profile.

As the whiskey develops on the palate, a youthful vibrancy becomes apparent, adding an interesting dimension to the overall experience. The finish is long and satisfying, offering a delightful combination of raisins, cherries, and dates, intertwined with cinnamon and peppermint from the rye influence. Lingering notes of oak and nut butter round out the experience, leaving a lasting impression.

EJ Curley Single Barrel represents a bourbon that balances complexity with drinkability, making it a standout choice for enthusiasts seeking a unique and memorable whiskey experience.

name: Elijah Craig Toasted Rye
description:
Elijah Craig Toasted Rye is a unique expression from Heaven Hill Distillery that elevates traditional rye whiskey through a specialized finishing process. This rye whiskey begins as fully matured Elijah Craig Straight Rye, which is then re-entered into custom toasted new oak barrels designed in collaboration with Independent Stave Company.

Bottled at 94 proof (47% ABV), Elijah Craig Toasted Rye offers a rich and complex flavor profile. On the nose, expect enticing aromas of toasted oak, crème brûlée, and hints of almonds and hazelnuts. The palate is characterized by a soft, creamy mouthfeel, featuring flavors of milk chocolate and subtle baking spices that create a delightful balance.

The finishing process imparts additional layers of sweetness and complexity, enhancing the classic rye spice without overwhelming it. The finish is softly warming, with lingering notes of drawn-out spices that invite another sip.

This expression showcases Heaven Hill's commitment to innovation while maintaining the integrity of traditional rye whiskey. Elijah Craig Toasted Rye stands out as a flavorful and approachable option for both rye enthusiasts and those new to the category.

name: The Senator 6 Year - 2022
description:
The Senator 6 Year Rye, bottled exclusively for BAXUS in 2022, stands out as a remarkable expression of craftsmanship and tradition in the world of rye whiskey. With an impressive alcohol by volume (ABV) of 59.75%, this release showcases the bold character that enthusiasts have come to expect from The Senator brand. Each bottle captures the essence of a meticulously aged rye, offering a unique profile that reflects both its heritage and the expertise behind its production.

This limited-edition rye whiskey has been carefully aged for six years, allowing it to develop a complex flavor profile that balances rich spices with subtle sweetness. The high proof enhances the whiskey's robust character, delivering notes of caramel, vanilla, and a hint of oak that are beautifully intertwined with classic rye spiciness. The Senator 6 Year Rye is not just a drink; it is an experience that invites drinkers to savor each sip and appreciate its depth and richness.

Bottled in 2022, this exclusive release is a testament to the growing popularity of rye whiskey and its resurgence in craft distilling. With only a select number of bottles available, collectors and connoisseurs alike will find this offering to be a prized addition to their collections. Whether enjoyed neat or in a cocktail, The Senator 6 Year Rye promises to deliver a memorable tasting experience that reflects the quality and dedication inherent in every drop.

name: Augusta River Proof - 2024
description:
The River Proof Series from Augusta Distillery embodies the rich heritage and craftsmanship of Kentucky bourbon, offering a unique "bottle-your-own" experience that allows visitors to engage with the distillation process firsthand. Inspired by the historic significance of the Ohio River, which played a pivotal role in the development of bourbon culture, this series invites enthusiasts to capture and cork their own bottles, creating a personal connection to the distillery's storied past. Located in the charming town of Augusta, Kentucky, Augusta Distillery not only produces high-quality bourbons but also fosters a sense of community and adventure among its guests.

Each bottle in the River Proof Series is crafted with meticulous attention to detail, showcasing the distillery's commitment to traditional methods while incorporating modern innovations. The bourbons are characterized by their complex flavors and smooth textures, culminating in a long, warming finish that reflects the quality of the ingredients and craftsmanship involved. This series serves as a celebration of both the past and present, allowing bourbon lovers to savor an authentic experience that highlights the essence of Kentucky bourbon culture.

name: Macallan 2002 19 Year Single Cask #1176 Speymalt Gordon & Macphail
description: A 2002 vintage single cask expression of Macallan matured for 19 years in a sherry cask. It was bottled in 2021 at a cask strength of 58.3% Abv. Gordon & Macphail spent much of the 20th century as the bottlers for Macallan’s spirit and as such have amassed quite an archive of the esteemed Speyside distillery’s liquid. The Speymalt label features both young and old small batch and single cask releases from Macallan.
baxus_class_name: Macallan 2002 19 Year Single Cask #1176 Speymalt Gordon & Macphail

name: Nikka Gold & Gold Sapporo Winter Olympic Games 1972 Bottling
description: A 1970s era bottling of Nikka's Gold & Gold blend crafted from malt whisky likely imported from Scotland as well as domestically produced. Gold & Gold first saw release in 1968 and was primarily for the export market, with much of the outturn destined for the USA. This special edition was bottled to celebrate the 1972 Sapporo winter olympics.
baxus_class_name: Nikka Gold & Gold Sapporo Winter Olympic Games 1972 Bottling

name: Nikka Gold & Gold World Environment Commemorative Bottle
description: An older era bottling of Nikka's Gold & Gold blend crafted from malt whisky likely imported from Scotland as well as domestically produced. Gold & Gold first saw release in 1968 and was primarily for the export market, with much of the outturn destined for the USA.
series: Gold & Gold World Environment Commemorative Bottle
baxus_class_name: Nikka Gold & Gold World Environment Commemorative Bottle

name: Copperworks 3 Year Double Cask Single Cask Nation
description: A 3 year old expression of Copperworks single malt whisky. This release is a marriage of two new charred oak casks (#294 and #321) is a combination of Washington-grown and Oregon-grown Genie barley grown in 2017 and distilled in late 2018 and early 2019. Bottled in August of 2022 the marriage yielded 450 bottles at 56.1% ABV.
baxus_class_name: Copperworks 3 Year Double Cask Single Cask Nation

name: Blanton's Single Barrel 1990 Bottling
description: Blanton’s Original was the first bourbon to be bottled from a single barrel back in 1984, revolutionising American whiskey and bringing it back to its former glory. Every batch is unique and the bottling strength of 46.5% helps maintain the authentic character of each barrel.

name: Blanton’s Red Takara 1992 Bottling
description:
The Blanton's Takara Edition is a special Japanese-exclusive release of the iconic Blanton's Single Barrel Bourbon. This expression has been aged for an additional 2 years beyond the standard Blanton's Single Barrel, resulting in a more complex and refined flavor profile. 

On the nose, this bourbon offers a slightly spicy and nutty aroma. The palate is well-rounded, with flavors of caramel, vanilla, honey, and corn. The finish is sweet and long-lasting, with a touch of cinnamon. 

Distributed exclusively in Japan by Takara, this limited and sought-after Blanton's expression is a must-try for bourbon enthusiasts looking to experience an elevated take on this classic American whiskey

name: Springbank 8 Year Japanese Export
description: The Springbank 8 Year Old Japanese Export is a rare and distinctive single malt Scotch whisky, crafted with the utmost care by the Springbank distillery, a family-owned gem nestled in the Campbeltown region of Scotland. This particular expression, bottled in the 1970s exclusively for the Japanese market, is presented in a unique dumpy bottle that captures the essence of its era. The whisky itself is a testament to Springbank's traditional distillation methods, boasting a classic old Springbank profile that is no longer found in today's offerings. With a fresh and fruity nose that hints at citrus, lemon pie, and apple juice, complemented by a palate that is both oily and mineral with subtle sweetness and notes of pear and grapefruit, this whisky culminates in a long, warm, and zesty finish. The Springbank 8 Year Old Japanese Export is not just a bottle of whisky; it is a piece of history, a collector's item that embodies the rich heritage and meticulous craftsmanship of the Springbank distillery.

name: Queen Elizabeth the 2nd 12 Year
description: The QE2 Single Malt Scotch Whisky is a regal and rare collector's item, steeped in the maritime tradition and royal legacy of the iconic Queen Elizabeth 2 ocean liner. Aged for over 12 years and bottled at a robust 48.6% ABV, this whisky is a celebration of craftsmanship and heritage. The elegant black ceramic jug, adorned with a golden coat of arms emblem, is a nod to the luxury and grandeur associated with the QE2, which was once the flagship of the Cunard Line. The whisky itself, likely distilled at the Springbank distillery, is a testament to the time-honored traditions of Scottish whisky-making, offering a rich and complex flavor profile that would appeal to connoisseurs and collectors alike. This special bottling, with its unique presentation and historical significance, would make a distinguished addition to any whisky collection, capturing the spirit of a bygone era of transatlantic travel and royal celebration.

name: Hibiki 1990s Bottling
description: An early edition of the Hibiki blend from Suntory crafted using malts from the Yamazaki & Hakushu distillery as well as grain whisky from the chita distillery. This non age stated release contains a variety of aged stocks from these esteemed distilleries and was bottled in the 1990s with a bright gold label design.

name: Kilkerran Cask Strength Batch 3 8 Year - 2018
description: The Kilkerran 8 Year Old Cask Strength Batch 3, distilled in 2018, is a robust and vibrant single malt Scotch whisky from the Glengyle Distillery in the historic whisky-producing region of Campbeltown. This expression is matured in bourbon casks, which impart a rich and complex flavor profile to the whisky, characterized by notes of caramel, leather, and a subtle peatiness that is a signature of the Kilkerran brand. Bottled at a potent 56.5% ABV, this whisky offers a full-bodied experience with a clear bourbon influence that is pronounced but not overwhelming, leading to a finish that is both rich and satisfying. The bottle's label is straightforward yet elegant, featuring the Kilkerran logo against a backdrop of a cityscape with a church steeple, indicative of the distillery's deep roots in Campbeltown. The Kilkerran 8 Year Old Cask Strength is a testament to the distillery's commitment to traditional whisky-making techniques, offering a pure and unadulterated taste of what Campbeltown malts have to offer.

name: Laredo Pass 10 Year Boot Bottle
description: The Laredo Pass 10 Year Boot Bottle is a novel and eye-catching piece of whiskey memorabilia, designed to captivate the imagination of American bourbon enthusiasts and collectors alike. This unique container is shaped like a classic cowboy boot, complete with decorative stitching and a star-shaped metal emblem that proudly declares its contents: "Laredo Pass 10 Year Old American Bourbon." The glossy, patent leather-like finish of the ceramic boot adds a touch of Western flair, making it a standout display item. While the boot bottle is a specialty item likely produced in limited quantities, it embodies the spirit of the American West and the rugged charm of cowboy culture. This particular bottle, once filled with a decade-old bourbon, now serves as a testament to the creativity and marketing ingenuity of the whiskey industry, appealing to those who cherish both the taste of fine bourbon and the iconic symbolism of Western Americana.

name: A. Altschuler 2012 12 Year Single Barrel #22-E
description: A 2012 vintage single barrel expression of A. Altschuler bourbon matured for 12 years. Distilled at MGP in Indiana this 12 year bourbon was crafted from a mashbill of 75% corn, 21% rye, 4% barley malt and bottled at 58.44% Abv with 137 bottles produced.

name: Penelope Valencia Batch 05
description: The 5th batch of Penelope's Valencia label which sees their blend of straight bourbons finished in Vino De Naranja (orange wine) casks. Bottled at 47.5% Abv.

name: Penelope 8 Year Rye Tokaji Finish
description: An 8 year old expression of rye whiskey finished in Tokaji sweet wine casks. Bottled by Penelope at 53% Abv.

name: Macallan 30 Year Fine Oak Pre-2012 Bottling
description: A pre-2012 era bottling of Macllan's 30 year old age stated expression in their fine oak range. This series of bottlings sees Macallan matured in sherry seasoned European & American oak as well as bourbon casks. This series was discontinued in 2018 and renamed the triple cask series.
baxus_class_name: Macallan 30 Year Fine Oak Pre-2012 Bottling

name: Nashtucky 8 Year Single Barrel #5516 For Seelbach's
description: An 8 year old expression of Kentucky distilled bourbon moved to Nashville for further maturation. Bottled at 65.24% Abv by Nashville Barrel Company.
baxus_class_name: Nashtucky 8 Year Single Barrel #5516 For Seelbach's

name: Ol' New Riff 6 Year Bottled In Bond Rye
description: A heritage style rye whiskey from New Riff crafted from a mashbill of 65% Balboa Rye, 20% heirloom corn and 15% two-row malted barley. It was then entered into the barrel at 103 proof before maturing for 6 years. Bottled in bond at 50% Abv this release aims to revive a heritage style of rye production used pre prohibition.
baxus_class_name: Ol' New Riff 6 Year Bottled In Bond Rye

name: Ol' New Riff 6 Year Bottled In Bond Bourbon
description: A heritage style bourbon whiskey from New Riff crafted from a mashbill of 60% heriloom corn, 26 Balboa Rye and 14% two-row malted barley. It was then entered into the barrel at 103 proof before maturing for 6 years. Bottled in bond at 50% Abv this release aims to revive a heritage style of bourbon production used pre prohibition.
baxus_class_name: Ol' New Riff 6 Year Bottled In Bond Bourbon

name: New Riff 8 Year Bourbon
description: An 8 year old expression of bourbon from New Riff bottled at 100 proof.

name: Pride Of Anderson County 10 Year Single Barrel #6652 Rare Character
description: A single barrel bourbon bottled by Rare Character reportedly using barrels sourced from Wild Turkey. This Pride Of Anderson county release was matured for 10 years and 11 months after maturing on the 4th floor of warehouse 4 at the Tyrone campus. Bottled at 60% Abv in 2024.
baxus_class_name: Pride Of Anderson County 10 Year Single Barrel #6652 Rare Character

name: Hardin's Creek Kentucky Series 200ml Set
description: A three bottle set of Hardin's Creek expressions from Jim Beam showcasing how their three different distilleries impact their bourbon. Boston, Clermont and Frankfort distilleries are all unique in their wind flow, sunlight and local temperature conditions creating unique bourbons. This set offers 3x200ml offerings to taste each of the unique climates.

name: Ardbeg Uigeadail
description: A fine drop of Ardbeg bottled at cask strength. A marriage of Ardbeg from bourbon barrels and sherry butts which gives a sweet and smoky finish to this malt. Uigeadail is the loch from which all Ardbeg water flows. An absolutely stunning whisky, and following the demise of Airigh nam Beist, this probably represents the best value in the core range.

name: Signatory Vintage Edradour 10 Year Un-Chillfiltered - 2009
description:
Embark on a journey of Scottish tradition and artisanal excellence with a bottle of single malt whisky from the renowned Edradour Distillery, lovingly bottled by Signatory Vintage for their Un-Chillfiltered collection. Nestled in the picturesque heart of the Highlands, Edradour is one of Scotland's smallest distilleries, celebrated for its dedication to craft and quality.

This exceptional whisky, carefully selected for the Un-Chillfiltered series, embodies the essence of Edradour's distinctive character. Encased in a classic bottle, its golden amber hue captivates the eye, hinting at the complexity within. Delicate aromas of heather, honey, and orchard fruits greet the senses, evoking the rugged beauty of the Scottish landscape.

Upon the first sip, the palate is treated to a symphony of flavors, from rich caramel and toffee to subtle hints of oak and spice, each layer unfolding with precision and depth. Unfiltered and undiluted, this expression offers a pure and unadulterated taste experience, true to the whisky's natural essence.

With every sip, savour the legacy of centuries-old craftsmanship and the unparalleled beauty of Scotland's rugged terrain, captured in each drop of Edradour single malt whisky from Signatory Vintage's Un-Chillfiltered collection.

name: Glentauchers 1996 17 Year Single Cask #1395 Signatory Vintage
description: A 1996 vintage single cask expression of Glentauchers matured for 17 years in a bourbon barrel. Cask #1395 was bottled in 2013 at 46% Abv by Signatory Vintage as part of their un-chillfiltered collection.
baxus_class_name: Glentauchers 1996 17 Year Single Cask #1395 Signatory Vintage

name: Macallan A Night On Earth
description: This limited-edition single malt tells the story of New Year's Eve in Scotland through its evocative flavour and specially illustrated packaging.

name: Kilkerran 12 Year
description: Aroma - oak notes are dominant, followed by toasted marshmallows and dried fruit pudding, as well as cherries, marzipan and a hint of peat  Palate - initially fruity with citrus notes and orange peel, followed by vanilla, butterscotch, honeycomb and digestive biscuits  Finish - velvety and smooth with lemon meringue, to conclude, there’s an oiliness and saltiness that you’d expect from a Cambeltown dram

name: Port Ellen 1982 26 Year Single Cask #2729 Old Bothwell
description: A single cask Port Ellen, bottled by Old Bothwell Wine & Spirits Co. Distilled in 1982, this was bottled in 2009 from cask #2729.  Port Ellen is the lost jewel in the Islay crown, closed down by DCL (now Diageo) in 1983 due to an oversupply of peated whisky for blending and a perceived lack of interest in it as a single malt. It has developed a legendary status in the years since. A very rare 12 year old bottled for attendees of the visit of Queen Elizabeth II in 1980 is believed to have been the only distillery bottling produced in its years of operation. Diageo have bottled more since, but it is the independent companies that have given the whisky world the best chance to sample this sought after single malt.
baxus_class_name: Port Ellen 1982 26 Year Single Cask #2729 Old Bothwell

name: Glendronach 1993 25 Year Single Butt #659 For Cava Benito
description: A 1993 vintage single cask expression of Glendronach matured for 25 years in a sherry butt. Bottled in 2018 at 59.1% Abv exclusively for Cava Benito.
baxus_class_name: Glendronach 1993 25 Year Single Butt #659 For Cava Benito

name: Laphroaig Cairdeas Origin
description: the smoke is present here, sweet, creamy, vanilla, apricot, sticky, very sweet, lemons, therefore also slightly tart as a counterpoint to the sweetness, a pinch of cinnamon, quite straightforward Laphroa-like from bourbon barrels, with the second sip you also get butter biscuits right away Entry, more citrus, delicious

name: Talisker 25 Year Cask Strength - 2005
description:
Indulge in the extraordinary with a bottle of Talisker 25-Year-Old Single Malt Scotch Whisky, a limited edition gem bottled in the year 2005. Crafted on the rugged shores of the Isle of Skye, Talisker is renowned for its maritime influence and distinctive, robust character.

Enclosed in an elegant presentation, this 25-year-old expression captivates with its deep amber hue, reflecting a quarter-century of patient maturation in the coastal warehouses. The aroma is an enticing blend of maritime brininess, intertwined with notes of peat smoke, dried fruits, and a subtle hint of vanilla, showcasing the complex interplay between time and cask influence.

Upon the first sip, the palate is enveloped in a velvety cascade of flavors. Waves of smoky peat, warm spices, and the sweetness of matured oak unfold gracefully, leaving an enduring impression of depth and sophistication. The 2005 bottling captures a moment in time, encapsulating the culmination of a quarter-century journey that has transformed this Talisker into a rare and exquisite masterpiece.

This 25-year-old Talisker stands as a testament to the distillery's dedication to time-honored craftsmanship and the profound impact of time on the development of exceptional single malt Scotch whisky. Each sip invites you to savor the history and complexity held within this unique expression, a true collector's delight for aficionados seeking the pinnacle of aged Scotch whisky.

name: George T. Stagg 2005 Release
description: This extremely hearty whiskey ages in new charred oak barrels for no less than 15 years. Straight out of the barrel uncut and unfiltered the taste is powerful flavorful and intense. Open it up with a few drops of water sit back and ponder the wonders of the universe. Lush toffee sweetness and dark chocolate with hints of vanilla fudge nougat and molasses. Underlying notes of dates tobacco dark berries spearmint and a hint of coffee round out the palate.

name: Pappy Van Winkle 20 Year Family Reserve 2011 Bottling
description: A 2011 bottling of Pappy Van Winkle 20 year old bourbon. This era of Pappy was crafted from barrels produced at the Stitzel-Weller distillery, the legendary closed distillery that produced Old Fitzgerald. This 2011 era release was bottled at Buffalo Trace after Julian Van Winkle moved his operations to there. Stitzel-Weller stopped producing in 1992 so this 2011 lands just within the timeline to still potentially use Stitzel distilled barrels.
baxus_class_name: Pappy Van Winkle 20 Year Family Reserve 2011 Bottling

name: Glenturret 1989 29 Year Single Hogshead #235 Signatory Vintage
description: A 1989 vintage single cask expression of Glenturret matured for 29 years in a hogshead. Cask #235 was bottled at 44.9% Abv by Signatory Vintage and chosen exclusively for Vinothek Massen, Whisky Club Luxembourg & Whiskyexclusive.
baxus_class_name: Glenturret 1989 29 Year Single Hogshead #235 Signatory Vintage

name: Highland Park 1987 25 Year Single Hogshead #1541 Signatory Vintage
description: Distilled on June 30, 1987, and bottled on June 6, 2012, this whisky has been aged for 25 years in a hogshead cask, specifically cask number 1541. Bottled at cask strength, it boasts an alcohol by volume (ABV) of 47.2%. This bottle, part of Signatory's esteemed Cask Strength Collection, is individually numbered, with this particular release being bottle number 27 of only 203 produced.
baxus_class_name: Highland Park 1987 25 Year Single Hogshead #1541 Signatory Vintage

name: Laphroaig 1998 16 Year Single Butt #700389 For The Whisky Exchange Signatory Vintage
description: A 1998 vintage single cask expression of Laphroaig matured for 16 years in a sherry butt. Bottled in 2015 at 59.9% Abv by Signatory Vintage it was chosen by The Whisky Exchange.
series: Hand Picked by The Whisky Exchange
baxus_class_name: Laphroaig 1998 16 Year Single Butt #700389 For The Whisky Exchange Signatory Vintage

name: Thomas H. Handy 2012 Release
description: A barrel proof expression of rye whiskey from Buffalo Trace matured for at least 6 years and released as part of their annual Antique Collection series. This 2012 bottling is bottled at 132.4 proof.

name: Worthy Park 2005 10 Year Habitation Velier
description: A 2005 first year of production vintage from Worthy Park. Matured for 10 years this molasses based rum is produced from sugar cane grown on the estate and distilled in their Forsyths double retort pot stills. Fully matured in the tropics this special release from rum legend Velier was bottled at a barrel proof of 57.8% Abv.

name: Aberlour 12 Year
description: Nose : Extremely round and smooth with fruity notes (red apple). Palate : Strong sherry notes, fruity aromas combined with the richness of cocoa, toffee and spices. Overall : Warm and powerful with smoky notes.

name: Mars Komagatake 1991 28 Year Single Cask #160
description:
A 1991 vintage single cask expression of pre-closure Mars Komagatake whisky produced at their Shinshu distillery. Matured for 28 years in an American white oak cask it was bottled in 2010 at 61% Abv with 352 bottles produced.

Nestled amidst Japan's majestic Southern Alps and the towering Central Alps, Mars Shinshu stands as the nation's loftiest whisky distillery, perched over 2,600 feet above sea level. With over a century of distilling heritage, the Hombo family expanded their craft to include whisky in 1949. Originally situated in Kagoshima Prefecture on Kyushu, Mars Shinshu held the distinction of producing Japan's southernmost whisky until 1984, when the Hombo clan relocated the distillery to the serene alpine landscapes of Miyada village in southern Nagano Prefecture.

The move to Miyada was strategic, capitalizing on the region's cooler temperatures, which fostered a slower maturation process, and its abundant, soft, granite-filtered snowmelt-fed aquifers. This idyllic setting provided the perfect conditions for crafting exceptional whisky. Mars Shinshu's whiskies are renowned for their elegance, smoothness, and remarkable complexity, a testament to the distillery's unwavering commitment to quality and craftsmanship. 

Komagatake whiskies embody the essence of Japan's whisky-making tradition. With their distinct character and impeccable quality, Komagatake whiskies offer a captivating journey through Japan's rich whisky heritage.

name: Hampden 2010 6 Year HLCF Habitation Velier
description: A 2010 vintage high ester offering of Hampden matured for 6 years. Crafted from their mid tier ester HLCF mark this edition was fully matured in the tropics and bottled at an almost hazmat 68.5% Abv by Velier as part of his Habitation series. The HLCF sits in the middle of the 1600gr/laa limit for Jamaican rum producers but is still a considerably high ester offering compared to other contemporary rum distilleries.

name: Bruichladdich 21 Year Cuvee 640 Eroica "Oh Mensch! Gieb Acht!" - 2012
description:
The culminating edition of Bruichladdich's Cuvee series, Eroica stands as a testament to refined craftsmanship and innovative aging techniques. This 21-year-old whisky matured predominantly in American Oak casks, where it developed its distinctive character, before undergoing a finishing period in Limousin oak barrels previously used for Cognac aging. The nuanced flavors and complexities of Eroica reflect its 21-year journey of maturation, culminating in a harmonious blend of oak, spice, and rich fruit notes.

Eroica's subtitle, "Oh mensch! Gieb acht! Was spricht die tiefe mitternacht?", derives from the opening line of Nietzsche's Thus Spoke Zarathustra, adding a layer of philosophical depth to its narrative. As the final release in the Cuvee range, Eroica invites connoisseurs to embark on a sensory exploration inspired by both the artistry of whisky-making and the profound musings of Nietzsche's philosophical masterpiece.
baxus_class_name: Bruichladdich 21 Year Cuvee 640 Eroica "Oh Mensch! Gieb Acht!" - 2012

name: Bruichladdich 21 Year Cuvee 407 PX La Noche Bocca Arriba
description:
A captivating expression that marries the rich flavors of the Pedro Ximenez sherry cask with the innovative spirit of Bruichladdich distillery, this remarkable whisky pays homage to the surreal world of Julio Cortázar's literary masterpiece, "La Noche Boca Arriba."

Crafted with meticulous care, this whisky begins its journey in American Oak casks before being transferred to Pedro Ximenez sherry casks for a finishing period that imparts layers of depth and complexity. The result is a symphony of flavors that dance across the palate, with notes of dried fruits, rich caramel, and hints of dark chocolate intertwining seamlessly.

Inspired by Cortázar's surreal narrative, Bruichladdich PX La Noche Boca Arriba invites you to embark on a sensory journey where reality blurs with imagination. With each sip, immerse yourself in the intricate tapestry of flavors and aromas, as the whisky transports you to a realm where dreams and reality converge.
baxus_class_name: Bruichladdich 21 Year Cuvee 407 PX La Noche Bocca Arriba

name: Nashville Barrel Co 33 Year Single Barrel #277 Canadian Whiskey For Seelbach's
description: A huge hazmat strength expression of Canadian whiskey bottled at 76.12% Abv by Nashville Barrel Company. Chosen exclusively for Seelbach's this cask was matured for 33 years.
baxus_class_name: Nashville Barrel Co 33 Year Single Barrel #277 Canadian Whiskey For Seelbach's

name: PM Spirits Mic Drop 2015 4 Year Old
description: Crafted by PM Spirits this edition of Mic Drop was distilled in 2015 and released in 2019. The spirit for this release was distilled by MGP in Indiana. This batch, created from 37 casks, is a blend of 4-year-old bourbon with a mash bill of 60% corn, 36% rye, and 4% malted barley. It is bottled at cask strength with an ABV of 56.1%
baxus_class_name: PM Spirits Mic Drop 2015 4 Year Old

name: Zuidam Millstone 2004 100 Months Old 100 Rye
description: Zuidam Millstone 100 Rye Whisky is a distinguished product from the family-owned Zuidam Distillery in the Netherlands. This whisky is crafted from 100% rye, aged for 100 months, and bottled at 100 proof. The distillation process originally utilized German-made Holstein stills, but now incorporates traditional copper pot stills for the second distillation. Zuidam distillery prides itself on being largely self-sufficient, growing most of the grain it uses, including rye, barley, wheat, and corn. The Millstone 100 Rye is noted for its rich and complex character, a testament to the meticulous production methods and the distillery's dedication to flavor-driven grain cultivation.

name: Old Forester 10 Year 1924
description: A special edition from Old Forester crafted from a unique mashbill of 79% Corn, 11% Rye, 10% Malted Barley. This is the mashbill commonly used for the Early Times bourbon, a brand Brown-Forman has since sold to Sazerac. This 10 year old expression is bottled to celebrate the granting of a medicinal whiskey license to Brown-Forman in 1924. During prohibition BF acquired barrels from the closed distilleries across the US and bottled them under the Old Forester label.

name: Springbank 2004 9 Year Gaja Barolo
description: A 2004 vintage small batch release from Springbank matured for 4 years in refill bourbon barrels before being recasked into Gaja Barolo casks for another 5 years. Bottled in 2013 as part of the wood expressions series, a range of bottlings from the Campbeltown distillery which saw their spirit finished in unique cask types like madeira and barolo wine.

name: Corazón Anejo William Larue Weller Single Barrel #018 Tequila
description: Produced at Casa San Matías, this anejo tequila was matured for 26 months in casks that previously held William Larue Weller bourbon. Corazon is crafted from 100% Blue Weber agave and is then bottled as a single barrel.
baxus_class_name: Corazón Anejo William Larue Weller Single Barrel #018 Tequila

name: Corazón Reposado Buffalo Trace Single Barrel #12395 Tequila
description: A 2013 bottling single barrel expression of reposado tequila rested in barrels sourced from the Buffalo Trace distillery. Crafted from 100% blue weber agave and bottled at 40% Abv.
baxus_class_name: Corazón Reposado Buffalo Trace Single Barrel #12395 Tequila

name: Corazón Anejo George T. Stagg Single Barrel #022 Tequila
description: Produced at Casa San Matías, this anejo tequila was matured for 22 months in casks that previously held George T. Stagg bourbon. Corazon is crafted from 100% Blue Weber agave and is then bottled as a single barrel.
baxus_class_name: Corazón Anejo George T. Stagg Single Barrel #022 Tequila

name: Corazón Anejo Thomas H. Handy Single Barrel #9500 Tequila
description: Produced at Casa San Matías, this anejo tequila was matured for 19 months in casks that previously held Thomas H, Handy rye.  Corazon is crafted from 100% Blue Weber agave and is then bottled as a single barrel.
baxus_class_name: Corazón Anejo Thomas H. Handy Single Barrel #9500 Tequila

name: Brora 35 Year Diageo Special Releases - 2012
description: The Brora 35 Years Old, 11th Release of 2012, stands as an exceptionally rare and mature single malt originating from the shuttered Brora distillery. Unveiled in 2012 as a highlight of that year's Diageo Special Releases, this whisky underwent a remarkable 35-year maturation period in refill American oak casks. Bottled at its natural cask strength of 48.1%, it embodies the essence of time and craftsmanship, offering aficionados a glimpse into the storied history of Brora through its rich and complex flavors.

name: Highland Park 1989 29 Year Connoisseurs Choice Gordon & Macphail
description: A 1989 vintage expression of Highland Park matured in refill sherry for 29 years. Bottled in 2018 at 57% Abv as part of the legendary Connoisseurs choice series from Gordon & Macphail.
baxus_class_name: Highland Park 1989 29 Year Connoisseurs Choice Gordon & Macphail

name: Talisker 30 Year 2007 Release
description: Talisker is the oldest (and up until recently, only) distillery on the Isle of Skye. It is part of the Diageo stable, and as such is regularly included in the highly anticipated annual Diageo Special Releases. This 2007 edition was the oldest official bottling of Talisker ever released at the time. It proved to be extremely popular and sold out within no time. It was bottled at a natural cask strength of 50.7% and limited to 3000 numbered bottles.

name: Corazón Anejo George T. Stagg Single Barrel #003 Tequila
description: Produced at Casa San Matías, this anejo tequila was matured for 22 months in casks that previously held George T. Stagg bourbon. Corazon is crafted from 100% Blue Weber agave and is then bottled as a single barrel.
baxus_class_name: Corazón Anejo George T. Stagg Single Barrel #003 Tequila

name: Benrinnes 2006 13 Year Single Hogshead #305391 For RAF Fund Adelphi
description: Distilled at the Benrinnes distillery in Speyside, this expression was bottled by independent bottler Adelphi. It has been matured for over a decade in a single ex-Oloroso sherry hogshead before being bottled in autumn of 2020. This expression has been bottled for the Royal Air Force Benevolent Fund's commemoration of the 80th anniversary of the Battle of Britain.
baxus_class_name: Benrinnes 2006 13 Year Single Hogshead #305391 For RAF Fund Adelphi

name: Lagavulin 21 Year Islay Jazz Festival 2019
description: A 21 year old expression of Lagavaulin bottled in 2019 at a cask strength of 50.9% Abv. This mature release was chosen to celebrate the 2019 edition of the annual Islay jazz festival.

name: Craigellachie 8 Year Battlehill
description:
Situated in Huntly, a quaint town nestled in North East Scotland, Duncan Taylor is surrounded by a landscape rich in heritage and steeped in history.

The significance of Battlehill resonates deeply in Scottish history, marking the battleground where Robert The Bruce clashed with John Comyn, Earl of Buchan, in December 1307. This historic encounter unfolded atop a hill at Slioch in Huntly, now immortalized as Battlehill.

Among the many landmarks dotting the landscape, Battlehill stands as a testament to Scotland's storied past, embodying the nation's resilience and spirit.

The Battlehill Scotch Whisky range showcases the pinnacle of Scotland's whisky-making tradition. Comprising the finest single malt and single grain whiskies, aged for up to 55 years, these exceptional spirits hail from Scotland's most prestigious distilleries. Each bottle represents a journey through time and craftsmanship, capturing the essence of Scotland's rich heritage and unparalleled whisky expertise.

This offering from Craigellachie is a perfect example of the robust and flavorful nature the range attempts to capture.

name: Ron Zacapa Centenario XO Solera Gran Reserva Especial
description:
Encased in a sleek amber-toned bottle, this exquisite rum embodies sophistication and refinement, inviting enthusiasts to embark on a luxurious sensory journey.

The bottle's elegant curves and weighty feel exude prestige, while the intricate detailing and distinguished Ron Zacapa emblem on the label underscore the brand's commitment to excellence and quality.

Upon uncorking, a captivating bouquet of aromas fills the air—a harmonious blend of sweet caramel, luscious vanilla, and subtle hints of toasted oak. Each scent delicately entices the senses, setting the stage for the indulgence that lies within.

Pouring a generous measure reveals the rum's mesmerizing amber hue, shimmering with golden brilliance. The liquid coats the glass with its rich texture, promising a velvety smoothness that is unparalleled.

The first sip unveils an exquisite fusion of flavors—a symphony of honeyed sweetness, decadent toffee, and subtle spiced fruit. Delicate notes of chocolate and coffee linger, adding depth and complexity to each sip, while the gentle warmth of oak leaves a lingering, satisfying finish.
baxus_class_name: Ron Zacapa Centenario XO Solera Gran Reserva Especial

name: Springbank 8 Year Pure Malt Japanese Import
description: An especially rare version of the Springgbank Pure Malt series, this bottling was exclusively produced for the Japanese market, and commands a certain mystique as a result. A hugely popular release in itself, this offering from Springbank exemplifies what makes Scotch special.
baxus_class_name: Springbank 8 Year Pure Malt Japanese Import

name: Talisker Storm Made by the Sea
description: Talisker Storm represents a masterful blend meticulously crafted from an array of Talisker's finest casks, each aged to perfection. This harmonious marriage of different-aged casks amplifies the renowned intensity of Talisker's signature smoky, maritime character, creating a whisky of unparalleled depth and complexity.  Bottled at 45.8% ABV, Talisker Storm is meticulously curated to showcase its distinct personality and flavors in their most vibrant form. This optimal alcohol percentage allows the whisky to reveal its full spectrum of aromas and tastes, ensuring a truly memorable tasting experience with every sip.  As the waves crash against the rugged shores of the Isle of Skye, Talisker Storm captures the essence of its maritime surroundings, evoking a sense of adventure and intrigue. From the first tantalizing aroma to the lingering finish, this exceptional whisky embodies the spirit of Talisker's storied heritage and unwavering commitment to excellence.
baxus_class_name: Talisker Storm Made by the Sea

name: Lagavulin 1995 Sherry Butts Bottled For 2013 Islay Jazz Festival
description: A 1995 vintage expression of Lagavulin matured in sherry butts. Bottled at 51.9% Abv in 2013 it was chosen to celebrate the annual Islay jazz festival.
baxus_class_name: Lagavulin 1995 Sherry Butts Bottled For 2013 Islay Jazz Festival

name: Port Ellen 1983 28 Year Single Cask #230 Old Bothwell
description: A 1983 vintage single cask expression of the once closed and now revived Port Ellen. Matured for 28 years cask #230 was bottled in 2011 at 55.5% Abv by Old Bothwell wine & spirits.
baxus_class_name: Port Ellen 1983 28 Year Single Cask #230 Old Bothwell

name: Bowmore 15 Year Feis Ile 2012
description: A 2012 special edition from Bowmore bottled in 2012 to celebrate the annual Feis Ile Islay festival. Bottled at 55.4% Abv this expression was limited to just 750 bottles. Although the cask type is not noted, the super dark spirit suggests this was matured in sherry casks.

name: Wiser's Oldest Decanter
description: An extremely rare bottle, this whisky is as elusive as it is illustrious. The Wiser's brand has long been one of Canadian whisky's best, and this stunning decanter is sure to be no exception.

name: Old Overholt 10 Year Cask Strength Rye - 2023
description: Tasting Notes Dark and deep amber color with golden and henna hues. Bold yet with a sweet bouquet of mellowed oak, sweet corn and vanilla underpinned by rich warm black pepper and cinnamon-toast spice. Black pepper, cinnamon and baking spices complemented by light ripe cherries, green peppercorn, sweet caramel and vanilla. Rich and complex mouthfeel. A long finish with lingering rye spice and vanilla. Balanced yet complex flavors of brown sugar and honey underly leather and charred oak. — Distiller's notes
baxus_class_name: Old Overholt 10 Year Cask Strength Rye - 2023

name: Benrinnes 18 Year Cadenhead's Cask Strength 2018 Release
description: It's evident why Benrinnes holds a special place in Cadenhead's heart, given its distinctive profile.  While not typically labeled as a single malt—except on rare occasions when it exhibits its robust, meaty character—Benrinnes offers independent bottlers like Cadenhead an ideal canvas for showcasing distilleries.  Interestingly, Benrinnes' current location is its second incarnation. The original distillery, constructed in 1826 by Peter MacKenzie, fell victim to a devastating flood in 1829. John Innes later discovered and established the distillery's current site.
baxus_class_name: Benrinnes 18 Year Cadenhead's Cask Strength 2018 Release

name: Grand Old Parr 12 Year
description:
From the producer: "Old Parr is a blended Scotch whisky with a smooth and accessible flavor that is perfect for sharing.

Old Parr was named after the legendary figure of Thomas Parr, said to be England’s longest-lived man, aged 152 when he died in 1635. His long life symbolized the maturity of the whiskies used in the blend, whilst his wisdom represented the skill and knowledge required to produce it."

This is an especially old example of this blended scotch, having been bottled before Diageo took over production of the Grand Old Parr line with its acquisition of Guinness.

name: Hibiki Japanese Harmony "One Door"
description:
The Hibiki Japanese Harmony range of Japanese whisky embodies the epitome of elegance, harmony, and artistry in the world of spirits. Crafted by Suntory, one of Japan's most esteemed whisky distilleries, Hibiki Japanese Harmony celebrates the fusion of tradition and innovation, resulting in a blend of remarkable complexity and refinement.

At the heart of Hibiki Japanese Harmony lies a meticulous selection of malt and grain whiskies, each meticulously aged to perfection in a variety of casks, including ex-bourbon, sherry, and Japanese oak barrels. This diverse maturation process imparts a symphony of flavors and aromas, ranging from delicate floral notes to hints of honey, citrus, and subtle spices.

The art of blending is paramount in the creation of Hibiki Japanese Harmony. Suntory's master blenders carefully harmonize the different whisky components to achieve a seamless integration of flavors, ensuring a smooth and balanced drinking experience that resonates with sophistication and depth.

The presentation of Hibiki Japanese Harmony is as exquisite as its contents. Adorned with the brand's iconic 24-faceted bottle design, inspired by the traditional Japanese kimono, each bottle exudes a sense of grace and refinement. Its golden amber hue evokes images of the Japanese landscape, inviting enthusiasts to embark on a sensory journey through the flavors and textures of Japan's whisky-making tradition.

Whether enjoyed neat, on the rocks, or as a key ingredient in inspired cocktails, Hibiki Japanese Harmony captivates the palate with its nuanced complexity and graceful character. As a true ambassador of Japanese whisky craftsmanship, it embodies the essence of harmony, inviting enthusiasts to savor the beauty and sophistication of Japan's rich whisky heritage.

name: Nikka Gold & Gold Lily of the Valley
baxus_class_name: Nikka Gold & Gold Lily of the Valley

name: Wiser's Oldest 1941 Vintage 18 Year
description:
Wiser's, one of the most favored whisky brands across Canada, boasts a rich heritage that dates back to 1857 when J.P. Wiser first distilled its exquisite blend. Embracing a tradition of excellence, each batch of Wiser's whisky undergoes meticulous aging, spending a decade gracefully maturing within the confines of oak barrels, absorbing the essence of time and craftsmanship.

Among the esteemed collection of Wiser's offerings lies a true gem of the whisky world: an 18-year-old masterpiece, distilled in the historic year of 1941 and elegantly bottled in the midst of 1959. This particular vintage encapsulates not only the essence of Wiser's distinguished craftsmanship but also a slice of Canadian whisky history, embodying the artistry and dedication of its creators across generations.

name: Yamazaki "Royal"
description: The Yamazaki "Royal" is a prestigious and historic whisky from Suntory, one of the founding fathers of Japanese whisky. Established by Shinjiro Torii in 1923, the Yamazaki distillery is Japan's first and oldest malt whisky distillery. The "Royal" series, particularly the Suntory Royal 60th Anniversary edition, was created to commemorate the company's 60th anniversary in 1959. This special release was produced using malt and grain whiskies distilled at Yamazaki, with subsequent grain whisky production moved to the Chita distillery during Suntory's expansion in the 1980s. The Yamazaki Royal is known for its rich heritage and exceptional quality, making it a highly sought-after collector's item. The bottles from this series often feature unique and elegant designs, reflecting the brand's commitment to craftsmanship and tradition.

name: Black Maple Hill Small Batch
description: Limited edition bottling bottled by Black Maple Hill Distillery Co. Bardstown KY red label ullage: very top shoulder black capsule very slightly scuffed front label very slightly worn. Black Maple Hill is among the most coveted American whiskeys with a history that connects it with some of the biggest names in Kentucky distilling. Like several other extremely limited-release brands from the early 2000s Black Maple Hill did not make its own whiskey or even bottle it. Rather its owner a California-based company called CVI Brands hired Julian Van Winkle III to find high-quality barrels of whiskey and bottle it for them. At the time Van Winkle was working out of the disused Hoffman Distillery in Lawrenceburg Kentucky where he bottled whiskey for his own brand Old Rip Van Winkle as well as for clients like CVI all of which have long since achieved legend status among collectors.

name: A.H. Hirsch  15 Year Reserve Gold Wax 1989 Bottling
description: A legendary bottle of Bourbon that has had a whole book written about itself: The Best Bourbon You'll Never Taste by Charles K Cowdery. This is first ever release of the famous A.H. Hirsch reserve, purchased by Gordon Hue in 1989 following the filing for bankruptcy of what had by then become Michter's distillery, where the whisky was distilled and stored. Hue instructed Julien Van Winkle III to bottle this 15 year old straight away.
baxus_class_name: A.H. Hirsch  15 Year Reserve Gold Wax 1989 Bottling

name: Sazerac 18 Year 2012 Release
description: An 18 year old expression of rye whiskey from Buffalo Trace bottled at 90 proof as part of their annual Antique Collection. This is a Fall 2012 release.

name: Crown Royal 1978 Vintage 1 Litre
description: A signature release of Canadian Whiskey from Crown Royal vatted from casks distilled in or before 1978.

name: Wild Turkey 8 Year 1989 Bottling
description: An older bottling of Wild Turkey's signature 8 year old age statement bottled at 101 proof in 1989. Older editions of Wild Turkey are particularly sought after amongst enthusiasts, notably for their remarkably different taste profile to modern Wild Turkey bottles. The distillery originally produced bourbon using cypress wood tanks but these were slowly phased out from 1984 until 1990. The other notable production change came in 2004 when the barrel entry proof was changed to 110, up from 107. The combination of these changes have resulted in serious demand for older vintage bottlings from the much loved distillery, with some believing 1990s era bottlings to be the distillery’s best ever.

name: Bowmore 1963 30 Year Old 30th Anniversary
description: Distilled in 1963, the year that Stanley P Morrisson purchased the Bowmore distillery, this 30 year old small batch release celebrates 30 years of Morrison ownership. Bowmore distillate from the 1960’s is particularly sought after with many truly legendary expressions being distilled in this decade, such as the mythical 1964 black Bowmores. The Morrison family ran Bowmore for much of the latter 20th century before being bought out by Suntory in 1994.

name: Proof And Wood Vertigo 2021 American Blended Whiskey
description: A crazy 12 barrel blend of American whiskey from Proof And Wood bottled in 2021 at 51.15% Abv. The blend contains 1992 vintage American Light Whisky, 2008 American Light Whiskey, 2012 95 % Rye Whiskey, and a 2015 Bourbon with a mash bill of 75% corn, 21% rye, and 4 % malted barley. This was all produced at the MGP distillery in Indiana and therefore contains light whiskey that is almost 30 years of age!
baxus_class_name: Proof And Wood Vertigo 2021 American Blended Whiskey

name: SMWS 26.146 Clynelish 2011 8 Year
description: A 2011 vintage single cask expression of Clynelish matured for 8 years in a 2nd fill bourbon cask. It was bottled at 58.6% Abv by the Scotch Malt Whisky Society.

name: Wild Turkey Heritage Single Barrel
description: First released in 2005, this duty free exclusive offering from Wild Turkey was bottled as a single barrel at 101 proof.

name: Caribou Crossing Single Barrel
description: A single barrel expression of Canadian whiskey bottled by Sazerac in a bottle reminiscent of their Blanton's decanters.

name: Wild Turkey Batch W-T-02-91 Rare Breed
description: This 1991 batch was bottled at 55% Abv. Older editions of Wild Turkey are particularly sought after amongst enthusiasts, notably for their remarkably different taste profile to modern Wild Turkey bottles. The distillery originally produced bourbon using cypress wood tanks but these were slowly phased out from 1984 until 1990. The other notable production change came in 2004 when the barrel entry proof was changed to 110, up from 107. The combination of these changes have resulted in serious demand for older vintage bottlings from the much loved distillery, with some believing 1990s era bottlings to be the distillery’s best ever.
baxus_class_name: Wild Turkey Batch W-T-02-91 Rare Breed

name: Redbreast Kentucky Oak
description: A special edition release from Redbreast crafted from their signature Irish single pot still whiskey. This spirit was then finished in American oak casks sourced from the Taylor family elk cave farm and bottled at 101 proof.

name: Rare Character 7 Year Single Amburana Barrel For Colonial Wine And Spirits
description: A single barrel expression of bourbon sourced from Indiana and finished in an Amburana wood barrel. Bottled by Rare Character at 59.6% Abv it was chosen for Colonial Wine And Spirits.
baxus_class_name: Rare Character 7 Year Single Amburana Barrel For Colonial Wine And Spirits

name: Redbreast 21 Year Irish Whiskey
description: A classic expression of Redbreast's Irish single pot still whiskey matured for 21 years in American oak ex-bourbon casks and 1st fill sherry oak casks before being bottled at 46% Abv.

name: Pikesville Rye Mini
description: Now owned by Heaven Hill, bottles of original Pikesville Rye are difficult to come across. Once a booming industry, rye whiskey production in Maryland -- where the brand originates -- was closed down upon the advent of Prohibition.

name: Booker's 2022-03 Kentucky Tea Batch
description: The third batch in 2022 of Booker's bourbon, this release was bottled at 63.25% Abv and nicknamed 'Kentucky Tea'.

name: Maker's Mark Gold Wax 1994 Bottling
description: A 1994 bottling of Maker's Marks 101 proof export bottling. This limited edition offering was primarily available in the Japanese market.

name: Glen Grant 25 Year 2024 Release
description: A 2024 edition from Glen Grant featuring their 25 year old expression matured in bourbon barrels and Oloroso sherry casks. Bottled at 46% Abv.

name: English Whisky Company 8 Year Single Hogshead Cadenhead's
description: A single cask expression of peated English whisky sourced from The English Whisky Company in Norfolk. Matured for 8 years in a bourbon hogshead this cask was bottled at 61.9% Abv by Cadenhead's in 2018.
baxus_class_name: English Whisky Company 8 Year Single Hogshead Cadenhead's

name: Rhum J.M 1997 10 Year
description:
One of the rare rums in the world to boast a terroir, the sugar cane for this rum—spelled rhum in French—is cultivated in a distinctive microclimate, nestled in volcanic soil on the slopes of Mt. Pelee. Situated on a sloping field with low cloud cover and caressed by sea breezes, this locale is a stark departure from the typical flat lands and poor soils where most sugarcane is grown. Much akin to the revered houses of Bordeaux, Cognac, or Champagne, this single estate rum is distinguished by its unique microclimate and precisely defined geographic boundaries, imparting distinct characteristics to the final product.

Another notable feature is its classification as Rhum Agricole, crafted directly from sugar cane juice rather than molasses. Accounting for less than 5% of global rum production, this method yields a markedly different spirit. Among a series of rums, each distinguished by age, are Rhum Blanc J.M., Rhum J.M. Paille (Gold), and Rhum J.M. VSOP. This particular iteration is aged for a decade in Oak casks before being bottled, contributing to its unparalleled depth and complexity.

name: Old Fitzgerald's 1849 10 Year 1970 Bottling
description: A 1970 bottling of Old Fitzgerald matured for 10 years and bottled at 90.4 proof. This era of the brand was crafted from their original wheated mashbill using jug yeast.

name: Maker's Mark Cask Strength 375ml
description: Maker's Mark Cask Strength Bourbon is a premium offering from the renowned Maker's Mark Distillery in Kentucky. This expression is bottled straight from the barrel, ranging from 108 to 114 proof, which provides a bolder and richer flavor profile compared to the standard Maker's Mark. The distillery, known for its iconic red wax-sealed bottles, uses a mash bill of 70% corn, 16% red winter wheat, and 14% malted barley. The Cask Strength edition was initially released in 375ml bottles before expanding to 750ml in 2020. This bourbon retains the signature Maker's Mark flavors of caramel, vanilla, and oak, while amplifying them with added intensity and complexity, making it a favorite among bourbon enthusiasts seeking a robust and full-bodied experience.

name: Thirteenth Colony Cask Strength 2024 Release
description: A 2024 special edition release from Thirteenth Colony, a new wave distillery from Americus, Georgia. Matured for 5-6 years this batch was released at 60.32% Abv and was highly praised by critics.

name: Larceny Barrel Proof Batch A122
description: A barrel proof offering of Larceny, a wheated expression of bourbon from Heaven Hill. This 2022 release is bottled at 62.2% Abv.

name: Larceny Barrel Proof Batch B523
description: A barrel proof offering of Larceny, a wheated expression of bourbon from Heaven Hill. This 2023 release is bottled at 62.2% Abv.

name: J. Henry & Sons 2022 Anniversary Blend
description: A 2022 special edition from Wisconsin producer J. Henry & Sons. Crafted from grains grown on their farm, this 2022 offering is a 4 grain mashbill crafted from 60% Red Heirloom Corn, 14% Heirloom Winter Wheat, 14% Heirloom Spooner Rye, and 12% Malted barley.  Matured for at least 5 years this edition is bottled at 60.4% Abv with 1542 bottles produced.

name: Old Forester Rye Barrel Strength Single Barrel
description: A single barrel expression of rye whiskey from Brown-Forman's Old Forester distillery bottled at barrel strength.
baxus_class_name: Old Forester Rye Barrel Strength Single Barrel

name: Corazón Anejo George T. Stagg Single Barrel #024 Tequila
description: Produced at Casa San Matías, this anejo tequila was matured for 22 months in casks that previously held George T. Stagg bourbon. Corazon is crafted from 100% Blue Weber agave and is then bottled as a single barrel.
baxus_class_name: Corazón Anejo George T. Stagg Single Barrel #024 Tequila

name: Master Picke 15 Year Third Edition
description: A 15 year old expression of Kentucky bourbon whiskey crafted from a unique mashbill of 78.5% corn, 13% rye and 8.5% malted barley. It was bottled at a cask strength of 57.35% Abv by Bull Run distillery in Oregon.

name: Master Picke 14 Year American Whiskey Single Barrel #16
description: A 14 year old expression of straight American whiskey bottled under the Master Picke label from Bull Run distillery in Oregon. Distilled in Kentucky this single barrel was bottled at a cask strength of 63.5% Abv.
baxus_class_name: Master Picke 14 Year American Whiskey Single Barrel #16

name: George T. Stagg 2022 Release
description: A 2022 release of the annual George T Stagg bourbon crafted from Buffalo Trace's #1 low rye mashbill. This batch was distilled in spring 2007 matured for 15 years and 5 months and is bottled at 69.35%Abv.

name: High West Bourye Batch 17A11
description: An early batch of High West's signature "Bourye", a blend of bourbon and rye whiskies. Early editions of this release contained sizeable amounts of well aged whiskies sourced from MGP in Indiana and are highly praised amongst High West enthusiasts.

name: A Midwinter Night's Dram Encore Act 1 Scene 1
description: A special edition version of High West's signature Midwinter Night's dram finished in white port casks instead of their usual tawny/ruby port casks. This is the first batch produced of the encore edition and is bottled at 50.8% Abv.
baxus_class_name: A Midwinter Night's Dram Encore Act 1 Scene 1

name: A Midwinter Night’s Dram Act 9 Scene 2
description: A special release from High West in Utah crafted from their Rendevouz rye whiskey finished in French oak and tawny port casks. This is the 9th annual edition and the second batch from the year's release.
baxus_class_name: A Midwinter Night’s Dram Act 9 Scene 2

name: Angel's Envy Tawny Port Barrels Cellar Collection Release 2
description: A 2020 special edition release from Angel's Envy crafted from bourbon finished in tawny port wine casks. Bottled as the 2nd release in their Cellar Collections series at a higher than average strength of 55.8% Abv.
baxus_class_name: Angel's Envy Tawny Port Barrels Cellar Collection Release 2

name: Rock Hill Farms Single Barrel
description: A single barrel expression of bourbon from Buffalo Trace crafted from their #2 high rye mashbill. Bottled at 50% Abv.

name: 1792 12 Year
description: An older than average expression from Barton distillery in Bardstown matured for 12 years and bottled at 48.3% Abv.

name: Bardstown Collaborative Series Amaro Nonino
description: A special release from Bardstown Bourbon Co as part of their collaborative series. This edition is crafted from a blend of 80%  12 year old kentucky bourbon, 10% 7 year old Indiana rye made of a 51% rye mashbill and a 10% component of Indiana rye aged for 6 years made of a 95/5 rye mashbill. The blend was then finished for 17 months in Amaro Nonino Riserva barrels, a rare type of Grappa before being bottled at 111 proof.

name: Milam & Greene Single Barrel Bourbon #505 Cooper's Hawk
description: A single barrel bourbon sourced from Tennessee bottled at a huge 64.05% Abv. Bottled by Miam & Greene this barrel is a part of their wildlife collection and is named the Cooper's Hawk.
baxus_class_name: Milam & Greene Single Barrel Bourbon #505 Cooper's Hawk

name: Angel's Envy Private Select Distillery Exclusive Signed Bottle
description: A distillery exclusive barrel of Angel's Envy finished in port wine barrels and bottled at 57.5% Abv. This lot is signed.
baxus_class_name: Angel's Envy Private Select Distillery Exclusive Signed Bottle

name: Bardstown Collaborative Series Carter Cellars
description: A special release from Bardstown Bourbon Co as part of their collaborative series. This blend is made up of 49% 17 year Tennessee whiskey, 41% 12 year Kentucky bourbon and 10% 6 year Indiana rye whiskey made form a 95/5 mashbill. This blend was then recasked into 10 Carter Cellars Napa Valley Cabernet wine barrels for 14 months. Vatted together it was then bottled at 108.3 proof.

name: Bardstown Collaborative Series Foursquare Rum
description: A special edition collaboration between Bardstown Bourbon Co and esteemed Barbados rum producer Foursquare. Crafted from 7 year Indiana distilled rye and 17 year Tennessee bourbon the blend was finished for 23 months in Foursquare rum barrels.

name: Thirteenth Colony Cask Strength 15th Anniversary
description: A 2024 special edition release from Georgia based produced Thirteenth Colony. This release celebrates the 15th anniversary of the distillery and master distiller Graham Arthur chose 25 barrels for this batch. Matured for 8 years and 9 months it was bottled at an almost hazmat strength of 139.2 proof. Just 3330 bottles were produced from this cask strength batch.

name: Old Ramshead 1916 Bottled In Bond 1930
description: Distilled in 1916, this bourbon was protected in bond by the American Medicinal Spirits Company from the Prohibition Act of 1920, which made alcohol production and consumption illegal. The whiskey was produced at the Anderson Distillery distillery in 1916, then owned by the infamous Whiskey Trust. The Trust was accused of engaging in several illegal activities, including intimidation of distillery owners who did not want to sell up to them. They acquired Anderson by some means in 1905, but were forced to close it down with the enactment of Prohibition in 1920. The stocks from the distillery were transferred to the Wathen warehouses that year, and bottled by the American Medicinal Spirits Company. The American Medicinal Spirits Company was one of only around 30 distilling companies to survive Prohibition of the 434 that existed prior. Exploiting the medicinal loophole was the brainchild of Otto Wathen, an idea which continues to prove its value today in the persisting image of his still ever-popular portfolio, which eventually included Old Grand-dad, Old Taylor and Old Crow, among many others. The American Medicinal Spirits Company was eventually subsumed by National Distillers (the revived legitimate face of The Whiskey Trust), who along with Schenley, Hiram Walker and Seagram's, became the big 4 American whiskey companies following the eventual repeal of Prohibition. The National Distillers acquisition of the AMS Co meant the return for brands such as Old Ramshead, bottled here in 1930. Sadly, as with many others, the Anderson Distillery never returned, and was razed and never rebuilt following the repeal of Prohibition.

name: A Midwinter Night’s Dram Act 9 Scene 4
description: A special release from High West in Utah crafted from their Rendevouz rye whiskey finished in French oak and tawny port casks. This is the 9th annual edition and the fourth batch from the year's release.
baxus_class_name: A Midwinter Night’s Dram Act 9 Scene 4

name: Booker's 6 Year "Pinkie's Batch" 2022 Bottling
description:
Booker's Bourbon "Pinkie's Batch" 2022-04 is a distinguished release that pays homage to Frederick Booker Noe, affectionately known as "Pinkie" to his family and friends. This batch is aged for 6 years, 10 months, and 10 days, and bottled at a robust 122.4 proof (61.2% ABV), offering bourbon enthusiasts a full-flavored and potent expression.

The nose of Pinkie's Batch is inviting and complex, featuring a harmonious blend of brown spices and vanilla notes. As you bring the glass closer, you're greeted by rich aromas of vanilla bean, reminiscent of opening a fresh package. Warm oak notes complement the vanilla, while hints of caramel, brown sugar, and baking spices add depth to the bouquet. A subtle touch of tobacco emerges in the background, accompanied by a gentle reminder of the bourbon's high proof.

On the palate, Pinkie's Batch delivers Booker's signature vanilla flavor in full force. The initial sip floods the mouth with a sweet and rich profile, showcasing heavy caramel and generous vanilla notes. These are complemented by nuances of peanut butter and dried fruits, particularly raisins and fresh dates. The sweetness is balanced by deeper, more complex flavors of molasses or sorghum, creating a dessert-like experience. As the flavors develop, subtle notes of barrel char, tobacco, pepper, and leather emerge, adding layers of complexity to the tasting experience.

The finish is lingering and well-rounded, with the interplay of sweet and spicy notes continuing to evolve. While the mouthfeel may be slightly thinner than some previous Booker's releases, the overall experience remains satisfying and true to the brand's reputation for bold, uncut, and unfiltered bourbon. Pinkie's Batch stands as a fitting tribute to Frederick Booker Noe, offering a bourbon that both honors tradition and delivers a memorable tasting experience.
204_pinkies_batch/

name: Booker's 6 Year "Granny's Batch" 2020 Bottling
description:
Booker's Bourbon "Granny's Batch" 2020-01 is a remarkable expression that pays tribute to Booker Noe's grandmother, who played a significant role in raising him. This batch was aged for 6 years, 4 months, and 21 days, and bottled at a robust 126.4 proof (63.2% ABV), offering bourbon enthusiasts a full-flavored and potent experience.

The nose of Granny's Batch is rich and inviting, featuring a harmonious blend of sweet and spicy aromas. Buttery notes mingle with toasted walnuts, creating a warm and comforting scent. Dusty oak and citrus undertones add complexity, while a powdery vanilla aroma evokes memories of freshly baked cake. As the bourbon opens up, rich cherry and dark stewed plum scents emerge, accompanied by hints of black pepper and grape tannins.

On the palate, Granny's Batch delivers an intense yet surprisingly delicate flavor profile. The initial sip brings a wave of heat, quickly followed by a thick, syrupy cherry juice note. As the bourbon develops on the tongue, creamy citrus flavors emerge, complemented by rye spice, cinnamon stick, and plum. The signature Beam peanut shell note, while present, is more subtle in this batch, allowing other flavors to shine through.

The finish is impressively long, with waves of flavor that seem to go on forever. The interplay between sweet and spicy notes continues, with lingering hints of cinnamon, vanilla, and that characteristic dusty, salted peanut shell flavor. The high proof is evident but not overwhelming, creating a warm, satisfying conclusion to each sip.

Granny's Batch showcases the complexity and depth that Booker's is known for, offering a bourbon that is both powerful and nuanced. It's a fitting tribute to Booker Noe's grandmother, delivering a memorable tasting experience that bourbon enthusiasts will savor.

name: Jim Beam Bonded Beam Formula 12 Early 2000s Bottling Liter
description: A circa 1990s to early 2000s bottling of Jim Beam's Number 12 Formula bottled in bond at 50% Abv. This is produced prior to 2007 as noted by "six generations" on the side. The label would later include Fred Noe who became master distiller in 2007, thus changing to seven generations. This is theorised to be an export product with most of the bottles seen typically for the Australian market. This is bottled in a 1 liter format.
baxus_class_name: Jim Beam Bonded Beam Formula 12 Early 2000s Bottling Liter

name: Macallan Reflexion
description: This exceptional single malt draws its colour and flavour from maturation in smaller hogshead casks, allowing a greater surface area of wood to interact with the whisky to deliver an intricate character influenced by both Spanish and American oak casks. The depth of colour and complex flavour of Reflexion is derived from the use of first-fill casks, carefully selected for this distinctive expression to accentuate its aromas and flavours. Bold and full bodied, Reflexion is a celebration of floral and vanilla notes, punctuated with fresh apples and apricots.

name: Clase Azul Pink 2022 Release
description: Produced as a project to rasie breast cancer awareness, this is a limited edition bottle of an already prestigious Reposado tequila.

name: Crown Royal Mini
description:
Seagram's Crown Royal is a renowned Canadian whisky brand, originally created in 1939 by Samuel Bronfman as a tribute to the royal tour of Canada by King George VI and Queen Elizabeth. This blended whisky is celebrated for its smoothness and rich flavor profile, making it one of the best-selling whiskies in North America.

Crown Royal is crafted from a blend of over 50 different whiskies, each aged to perfection and meticulously selected to create a harmonious balance of flavors. The whisky is known for its signature notes of vanilla, caramel, and light oak, complemented by hints of fruit and spice. Its distinctive purple velvet bag has become iconic, symbolizing luxury and quality.

Initially available only in Canada, Crown Royal was introduced to the United States in the 1960s, where it quickly gained popularity. The brand has since expanded its range to include various expressions, such as Crown Royal Reserve, Crown Royal Black, and flavored variants like Maple and Vanilla.

Today, Crown Royal remains a staple in bars and homes alike, appreciated for its versatility—whether enjoyed neat, on the rocks, or as part of a cocktail. Its legacy continues as a symbol of Canadian whisky craftsmanship and tradition.

name: Wild Turkey Liqueur With Honey Mini
baxus_class_name: Wild Turkey Liqueur With Honey Mini

name: Blair Athol 1995 25 Year Single Butt #DL14585 Douglas Laing
description: A 1995 vintage single cask expression of Blair Athol matured for 25 years in a sherry butt. Bottled in 2020 at 57.9% Abv by Douglas Laing.
baxus_class_name: Blair Athol 1995 25 Year Single Butt #DL14585 Douglas Laing

name: Pappy Van Winkle 20 Year Family Reserve 2019 Bottling
description: A 2019 bottling of Papy Van Winkle 20 year old bourbon crafted from a historic wheated recipe now distilled by Buffalo Trace. Each release of Pappy is hand selected by Julian Van Winkle, the grandson of the original Pappy. Although originally produced using barrels from the closed Stitzel-Weller distillery, since 2002 Julian has had an agreement with Buffalo Trace to use their stocks once his stored barrels ran dry.
baxus_class_name: Pappy Van Winkle 20 Year Family Reserve 2019 Bottling

name: Jack Daniel's Single Barrel Rye Barrel Proof
baxus_class_name: Jack Daniel's Single Barrel Rye Barrel Proof

name: Wild Turkey Generations 2023 Release
description: This spirit is a blend of 9, 12, 14, and 15 year old bourbon, each one representing the original tastes of the 3 generations of Russels who have built Wild Turkey into what it is today. Blended and bottled by Jimmy, Eddie, and Bruce Russell.

name: Heaven Hill 1998 15 Year Single Barrel For Whisky Jewbilee
description: A 1998 vintage single cask expression of Heaven Hill bourbon matured for 15 years and bottled in September 2013 by the Jewish Whisky Company for their Whisky Jewbilee festival. This 1998 vintage is unique as Heaven Hill Springs, their original distillery, burned down in 1996 and HH wouldn't purchase the Bernheim distillery until 1999. The company contract distilled and sourced from distilleries in Kentucky like Jim Beam to maintain supply of their liquid. This single barrel hails from that contract distilled/sourced era, with the true producer never being disclosed. Bottled at 61.3% Abv this barrel had a tiny outturn of just 67 bottles!
baxus_class_name: Heaven Hill 1998 15 Year Single Barrel For Whisky Jewbilee

name: Heaven Hill 1998 15 Year Single Barrel For Whisky Jewbilee
description: A 1998 vintage single cask expression of Heaven Hill bourbon matured for 15 years and bottled in September 2013 by the Jewish Whisky Company for their Whisky Jewbilee festival. This 1998 vintage is unique as Heaven Hill Springs, their original distillery, burned down in 1996 and HH wouldn't purchase the Bernheim distillery until 1999. The company contract distilled and sourced from distilleries in Kentucky like Jim Beam to maintain supply of their liquid. This single barrel hails from that contract distilled/sourced era, with the true producer never being disclosed. Bottled at 61.3% Abv this barrel had a tiny outturn of just 29 bottles!
baxus_class_name: Heaven Hill 1998 15 Year Single Barrel For Whisky Jewbilee

name: Eagle Rare 17 Year Spring 2016 Release
description: A spring 2016 release of Eagle Rare matured for a huge 17 years! This release comes from Buffalo Trace's #1 low rye mashbill and is bottled as part of their highly sought after Antique Collection series.

name: Sazerac 18 Year Spring 2015 Release
description: A spring 2015 release of Sazerac rye whiskey matured for a huge 18 years! This release comes from Buffalo Trace's rye mashbill and is bottled as part of their highly sought after Antique Collection series.

name: Mount Vernon Rye 1903 Macy & Jenkins
description: A 1903 vintage expression of rye whiskey produced under the Mount Vernon brand and bottled by Macy & Jenkins. This era of the label was likely produced by Hannis Distilling Co at their DSP 3 location in Baltimore, Maryland. This batch of rye was distilled in 1903 and bottled before 1918 by merchants Macy & Jenkins of New York. This firm was closed at the start of prohibition, but no closer bottling date is available.

name: Chandler Gin Stewart Distilling Co Early 1900s Bottling
description:
A bottling of Chandler Gin made by the Stewart Distilling Co in Philadelphia. This was bottled in the early 1900s. Robert Stewart was an Irishman who emigrated to Baltimore in the middle of the 19th century. He started his distillery in 1886 in Highlandtown and then officially incorporated his business in 1894. The firm produced "Robert Stewart Rye" and contracted H.B. Kirk in New York for bottling, a firm which also bottled Old Crow Rye from W.A. Gaines & Co. Robert Stewart decided to retire and sell the company in 1897 to the Carstairs of Philadelphia. In 1898, the same year this rye whiskey was produced, a news article claims the distillery had the capacity to produce 1200-1500 gallons of whiskey per day with an expansion planned to up production to 3000 gallons per day. The Carstair Brothers ran the firm themselves from 1898 until 1908 when the firm consolidated its holdings, creating the Stewart Distilling Company and merged its historical Carstairs, Mcall & Co company into one. The distillery and firm operated until 1919. As prohibition loomed the Carstairs Mcall & Co firm chose to liquidate the site, but J.H. Carstair stepped in and purchased the distillery himself. Prohibition hampered any chance of revival however and by 1921 J.H. Carstair was out of the business. The site was sold and continued to hold liquor onsite through the early years of prohibition, even having its liquid stolen by bootleggers in 1923. The moonshiners tunnelled into the distillery from a nearby empty house and pumped the whiskey out of the barrels into containers next door. In 1924 the vice president Jacob Katz of Stewart Distillery and the manager of nearby Sherwood distillery were caught selling both barrels and cases of whiskey, actions outlawed by prohibition. Finally in 1925 the distillery was put up for sale and dismantled, being fully purchased by the Crown Oil & Wax Company in 1927. This specific bottle bears no size or strength, but one has reportedly been opened and proofed as approximately 110. We estimate this to be a 4/5th quart/750ml bottle size. 

Baxus holds a number of these assets so please carefully inspect images for their fill level and condition.
baxus_class_name: Chandler Gin Stewart Distilling Co Early 1900s Bottling

name: W.L. Weller 12 Year 2014 Bottling
description: A 2014 bottling of Weller bourbon produced at Buffalo Trace and matured for 12 years. Bottled at 90 proof this edition is presented in the older squat type bottle shape.

name: Bourbon Lore Trio Pack (3x750ml Bottles)
description:
A three bottle set of bourbons chosen by Bourbon Lore. This set includes:

Ben Holladay 18 Barrel Blend by Bourbon Lore

Binder’s Stash 8 Year Bourbon selected by Bourbon Lore

Premier Dram’s 7 Year Bourbon selected by Bourbon Lore

Each of these releases was hand selected by Bourbon Lore, a bourbon picking group founded by Mason Walker, a whiskey collector, and Clay Risen, a whiskey historian and author. 

The premier drams single barrel has been signed.

name: Old Ramshead 1916 Bottled In Bond 1930
description: Distilled in 1916, this bourbon was protected in bond by the American Medicinal Spirits Company from the Prohibition Act of 1920, which made alcohol production and consumption illegal. The whiskey was produced at the Anderson Distillery distillery in 1916, then owned by the infamous Whiskey Trust. The Trust was accused of engaging in several illegal activities, including intimidation of distillery owners who did not want to sell up to them. They acquired Anderson by some means in 1905, but were forced to close it down with the enactment of Prohibition in 1920. The stocks from the distillery were transferred to the Wathen warehouses that year, and bottled by the American Medicinal Spirits Company. The American Medicinal Spirits Company was one of only around 30 distilling companies to survive Prohibition of the 434 that existed prior. Exploiting the medicinal loophole was the brainchild of Otto Wathen, an idea which continues to prove its value today in the persisting image of his still ever-popular portfolio, which eventually included Old Grand-dad, Old Taylor and Old Crow, among many others. The American Medicinal Spirits Company was eventually subsumed by National Distillers (the revived legitimate face of The Whiskey Trust), who along with Schenley, Hiram Walker and Seagram's, became the big 4 American whiskey companies following the eventual repeal of Prohibition. The National Distillers acquisition of the AMS Co meant the return for brands such as Old Ramshead, bottled here in 1930. Sadly, as with many others, the Anderson Distillery never returned, and was razed and never rebuilt following the repeal of Prohibition.

name: Willett 8 Year Single Barrel Bourbon #5284 For Sense Of Taste
