description: A hazmat strength expression from Willett matured for 8 years and bottled at 70.4% Abv. This single barrel was chosen exclusively for Sense Of Taste, a chain of retailers in Queensland Australia.
baxus_class_name: Willett 8 Year Single Barrel Bourbon #5284 For Sense Of Taste

name: Jameson 1980s Bottling Liter
description: An early 1980s bottling of Jameson blended Irish whiskey bottled in a 1 liter format.

name: Highland Park Cask Strength Release No.2
description: The second batch of cask strength Highland Park released at 63.9% Abv.
baxus_class_name: Highland Park Cask Strength Release No.2

name: G.H. Mumm V.S.O.P Cognac
description: A VSOP expression of Cognac produced by G.H. Mumm, a brand typically known for its high end Champagne.

name: Macallan The Harmony Collection Smooth Arabica
description: This unique single malt was inspired by the Ethiopian Arabica bean. Ethiopia is claimed to be the birthplace of coffee as the Arabica bean was the first species of coffee to be cultivated. Exuding notes of ground coffee, hazelnuts, sweet raisin and vanilla, this special whisky will transport you into a world of flavour and texture, awakening all of your senses.
baxus_class_name: Macallan The Harmony Collection Smooth Arabica

name: Macallan M Decanter 2019 Release
description: M is the iconic result of an unprecedented collaboration between three masters of their crafts who shared the same unique objective - to create the world's most sophisticated whisky contained in an exquisite, exclusively designed crystal decanter. A masterpiece of design, M is brought to conception by creative director and legendary designer Fabien Baron, brought to life by Lalique mastery of crystal and brought to purpose by The Macallan.

name: Wild Turkey Master's Keep Decades
description: The second batch in the Master's Keep series from Wild Turkey, this 2018 edition celebrates 35 years of service from master distiller Eddie Russell. Crafted from a batch of bourbon matured between 10-20 years, at was bottled at 52% Abv.

name: MGP 8 Year Light Whiskey Single Beer Barrel For Whiskey Jewbilee Chicago
description: An 8 year old expression of American light whiskey produced by MGP in Indiana. The barrel for this finish was originally an MGP rye cask before it was filled with beer. Once the beer was matured the barrel was then used to finish this Indiana light whiskey. Bottled at 65.1% Abv with 225 bottles produced exclusively for the Whiskey Jewbilee Festival.
baxus_class_name: MGP 8 Year Light Whiskey Single Beer Barrel For Whiskey Jewbilee Chicago

name: Westland For Whiskey Jewbilee 2015
description: A 2015 special edition of Westland crafted from 4 casks of heavily peated single malt whisky. This vatting was bottled at 59% Abv for the 2015 Whiskey Jubilee Festival.

name: Koval Single Cask #914 For Whiskey Jewbilee 2016
baxus_class_name: Koval Single Cask #914 For Whiskey Jewbilee 2016

name: Hill And Hill Bottled In Bond 1963 Bottling
description: A 1963 bottling of Hill And Hill bourbon produced at DSP KY 19/The Old Taylor distillery. This bottled in bond expression has unfortunately had its vintage details obscured on the tax label but the glass punt suggests a circa 1963 year bottling. Hill And Hill was an esteemed brand throughout bourbon history but was produced by National Distillers post prohibition.
baxus_class_name: Hill And Hill Bottled In Bond 1963 Bottling

name: Robbie Burns Famed Old Blended Scotch 1960s Bottling
description: A 1960s era bottling of Robbie Burns Famed Scotch whisky produced by R.H. Thomson. Note there is no size or strength noted but we expect this to be 700-750ml and 40-43% Abv.
baxus_class_name: Robbie Burns Famed Old Blended Scotch 1960s Bottling

name: Hennessy Izambard Single Distillery Cognac
description: A single distillery release from Hennessy crafted from Cognac produced exclusively at the Izambard distillery. Most Hennessy products are a blend of Cognacs from multiple distilleries in the region, whereas this edition uses Cognac from just one producer.

name: Macallan 1928 50 Year Anniversary Malt
description:
A near mythical bottle of Macallan distilled in 1928! This over 50 year old expression was featured as part of the Anniversary Malt series and was a revolutionary series of bottlings designed to be purchased to celebrate a special milestone in one's life. This expression was bottled in 1983 and thus contains over 50 year old single malt spirit.

This bottle is bottled at a cask strength of 38.6% Abv, or "under strength" as 40% Abv is the modern requirement for all Scotch whisky. This release saw just 500 bottles produced in a time when single malt whisky represented the smallest of fractions of the whisky market. 

Macallan was one of the few brands in Scotland that has been able to persevere through the troubles the 20th century brought. They have maintained steady production of exceptional quality single malt whisky through war time, economic downturns and whisky market crashes. 

Pivoting in the early 1980s to focusing on bottling their own whisky as a single malt, this was an unheard of move with almost the entire whisky market exclusively drinking blends. The move would pay dividends for the Speyside giant as the early focus on single malt has meant highly aged stocks like this release are amongst the most treasure whiskies on the planet.

name: Macallan Reflexion
description: This exceptional single malt draws its colour and flavour from maturation in smaller hogshead casks, allowing a greater surface area of wood to interact with the whisky to deliver an intricate character influenced by both Spanish and American oak casks. The depth of colour and complex flavour of Reflexion is derived from the use of first-fill casks, carefully selected for this distinctive expression to accentuate its aromas and flavours. Bold and full bodied, Reflexion is a celebration of floral and vanilla notes, punctuated with fresh apples and apricots.

name: Springbank 19 Year Batch 17 That Boutique-y Whisky Company Miniature
description: A 19 year old expression of Springbank bottled as the 17th batch from That Boutique-y Whisky Company. Released at 50.2% Abv, this is a 50ml format sized miniature.
baxus_class_name: Springbank 19 Year Batch 17 That Boutique-y Whisky Company Miniature

name: Macallan 1824 Series Oscuro
description: A sherry matured expression of Macallan presented in a tall and sleek decanter. Fully matured in Oloroso sherry casks, a high proportion were 1st fill resulting in a deep red colour for the spirit. Bottled at 46.5% Abv this release is vatted together and then returned to oak casks for another 6 months of mellowing.

name: 1990s Irish Spirits Miniature Set
description:
A four bottle set of Irish produced miniature bottles from circa 1990s. This set includes:

Jameson Irish whiskey

John Power Irish Whiskey

Paddy Old Irish Whiskey

Cork Dry Gin

name: 1970s Assorted Miniature Set
description:
A selection of vintage miniature spirits. This set includes:

1970s Smirnoff Vodka. 

1970s Dewar's White label blended Scotch whisky. 

1970s Beefeater Gin

1965 vintage 6 year old Canadian Club whisky.

name: Clase Azul Tequila Dia de los Muertos 2023 Release
description: The 2023 edition of Clase Azul's hugely popular Día de Muertos Edición Limitada. This anejo tequila was matured for 25 months in American whiskey casks then finished in French Armagnac casks.
baxus_class_name: Clase Azul Tequila Dia de los Muertos 2023 Release

name: Clase Azul 25th Anniversary Edition
description: A special 1 liter release of Reposado tequila from Clase Azul bottled to celebrate their 25th anniversary. This edition is matured for 8 months in 1st fill American whisky casks and 9125 of these amazing decanters were produced.

name: Clase Azul Pink 2024 Release
description: Produced as a project to rasie breast cancer awareness, this is a limited edition bottle of an already prestigious Reposado tequila.

name: Michter's Barrel Strength Toasted Barrel Rye 2023 Release
description: A special edition release from Michter's crafed from their signature rye whiskey. This 2023 limited offering was finished in a toasted barrel and bottled at a rare barrel proof of 54.2% Abv.
baxus_class_name: Michter's Barrel Strength Toasted Barrel Rye 2023 Release

name: Weller C.Y.P.B.
description: The result of a collaboration between Buffalo Trace and bourbon fans at home, the "Craft Your Perfect Barrel" release supposedly owes its recipe to the consensus of a survey conducted by the celebrated Kentucky distillery.

name: Blanton's Gold 2023 Bottling
description: A 2023 bottling of Blanton's Gold Label bourbon, a single barrel expression from Buffalo Trace crafted from their high rye #2 mashbill. The Gold edition of this legendary bourbon his bottled at 51.5% Abv.

name: Willett 1984 24 Year Single Barrel Rye #446 For Bonili Japan Co
description: Distilled in 1984 and sourced from an undisclosed Kentucky distillery, this rye whiskey was left to mature for 24 years! Stored in new charred oak casks barrel #446 was matured in warehouse G on rick N1 and chosen exclusively for Japanese importer Bonili Japan Co. This barrel hails from a legendary period of Willett's history, a time when their warehouses were stuffed full of heavily matured stocks from many closed Kentucky distilleries.
baxus_class_name: Willett 1984 24 Year Single Barrel Rye #446 For Bonili Japan Co

name: Jack Daniel’s 1954 Gold Medal 1L
description: If there is anything as unique as the Jack Daniel’s 1954 Gold Medal commemorative bottle, it’s the story of how the Distillery came to acquire this special Gold Medal. Roger Motlow, one of Lem’s sons, received a letter about a whiskey judging contest in Brussels, Belgium. He handed the letter to Herb Fanning, his right hand man, and told him to take care of it. And indeed Mr. Herb did! He walked right out to the production line, pulled the first three bottles, and sent them on their way. According to Mr. Herb, when the folks in the advertising department found out he had pulled whiskey for the competition off the bottling line, they were a bit upset and asked why he hadn’t looked for some special whiskey for the judging. To this Mr. Herb exclaimed: “Why all Jack Daniel’s is special!” The folks in Brussels seemed to agree. Jack Daniel’s was awarded its sixth Gold Medal, the 1954 Star of Excellence.

name: Laphroaig 25 Year Cask Strength 2017 Release
description: The 2017 release of Laphroaig's 25 year old cask strength expression. This release was matured in bourbon and 2nd fill Oloroso sherry casks before being bottled at 48.9% Abv.

name: Orphan Barrel 18 Year Indigo's Hour
description: A 2024 special release from Orphan Barrel of 18 year old bourbon bottled at 90 proof. This expression was reportedly distilled in Indiana, aged in Kentucky and then bottled in Tennessee.

name: Bain's 1999 21 Year Double Cask
description: A 1999 vintage expression of double cask matured single grain whisky from James Sedgewick distillery in South Africa. Matured for 21 years this release from the Bain's label was finished in both Amontillado & Manzanilla sherry casks before being bottled at 46.8% Abv.

name: Baker's 13 Year Single Barrel
description: A limited edition offering from Jim Beam in their Baker's series. This 13 year old expression is bottled from a single barrel at 107 proof.

name: Colonel E.H. Taylor Barrel Proof Batch 11
description: The 11th batch of barrel proof bourbon from Buffalo Trace bottled as part of their EH Taylor label. This release was bottled at 129 proof in 2022.
baxus_class_name: Colonel E.H. Taylor Barrel Proof Batch 11

name: Elijah Craig 12 Year Barrel Proof Batch C919
description: A 12 year old expression of Elijah Craig from Heaven Hill bottled at a barrel proof of 68.4% Abv.
baxus_class_name: Elijah Craig 12 Year Barrel Proof Batch C919

name: Russell's Reserve Single Barrel For Blackout Barrel D-Day 74th Anniversary
description: A single barrel expression of Wild Turkey bourbon bottled in the Russell's Reserve series. This barrel was chosen by Blackout Barrel to commemorate the 74th anniversary of D-Day.
baxus_class_name: Russell's Reserve Single Barrel For Blackout Barrel D-Day 74th Anniversary

name: Gosling Brothers Barbados Falernum 1940s Bottling
description: A circa 1940s bottling of Falernum, a type of liqueur made from rum, lime and sugar. Falernum was historically produced in Barbados, although other Caribbean countries like Jamaica and Grenada have claimed origins. Falernum was typically used as a sweetening and flavouring liqueur for rum punches and cocktails of the late 1800s/early 20th century. Falernum has seen a resurgence amongst cocktail bartenders in the 21st century, with many favouring it over using standard sugar syrup or amaro. This is a circa 1940s era bottling as the glass wording imprinted in the bottle dates to 1935 at the earliest, and a similar font designed rum from Gosling Brothers was confirmed to be of circa WW2 era. This was bottled by Gosling Brothers, a Bermuda rum producer who began in 1806. The firm sourced spirits and wines for export but in 1860 they acquired their fist barrels of rum, creating the unique Gosling Black Seal blend. This brand has endured and is still today a widespread label containing blended Caribbean rums that are vatted on the island of Bermuda. As the Gosling Brothers firm acted as a supplier of wines & spirits it is therefore reasonable to assume they were also sourcing Falernum from Barbados to sell alongside their rums. Although no size or Abv is declared for this bottle we expect it to be an approx 750ml sized bottle, and likely a rough Abv of 15-25% Abv as was common for Falernum at the time.

name: Bacardi Carta Blanca Superior 1910s Bottling
description: A 1910s-1920s era vintage of Bacardi Carta Blanca Superior distilled by the Bacardi family at their Santiago de Cuba distilleries. The brand was founded in 1862 by Facundo Bacardi Masso, a Catalonian merchant who opened two distilleries to create both a light and heavy style of rum. His blended rum was a huge hit and allowed Facundo to purchase more and more distilleries, expanding further into Mexico and Puerto Rico. The Bacardi family held the firm until the company was seized by Fidel Castro in 1959 amid the Cuban Revolution. As the nation began nationalising industry, Bacardi moved its headquarters and continued production in Puerto Rico, Brazil, Spain, Canada and Mexico. This stunning bottle was produced prior to the introduction of prohibition in 1920 as it makes reference to their New York headquarters, which was closed amid nationwide prohibition. On the rear of the bottle is an Acker Merrall wine merchants (today Acker wine auctions) sticker noting tax has been paid as of 1913, thus this bottle is likely from the mid 1910s until the late 1920s. Of note are the bubbles visible in the glass, suggesting this was a hand blown glass bottle and likely therefore dates towards the earlier range as machine moulded glass became more prevalent throughout this decade. A wonderful old bottling of Cuban rum produced in their Santiago de Cuba homeland by the Bacardi family, likely during the first world war.

name: Chartreuse Green 1940s-1950s Bottling
description: A circa late 1940s until mid 1950s era bottling of Chartreuse noted by the bulged neck, imprinted band above the label, additional Chartreuse black labelling under the label as the Sheiffelin importers. Older expressions of Chartreuse are highly sought after as the liqueur actively eats sugar, mellowing over time and creating an exceptionally rich and decadent spirit. Chartreuse has been made by French monks for close to two centuries now, with the recipe a close guarded secret. The monks have been forced into exile at various times in the past, moving production to Spain at one point. Although no size is noted we expect this was bottled at the usual 55% Abv in an approx 4/5th quart/757ml format.

name: Gordon's Dry London Gin 1910s-1920s Bottling
description: A circa 1910s-1920s era bottling of Gordon's London Dry Gin likely produced at the the Gordon's Goswell Road distillery in London.  The earliest this bottle can be dated to is 1904 with the rear label noting ta report on Gordon's imitation bottles sparking the need for this newly designed bottle. Spring cap closures were introduced in the late 1920s for the brand and King George granted Gordon's a warrant in 1925, thus this bottle can conservatively be estimated to be from 1904-1924 Dry Gin of this era was commonly barrel aged anywhere from 6 months to 2 years to ensure the most mellow spirit possible.

name: Chartreuse Pre-1917 Bottling
description: A Pre-1917 era bottling of Chartreuse as noted by the inventoried date taken in 1917 on the neck of the bottle. Older expressions of Chartreuse are highly sought after as the liqueur actively eats sugar, mellowing over time and creating an exceptionally rich and decadent spirit. Chartreuse has been made by French monks for close to two centuries now, with the recipe a close guarded secret. The monks have been forced into exile at various times in the past, moving production to Spain at one point. This is a 33 1/9th fluid ounce sizing, close to an American quart sized bottling.

name: WhistlePig 10 Year Rye Piggybank Decanter
description: A 10 year old expression of rye whiskey bottled in a special decanter based on a 19th-century Berkshire Bitter Pig. Bottled at 110 proof in a 1 litre format.

name: Old Forester 4 Year Bonded 1995 Bottling Liter
description: A 1995 bottling of Old Forester bourbon matured for 4 years and bottled in bond at 50% Abv in a 1 litre format.
baxus_class_name: Old Forester 4 Year Bonded 1995 Bottling Liter

name: James E. Pepper 1946 Bottled In Bond 1950
description: A 1946 vintage expression of James E. Pepper bourbon produced at the original James E. Pepper distillery in Lexington, Kentucky. This era of Pepper bourbon was crafted at their distillery post prohibition in 1934. The Pepper family had been operating sizeable distilleries in Kentucky for generations, but when James died in 1906 his wife sold the Lexington location to a group of investors. The site operated until 1917 and was then granted a license to bottle stocks through prohibition. A fire in 1933 raised the old distillery, once known as the Henry Clay distillery, to the ground. Once prohibition was lifted the large liquor giant Schenley would come knocking, and in 1934 they purchased Old Oscar Pepper. Production was strained with World War II demanding ethanol be generated for the war effort over whiskey. Even post war Schenley suffered and in 1958 they closed the James E. Pepper distillery. This is a rare post war vintage of bourbon from the Lexington distillery which was bottled in bond at 50% Abv in 1950. The decanter used for this release has since been replicated by the new James E. Pepper distillery which sits on the same Lexington site.
baxus_class_name: James E. Pepper 1946 Bottled In Bond 1950

name: Chartreuse Voiron Yellow 1961-1969 Half Size Bottling
description: A circa 1961-1969 era bottling of yellow Chartreuse as noted by the tax stamp and importer of Schieffelin & Co New York. This firm imported Chartreuse from the 1940s until 1969 and the tax stamp affixed to this bottle was introduced in 1961, thus suggesting this 1961-1969 date range. Older expressions of Chartreuse are highly sought after as the liqueur actively eats sugar, mellowing over time and creating an exceptionally rich and decadent spirit. Chartreuse has been made by French monks for close to two centuries now, with the recipe a close guarded secret. The monks have been forced into exile at various times in the past, moving production to Spain at one point.
baxus_class_name: Chartreuse Voiron Yellow 1961-1969 Half Size Bottling

name: Chartreuse Voiron Yellow 1986-1990 Bottling
description: A circa 1986-1990 era bottling of Chartreuse yellow label. Chartreuse transitioned to black capped bottles in 1980 and 21 brands were the importer of Chartreuse until 1990. This bottle also lacks a tax stamp, which were phased out in 1985. This therefore suggests a likely bottling era of 1986-1990. Older expressions of Chartreuse are highly sought after as the liqueur actively eats sugar, mellowing over time and creating an exceptionally rich and decadent spirit. Chartreuse has been made by French monks for close to two centuries now, with the recipe a close guarded secret. The monks have been forced into exile at various times in the past, moving production to Spain at one point.

name: Chartreuse Voiron Yellow 1940s-1950s Bottling
description: A circa late 1940s until mid 1950s era bottling of Chartreuse noted by the bulged neck, imprinted band above the label, additional Chartreuse black labelling under the label as the Sheiffelin importers. Older expressions of Chartreuse are highly sought after as the liqueur actively eats sugar, mellowing over time and creating an exceptionally rich and decadent spirit. Chartreuse has been made by French monks for close to two centuries now, with the recipe a close guarded secret. The monks have been forced into exile at various times in the past, moving production to Spain at one point.

name: Chartreuse Early 1900s Bottling Pint
description: An approximately pre 1920s bottling of Chartreuse liqueur in a 16 fluid ounce/pint sized bottling. Older expressions of Chartreuse are highly sought after as the liqueur actively eats sugar, mellowing over time and creating an exceptionally rich and decadent spirit. Chartreuse has been made by French monks for close to two centuries now, with the recipe a close guarded secret. The monks have been forced into exile at various times in the past, moving production to Spain at one point.

name: Chartreuse V.E.P. 1991 Bottling
description: The 1991 release of Chartreuse's VEP expression liqueur. Standard Chartreuse is usually aged for 3-5 years but the V.E.P. expression contains liqueur aged for 11-20 years. Bottled at 54% Abv in a 1 litre format.

name: O.F.C. 1916 Bottled In Bond 1925
description: A 1916 vintage expression of bourbon whiskey produced by Albert Blanton at the Carlisle distillery. Bottled in bond at 50% Abv in 1926 at the George T. Stagg distillery in Frankfort. The Carlisle distillery was a sister distillery to George T. Stagg's Old Copper Fire Distillery and was located just 1 mile away. Details are exceptionally thin on this distillery, with no clear closure date available but the last recorded transaction for the George T. Stagg's involvement with Carlisle is dated 1920. As this coincides with prohibition it is likely Carlisle closed around this time. This pint bottling was produced by Albert Blanton at the Carlisle distillery for Schenley and bottled during prohibition.

name: EBRA Selection 1999 14 Year Single Cask #2.2
description: A 1999 vintage single barrel expression of straight bourbon whiskey matured for 14 years. Bottled in 2012 at 53.3% Abv it was chosen for the European Bourbon Rye Association.

name: Abraham Bowman 2007 Wheated Bourbon Bottled 2016
description: A 2007 vintage expression of Bowman bourbon crafted from a wheated bourbon mashbill. This special edition was bottled in 2016 at 47% Abv.

name: Elijah Craig 1990 18 Year Single Barrel #2632 Signed Bottle
description: A 1990 vintage single barrel expression of Elijah Craig bourbon bottled at 45% Abv after maturing for 18 years. This barrel was distilled at the original Heaven Hill springs before it burned down. This is a signed bottle.
baxus_class_name: Elijah Craig 1990 18 Year Single Barrel #2632 Signed Bottle

name: William Heavenhill 15 Year Cask Strength Dump 2
description: A 2014 special release from Heaven Hill as part of their William Heavenhill brand. This 15 year old bourbon was matured in barrels larger than the usual 53 gallon ones, with 5 of these oversized barrels selected for dumping in 2014. Dump #2 was bottled at 135.6 proof and just 5 barrels were used in this release.
baxus_class_name: William Heavenhill 15 Year Cask Strength Dump 2

name: Old Fitzgerald Prime 375ml
description: A United Distillers era bottling of Old Fitzgerald prime as noted by the rear UPC label of 08807. This 375ml bottling was likely sourced from the Bernheim distillery but the sourcing and ownership of Old Fitzgerald becomes hazy in the mid 1990s and into the 2000s as the brand is sold to Heaven Hill. Bottled at 86 proof.

name: W.L. Weller 7 Year Special Reserve 1990 Bottling
description: A circa 1990 bottling of Weller Special Reserve matured for 7 years and bottled at 90 proof. This era of Weller was bottled by United Distillers and produced at the now legendary Stitzel-Weller distillery.
baxus_class_name: W.L. Weller 7 Year Special Reserve 1990 Bottling

name: Very Old Fitzgerald 1946 8 Year Bottled In Bond
description: A 1946 vintage expression of Old Fitzgerald produced by Pappy Van Winkle himself at the Stitzel-Weller distillery. This Very Old bourbon was matured for 8 years and bottled in bond at 50% Abv in 1956.
baxus_class_name: Very Old Fitzgerald 1946 8 Year Bottled In Bond

name: Old Weller 7 Year 107 Proof 1979 Bottling
description: A 1979 bottling of Old Weller 107 proof bourbon matured for 7 years. This era of Weller was distilled at the Stitzel-Weller distillery from their wheated mash bourbon.

name: Old Overholt 1972 Bottling
description: A 1972 bottling of Overholt rye whiskey bottled at 86 proof. Post prohibition National Distillers crafted Overholt rye at the Broad Ford distillery in Pennsylvania until its closure in the 1950s. They continued to bottle the brand using rye sourced from another Pennsylvania distillery until National Distillers sold to Jim Beam in 1987. The source of this post Broad Ford closure has never been confirmed, but names such as Michter's are commonly suggested.

name: Old Grand-Dad 1964 Bottled 1969
description: A 1964 vintage expression of Old Grand-Dad distilled at the original Old Grand-Dad distillery in Frankfort. Bottled in 1969 this 86 proof expression was produced for the export market.

name: Old Underoof 1959 Bottled In Bond 1969 Quart
description:
A 1959 vintage expression of bourbon bottled under the historic Old Underoof brand. Bottled in bond at 50% Abv in 1969 this 6 year age stated bourbon was ultimately matured over 10 years. Produced at the Bonds Mill distillery DSP KY 35 in Lawrenceburg, this release was bottled at DSP 1 Bernheim by Schenley who held the distillery at the time. Bonds Mill was opened in 1934 on the site of the original Old Prentice distillery. This location was just opposite Old Joe Distillery, the Spanish architecture inspired distillery that would later become Four Roses Lawrenceburg. Bonds Mill was was built by Robert E. Johnson, a businessman who's lineage had produced bourbon in Lawrenceburg for the Saffell Distilling co, a storied firm in the area. They initially purchased spirit from the Old Joe distillery on the other side of the road, before fully producing their own spirits under the Bonds Mill label. The distillery was named Bond & Johnson in 1945 and then eventually purchased by Robert and Alvin Gould in 1958. The Goulds used the Bonds Mill site to create whiskey for their J.T.S. Brown label they held. They would ultimately sell the site to Schenley who acquired the existing stocks before ultimately closing production in the late 1960s. The existing warehouses were sold to Wild Turkey. 

This 1969 release was bottled at the Bernheim distillery owned by Schenley under the Old Underoof branding. Underoof was a brand heavily associated with Chas. Dennehy & Co of Chiacgo. Dennehy was a partnership between Charles Dennehy and two individuals named Weadley & Cleary. The firm sourced rye and bourbon whiskies from across the US, producing house brands such as Old Potter and Clear Spring. Their Old Underoof brand was the most popular and was launched in 1905. When Charles died his son Thomas Dennehy took over the firm, actively fighting against the questionably illegal Whiskey Trust who were trying to monopolise whiskey making in the United States. The firm was ultimately closed in 1918 as a consequence of looming prohibition, but the resurrection of its Old Underoof brand by Schenley in the 1960s suggests the firm may have acquired Dennehy's brands.
baxus_class_name: Old Underoof 1959 Bottled In Bond 1969 Quart

name: Old Overholt 1951 Bottled In Bond 1962
description: Produced at their Broad Ford distillery, this 1951 vintage expression of Old Overholt was bottled in bond at 50% Abv in 1962. Although this bottle states an 8 year age statement, the tax strip notes this is likely over 11 years of age. National Distillers operated Old Overholt post prohibition, reopening the Broad Ford distillery. This wouldn't last too long as Broad Ford was closed in the 1950s, with Overholt then bottling sourced stocks until selling to Beam in 1987. This is therefore a supremely rare expression of Old Overholt as it is produced at Broad Ford and matured far longer than usual for the brand.

name: Old Ezra 15 Year 1987 Bottling
description: A 1987 vintage bottling Old Ezra 15 year old from Ezra Brooks. This era of the brand was produced at the Medley distillery in Owensboro, a few years before it was sold to David Sherman (later Lux Row). Ezra Brooks was originally produced at the Hoffman/Old Commonwealth distillery in Lawrenceburg, with Medley acquiring the brand after Hoffman closed.

name: Old Fitzgerald 1945 Bottled In Bond 1949
description: A 1945 vintage expression of Old Fitzgerald bottled in bond at 50% Abv in 1949. This post war vintage is crafted from their original wheated mashbill and was distilled under the care of Pappy Van Winkle himself.

name: Old Crow 1967 Bottling Quart
description: A larger format quart sized bottling of Old Crow bottled in 1967 at 86 proof. This era of the distillery was produced at the original Old Crow site before the distillery was closed by Beam after acquiring National Distillers in 1987.

name: Chapin & Gore 6 Year 1970s Bottling Quart
description: A pre-1976 quart sized bottling of Chapin & Gore bourbon. Chapin & Gore was a label associated with Chicago mainly and was the main branding from merchants of the same name. They began bottling their sour mash whiskies in the 1860s and the brand found huge success in Chicago. Prohibition shuttered their operations but the brand was acquired by National Distillers who initially produced it, before later selling the label to Schenley.  This era of the brand was produced under the ownership of Schenley and notes having both Frankfort and Bardstown distilleries. It is believed the distilleries referenced are the Fairfield distillery in Bardstown as well as George T Stagg in Frankfort. This is either produced at one of those distilleries, or a blend of both. Schenley acquired Fairfield in 1945 but closed the site in the 1970s amid reduced demand for bourbon. This bottle is a 6 year old released at 93 proof in a quart format.

name: Berghoff 14 Year 100th Anniversary 1998 Bottling
description: A 14 year old expression of Kentucky bourbon bottled in 1998 to celebrate 100 years of operation of the Berghoff restaurant in Chicago. This bottling was done by Julian Van Winkle at his Old Commonwealth/Lawrenceburg site. Berghoff had long been one of Julian's best customers, with the restaurant even having its own line of Stitzel-Weller produced bourbon. This era of Julian Van Winkle's bottlings contained liquid sourced from right across Kentucky, including many closed distilleries such as Yellowstone, Glenmore, Medley and Stitzel-Weller. Given the strong history of Berghoff bottlings containing Stitzel-Weller liquid, it is likely this 100 year anniversary bottling also contains SW produced whiskey, however this cannot be stated for certain.

name: Echo Spring 6 Year 1955 Bottling
description: A historic brand of bourbon originally produced at the Murphy-Barber distillery in Clermont, which opened in 1881. This era of the brand was distilled by Schenley who acquired the label after prohibition. Schenley held a number of distilleries including the James E. Pepper, George T. Stagg and Bernheim distillery but records suggest this likely used Bernheim distillate. This is a 1955 bottling of a 6 year old bourbon bottled at 86 proof.

name: J.W. Dant 1965 Bottled In Bond 1971
description: A 1965 vintage expression of bourbon distilled at the George T Stagg distillery, now known as Buffalo Trace. Bottled in bond at 50% Abv in 1971 under the J.W. Dant branding owned by Schenley.

name: Barton 8 Year For Hotel Pfister 1955 Bottling
description: An 8 year old expression of bourbon produced by the Barton distillery in Bardstown. This special edition was bottled in 1955 exclusively for the Pfister hotel in Milwaukee at 90 proof.
baxus_class_name: Barton 8 Year For Hotel Pfister 1955 Bottling

name: David Nicholson 7 Year Bottled In Bond 1982 Bottling
description: A 1982 bottled in bond expression of bourbon produced at the Stitzel-Weller distillery. This wheated bourbon was matured for 7 years and bottled at 50% Abv in 1982.
baxus_class_name: David Nicholson 7 Year Bottled In Bond 1982 Bottling

name: Old Crow 1970s Bottling
description: An earlier 1970s era bottling of Old Crow likely matured for 6 years, but the label has unfortunately faded so we cannot be 100% certain. This era of Old Crow was produced at the original distillery before it was closed by Beam after they acquired National Distillers in 1987. This is a 90 proof offering, which is higher than the usual 80 and 86 proof Old Crows typically seen from this era.

name: Old Charter 1971 7 Year Bottled In Bond
description: A 1971 vintage expression of Kentucky bourbon distilled at the Bernheim distillery in Louisville by Schenley. Matured for 7 years this was bottled in bond at 50% Abv at DSP-KY-113, the site known as Buffalo Trace today. The Old Charter brand was acquired by the Bernheim distillery in the early 1930s before Schenley purchased Bernheim in 1937. After spending much of the 20th century being produced at Bernheim, Schenley was purchased by Guinness in 1987 and then in 1999 Buffalo Trace purchased the brand.
baxus_class_name: Old Charter 1971 7 Year Bottled In Bond

name: Verdelho 1900 Single Cask Madeira Bottled 1957 Blandy's Madeiras
description: A 1900 vintage madeira from Portugal matured in oak until 1957. This cask yielded 626 bottles with 600 imported for Sherry Wine & Spirits Co in New York. Bottled at 21% Abv this release was supplied by Blandy's Madeira.
baxus_class_name: Verdelho 1900 Single Cask Madeira Bottled 1957 Blandy's Madeiras

name: Madeira 1800 Buchanan
description: A circa 1800 produced madeira drawn from a demijohn owned by George Buchanan, a British consul. This wine was purchased from their estate in 1911 and removed from the demijohn and placed into this bottle in 1913 by Charles Bellows of New York City.

name: Old Oporto Port 1875 Boos Kaufman Syracuse
description: An 1875 vintage Port Bottled by Boos Kaufman Syracuse. Although no size is stated we estimate this to be an approximate standard size of 750ml.
baxus_class_name: Old Oporto Port 1875 Boos Kaufman Syracuse

name: Larsen Cognac 1960s Bottling
description: A circa early 1960s bottling of Larsen Cognac bottled in a 4/5th quart format at 81 proof.

name: Fine Old Port Wine Circa 1880s
description: A circa 1880s era port wine from Portugal.

name: Astor House Madeira 1770 Vintage
description:
A 1770 vintage madeira wine bottled for the Astor House, a premier hotel in New York City throughout the 19th century. The handwritten paper label on the bottle reads:

"This Madeira was bought by Mr. Francis Amory of Boston by the  year 1770 and sent by him on two voyages in his ships. On his death, it was sold to Mr’s S. D. and M.  Williams in 1805 who sold it to Stetson in 1818, who them kept a home in Boston. Stetson took this  wine to Baltimore, then to New York. [Where he became owner of The Astor House Hotel of New  York]. A bottle of this wine was opened with Home suppers in B. Presented to G. G. DeWitt Jr. by  Thomas Mannon, February 4, 1884. Recorked by Dewitt.  "

Francis Amory was a seasoned wine merchant in Boston and imported the finest quality madeira wines from Portugal as the fortified wine travelled well from Europe. The Williams family were wine merchants who then sold this to Charles A. Stetson, the owner of the Astor House hotel in New York. The hotel was famous for its food and wine offerings.

name: Lallier Champagne Reflexion R.018 Magnum
description: A 1500ml magnum format of Lallier Champagne's 2018 harvest of their Reflexion series. Produced from a blend of 56% pinot noir and 44% chardonnay grapes with 70% of the wine from their 2018 harvest and 30% from their reserves. Matured for at least 3 years in casks this champagne had 7g/L of sugar dosage and was matured in bottle since 2022. This exceptional quality champagne is the signature pour at both Baccarat and the Ritz Carlton!

name: Havana Club Special Gold 1954-1962 Bottling
description: A vintage bottling of Havana Club rum we estimate to be bottled anywhere between 1954-1962. This pre-castro era bottling features a logo design used from 1954-1962 and was exported to the US market. Havana Club was the English brand name produced by Don Jose Arechabala who purchased the La Vizcaya distillery in Cardenas in 1878. Once prohibition in the states ended the Jose Arechabala company launched Havana Club to target the American market, with both the brand and distillery remaining in family hands until the 1950s. In 1959 Cuba revolted and Fidel Castro took power, nationalising much of the country's industrial production including the sugar and thereby rum industry. The Arechabala family fled the country, leaving their distillery in the hands of the Castro government. The US shortly after introduced restrictions for Cuban made rums, thus little of Havana Club was able to make it into the United States throughout the later 20th century. Cuba and French spirits firm Pernod Ricard partnered in 1993 to distribute the rum globally, and Havana Club has become a staple sugar cane spirit for rum lovers across the world. This 1950s era bottling was produced in the pre-Castro era of the distillery, when it was by the Arechabala family and the brand was poised to be the next big thing in the US. To provide further estimation to the bottling date the tax stamp from this bottling is commonly estimated to be from 1961, however it is unclear if this design was used earlier by imported products, and thus we can only provide a range of 1954-1962.

name: Stewart Distilling Co 1898 Pure Rye
description: A bottling of Stewart Distilling Co pure rye whiskey made in 1898! This was bottled prior to the introduction of prohibition in 1919. Robert Stewart was an Irishman who emigrated to Baltimore in the middle of the 19th century. He started his distillery in 1886 in Highlandtown and then officially incorporated his business in 1894. The firm produced "Robert Stewart Rye" and contracted H.B. Kirk in New York for bottling, a firm which also bottled Old Crow Rye from W.A. Gaines & Co. Robert Stewart decided to retire and sell the company in 1897 to the Carstairs of Philadelphia. In 1898, the same year this rye whiskey was produced, a news article claims the distillery had the capacity to produce 1200-1500 gallons of whiskey per day with an expansion planned to up production to 3000 gallons per day. The Carstair Brothers ran the firm themselves from 1898 until 1908 when the firm consolidated its holdings, creating the Stewart Distilling Company and merged its historical Carstairs, Mcall & Co company into one. The distillery and firm operated until 1919. As prohibition loomed the Carstairs Mcall & Co firm chose to liquidate the site, but J.H. Carstair stepped in and purchased the distillery himself. Prohibition hampered any chance of revival however and by 1921 J.H. Carstair was out of the business. The site was sold and continued to hold liquor onsite through the early years of prohibition, even having its liquid stolen by bootleggers in 1923. The moonshiners tunnelled into the distillery from a nearby empty house and pumped the whiskey out of the barrels into containers next door. In 1924 the vice president Jacob Katz of Stewart Distillery and the manager of nearby Sherwood distillery were caught selling both barrels and cases of whiskey, actions outlawed by prohibition. Finally in 1925 the distillery was put up for sale and dismantled, being fully purchased by the Crown Oil & Wax Company in 1927. This specific bottle bears no size or strength, but can be dated to pre-1914 as Carstairs introduced a signature "non-refillable bottle" with a unique design. As Stewart Distilling Co is noted on the label this would suggest the bottle is from 1909 or later, thus making this likely an 11-16 year old rye whiskey.

name: J. Wray & Nephew Old Rum Pre-1916 Bottling
description: A circa pre-1916 bottling of J.Wray & Nephew Old Rum bottled prior to the acquisition of the firm by the Lindo Brothers. The history for this bottle is unfortunately quite hard to pin down but the noted firm name of just "J.Wray & Nephew" suggests this bottle was completed prior to the 1916 purchase of the firm, with sources suggesting the Lindo Brothers established "J.Wray & Nephew Ltd" after finalising the deal. This is somewhat contested as other research material shows this name on a 1916 advertisement of Applemony (a blend of Appleton and Monymusk) but the evidence provided for the bottle suggests this is likely bottled anywhere from the late 1890s until approximately the mid to late 1910s. This will therefore have been blended by C.J Ward, the titular nephew of original founder John Wray. Wray established his rum firm as a blender to supply his pubs, and sourced his rums from the surrounding estates. He brought C.J Ward into the business in 1860 and when Wray died in 1870 he left the entire firm to Ward. This rum is therefore likely a blend of circa early 20th century distillates sourced from the sugarcane estates around Jamaica. These will likely have been from pot stills and will have been crafted long before the ester limit was established for rum by the rum pool in the 1930s. Whilst all effort has been made to ensure historical and era accuracy, this is a supremely rare rum with little to provide more era appropriate dating, please bear this in mind when purchasing. Although no size or Abv is noted on this bottle we expect it is approximately a 750ml sized bottle.
baxus_class_name: J. Wray & Nephew Old Rum Pre-1916 Bottling

name: Hawkeye 4 Year 1964 Bottling
description: A 4 year old expression of Kentucky bourbon distilled by Double Springs Distillers at the Greenbrier distillery in Bardstown. Although often confused with the Greenbrier Distillery in Tennessee, this Greenbrier was located in Nelson County and was built in 1870 by Basil Hayden. Prohibition closed the distillery in 1920, and then post repeal it was rebuilt in 1935 by Jim Conway, a local car dealer. The plant changed hands a few times, with notable names like the Wathen brothers holding it at one point, before eventually being closed in the late 60s. This 4 year old bourbon was produced by Greenbrier under their doing business as name of Double Springs Distillers. It was chosen exclusively for Hawkeye liquors located in Minnesota.

name: Moutai Sunflower Early 1980s Bottling
description:
A circa early 1980s era bottling of Kweichow Moutai Baiju from China. This bottling holds the sunflower logo on the bottle which was introduced post Proletarian Cultural Revolution which began in 1966. This sunflower logo was officially used from 1968 until 1983. 

Please note that whilst Baxus takes every step to ensure authentic bottles are listed, Baiju is exceptionally difficult to authenticate. As the liquid cannot be clearly seen without opening the bottle this bottle cannot be 100% guaranteed as authentic, although we have examined provenance and deemed this asset okay to list. Purchases are made with this authentication concern in mind.

name: Barton 20 Year Kentucky Gentleman Early 1980s Bottling
description: A circa 1983-1985 bottling of Barton bourbon matured for a huge 20 years and bottled at 101 proof. This exceptionally old whiskey is amongst the largest age statements from the Bardstown distillery and based on the available listings from this era likely released just for the Italian market.
baxus_class_name: Barton 20 Year Kentucky Gentleman Early 1980s Bottling

name: Guedes 1944 Port 1971 Bottling
description: A 1944 vintage port from Portugal bottled at 20% Abv in 1971.

name: Old Fitzgerald Bottled In Bond 1953 Decanter
description: A 1953 bottling of Old Fitzgerald presented in an original glass decanter. Unfortunately the specific dates for this decanter have been lost as a tear at the end of the tax strip means they are missing. Old Fitzgerald was generally aged 8 years or more however, suggesting this was likely distilled in the early to mid 1940s. This glass decanter might seem familiar to Old Fitzgerald enthusiasts, with the shape being replicated by Heaven Hill in their modern Old Fitzgerald releases. This is a classic edition of Stitzel-Weller era produced bourbon that will have been hand crafted with oversight from the original Pappy Van Winkle.
baxus_class_name: Old Fitzgerald Bottled In Bond 1953 Decanter

name: Weller's Antique Reserve 10 Year 110 Barrel Proof 1960s/1970s Bottling
description: An incredible rarity, this expression of wheated bourbon was produced by Stitzel-Weller from the early 1960s until the early 1970s. Matured for 10 years it was bottled at a higher than usual barrel proof of 110 proof. Stitzel notoriously bottled at a barrel proof of 107, so a 100 proof offering is rarely seen. This will have been crafted from the original wheated recipe using jug yeast and distilled under the watch of the original Pappy Van Winkle himself.
baxus_class_name: Weller's Antique Reserve 10 Year 110 Barrel Proof 1960s/1970s Bottling

name: Old Weller 7 Year 107 Proof 1990 Bottling
description: A 1990 bottling of Weller bourbon matured for 7 years and bottled at their signature 107 proof. This Stitzel-Weller era produced bottle of the brand is crafted from their signature wheated mashbill whilst under the ownership of United Distillers.

name: Old Governor 7 Year 1969 Bottling Quart
description: A 1969 vintage bottling of Old Governor bourbon matured for 7 years and bottled at 86 proof. This quart sized bottle was likely produced by Heaven Hill at their original pre-fire Heaven Hill Springs distillery in Bardstown.

name: Old Rip Van Winkle 15 Year 2002 Bottling
description: A 2002 era bottling of Old Rip Van Winkle 15 year old bourbon. This is the first year that the 15 year old was bottled in Frankfort as Julian Van Winkle moved his bottling facilities from Lawrenceburg to Buffalo Trace in Frankfort. This release likely uses barrels distilled at his family's historic Stitzel-Weller distillery.
baxus_class_name: Old Rip Van Winkle 15 Year 2002 Bottling

name: Old Weller 7 Year 107 Proof 1988 Bottling 1 Liter
description: A 1988 bottling of Weller bourbon matured for 7 years and bottled at their signature 107 proof. This Stitzel-Weller era produced bottle of the brand is presented in a 1 liter format.
baxus_class_name: Old Weller 7 Year 107 Proof 1988 Bottling 1 Liter

name: Very Old Fitzgerald 1951 13 Year Bottled For Joseph H. Pengilly - Leaking
description:
An exceptionally rare expression of wheated bourbon from the Stitzel-Weller distillery produced in 1951 and matured for 13 years. This bottled in bond release was bottled in 1964 exclusively for a private client. This era of Stitzel will have been crafted from their original wheated recipe with home produced jug yeast and distilled under the watchful eye of Pappy Van Winkle himself. 

**Please note condition of this lot. We received the bottle leaking but the seal is still intact. Parafilm will be applied to this bottle before shipping but Baxus cannot guarantee this bottle will not leak in transit.
baxus_class_name: Very Old Fitzgerald 1951 13 Year Bottled For Joseph H. Pengilly - Leaking

name: Old Bardstown 1963 Bottled In Bond 1969
description: A 1963 vintage expression of Old Bardstown bourbon produced by Willett themselves at their original Bardstown distillery. Matured for 6 years it was bottled in bond in 1969. This era of Willett was produced at their Bardstown distillery which was opened in 1936 by Thompson and Johnny Willett in 1936. The distillery operated until the early 1980s when the heavy downturn of bourbon forced them to cease distillation. The firm operated as an NDP bottler for many years, until in 2012 the new Willett distillery opened.

name: Old Taylor 1966 Bottled In Bond 1971 Quart
description: A 1966 vintage expression of bourbon produced by the historic Old Taylor distillery. Matured until 1971 it was bottled in bond at 50% Abv. This large format quart size (946ml) release was bottled at the Old Grand-Dad facility by National Distillers.
baxus_class_name: Old Taylor 1966 Bottled In Bond 1971 Quart

name: Jack Daniel's Old No.7 1984 Bottling
description: A 1984 bottling of Jack Daniel's signature Old No.7 Tennessee whiskey. This bottling curiously is missing a proof/abv statement but Jack bottles from this era were usually released at 90 proof.

name: Wathen's Single Barrel Bottled 2002
description: A 2002 bottling of Wathen's single barrel bourbon bottled by the Charles Medley Company, a historied firm that was once the owners of Medley distillery in Owensboro. After Medley and Glenmore were sold to United Distillers in the early 1990s some of the Medley family retained stocks from the distillery. Charles Medley attempted to revive the distillery a number of times, with the site eventually becoming Green River today under different ownership. The Wathen brand was bottled by the Charles Medley Company using stocks sourced from Kentucky, and bottles from the 1990s/early 2000s likely contain Medley sourced barrels. Although the firm has never disclosed the sources, they always bottled Kentucky bourbons.

name: Willett 1959 Bicentennial 1975 Bottling
description:
A special release from Willett crafted from bourbon distilled on the 4th of February 1959 and bottled on the even of the USA's independence in 1975. Crafted from 32 barrels this 107 proof bourbon was available exclusively at Cork & bottle in Covington, Kentucky and was limited to 3168 bottles.

This era of Willett was produced at their Bardstown distillery which was opened in 1936 by Thompson and Johnny Willett in 1936. The distillery operated until the early 1980s when the heavy downturn of bourbon forced them to cease distillation. The firm operated as an NDP bottler for many years, until in 2012 the new Willett distillery opened.

name: Pikesville 1972 Bottled In Bond 1978
description: A 1972 vintage bottled in bond expression of Pikesville Maryland straight rye distilled by Majestic distillery and bottled by Standard Distillers Products in Baltimore. Pikesville was primarily a sourced brand post prohibition and its owner Andrew W. Merle contracted Majestic Distillers to produce rye for the label. Majestic would maintain this contract until 1972 when it ceased distilling operations, instead focusing on packaging and importing products. This 1972 vintage is noted to be made at Majestic in their final year of distillation. Pikesville would sourced from Pennsylvania from 1972 until 1982 when Heaven Hill purchased the brand and existing stocks.

name: Very Old Fitzgerald 1958 8 Year Bottled In Bond 1/2 Pint
description: A 1958 vintage 8 year old expression of Old Fitzgerald produced by the Stitzel-Weller distillery during the legendary Pappy Van Winkle's ownership. This 1/2 pint bottling notes is bottled in bond at 100 proof.
baxus_class_name: Very Old Fitzgerald 1958 8 Year Bottled In Bond 1/2 Pint

name: Elijah Craig 1991 20 Year Single Barrel #15
description: A special release of Elijah Craig bourbon from Heaven Hill distilled in 1991 at their original Heaven Hill Springs distillery. Matured for a huge 20 years it was bottled from a single barrel at 45% Abv.

name: Old Grand-Dad 1970 Bottled In Bond 1976 Quart
description: A 1970 vintage expression of Old Grand-Dad bottled in bond at 50% Abv in 1976. This original OGD distillery product is presented in a large format quart size bottling.
baxus_class_name: Old Grand-Dad 1970 Bottled In Bond 1976 Quart

name: Russell's Reserve Single Barrel For Baxus & BoozApp VIPs
description: A special single barrel of Russell's Reserve bourbon from Wild Turkey hand selected by the Boozapp and Baxus team on a trip to Kentucky. Barrel #23-0098 was distilled in 2014 and matured for 9 years on the 4th floor of rickhouse K at the Tyrone campus. This barrel was chosen by the team and a small number of selected VIP Boozapp users who had a sizeable amount of Russell's Reserve private barrels on their wishlist. As a spot on the pick opened up the Boozapp team flew these VIPs down to Kentucky for a once in a lifetime Wild Turkey experience. These Turkey experts helped pick the perfect barrel in collaboration with the third generation of the Russell family to work at the distillery, Bruce Russell. This 110 proof offering came from a particularly standout barrel Bruce had selected for the pick.
baxus_class_name: Russell's Reserve Single Barrel For Baxus & BoozApp VIPs

name: Michter's Single Barrel Rye Early 2000s Bardstown Bottling
description: An early 2000s era bottling of Michter's single barrel rye whiskey sourced and bottled in collaboration with KBD (now Willett) at their Bardstown facility. Michter's early bottles were sourced and bottled with the help of Julian Van Winkle at his Old Commonwealth/Lawrenceburg distillery. Julian shut this location in 2002 and moved to the Buffalo Trace distillery, prompting Michter's to establish a partnership with Kentucky Bourbon Distillers in Bardstown. At this time Willett/KBD's warehouses were stocked full of exceptionally mature and rare barrels sourced from both open and closed distilleries like Heaven Hill, Yellowstone, Glenmore, Medley and Stitzel-Weller. Michter's founder Joe Magliocco used their stocks and bottling facilities whilst contract distilling his whiskies at Old Forester.
baxus_class_name: Michter's Single Barrel Rye Early 2000s Bardstown Bottling

name: Henry McKenna 2003 10 Year Single Barrel
description: A 2003 vintage expression of Henry McKenna bourbon produced at the Heaven Hill distillery. Matured for 10 years, this single barrel is bottled in bond at 50% Abv.

name: Pappy Van Winkle 20 Year Family Reserve 2015 Bottling
description: A 2015 bottling of Papy Van Winkle 20 year old bourbon crafted from a historic wheated recipe now distilled by Buffalo Trace. Each release of Pappy is hand selected by Julian Van Winkle, the grandson of the original Pappy. Although originally produced using barrels from the closed Stitzel-Weller distillery, since 2002 Julian has had an agreement with Buffalo Trace to use their stocks once his stored barrels ran dry.
baxus_class_name: Pappy Van Winkle 20 Year Family Reserve 2015 Bottling

name: George T. Stagg 2011 Release
description: A bottling of George T. Stagg, a 15 year or older bourbon from Buffalo Trace crafted from their #1 low rye mashbill. This barrel proof bourbon is bottled each year as part of Buffalo Trace's Antique Collection. This 2011 bottling is released at 142.6 proof.

name: Pappy Van Winkle 15 Year Family Reserve 2021 Bottling
description: A 15 year old expression of wheated bourbon carefully chosen by Julian Van Winkle, the grandson of the original Pappy Van Winkle. Early Van Winkle offerings were crafted from barrels sourced from the legendary closed Stitzel-Weller distillery, but in 2002 Julian struck a deal with Buffalo Trace to use their wheated bourbon once his stored barrels ran empty. This 2022 bottling will have been crafted from Buffalo Trace's wheated bourbon mashbill and carefully blended by Julian Van Winkle.
baxus_class_name: Pappy Van Winkle 15 Year Family Reserve 2021 Bottling

name: Pappy Van Winkle 20 Year Family Reserve Pre-2007 Bottling
description: A circa 2002-2007 bottling of Pappy Van Winkle 20 year old. This era is denoted by the Frankfort address on the bottle, as Julian Van Winkle bottled his bourbon at his Lawrenceburg site until moving in 2002. Laser codes were then introduced to the series in 2007. This bottle does not have a laser code but holds the Frankfort address, this making it a 2002-2007 era bottling. This window of time is within the production period of Stitzel-Weller and likely contains wheated bourbon produced at the now legendary closed Louisville distillery.
baxus_class_name: Pappy Van Winkle 20 Year Family Reserve Pre-2007 Bottling

name: George T. Stagg 2009 Release
description: A bottling of George T. Stagg, a 15 year or older bourbon from Buffalo Trace crafted from their #1 low rye mashbill. This barrel proof bourbon is bottled each year as part of Buffalo Trace's Antique Collection. This 2009 bottling is released at 141.4 proof.

name: George T. Stagg 2007 Release
description: A bottling of George T. Stagg, a 15 year or older bourbon from Buffalo Trace crafted from their #1 low rye mashbill. This barrel proof bourbon is bottled each year as part of Buffalo Trace's Antique Collection. This 20107 bottling is released at 144.8 proof.

name: Van Winkle 12 Year Special Reserve Lot "B" 2010 Bottling
description: A 12 year old expression of wheated bourbon carefully chosen by Julian Van Winkle, the grandson of the original Pappy Van Winkle. Early Van Winkle offerings were crafted from barrels sourced from the legendary closed Stitzel-Weller distillery, but in 2002 Julian struck a deal with Buffalo Trace to use their wheated bourbon once his stored barrels ran empty. This 2010 bottling will have been crafted from Buffalo Trace's wheated bourbon mashbill and carefully blended by Julian.
baxus_class_name: Van Winkle 12 Year Special Reserve Lot "B" 2010 Bottling

name: Van Winkle 13 Year Family Reserve Rye 13 Year 2006 Bottling
description: A 13 year old expression of rye whiskey chosen by Julian Van Winkle and bottled at the Buffalo Trace distillery. This batch of rye whiskey was reportedly sourced from the closed Medley distillery and matured in cask from 1985 until 2004 when it was tanked to halt further aging. Once the liquid was tanked Julian then blended rye whiskey from the Old Bernheim distillery known as Cream Of Kentucky through the existing stocks. This means that despite Van Winkle ryes holding a 13 year age statement, the vatting was over 19 years of age. A small amount of the tanked liquid was released each year from 2004 until 2016, with 2017 not seeing any bottle's released and 2018 transitioning to Buffalo Trace distilled spirit. This 2006 bottling is therefore one of the early releases of sourced rye whiskey, containing the original tanked 19 year Medley product along with the blended Cream Of Kentucky rye whiskey.
baxus_class_name: Van Winkle 13 Year Family Reserve Rye 13 Year 2006 Bottling

name: Van Winkle 12 Year Special Reserve Lot "B" 2011 Bottling
description: A 12 year old expression of wheated bourbon carefully chosen by Julian Van Winkle, the grandson of the original Pappy Van Winkle. Early Van Winkle offerings were crafted from barrels sourced from the legendary closed Stitzel-Weller distillery, but in 2002 Julian struck a deal with Buffalo Trace to use their wheated bourbon once his stored barrels ran empty. This 2011 bottling will have been crafted from Buffalo Trace's wheated bourbon mashbill and carefully blended by Julian.
baxus_class_name: Van Winkle 12 Year Special Reserve Lot "B" 2011 Bottling

name: Van Winkle 12 Year Special Reserve Lot "B" 2016 Bottling
description: A 12 year old expression of wheated bourbon carefully chosen by Julian Van Winkle, the grandson of the original Pappy Van Winkle. Early Van Winkle offerings were crafted from barrels sourced from the legendary closed Stitzel-Weller distillery, but in 2002 Julian struck a deal with Buffalo Trace to use their wheated bourbon once his stored barrels ran empty. This 2016 bottling will have been crafted from Buffalo Trace's wheated bourbon mashbill and carefully blended by Julian.
baxus_class_name: Van Winkle 12 Year Special Reserve Lot "B" 2016 Bottling

name: Van Winkle 13 Year Family Reserve Rye 13 Year 2016 Bottling
description: A 13 year old expression of rye whiskey chosen by Julian Van Winkle and bottled at the Buffalo Trace distillery. This batch of rye whiskey was reportedly sourced from the closed Medley distillery and matured in cask from 1985 until 2004 when it was tanked to halt further aging. Once the liquid was tanked Julian then blended rye whiskey from the Old Bernheim distillery known as Cream Of Kentucky through the existing stocks. This means that despite Van Winkle ryes holding a 13 year age statement, the vatting was over 19 years of age. A small amount of the tanked liquid was released each year from 2004 until 2016, with 2017 not seeing any bottle's released and 2018 transitioning to Buffalo Trace distilled spirit. This 2016 bottling is therefore the final release of sourced rye whiskey, containing the original tanked 19 year Medley product along with the blended Cream Of Kentucky rye whiskey.
baxus_class_name: Van Winkle 13 Year Family Reserve Rye 13 Year 2016 Bottling

name: Pappy Van Winkle 20 Year Family Reserve 2021 Bottling
description: A 2021 bottling of Papy Van Winkle 20 year old bourbon crafted from a historic wheated recipe now distilled by Buffalo Trace. Each release of Pappy is hand selected by Julian Van Winkle, the grandson of the original Pappy. Although originally produced using barrels from the closed Stitzel-Weller distillery, since 2002 Julian has had an agreement with Buffalo Trace to use their stocks once his stored barrels ran dry.
baxus_class_name: Pappy Van Winkle 20 Year Family Reserve 2021 Bottling

description: A 2018 bottling of Papy Van Winkle 23 year old bourbon crafted from a historic wheated recipe now distilled by Buffalo Trace. description: A 15 year old expression of wheated bourbon carefully chosen by Julian Van Winkle, the grandson of the original Pappy Van Winkle. This 2022 bottling will have been crafted from Buffalo Trace's wheated bourbon mashbill and carefully blended by Julian Van Winkle.
baxus_class_name: Pappy Van Winkle 15 Year Family Reserve 2022 Bottling

name: Thomas H. Handy 2006 Release
description: A barrel proof expression of rye whiskey from Buffalo Trace matured for at least 6 years and released as part of their annual Antique Collection series. This 2006 bottling is the first batch to be released and is bottled at 132.7 proof.

name: Black Maple Hill 14 Year Single Barrel Bourbon #153
description: A 14 year old expression of single barrel bourbon bottled by KBD (Willett) at their distillery in Bardstown on behalf of CVI Brands in California. This barrel is part of the legendary Black Maple Hill label, a line of bottlings from CVI brands sourced from the warehouses of Julian Van Winkle & Willett. During the 1990s and early 2000s these warehouses were stuffed full of very mature barrels of Kentucky bourbon and rye amid the industry downturn. The sources of these barrels are typically undeclared, but both Willett & Julian Van Winkle had access to many of the closed 1980s/1990s Kentucky distilleries like Medley, Glenmore, Yellowstone and Stitzel-Weller. They also worked closely with Heaven Hill to contract and purchase very mature barrels. Savvy firms like CVI brands created specialist labels like Black Maple Hill to bottle these mature whiskies as single barrels. Barrel #153 was bottled in the mid 2000s by KBD in Bardstown and is released at 47.5% Abv.
baxus_class_name: Black Maple Hill 14 Year Single Barrel Bourbon #153

name: A.H. Hirsch Reserve 1974 16 Year Blue Wax
description: A 1974 vintage expression of pot still produced straight bourbon whiskey from the original Michter's distillery in Pennsylvania. Adolph Hirsch commissioned 400 barrels to be filled by Michter's master distiller Dick Stoll. These barrels were left to mature in Pennsylvania until Michter's shut its doors in the 1980s. The stocks were purchased by liquor legend Gordon Hue, who then contracted Julian Van Winkle to bottle the barrels. A number of different versions of this 400 barrel batch were released, some with wax tops and a hand-full exclusive to the Japanese market. The stocks eventually changed hands, resulting in this gold foil topped edition. This is the bourbon heralded by Chuck Cowdery as "The best bourbon you'll never try" in his book. The mythos of the Michter's pot still product has become legend and resulted in this 1974 batch being amongst the most sought after bourbon in Kentucky.
baxus_class_name: A.H. Hirsch Reserve 1974 16 Year Blue Wax

name: Very Very Old Fitzgerald 1958 12 Year Export
description: A 1958 vintage expression of Very Very Old Fitzgerald matured for 12 years and bottled at 86 proof for the export market in 1970. This original recipe Stitzel-Weller era product will have been crafted whilst the legendary Pappy Van Winkle was at the helm of the distillery.
baxus_class_name: Very Very Old Fitzgerald 1958 12 Year Export

name: KBD Jazz Club 12 Year Cool Jazz Edition
description: A late 1990s/early 2000s bottling of 12 year old Kentucky bourbon sourced from an undisclosed distillery and bottled by KBD/Willett. Throughout the late 20th century Willett's warehouse were stuffed full of very old bourbon and rye whiskies sourced from right across Kentucky, including many closed distilleries like Stitzel-Weller, Yellowstone, Glenmore and Medley. Trading as Kentucky Bourbon Distillers (KBD), they operated as an NDP sourcing barrels and bottling them under their own unique brands. This 12 year old expression was bottled at 101 proof as part of their Jazz Club collection label under the assumed doing business name of "Jazz Distillers".
baxus_class_name: KBD Jazz Club 12 Year Cool Jazz Edition

name: Parker's Heritage Collection Fifth Edition 10 Year Cognac Barrel
description: A 2011 special release, this is the 5th edition in Heaven Hill's Parker's Heritage Collection. This release was comprised of 10 year old Kentucky bourbon finished for 6 months in French oak Grande Champagne Cognac casks. The Parker's Heritage Collection celebrates the tenure of the late master distiller Parker Beam. The series showcases unique styles of Heaven Hill spirit and has seen bourbon matured for over 27 years as well as wheat whiskey and even Kentucky malt whiskey included.

name: W.L. Weller 10 Year Centennial Louisville Bottling
description: Introduced in 1996 as part of the bourbon heritage collection, this 10 year old expression of wheated bourbon was sourced from the Stitzel-Weller distillery and bottled at 50% Abv. The BHC series was launched by United Distillers during their short lived interest in bourbon. Once United merged to form Diageo that enthusiasm disappeared, leading to them selling their Bernheim distillery in Louisville to Heaven Hill, and selling their Weller brand to Buffalo Trace. This is a United Era release using spirit from Stitzel-Weller that was bottled at their Bernheim distillery in Louisville. The 10 year Centennial label was produced by Buffalo Trace in the 2000s and was discontinued around 2008.
baxus_class_name: W.L. Weller 10 Year Centennial Louisville Bottling

name: Mellwood 1914 Bottled In Bond 1918
description: Distilled in 1914 at the Mellwood Distillery, the 34th distillery in the 5th district of Kentucky, this whisky was bottled in bond at 50% abv in 1918 just before prohibition started looming its head. Mellwood was acquired by The Whiskey Trust in 1899, a firm that would later become the American Medicinal Spirits Co. Mellwood closed in 1918 but was one of the few old sites to reopen post prohibition, operating as General Distilling Company for National Distillers before once again closing in the 60s, this time for good.

name: Old Weller 7 Year 107 Proof 1975 Bottling
description: A 1975 bottling of Weller bourbon matured for 7 years and bottled at their signature 107 proof. This Stitzel-Weller era produced bottle of the brand is crafted from their signature wheated mashbill.

name: Old Charter 13 Year Louisville Bottling
description: In the early 1990s, United Distillers & Vintners, the company that would later become Diageo, released The Bourbon Heritage Collection. The Heritage Collection was a series of five bottles from the company's US distilleries. This bottle was released as part of that set. Earlier editions like this were bottled by United Distillers at their Bernheim distillery in Louisville. The label was then acquired by Buffalo Trace and bottled in Frankfort.

name: Weller Full Proof
description: William Larue Weller developed his original bourbon recipe with wheat, rather than rye. Bottled at the same 114 proof the spirit was when it entered into the barrel, this non-chill filtered wheated bourbon forgoes chill filtration to preserve all the naturally occurring residual oils and flavors that occur during the distillation and aging process (potentially making it appear cloudy at cold temperatures). This bourbon balances a rich mouth feel, with robust notes of vanilla and oak. A whiskey that satisfies the demand of the non-chill filtered whiskey enthusiasts, honoring the man who made wheated bourbon legendary.

name: Penelope 4 Year Toasted "Marshmallow Toast"
description: A private batch of Penelope bourbon finished in heavy charred casks and nicknamed "Marshmallow Toast". This batch is bottled at 55% Abv.

Notably the colour comes from the use of saffron but the liqueur also contains Ceylon cinnamon, Florentine iris, Italian Apennine juniper and Samnite mint. The tax stamp affixed to this asset dates the bottle to the 1980s or early 1990s.

description: A 1964 vintage expression of Canadian whiskey matured for 6 years and bottled under the O.F.C label by Schenley.

name: Blanton's Single Barrel 2019 Bottling
description:
Blanton's Single Barrel Bourbon is a celebrated expression that holds the distinction of being the first single-barrel bourbon ever produced, introduced in 1984 by Buffalo Trace Distillery. Known for its rich heritage and craftsmanship, Blanton's has become a sought-after favorite among bourbon enthusiasts.

Each bottle of Blanton's comes from a single barrel, resulting in unique flavor profiles that can vary from one release to another. Typically bottled at 93 proof, this bourbon is aged in charred American white oak barrels, allowing it to develop a complex character over time. 

On the nose, Blanton's Single Barrel offers inviting aromas of honey, caramel, and ripe fruit, complemented by hints of citrus and spice. The palate is full-bodied and vibrant, featuring flavors of cinnamon, vanilla, and dark chocolate. A subtle spiciness adds depth, while the finish is smooth and lingering, leaving behind notes of oak and sweet toffee.

Blanton's iconic packaging includes a distinctive bottle shape and a horse-and-jockey stopper that has become a collector's item in its own right. With its combination of quality, rarity, and craftsmanship, Blanton's Single Barrel remains a benchmark for bourbon aficionados and continues to capture the hearts of whiskey lovers around the world.

name: Maker's Mark Private Select For The Twisted Tail 2024
description: A special single barrel expression of Maker's Mark chosen exclusively for The Twisted Tail in 2024. This barrel was finished with the following oak stave profile: 1 baked American Pure, 1 seared French cuvee, 2 Maker's Mark 46, 5 roasted French mendiant and 1 toasted French spice. It was bottled at 55.65% abv with 240 bottles released.
baxus_class_name: Maker's Mark Private Select For The Twisted Tail 2024

name: Blanton's Single Barrel 2024 Bottling Miniature
description: A miniature bottling of Blanton's single barrel presented in a 50ml size and bottled in 2024.

name: Willett 1990 18 Year Single Barrel Bourbon #8551 For Dug'z & Willy'z
description: Distilled in 1990 and sourced from an undisclosed Kentucky distillery, this bourbon whiskey was left to mature for 18 years! Stored in new charred oak casks barrel #8551 was matured in warehouse C on rick North 14 and chosen exclusively for Dug'z & Willy'z. This barrel hails from a legendary period of Willett's history, a time when their warehouses were stuffed full of heavily matured stocks from many closed Kentucky distilleries.
baxus_class_name: Willett 1990 18 Year Single Barrel Bourbon #8551 For Dug'z & Willy'z

name: Remy Martin V.S.O.P Large Format 1960s Bottling
