baxus_class_name: Remy Martin V.S.O.P Large Format 1960s Bottling

name: Virginia Gentleman 4 Year 1969 Bottling
description: Produced at the original A. Smith Bowman distillery in Fairfax County, this 1969 bottling was produced long before the Virginia distillery became a redistillation plant for Sazerac.

name: Very Olde St. Nick Summer Rye Cask Lot S32
description: An olde summer rye whiskey sourced from an undisclosed distillery in Kentucky. This 86 proof offering was bottled by Preservation distillery as part of their long running Olde St. Nick label.
baxus_class_name: Very Olde St. Nick Summer Rye Cask Lot S32

name: Westland Single Cask For Whisky Jewbilee Seattle 2016
description: A 2016 special release from Single Cask Nation bottled exclusively for the Whisky Jewbilee show in Seattle. This release is an evolution of the 2015 release which took four casks of peated Westland single malt and vatted them together. A small portion of the 2015 vatting was put aside and filled into a bourbon barrel for 9 more months. This 2016 offering is that bourbon barrel bottled at 58.1% Abv.
baxus_class_name: Westland Single Cask For Whisky Jewbilee Seattle 2016

name: Catoctin Creek 2011 3 Year Single Cask Rye #107 Single Cask Nation
description: A 2011 vintage single cask expression of 100% rye grain whiskey produced in Virginia by Catoctin Creek. This release was matured for 3 years, first in a fresh filled white wine cask then a charred American oak cask. It was bottled at 62.4% Abv by Single Cask Nation with 251 bottles produced.
baxus_class_name: Catoctin Creek 2011 3 Year Single Cask Rye #107 Single Cask Nation

name: MGP Rye & Bourbon Blend For Whisky Jewbilee
description: A special blend of bourbon and rye whiskies from MGP in Indiana bottled exclusively for the Whiskey Jubilee Festival. This release contains 5 year old rye whiskey blended with 12 year old bourbon before being bottled at 53% Abv with 280 bottles produced.
baxus_class_name: MGP Rye & Bourbon Blend For Whisky Jewbilee

name: Wild Turkey 2012 9 Year Single Cask #21-0036 Single Cask Nation
description: A 2012 vintage single cask expression of Wild Turkey matured for 9 years on the 4th floor of rickhouse MCB. Bottled in 2022 at 56% Abv by Single Cask Nation with 168 bottles produced.
baxus_class_name: Wild Turkey 2012 9 Year Single Cask #21-0036 Single Cask Nation

name: Hine Old Vintage Grande Champagne Cognac 1970s Bottling
description: A 1970s bottling of Hine Cognac crafted from grapes from the Grande Champagne region.
baxus_class_name: Hine Old Vintage Grande Champagne Cognac 1970s Bottling

name: Chateau De Laubade 1947 Bas Armagnac
description: A 1947 vintage post war expression of Armagnac from Chateau De Laubade bottled at 45% Abv.

name: Four Roses 8 Year Private Selection OBSV For Borbone Brigante
description: A barrel strength expression of Four Roses chosen from a single cask after 8 years of maturation. It was crafted from the OBSV recipe which has a 35% rye grain mashbill. This barrel was pulled from warehouse MW and is bottled at 62.8% Abv exclusively for Borbone Brigante in 2017.
baxus_class_name: Four Roses 8 Year Private Selection OBSV For Borbone Brigante

name: Four Roses 8 Year Private Selection OESK For Gordon's
description: A barrel strength expression of Four Roses chosen from a single cask after 8 years of maturation. It was crafted from the OESK recipe which has a 20% rye grain mashbill. This barrel was pulled from warehouse AN and is bottled at 54% Abv.
baxus_class_name: Four Roses 8 Year Private Selection OESK For Gordon's

name: Yamazaki 18 Year
description: Yamazaki 18 Year Old is an award winning Japanese single malt. This legendary 18 year old whisky earned a Gold at the 2007 International Spirits Challenge and a Double Gold at the 2005 San Francisco World Spirits Competition. Being one of Suntory’s most popular products, you know you have quality when you have Yamazaki.

name: Jameson Gold Reserve - 2015
description: Gold Reserve is comprised of three different pot still whiskeys and one grain whiskey. Of the pot still whiskeys, one is aged in virgin American oak for 8-10 years, one in ex-bourbon for 10-20 years, and one in ex-sherry for 10-12 years

name: Macallan Estate
description: The Macallan Estate is the Whisky Maker’s tribute to their heritage and home. It is an extremely special new single malt containing rare spirit from a proportion of the barley grown at Easter Elchies estate, which is distilled just once a year over the course of a single week. Created by Whisky Maker Sarah Burgess, The Macallan Estate is a celebration of the single malt’s peerless provenance and heritage.

name: Michter's Toasted Barrel Bourbon 2021 Release
description: First introduced to great acclaim in the Fall of 2014, Michter;'s Toasted Barrel Finish Bourbon is a groundbreaking whiskey expression. It is made by taking Michter's Kentucky Straight Bourbon and aging it for additional time in a second custom-made barrel.

name: Blood Oath Pact No. 4
description: The 4th expression of Blood Oath from Lux Rowe crafted from Kentucky straight bourbon finished in toasted oak barrels and bottled at 49.3% Abv.

name: Old Forester Single Barrel 100 Proof For The Barrel Drip
description: A 100 proof expression of bourbon from Old Forester bottles exclusively for The Barrel Dip.
baxus_class_name: Old Forester Single Barrel 100 Proof For The Barrel Drip

name: Ron Caney Superior Carta De Oro Pre-Castro 1960s Bottling
description:
A unique vintage bottling of Ron Caney rum produced in Santiago De Cuba. Reference material for dating information is thin on the ground but the brand claims to have been in operation for over 150 years and was reportedly produced at the same site Bacardi used in Cuba. The red logo would suggest this was either an offshoot of the Bacardi brand, or a rival company looking to replicate Bacardi's look. 

Conservatively we estimate this bottle to have been released in roughly the 1930s-1940s due to the glass style and seal. However a lack of strength, tax stamp or sizing precludes any further accurate dating. Other verifiable 1960s era bottlings of Ron Caney feature a red hut logo instead, this this will have been produced prior.
baxus_class_name: Ron Caney Superior Carta De Oro Pre-Castro 1960s Bottling

name: Sutter's Distilled Dry Gin 1943 Bottling
description: A 1943 bottling of dry gin produced from sugar cane in Cuba and bottled by Cook McFarland under the Sutter's brand.

name: Special Old Reserve 1917 Bottled In Bond 1932
description: A 1917 vintage pre prohibition era expression of bottled in bond bourbon produced by the R.P. Pepper distillery #RD 368 located in Nelson County. This distillery was a part of The Anderson & Nelson Distilleries Co, a firm that held approximately 6 distilleries before it was later acquired in 1905 by The Whiskey Trust who sought to monopolise the US distilling industry. The distillery was closed at the start of prohibition and its warehouses used as concentration storage for other distilleries. This was bottled by American Medicinal Spirits Co (the prohibition era name of The Whiskey Trust) in 1932 under their own Special Old Reserve label.
baxus_class_name: Special Old Reserve 1917 Bottled In Bond 1932

name: Martell Very Old Pale Cognac 1950s Bottling Half Size
description: A half sized format bottling of Martell Very Pale Cognac from approximately the 1950s-1960s. Note no size is given for this bottle but we estimate it to be approximately 300-375ml in size. This lot is sealed with a spring cap closure notorious for keeping a perfect seal and used until the start of the 1960s.
baxus_class_name: Martell Very Old Pale Cognac 1950s Bottling Half Size

name: Jamaica 1993 Cask #3 & #23 Bottled 2011 Samaroli
description: A 1993 vintage expression of Jamaican rum vatted from two casks and bottled in 2011 at 43% Abv by legendary Italian independent bottler Samaroli.

name: Maison Peuchet Reserve De l'Empereur X.O. Grande Champagne Cognac
description: An XO expression of Cognac produced from grapes sourced in the Grande Champagne region of Cognac by Maison Peuchet.
baxus_class_name: Maison Peuchet Reserve De l'Empereur X.O. Grande Champagne Cognac

name: Yellow Chartreuse 1940s Bottling Half Liter L.Garnier
description: A circa early to mid 1940s bottling of Yellow Chartreuse.. Older expressions of Chartreuse are highly sought after as the liqueur actively eats sugar, mellowing over time and creating an exceptionally rich and decadent spirit. Chartreuse has been made by French monks for close to two centuries now, with the recipe a close guarded secret. The monks have been forced into exile at various times in the past, moving production to Spain at one point. This is a half liter sized bottling likely bottled around 40-43% Abv.
baxus_class_name: Yellow Chartreuse 1940s Bottling Half Liter L.Garnier

name: Sandy Macdonald Special Scotch Whisky 1950s Bottling
description: A circa 1950s spring cap sealed expression of Sandy Macdonald. This blend notably included Glendullan. Although this bottle has no size or strength we expect this to be roughly 750ml in size and 40-43% Abv.
baxus_class_name: Sandy Macdonald Special Scotch Whisky 1950s Bottling

name: Chartreuse Green 1990s Bottling L.Garnier
description: A circa 1990s bottling of green label Chartreuse. Older expressions of Chartreuse are highly sought after as the liqueur actively eats sugar, mellowing over time and creating an exceptionally rich and decadent spirit. Chartreuse has been made by French monks for close to two centuries now, with the recipe a close guarded secret. The monks have been forced into exile at various times in the past, moving production to Spain at one point.

name: Knob Creek 18 Year Batch KC001
description: The first batch of Knob Creek's huge 18 year old age statement released in 2022. Bottled at 100 proof this highly mature Kentucky bourbon is crafted from Jim Beam's lower rye grain mashbill.

name: Domaine Du Hourtica 1942 7 Year Francis Darroze Bas-Armagnac 1984 Bottling
description: Distilled in 1942 by Domaine Du Hourtica this Bas-Armagnac was matured for 7 years in wood. The rear label notes it ws bottled in 1984 suggesting this Armagnac likely spent 7 years in cask before sitting in a demijohn from 1949-1984. Bottled at 88 proof by agent Franics Darroze.
baxus_class_name: Domaine Du Hourtica 1942 7 Year Francis Darroze Bas-Armagnac 1984 Bottling

name: Rob Roy De Luxe 1960s Bottling
description:
A 1960s era bottling of Rob Roy De Luxe blended Scotch whisky produced by The Scottish Trading Company before it was acquired by Stanley P. Morrison in 1967. 

**Please note this asset is likely missing a tax stamp but the metal capped seal appears to still be intact. Please carefully inspect images before purchasing.

name: Macallan 74 Year Red Collection 2020 Release
description: The 2020 expression of Macallan's 74 year old age statement released as part of their red collection series. This line of bottlings features high age stated Macallan single malt matured in the finest oak casks and bottled in a special liver. Red is a core theme in the Macallan's brand identity, with the whisky often matured in sherry casks resulting in a deep red colour. This labelling is a nod to the original Macallan bottlings from the early 1980s like the signature anniversary series.

name: Macallan 40 Year Red Collection 2020 Release
description: The 2020 expression of Macallan's 40 year old age statement released as part of their red collection series. This line of bottlings features high age stated Macallan single malt matured in the finest oak casks and bottled in a special liver. Red is a core theme in the Macallan's brand identity, with the whisky often matured in sherry casks resulting in a deep red colour. This labelling is a nod to the original Macallan bottlings from the early 1980s like the signature anniversary series.

name: Macallan 77 Year Red Collection 2022 Release
description: The 2022 expression of Macallan's 77 year old age statement released as part of their red collection series. This line of bottlings features high age stated Macallan single malt matured in the finest oak casks and bottled in a special liver. Red is a core theme in the Macallan's brand identity, with the whisky often matured in sherry casks resulting in a deep red colour. This labelling is a nod to the original Macallan bottlings from the early 1980s like the signature anniversary series.

description: The 2020 expression of Macallan's 50 year old age statement released as part of their red collection series. This line of bottlings features high age stated Macallan single malt matured in the finest oak casks and bottled in a special liver. Red is a core theme in the Macallan's brand identity, with the whisky often matured in sherry casks resulting in a deep red colour. This labelling is a nod to the original Macallan bottlings from the early 1980s like the signature anniversary series.

description: The 2020 expression of Macallan's 60 year old age statement released as part of their red collection series. This line of bottlings features high age stated Macallan single malt matured in the finest oak casks and bottled in a special liver. This labelling is a nod to the original Macallan bottlings from the early 1980s like the signature anniversary series.

name: Macallan 78 Year Red Collection 2020 Release
description: The 2020 expression of Macallan's 78 year old age statement released as part of their red collection series. This line of bottlings features high age stated Macallan single malt matured in the finest oak casks and bottled in a special liver. Red is a core theme in the Macallan's brand identity, with the whisky often matured in sherry casks resulting in a deep red colour. This labelling is a nod to the original Macallan bottlings from the early 1980s like the signature anniversary series.

name: Wild Turkey Single Barrel "Kentucky Spirit"
description: A single barrel expression of Wild Turkey's signature 101 proof offering bottled under their Kentucky Spirit label.

name: Westland 2013 7 Year Single Cask #437 Single Cask Nation
description: Founded in 2010 in Seattle, WA, Westland Distillery mashes, distills, matures and bottles American Single Malt Whiskey in the heart of the Pacific Northwest. Distilled in the Scottish tradition and matured in the American style, Westland brings a new and distinctly American voice to the world of single malt whiskey. This is a Single Cask Nation exclusive bottling.
baxus_class_name: Westland 2013 7 Year Single Cask #437 Single Cask Nation

name: Booker’s Little Book Chapter 2 2018 Bottling
description: Little Book Chapter 2 (Noe Simple Task) is a blend of Kentucky-made rye whiskey, a 13-year-old Canadian rye and a 40-year-old blended Canadian whisky. Each of these components were aged in different styles of casks and lended different notes to the final, interesting, product.

name: Michter's 10 Year Single Barrel Bourbon 2016 Bottling
description: A 2016 bottling of 10 year old bourbon bottled from a single barrel by Michter's. Prior to 2015 Michter's was contract producing its spirits at an undisclosed Brown-Forman distillery, rumoured to be Early Times/Old Forester. In 2015 the company established their full scale distillery in Shively, slowly transitioning to their own spirit. This 2016 bottling will have been crafted from spirit contract distilled by Michter's at the undisclosed Brown-Forman site.
baxus_class_name: Michter's 10 Year Single Barrel Bourbon 2016 Bottling

name: Eagle Rare 10 Year 101 Proof
description: Eagle Rare Kentucky Straight Bourbon Whiskey is masterfully crafted and carefully aged for no less than ten years. The rareness of this great breed of bourbon is evident in its complex aroma, as well as the smooth and lingering taste. Eagle Rare is a bourbon that lives up to its name with its lofty, distinctive taste experience.

name: Bourbon De Luxe 1916 18 Year Bottled In Bond
description: A 1916 vintage expression of Bourbon De Luxe matured for 18 years and bottled in bond in 1934 by the American Medicinal Spirits Company. This batch of barrels was sourced from the Mellwood distillery in Louisville. Mellwood was acquired by The Whiskey Trust in 1899, a firm that would later become the American Medicinal Spirits Co. Mellwood closed in 1918 but was one of the few old sites to reopen post prohibition, operating as General Distilling Company for National Distillers before once again closing in the 60s, this time for good.
baxus_class_name: Bourbon De Luxe 1916 18 Year Bottled In Bond

name: Noah's Mill 15 Year Batch H-9-82
description: An older batch of Noah's Mill bourbon when it still held a 15 year old age statement. This era of the brand was bottled by Willett using barrels sourced from distilleries right across Kentucky. Batch H-9-82 was bottled at 57.15% Abv.

name: Glenfiddich 21 Year Reserva Rum Cask Finish
description: The return of the name Reserva to Glenfiddich's 21yo after a few years under different titles is also accompanied by an upgrade to its packaging. It is still finished in rum casks for four months, but now has a more elegant presentation, as befits its position towards the top of the distillery's regular range.
baxus_class_name: Glenfiddich 21 Year Reserva Rum Cask Finish

name: Crown Royal Limited Edition
description: tasty, reminiscent of the American Rye whiskey

name: Orphan Barrel 20 Year Barterhouse
description: Twenty years in American Oak will make your average spirit a bit mellow. Take all the fight out. Well this here is no ordinary spirit, and twenty years is long enough to pick up a trick or two. For one barrel in particular, it was long enough to develop the gift of a silver tongue. The old Stitzel-Weller rickhouse hands had it written off as a rumor. A character so smooth, it could clean out the card sharps and take the shirt off a travelling salesman's back.  But the rumors were true. And when the chips are in, a smooth operator can be mighty persuasive indeed. One sip of Barterhouse Kentucky Straight Bourbon Whiskey and you just might find yourself forgiving Robert Johnson for trading his soul to the very devil himself.

name: John Walker & Sons XR 21 Year
description: John Walker & Sons XR 21 was created to honour this very special occasion. Inspired by Sir Alexander’s own hand-written notes, it is blended from the exclusive Johnnie Walker reserve of rare whiskies, all of which have been matured for a full 21 years..   Bottle of John Walker & Sons XR 21 whisky on an angle Assured, balanced and elegant, it has intriguing layers of intensity that are both surprising and delightful. Sweet honey and tempered spices come cloaked in warming smoke. Citrus zest, ripened tropical fruits and caramel swirl within hints of tobacco and raisins. The long, smooth, soothing finish is complex and fascinating - a myriad of influences played out over a subtle tapestry of peatiness.

name: Ardbeg 1974 26 Year Single Barrel Silver Seal
description: This single barrel Ardbeg was distilled in May 1974, matured for 26 years and bottled in March 2001.
baxus_class_name: Ardbeg 1974 26 Year Single Barrel Silver Seal

name: Buffalo Trace 1995 15 Year Old Experimental Collection French Oak
description: Distilled in 1995 from their #2 rye mashbill, this expression from Buffalo Trace was matured for 15 years in a toasted not charred French Oak cask. This maturation discounts it from being called bourbon. Air dried for a long 24 months this uncharred cask experienced a huge evaporation of 69.7% Abv after 15 years and 3 months of maturation. Bottled in 2010 at 45% Abv as part of the experimental collection.
baxus_class_name: Buffalo Trace 1995 15 Year Old Experimental Collection French Oak

name: Knob Creek 15 Year Batch KC001
description: The first batch of Knob Creek's 15 year old age statement. This release is crafted from Jim Beam's low rye mashbill and is bottled at 50% Abv.

name: Brown-Forman 12 Year 150th Anniversary Decanter
description: A 2020 special edition release from Brown-Forman bottled in a unique decanter to celebrate the 150th anniversary of the company. The liquid for this decanter was crafted from six barrels laid down in April 2008 and then matured for 12 and a half years. Bottled in 2020 this edition saw 500 decanters set aside exclusively for the Brown-Forman family & friends, with 150 decanters set aside for tastings and events. With the 2020 pandemic impacting event options it was decided in 2023 to release the remaining 150 decanters to the public on prohibition repeal day.

name: Bardstown Collaborative Chateau De Laubade Finish
description: In their press release, Bardstown states that the 2022 Château de Laubade Armagnac release includes a blend of 12-year-old Kentucky and 10-year-old Tennessee bourbon, finished in Laubade Armagnac casks for 16 months. Their first release featured a 12-year-old Indiana bourbon finished in Armagnac barrels for 18 months.
baxus_class_name: Bardstown Collaborative Chateau De Laubade Finish

name: Pappy Van Winkle Family Reserve Bourbon 15 Year
description: A 15 year old expression of wheated bourbon carefully chosen by Julian Van Winkle, the grandson of the original Pappy Van Winkle. Early Van Winkle offerings were crafted from barrels sourced from the legendary closed Stitzel-Weller distillery, but in 2002 Julian struck a deal with Buffalo Trace to use their wheated bourbon once his stored barrels ran empty. This 2021 bottling will have been crafted from Buffalo Trace's wheated bourbon mashbill and carefully blended by Julian Van Winkle.
baxus_class_name: Pappy Van Winkle Family Reserve Bourbon 15 Year

name: George T. Stagg - 2020
description: From the distiller: "George T. Stagg built the most dominant American distillery of the 19th century, during a time known as the Gilded Age of Bourbon. Uncut and unfiltered, this robust bourbon whiskey ages for nearly a decade and boasts the bold character that is reminiscent of the man himself."

name: Don Julio 1942
description: A small batch Anejo named after founder Don Julio Gonzalez-Frausto Estrada, who first distilled Tequila at the age of just 17 in 1942. Aged for at least 30 months in American white-oak, this is a remarkably smooth and incredibly complex Tequila with notes of tropical fruit, agave, and a hint of cinnamon spice.

name: Westland 2013 7 Year Single Barrique #4859 Single Cask Nation
description: A 2013 vintage single cask expression of American single malt from Westland matured for 7 years in a Moscatel wine barrique. It was bottled at 52.55% Abv by Single Cask Nation.
baxus_class_name: Westland 2013 7 Year Single Barrique #4859 Single Cask Nation

name: Macallan Edition No. 5
description: From the distiller: "The Macallan Edition No. 5 is our very own homage to the diversity and complexity of natural colour. Inspired by a coming together of whisky making mastery and colour expertise and insight, this single malt celebrates both The Macallan’s commitment to natural colour and the intricate whisky making process.100% natural in colour, all of our exceptional whiskies from The Macallan are shaped from time spent in the very best casks; maturing, nurturing and developing character. World renowned colour masters at the Pantone Color Institute created a uniquely bold shade of purple; reflecting an enigmatic, multi-faceted and intricate combination of red and blue."

name: Macallan Edition No. 3
description: Inspiration and innovation lie at the heart of The Macallan and nowhere is this more evident than in The Edition Series. Edition No. 3 brings to life the flavour experience of The Macallan through aroma, calling on Master Perfumer Roja Dove's remarkable sensory knowledge and expert sense of smell to create the third unique expression in the series. Borne of two art forms, Edition No. 3 unites the worlds of whisky and aroma to reveal the complexities of single malt character and the power of the senses in creating and experiencing The Macallan. When we experience and enjoy whisky, the power of aroma is unquestionable - and it is this power that makes the approach to Edition No. 3 truly mesmerizing.

name: Macallan Edition No. 4
description: From the distiller: "The fourth release in this innovative annual Series, Edition No.4 embodies the craftsmanship and pioneering design of the new Macallan Distillery and demonstrates the mastery of whisky making since 1824. As we enter an exciting new era, this limited edition marks the coming together of our history and new horizons in the creation of two structural masterpieces: a remarkable whisky and a magnificent new distillery."

name: Four Roses 10 Year Private Selection OESV
description: A barrel strength expression of Four Roses chosen from a single cask after 10 years of maturation. It was crafted from the OESV recipe which has a 20% rye grain mashbill. This barrel was pulled from warehouse PS and is bottled at 58.3% Abv.
baxus_class_name: Four Roses 10 Year Private Selection OESV

name: Caperdonich 1992 Single Hogshead #121141 Bottled 2017 Carn Mor
description: Caperdonich 1992 MMcK is a remarkable Single Malt whisky from the Caperdonich Distillery. Bottled by Morrison and MacKay for their exclusive Càrn Mòr Celebration of the Cask series. Aged for 24 years in a Hogshead cask (#121141), it has a strength of 58.9% Vol. Limited to just 240 bottles, this 700 ml expression is a rare find.
series: Càrn Mòr Celebration of the Cask
baxus_class_name: Caperdonich 1992 Single Hogshead #121141 Bottled 2017 Carn Mor

name: Lagavulin 16 Year
description: Founded over 200 years ago and indelibly etched into whisky folklore, the Lagavulin distillery is on the Isle of Islay which is known for its heavily peated whiskies. Those deep smoky notes are in evidence here, the whisky having been aged in oak barrels for at least 16 years.

name: El Viejito Extra Anejo
description:
An extra anejo expression of Tequila from El Viejito produced at their distillery NOM 1107 in Jalisco. Located in the highlands of Jalisco this tequila is crafted from high elevation agave that is then roasted in brick ovens and crushed using a roller mill. The juice is then fermented in closed stainless steel tanks then pitched with their own cultured yeast. Distilled twice in a stainless steel and copper hybrid still before being filled into used American whiskey barrels. This extra anejo is left to mature for three years in these previously used whiskey barrels, before being dumped and bottled at 41% Abv.

The El Viejito label is the house brand for the distillery, but their tequila is also the source of other brands including: Distinqt, Campeon, Luna Nueva, Karma, Los Cinco, Mi Viejo and Peligroso.

name: Eagle Rare 10 Year Single Barrel Select
description: A 10 year old expression of Eagle Rare crafted by Buffalo Trace from their low rye mashbill. This release is a single barrel offering chosen exclusively for a store.
baxus_class_name: Eagle Rare 10 Year Single Barrel Select

name: Ben Nevis 1996 19 Year Single Butt Hunter Laing
description: This whisky was distilled in August 1996. It was aged in a sherry butt for 19 years before being bottled in November 2015. Part of the Author's Series,  this particular bottle celebrates Leo Tolstoy.
baxus_class_name: Ben Nevis 1996 19 Year Single Butt Hunter Laing

name: VOSN Straight Outta Bardstown 9 Year BAXUS Single Barrel
description: A 9 year old expression of bourbon chosen by the BAXUS team during our trip to the Preservation distillery in Bardstown. This sourced barrel of Kentucky bourbon was selected by our team and industry legend Marci Palatella for release under her new "Straight outta Bardstown" label. Under a dozen single barrels are chosen each year for this label, with Marci holding only her finest stocks aside for the Very Olde St Nick label. Our barrel was bottled at a solid strength of 64.2% Abv with only 142 bottles produced.
baxus_class_name: VOSN Straight Outta Bardstown 9 Year BAXUS Single Barrel

name: Augusta Buckner's Single Barrel 15 year - 2023
description:
Nestled in the epicenter of bourbon heritage, Augusta Distillery is a beacon of tradition and community pride. Positioned majestically along the Ohio River, Augusta serves as a gateway to five significant markets, marking its prominence on the famed B-Line Bourbon Trail. The distillery's unwavering dedication to authenticity and heritage shines through in every bottle, encapsulating the very essence of Kentucky's spirit.

This is the long-awaited follow-up to Buckner’s inaugural offering. The 15-year Single Barrel has matured for a decade and a half to provide an extraordinary pour that leaves a striking first impression, followed by layered complexities on the way to a lingering finish.  Only six barrels were used in this inaugural bottling and barrel #2 offered the lowest yield but the overall best flavor profile.  

Color & Nose - Warm tones of golden copper and candlelight combine with finished cherry wood to draw you near. Active legs confirm this pour is cask strength. With surprising brightness and clarity for its age, the presentation invites further exploration. 

Palate - The dry corn and honeyed-vanilla notes from Buckner 13 year have matured into cooked butter and brown sugar on the front with hints of baking spices, clove and weathered cedar that linger. Its symphony of scents suggests a rare complexity only found through the patience of a properly aged 15-year Kentucky bourbon. 

Finish - This bourbon’s lingering, perfumed finish may be its defining attribute. Subtle, refined notes of wood, exotic spice, tobacco, and leather endure thanks to time and unfiltered bottling. Like all Buckner’s bourbons, each sip provides an unforgettable experience that instantly returns you to the limestone hills of Kentucky only to demand further unhurried exploration.

name: Wild Turkey 12 Year Pseudo-Split Label 2003 Bottling
description: First released in 1980, the 12 year old age statement from Wild Turkey has become a serious fan favourite. This is the Pseudo-Split label edition released from 1999 onwards. This specific bottle was produced in 2003. Older editions of Wild Turkey are particularly sought after amongst enthusiasts, notably for their remarkably different taste profile to modern Wild Turkey bottles. The distillery originally produced bourbon using cypress wood tanks but these were slowly phased out from 1984 until 1990. The other notable production change came in 2004 when the barrel entry proof was changed to 110, up from 107. The combination of these changes have resulted in serious demand for older vintage bottlings from the much loved distillery, with some believing 1990s era bottlings to be the distillery’s best ever.
baxus_class_name: Wild Turkey 12 Year Pseudo-Split Label 2003 Bottling

name: Blanton's Gold 1995 Bottling
description: A superb single barrel bourbon. Blanton's Gold is distilled from a mashbill of corn, rye and malted barley. Each bottle is hand filled, sealed, labelled and individually numbered.

name: Bardstown Fusion #1
description: DESCRIPTION Fusion Series #1 is a blend of 60% of Bardstown Bourbon Company’s two-year-old wheated and high-rye Kentucky bourbons along with a 40% 0f 11 year 7 month bourbon from kentucky to create a smooth, complex pour. TASTING NOTES Leather, roasted nuts, and rich caramel of old kentucky bourbon is countered with lively fruit and spice of the young kentucky bourbon. The result is a unique nose, rich palate, and a balanced, lasting finish.

name: Four Roses Private Selection OBSK 9.75 year
description:
Bottled at 58.2% ABV, the Four Roses OBSK 9 Years 9 Months is a vivid expression of the 'B' mash bill combined with the 'K' yeast strain, known for its rich spiciness and full-bodied character.

Tasting Experience: A bold and spicy expedition into the heart of Four Roses' flavor profile.

Nose: A vibrant blend of spice accompanied by a hint of floral elegance, laying the groundwork for an adventurous tasting voyage.

Palate: The spicy undertones take center stage, adorned by a sweet melody that balances the robust flavor profile.

Finish: A bold, warming finish encapsulating the essence of the rich spice and full-bodied character inherent in the Four Roses OBSK blend.
baxus_class_name: Four Roses Private Selection OBSK 9.75 year

name: Old Forester 86 Proof
description: From the distiller: "Created in 1870, Old Forester is the only bourbon continuously distilled and marketed by the founding family before, during and after Prohibition. At 86 proof, Old Forester delivers a genuine bourbon experience, with rich, full flavor and a smooth character that is ideal for sipping neat, on the rocks, with a splash of water or in a classic cocktail."

name: Michter's Toasted Barrel Finish Sour Mash - 2022
description: Nose: The nose opens with lush red fruits, toasted oak tannins, coconut, hints of butterscotch, baking spices, barrel spices, faint nutty notes, vanilla, cacao, herbaceous touch. As you nose deeper fruit continue to build to a juicy fruit-esque note alongside increased herbaceous notes and cacao powder notes.  Palate: The palate opens viscous with warm toasted oak notes of toasted coconut, caramel, red and black fruits, and warming tannic spice before becoming chocolatey with baking spice notes, vanilla, honeyed nuts, and a touch of herbaceousness. As you continue to chew it remains sweet with the spice briefly picking up again before returning to vanilla, fruits, herbaceous notes, dark chocolate, and a lingering tannin-driven warmth.  Finish: The finish opens with lingering warmth, toasted oak spice, coconut, chocolate, and dried fruits leading into an aftertaste of herbaceous notes, cacao, dried fruits, and toasted oak tannins.
baxus_class_name: Michter's Toasted Barrel Finish Sour Mash - 2022

name: Blanton's Black 1995 Bottling
description: The Blanton's Single Barrel Bourbon Whiskey, with its iconic horse and jockey stopper, is a true collector's piece from 1995. This particular bottle, labeled as barrel number 340, was individually selected, filtered, and bottled by hand at the Blanton Distillery, showcasing the meticulous care and craftsmanship that goes into each bottle. Stored in Warehouse H and bottled at 40% alcohol by volume (80 proof), this bourbon is a testament to the rich tradition of Kentucky's distilling heritage. The rounded bottle with its reddish-brown liquid and the signature metal stopper reflects the brand's commitment to quality and its storied past. A bottle like this not only represents a fine bourbon but also a piece of history, making it a coveted item for whiskey enthusiasts and collectors alike.

name: Balvenie 21 Year Old Port Wood Speyside Single Malt Scotch Whisky
description: The nose is deep, port, with dark fruit, raisin, chocolate, some nutmeg, Taste is warming and very well balanced, Body is extraordinary, more port, Finish is awesome, wanting more, Price is great, typical tube
baxus_class_name: Balvenie 21 Year Old Port Wood Speyside Single Malt Scotch Whisky

name: Old Fitzgerald 8 Year 1849 Connoisseurs of Fine Bourbon
description: User Review: Old Fitzgerald 1849 has one of the strongest open-bottle-whiffs of anything I’ve tasted so far.  As soon as you crack that plastic cap, you receive a distinct scent of freshly-picked apples.  After pouring it, the apples continue, but are accompanied by mowed-grass, corn, and a distant mint – simple but pleasant.  On tasting OF1849 was not as smooth as I’d expexted, exploding onto the tongue.  This develops, however into caramel apples, some oak, popcorn, and tres leches cake.  In other words, this is certainly sweet.  The popcorn which develops in the middle adds an interesting contrast to the rest of the swirl.  There’s also quite a nice mouth-feel to it and a spicy-to-clean finish.
baxus_class_name: Old Fitzgerald 8 Year 1849 Connoisseurs of Fine Bourbon

name: Old Forester Barrel Strength Single Barrel Warehouse K Floor 6
description: A single barrel expression from Brown-Forman's Old Forester distillery bottled at barrel strength.
baxus_class_name: Old Forester Barrel Strength Single Barrel Warehouse K Floor 6

name: Bourbontown Club 12 Year 1989 Bottling
description: A 1989 bottling of Bourbontown Club matured for 12 years and bottled by Willett at 86 proof. This era of Willett bottlings was sourced from various distilleries across Kentucky, often notably Heaven Hill before their fire.

name: Smooth Ambler Contradiction Rye
description:
The Contradiction Rye from Smooth Ambler stands as a love letter from one distillery to many others. After their success with the Old Scout series, which was sourced by Smooth Ambler, the company decided to attempt blending those whiskies with some distilled in-house. 

The result is a marriage of bottling and distilling, with the majority of the whiskey within being older than 9 years old.

name: Jim Beam 200th Anniversary Decanter 1995
description: Bottled in 1995 this decanter celebrates 200 years since Jacob Beam founded the company we know today as Jim Beam. This 75 month aged bottle comes in a flip top decanter and is bottled at 47.5% Abv.

name: Benriach 1966 40 Year Old
description: A 1966 small batch release of Benriach matured for 40 years in two hogsheads before being bottled in 2006. The oldest Benriach ever released at the time, this four decade old expression was bottled at 50% Abv with just 265 produced.

name: Cat's Eye The Magi 24 Year Armagnac
description:
Cat''s Eye Distillery is a boutique distillery providing craft spirits with unique character, with a focus on diversity of product and hard-to-find releases. 

Featuring a depiction of Biblical visitors on camels on the label, this Armagnac has been aged a minimum of 24 years. The relatively high alcohol content of 54% is standard for this single-distilled spirit.
baxus_class_name: Cat's Eye The Magi 24 Year Armagnac

name: Casa Obsidiana Blanco Tequila
description: A blanco expression of tequila from Casa Obsidiana crafted from 100% agave. Bottled at 40% Abv in a unique white decanter.

name: Lucky Seven 14 Year The Hold Up
baxus_class_name: Lucky Seven 14 Year The Hold Up

name: Knob Creek 2013 9 Year Old Single Bourbon For BHG#252
description: Distilled in 2013 this single barrel bourbon from Jim Beam was bottled as part of their Knob Creek label. Matured for 9 years it was bottled at 60% Abv exclusively for BHG. This barrel was sourced from the 6th floor of warehouse P.
baxus_class_name: Knob Creek 2013 9 Year Old Single Bourbon For BHG#252

name: Old Grand-Dad 114 1991 Bottling
description: A 1991 bottling of Old Grand-Dad 114, a 57% Abv barrel proof expression originally launched by National Distillers. This 1991 bottling will have been bottled by Jim Beam but likely uses existing mature stocks from the Old Grand-Dad distillery, which Beam after buying National Distillers in 1987.

name: Old Man Winter Eldest 25 Year
description: A 25 year old expression of sourced bourbon whiskey produced by KBD/Willett for Marci from Preservation distillery. This rare batch of bourbon was bottled at 90 proof and bottled under the Old Man Winter label, a sister label to the sought after Olde St Nick label. This is a Japanese export label.

name: Sam Thompson Pure Rye 1928 Bottling
description:
A 1928 bottling of Sam Thompson pure rye whiskey bottled during prohibition for medical use only. Note this lot still has its tax stamp affixed but both the distillation date and age statement displayed on the red strip has been lost. We anticipate this is an 11 year or older product as the rear label notes this whiskey was distilled prior to 1917.

The distillery was located on the banks of the Monongahela river in West Brownsville, PA. Sam Thompson was a native of Brownsville, PA and acquired the plant in 1844. He produced Sam Thompson Monongahela Rye Whiskey there until Prohibition. The brand continued to be sold for medicinal purposes until Repeal and later was acquired and produced elsewhere by Schenley.

name: Bernheim Barrel Proof Batch B923
description: Batch B923 from Heaven Hill of their Bernheim wheat whiskey. Crafted with a mashbill of 51% wheat, 37% corn and 12% malted barley this expression is bottled at a barrel proof of 60.2% Abv in 2023.

name: David James 10 Year Straight American Whiskey
description: This small batch American Whiskey is distilled at an undisclosed Indiana distillery.
baxus_class_name: David James 10 Year Straight American Whiskey

name: Blue Run Golden Rye
description:
Blue Run Spirits is a relatively new player in the bourbon and rye whiskey market, founded in 2020 by a group of friends with diverse backgrounds in marketing, technology, and politics. The brand quickly gained attention for its innovative approach to whiskey production and its focus on creating premium, small-batch spirits.

Blue Run Golden Rye is one of the brand's standout releases, exemplifying their commitment to high-quality rye whiskeys. This limited-edition expression highlights Blue Run's dedication to craftsmanship and meticulous attention to detail. The "Golden" in its name reflects the whiskey's appearance and its premium positioning within the Blue Run portfolio.

True to the brand's style, Golden Rye is presented in an elegantly designed bottle featuring a signature teardrop shape and a striking blue color scheme. This packaging not only captures the eye but also embodies the modern and sophisticated ethos of Blue Run Spirits.

name: Elijah Craig 10 Year Private Barrel For 21C Selects
description: A 10 year old expression of Elijah Craig from Heaven Hill bottled from a single barrel. This edition was bottled at a barrel proof of 61.35% Abv and was chosen by 21C in 2021.
baxus_class_name: Elijah Craig 10 Year Private Barrel For 21C Selects

name: Knob Creek 9 Year Single Barrel Bourbon For Commonwealth Tap
description: A single barrel store pick of Knob Creek's 9 year old bourbon bottled at 120 proof. This older edition was chosen by Commonwealth Tap.
baxus_class_name: Knob Creek 9 Year Single Barrel Bourbon For Commonwealth Tap

name: Buzzard's Roost Barrel Strength
description:
Buzzard's Roost is an innovative whiskey brand founded in 2019 by Jason Brauner and Judy Hollis Jones, both of whom have deep roots in the Kentucky bourbon scene. The brand is based in Louisville and has quickly gained recognition for its unique approach to whiskey production, focusing on small-batch offerings that emphasize quality and distinct flavor profiles.

The company sources its whiskey primarily from the Midwest Grain Products (MGP) distillery, utilizing aged spirits and then subjecting them to secondary maturation in proprietary barrels developed in collaboration with Independent Stave Company. This process involves extensive research into toasting techniques, allowing Buzzard's Roost to create a variety of flavor profiles that enhance the whiskey's complexity. With 17 different proprietary toast profiles, each release showcases a careful balance of sweetness and spice, setting it apart in a crowded market.

Buzzard's Roost has established a strong community presence, with the opening of the Buzzard's Roost Whiskey Row Experience in downtown Louisville, which serves as both a tasting room and an educational space for whiskey enthusiasts. The brand emphasizes its commitment to craftsmanship and innovation while fostering connections within the local community and the broader bourbon industry.

With a growing portfolio that includes various bourbons and ryes, Buzzard's Roost continues to expand its reach, currently distributing its products across 20 states. The brand's dedication to producing high-quality, flavorful whiskies has made it a notable player in the modern American whiskey landscape.

name: Sazerac Rye Whiskey
description:
Sazerac Rye Whiskey, produced by Buffalo Trace Distillery, is a classic Kentucky straight rye whiskey that pays homage to America's first branded cocktail. Bottled at 90 proof (45% ABV), this rye whiskey is aged for at least four years and crafted with a mashbill containing over 51% rye.

On the nose, Sazerac Rye offers inviting aromas of clove, vanilla, and anise, complemented by subtle hints of pepper and juicy citrus. The palate delivers a harmonious blend of flavors, featuring candied spices and citrus notes, creating a well-balanced and smooth drinking experience. The finish is medium in length, leaving a pleasant lingering sensation of licorice. Known for its versatility and crispness, Sazerac Rye excels both as a sipping whiskey and as the foundation for classic cocktails, particularly its namesake Sazerac. Despite its growing popularity, it remains an excellent value, typically priced around $30, making it a staple for both enthusiasts and bartenders alike.

name: Angel's Envy Straight Bourbon Whiskey
description:
Angel's Envy is a pioneering bourbon brand founded in 2010 by legendary Master Distiller Lincoln Henderson and his son Wes Henderson. After Lincoln's retirement from Brown-Forman, where he had developed renowned brands like Woodford Reserve, he came out of retirement to create a whiskey that would challenge traditional bourbon-making techniques.

The brand's innovative approach centers on secondary barrel finishing, a technique more commonly used in Scotch whisky production. Lincoln and Wes began experimenting with aging bourbon in port wine casks, a method that was initially met with skepticism from bourbon purists. The brand's name originated from Lincoln's joke that while the "angel's share" is the portion of whiskey lost to evaporation during aging, the remaining liquid must be what the angels would envy.

In 2013, Angel's Envy broke ground on its distillery in downtown Louisville, becoming the first full-production whiskey distillery in the city's urban center. This historic location, situated on Whiskey Row, symbolizes the brand's commitment to both innovation and bourbon heritage. The distillery was completed in 2016 and has since expanded, welcoming 10,000 visitors annually.

Now owned by Bacardi, Angel's Envy has grown from a family project to a nationally and internationally distributed brand. They continue to push boundaries by experimenting with various finishing techniques, including rum and sherry cask finishes, while maintaining a commitment to quality and craftsmanship passed down through three generations of the Henderson family.

name: Lucky Seven 14 Year Single Barrel #94
description: A Kentucky sourced expression of bourbon whiskey matured for 14 years and bottled a high strength of 66.35% Abv. This single barrel was chosen by Lucky Seven and bottled in their The Proprietor label.

name: Wild Turkey Freedom
description: A special duty free bottling from Wild Turkey first released in 2002. This expression was blended from barrels aged between 7 and 13 years and bottled at 106 proof.

name: Four Roses 2015 Small Batch Limited Edition
description: Every fall Four Roses releases their “small batch” limited edition. The small batch limited edition (SmBLE) release marries several different mash bills to create something exceptional. In total, Four Roses has 10 different mash bills but usually selects 3-4 to be a part of the SmBLE. The 2015 release is a combination of the following mash bills: OESK, OBSV and OBSK.
baxus_class_name: Four Roses 2015 Small Batch Limited Edition

name: Lucky Seven 14 Year Single Barrel #43
description: A 14 year old expression of Kentucky bourbon bottled at 60.05% Abv from a single barrel by Lucky Seven.

name: Midleton Very Rare 2020
description: A limited annual release with just 50 casks bottled each year Midleton Very Rare is a blended whiskey comprised of single pot still and grain whiskeys. The whiskeys are between 12-25 years old and are hand selected from the vast inventory at Midleton by their Master Distiller Barry Crockett.

name: Old Grand Dad 16 Year
description: A special edition release from Jim Beam distilled from their high rye mashbill and matured for 16 years. When Beam purchased National distillers in the 1980s they acquired distilleries and brands such as old Grand Dad and Old Crow. Despite closing the Old Grand Dad distillery they continued production of the higher rye mashbill typically used for the OGD brand. This is a well matured offering of that original era mashbill now produced at Jim Beam.

name: Larceny Barrel Proof Batch C922
description: A barrel proof offering of Larceny, a wheated expression of bourbon from Heaven Hill. This 2022 release is bottled at 63.3% Abv.

name: Larceny Barrel Proof Batch C923
description: A barrel proof offering of Larceny, a wheated expression of bourbon from Heaven Hill. This 2023 release is bottled at 63.2% Abv.

name: Larceny Barrel Proof Batch B522
description: A barrel proof offering of Larceny, a wheated expression of bourbon from Heaven Hill. This 2022 release is bottled at 61.9% Abv.

name: Larceny Barrel Proof Batch B521
description: A barrel proof offering of Larceny, a wheated expression of bourbon from Heaven Hill. This 2021 release is bottled at 60.5% Abv.

name: Larceny Barrel Proof Batch C921
description: A barrel proof offering of Larceny, a wheated expression of bourbon from Heaven Hill. This 2021 release is bottled at 61.3% Abv.

name: Milam & Greene 15 Year Batch 3
description: A 15 year old expression of bourbon sourced from Tennessee and bottled at barrel proof by Millam & Greene. Crafted from 21 barrels this third batch was bottled at 57.25% Abv.

name: Woodford Reserve Baccarat
description: From the distiller: "History and heritage meet innovation and sophistication. Woodford Reserve Baccarat Edition is crafted by uniquely finishing the most complex and balanced Kentucky Bourbon in select XO Cognac barrels. Sourced by our Master Distiller Chris Morris, each barrel has seen three seasons of cognac before being filled with Woodford Reserve.The result is the best of both spirits – a balance of crisp American and French oak notes, complex fruit character, subtle spiciness and a creamy confectionary finish. Presented in a bespoke Baccarat decanter, Woodford Reserve Baccarat Edition is the ultimate expression of American Whiskey at its finest."

name: Wilderness Trail Single Barrel Bourbon
description:
Wilderness Trail Single Barrel Bourbon is a meticulously crafted expression that showcases the distillery's commitment to quality and innovation in Kentucky whiskey-making.

This high-rye bourbon is distilled using Wilderness Trail's unique sweet mash process. This technique, while more challenging to execute consistently, results in a cleaner, more nuanced spirit that sets it apart from many traditional Kentucky bourbons.

On the nose, the bourbon offers a complex bouquet of aromas. Rich caramel and vanilla notes mingle with fresh orchard fruits, particularly apple and peach. There's an intriguing undercurrent of baked bread and licorice, adding depth and complexity to the olfactory experience.

The palate is bold and flavorful, with an initial burst of sweetness from honey and caramel. This is quickly followed by layers of cinnamon, nutmeg, and black pepper spice. The high rye content shines through, providing a pleasant herbal quality and a touch of grassiness. Despite its relative youth, the bourbon displays a surprising fruitiness and depth of flavor.

It offers a full-bodied mouthfeel with a pleasant warmth that doesn't overwhelm. The finish is long and satisfying, with lingering notes of oak, vanilla, and a subtle hint of dark chocolate.

Wilderness Trail Single Barrel Bourbon demonstrates the distillery's expertise in fermentation and distillation, resulting in a whiskey that punches above its age. It offers bourbon enthusiasts a chance to experience a meticulously crafted, unique expression of Kentucky bourbon that balances traditional flavors with innovative production methods.

name: Russell's Reserve 2002 Barrel Proof Bottled 2018
description:
A highly sought after release from Wild Turkey distilled in 2002 and matured for roughly 16 years before being bottled in 2018 at a barrel proof of 114.6 proof. 

This expression was crafted whilst Wild Turkey's barrel entry proof was 107, allowing more water soluble compounds to evolve in the spirit. This lower entry era of Turkey is particularly favoured by enthusiasts. 

Just 3400 bottles of this rare release were produced.

name: Rowan's Creek 1988 12 Year Batch QBC03.21
description: A 1988 vintage expression of bourbon matured for 12 years and bottled by KBD (now Willett) as part of their Rowan's Creek series. This expression was distilled on the 10th of August 1988 and bottled in Kentucky on the 27th of February 2003.

name: Kings County Single Barrel Bourbon For Reserve Bar
description: A monster hazmat strength pick from Kings County distillery in New York. This single barrel bourbon was chosen exclusively for Reserve Bar and bottled at a truly crazy 73.8% Abv! Crafted from 80% New York corn and 20% imported UK malted barley, it was matured for 7 years in a small cask.
baxus_class_name: Kings County Single Barrel Bourbon For Reserve Bar

name: Macallan Rare Cask NV
description: Rare Cask combines knowledge, skill, passion, commitment and creativity to create a remarkable whisky worthy of its name. Crafted to showcase complexity and depth, Rare Cask is drawn from the broadest spectrum of casks used in maturation on The Macallan Estate.

name: VOSN Straight Outta Bardstown 9 Year BAXUS Single Barrel
description: A 9 year old expression of bourbon chosen by the BAXUS team during our trip to the Preservation distillery in Bardstown. This sourced barrel of Kentucky bourbon was selected by our team and industry legend Marci Palatella for release under her new "Straight outta Bardstown" label. Under a dozen single barrels are chosen each year for this label, with Marci holding only her finest stocks aside for the Very Olde St Nick label. Our barrel was bottled at a solid strength of 64.2% Abv with only 142 bottles produced.
baxus_class_name: VOSN Straight Outta Bardstown 9 Year BAXUS Single Barrel

name: Chartreuse Green 1961-1969 Bottling
description: A circa 1961-1969 era bottling of green Chartreuse as noted by the tax stamp and importer of Schieffelin & Co New York. This firm imported Chartreuse from the 1940s until 1969 and the tax stamp affixed to this bottle was introduced in 1961, thus suggesting this 1961-1969 date range. Older expressions of Chartreuse are highly sought after as the liqueur actively eats sugar, mellowing over time and creating an exceptionally rich and decadent spirit. Chartreuse has been made by French monks for close to two centuries now, with the recipe a close guarded secret. The monks have been forced into exile at various times in the past, moving production to Spain at one point.

name: New Riff Headliner 2024 Release
description: A 2024 special release of Headliner, a blended American whiskey from New Riff. This release is crafted from 10 year old New Riff distilled bourbon, 9 year bourbon, 9 year old rye and 7 year old single malt matured in Oloroso sherry casks. This blended whiskey is then bottled at 58.85% Abv and available exclusively at the distillery.

name: Penelope 9 Year Private Select Batch 24-201
description: A 9 year old expression of bourbon from Penelope crafted from Indiana and Kentucky distilled spirits. Bottled at 50.6% Abv.

name: Eagle Rare 10 Year
description: Crafted using Buffalo Trace's low-rye Mash Bill #1 and aged for a minimum of 10 years in new, charred American oak barrels, this 90-proof bourbon is a crowd favourite.

name: Old Grand Dad 1936 Bottled In Bond 1940
description: A 1936 vintage bottled in bond expression of Old Grand-Dad. This was matured for 4 years and bottled at 50% Abv in 1940.
baxus_class_name: Old Grand Dad 1936 Bottled In Bond 1940

name: Wild Turkey 1855 Reserve Batch W-T-10-92
description: A 1992 bottling of Wild Turkey 1855 Reserve, a sister label to Wild Turkey's signature Rare Breed barrel proof offering. This batch was bottled at 55% Abv.

name: Monkey Shoulder Batch 27 Smooth And Rich - 2008
description: The Monkey Shoulder Batch 27 Smooth And Rich 2008 is a remarkable blend that embodies the spirit of innovation and tradition, crafted by the masters at William Grant & Sons. This exceptional whisky, bottled in 2008, is a testament to the art of blending, showcasing the smoothness achieved by carefully combining whiskies from the Glenfiddich, Balvenie, and Kininvie distilleries in Speyside, Scotland. The rich flavor profile is a result of the careful selection of casks, allowing the whiskies to mature to perfection and develop a depth of flavor that is both satisfying and complex, making it an excellent choice for those who appreciate the nuances of Scotch whisky.
baxus_class_name: Monkey Shoulder Batch 27 Smooth And Rich - 2008

name: Hampden 2001 16 Year Single Cask For TheWhiskyBarrel Kill Devil
description: Hampden 16 Year Old 2001 vintage single cask Jamaican Golden Rum from the Caribbean. Pot Still single cask distilled November 2001 and bottled 2018 by Hunter Laing & Co. Kill Devil exclusively for The Whisky Barrel. 265 bottles at cask strength.
baxus_class_name: Hampden 2001 16 Year Single Cask For TheWhiskyBarrel Kill Devil

name: Gold Tassel - 1979
description: The Gold Tassel, a whisky that evokes nostalgia and a sense of tradition. Introduced in the late 1970s, the Gold Tassel was part of the McGuinness brand, which was later rebranded as Silk Tassel. This whisky was known for its distinctive gold tassel decoration on the bottle, making it a popular collectible item among whisky enthusiasts. The Gold Tassel was a symbol of luxury and sophistication, and its packaging was designed to stand out on store shelves. Although the brand has undergone changes over the years, the Gold Tassel remains a nostalgic reminder of a bygone era in the world of whisky.
