name: Wild Turkey "Kentucky Spirit" Pewter Top - 1998
description:
The Wild Turkey Kentucky Spirit with the pewter top, produced from 1994 to 2001, represents a significant and highly sought-after expression in the distillery's history. This single barrel bourbon, bottled at 101 proof (50.5% ABV), was Wild Turkey's answer to the growing premium bourbon market of the 1990s, particularly in response to the success of Blanton's. The distinctive bottle design, shaped like a turkey with fanned feathers, and the weighty pewter stopper made it stand out on shelves and in collections.

What makes the pewter top Kentucky Spirit releases particularly special is their connection to Wild Turkey's heritage. These bottles were often filled with bourbon from Warehouses A, B, and C on the original Tyrone campus, which were personal favorites of Master Distiller Jimmy Russell. The age of the whiskey in these bottles is believed to range from 8 to 14 years, with some early releases potentially containing even older stocks. Tasting notes for these vintage Kentucky Spirits often describe a rich, complex flavor profile featuring the classic Wild Turkey "funk" - a combination of robust oak, vanilla, caramel, and spice, with a distinctive fruity and sometimes medicinal character that sets it apart from other bourbons of the era. Today, these pewter top releases are highly prized by collectors and enthusiasts, not just for their historical significance, but for the quality and unique character of the bourbon they contain.

name: Wild Turkey "Kentucky Spirit" Pewter Top - 2001
description:
The Wild Turkey Kentucky Spirit with the pewter top, produced from 1994 to 2001, represents a significant and highly sought-after expression in the distillery's history. This single barrel bourbon, bottled at 101 proof (50.5% ABV), was Wild Turkey's answer to the growing premium bourbon market of the 1990s, particularly in response to the success of Blanton's. The distinctive bottle design, shaped like a turkey with fanned feathers, and the weighty pewter stopper made it stand out on shelves and in collections.

What makes the pewter top Kentucky Spirit releases particularly special is their connection to Wild Turkey's heritage. These bottles were often filled with bourbon from Warehouses A, B, and C on the original Tyrone campus, which were personal favorites of Master Distiller Jimmy Russell. The age of the whiskey in these bottles is believed to range from 8 to 14 years, with some early releases potentially containing even older stocks. Tasting notes for these vintage Kentucky Spirits often describe a rich, complex flavor profile featuring the classic Wild Turkey "funk" - a combination of robust oak, vanilla, caramel, and spice, with a distinctive fruity and sometimes medicinal character that sets it apart from other bourbons of the era. Today, these pewter top releases are highly prized by collectors and enthusiasts, not just for their historical significance, but for the quality and unique character of the bourbon they contain.

name: Wild Turkey Rare Breed - 2003
description:
The Wild Turkey Rare Breed from the late 1990s and early 2000s, particularly batches like the renowned W-T-01-99, represents a pinnacle in bourbon craftsmanship that many enthusiasts consider legendary. These expressions, bottled at barrel proof (typically around 108.4 proof), showcase the distillery's commitment to producing complex, full-flavored whiskeys during a time when the bourbon industry was experiencing a glut of aged stocks. This era of Rare Breed is particularly prized for its rich, multifaceted flavor profile that balances intensity with elegance.

Tasting notes for these vintage Rare Breed releases often describe a dense, classic Wild Turkey profile with remarkable depth. The nose typically offers a fragrant bouquet of brandy-like fruitiness, honey-maple sweetness, and medicinal cherry, complemented by caramel creme, sweet oak, and herbal-floral spices. On the palate, enthusiasts report an oily mouthfeel delivering waves of cherry-vanilla, butter toffee, and brown sugar, intertwined with sweet herbs, citrus notes, and warm baking spices. The finish is characteristically long and flavorful, leaving a lasting impression of vanilla bean, cola, and molasses. These batches are often cited as being superior to modern releases, showcasing a perfect harmony of aged stocks that's difficult to replicate in today's high-demand bourbon market.

name: Elijah Craig 12 Year Barrel Proof Release #2 2013 Bottling
description: Nose: The darkest rich caramel oak hits hard and fast. Pancakes with syrup and dusty wood notes. Luxurious dark chocolate and lingonberry dusted with sugar. Heavy char and confectioner sugar.  Palate: Woah that’s sweet. Fruit tart covered in grade b maple syrup. A big dose of heavy cream. Strong dusty varnish style note. Oreo frosting. A massive backbone of oak. One of the sweetest yet oakiest whiskeys I’ve had.  Finish: Slice of white cake. Of course oak continues to be a strong flavor along with a dusty barrel aged syrup. Caramel iced coffee. Strong Kentucky hug. Settles into a Coca Cola coffee flavor.
baxus_class_name: Elijah Craig 12 Year Barrel Proof Release #2 2013 Bottling

name: Wild Turkey Cheesy Gold Foil 12 Year 1985 Bottling
description: A first year of release from Wild Turkey's highly sought after cheesy gold foil edition. This 12 year old bourbon is bottled at their signature 101 proof and lasted until 1992 when it was changed to a split label. Older editions of Wild Turkey are particularly sought after amongst enthusiasts, notably for their remarkably different taste profile to modern Wild Turkey bottles. The distillery originally produced bourbon using cypress wood tanks but these were slowly phased out from 1984 until 1990. The other notable production change came in 2004 when the barrel entry proof was changed to 110, up from 107. The combination of these changes have resulted in serious demand for older vintage bottlings from the much loved distillery, with some believing 1990s era bottlings to be the distillery’s best ever.
baxus_class_name: Wild Turkey Cheesy Gold Foil 12 Year 1985 Bottling

name: Old Kentucky Amber 10 Year
description: The Old Kentucky Amber 10 Year Old is a distinguished straight bourbon whiskey that embodies the rich heritage of Kentucky's distilling tradition. Aged for a decade, this bourbon is presented in a classic 750ml bottle sealed with a distinctive red wax, adding a touch of old-world charm and authenticity. The whiskey itself is notable for its deep amber color and a robust profile of flavors, featuring a harmonious blend of vanilla, caramel, and oak, with a subtle hint of fruitiness that complements its smooth, woody finish. This bourbon, rated highly for its balance and depth of character, is a testament to the craftsmanship and time-honored methods employed by the distillers at Old Kentucky, making it a prized addition to any whiskey enthusiast's collection.

name: Elmer T. Lee 1919-2013 Commemorative Edition 2014 Release
description: Nose: Rich with vanilla and caramel, the bold nose is laced with elements of butter and honey.  Palate: Reminiscent of some of the best private barrel Elmer’s we’ve had, this bourbon is silky and smooth, with a fuller mouth feel than it’s 90 proof brother. Honey and vanilla on the front palate are met by a mild spice on the mid palate.  Finish: The mid-palate spice carries through the long, luxurious finish. Slightly peppery, we found no hint of tannin. Truly a marvelous experience that carries on long after the last sip.
baxus_class_name: Elmer T. Lee 1919-2013 Commemorative Edition 2014 Release

name: St Magdalene 1982 26 Year Single Cask #2200 Signatory Vintage
description: A 1982 vintage single cask expression of the closed Lowland distillery St Magdalene. Often bottled under its other name Linlithgow, this cask was matured for 26 years in a wine treated butt and bottled at 61.2% Abv by Signatory Vintage in 2009.
baxus_class_name: St Magdalene 1982 26 Year Single Cask #2200 Signatory Vintage

name: Faultline 17 Year Caribbean Rum
description: We don't expect this single cask of 17 year old "Caribbean" rum to last very long, partly because it's so delicious and partly because of its origins. We can't say where it's from exactly, just that it's from somewhere in the CUribBeAN region. This incredibly complex and fragrant rum combines many of the ester-driven flavors we love about rum from Jamaica and St-Lucia with the richness and elegance of the Spanish style. The flavor profile is drier and more old school in character. There's a big dusty mineral note framed by tropical pineapple, overripe banana and powerful baking spice. On the palate, fresh grassy cane, touches of mint and anise and dried fruit that meanders in between tea and cola. It's a rum you absolutely do not want to miss, especially if you're interested in forbidden fruits.

name: The Balvenie Double Wood 12 year
description: Smooth and mellow with beautifully combined flavours – nutty sweetness, cinnamon spiciness and a delicately proportioned layer of sherry.

name: Wild Turkey Cheesy Gold Foil 12 Year 1989 Bottling
description:
The Wild Turkey Cheesy Gold Foil (CGF) 12 Year is known for its exceptional balance between sweet and oaky flavors, leaving a finish that's quite desirable. It's referred to as a premier bourbon that stands the test of time. It has an alcohol volume of 50.5%, which translates to 101 proof.

This bourbon was distinguished by its "Cheesy Gold Foil" labeling, a term used by bourbon communities to refer to this particular release. Among the Wild Turkey 101 12-year releases of the 1990s, the CGF variety is highly valued when compared to the "Split Label" variety from later in the decade. The CGF bottles tend to be valued more highly due to their iconic label and perhaps the quality of the bourbon itself.

It's described as a fantastic pour with a perfect combination of sweetness and oak. This blend of flavors is often what bourbon enthusiasts seek, making it a beloved choice among many.

This bourbon has become a collectible item over time due to its exceptional quality and the nostalgia associated with its release era.
baxus_class_name: Wild Turkey Cheesy Gold Foil 12 Year 1989 Bottling

name: Parker’s Heritage Heavy Char Barrels 10 Year - 2020
description: Nose: You can smell the charred oak scent right away. Underneath it is the aroma of musty wood and charred marshmallow. Every scent seems to have a toasted element to it. The vanilla bean scent seems toasted, the toffee seems a little burnt and even the chocolate scent smells a bit scorched. Overall, everything has a very rich and deep scent to it, but in a good way.  Palate: I’m not going to lie, most Heaven Hill whiskies (even lower proofed ones) usually have a roughness about them that may stem from distilling the whiskey to the maximum proof (160) and barreling their whiskey at the maximum barrel proof (125). So I was impressed with the first sip that showed a total lack of harshness (I’m struggling to not use the word “smooth”). Flavors center around loads of char and heavy caramels. Rich vanilla buttercream frosting and some fudge brownie edges with toffee chips also add their weight. Fruits are few and far between with each sip, but I do detect a small amount of cherry cordial flavors. Overall it’s sweet, smoky and very rich.  Finish: Rich, heavy wood flavors dominate on the finish leaving little room for much else to shine through. If anything there may be some cigar box notes followed by a bit of chocolate covered cherries. It feels like every flavor has somehow been condensed even more
baxus_class_name: Parker’s Heritage Heavy Char Barrels 10 Year - 2020

name: Wild Turkey 101 Japanese Export 12 Year
description: Color: Bold amber color   Nose: The initial nose on this is big. I poured about an ounce in a Glencairn and returned a few minutes later to find the entire room filled with whiffs of bourbon goodness. It’s classic Wild Turkey – with spicy caramel and lots of barrel char leaving a smokey undertone. Mind you, it’s not a peaty whiskey of course, but you can immediately tell the influence of the heavy char levels on the barrels. Its nose is dark and earthy, with spiced wood, and a thick and luscious character.   Palate: The initial sip hits my palate with a blast of spearmint and eucalyptus. The rye influence comes through immediately, but then settles into waves of earthy sweetness. There is a cherry cola or root beer vibe going on with dark cocoa and browned butter sauce. As the sip continues, orange chocolate makes an appearance as does a heavy French vanilla bean note. The mouthfeel is fantastic with a thick and viscous body that coasts the mouth well, leaving a thick earthy, spiced sweetness behind that puckers the side of the cheeks.    Finish: As we move into the finish more of the barrel char from the nose comes through, leading to lovely nutmeg, allspice and clove baking spices on a long and inviting finish. The 101 proof is just enough to make you want to keep going back for more, with that lingering cola note lasting into the next sip.

name: Old Heaven Hill 15 year
description: Candy sweet and thinly syrupy in a good way, featuring subtle background spice a stewy sweet, somewhat floral nose with interplay that keeps giving, pulling you back for another taste.

name: Old Ezra 12 Year Rare Old
description: The Old Ezra 12 Year Rare Old Kentucky Straight Bourbon Whiskey is a distinguished and premium bourbon, known for its rich and complex flavor profile. This bourbon is aged for 12 years using a genuine sour mash process, which contributes to its deep, amber color and robust character. Bottled at 101 proof (50.5% ABV), it offers a bold yet smooth drinking experience. The bottle features a distinctive brown and red label with the "Old Ezra" branding prominently displayed, emphasizing its age and quality. The traditional bourbon bottle shape, with a slightly tapered neck and a brown cap, complements the overall aesthetic.

name: Islay 2007 10 Year Single Hogshead #105 The Creative Whisky Co
description: A 2007 vintage single cask expression of Islay whisky matured for 10 years in an ex-sherry hogshead. It was bottled at 55.7% Abv by The Creative Whisky Co.
baxus_class_name: Islay 2007 10 Year Single Hogshead #105 The Creative Whisky Co

name: Ocho 8 Year Extra Anejo
description: Tequila Ocho Extra Añejo 8/8/8 Rancho El Carrizal is a premium, meticulously crafted tequila that stands out for its exceptional aging process and rich flavor profile. This particular expression has been aged for 8 years and 8 months, which is prominently displayed on the label. The bottle features a clear glass body with a reddish-brown cap, allowing the golden amber color of the tequila to be showcased. The label provides detailed information about the tequila, including its 100% pure agave composition and its origin in Mexico. The aging process in ex-American whiskey barrels imparts a complex array of flavors, including notes of oak, anise, dry fruits such as almonds and pine nuts, cherries, toffee, black pepper, and cinnamon. The result is a deep and complex tequila with a long-lasting peppery finish, making it a well-balanced sip. This tequila is produced as a collaboration between Tomas Estes and the Camarena family, emphasizing the importance of terroir and the unique characteristics of each agave field. Tequila Ocho is renowned for being the world's first single-estate tequila, with each vintage reflecting the specific year of harvest and location of the agave plants.

name: Lost Spirits Cuban Inspired
description: Appearances  The bottle of the 151 is one of my favorites from Lost Spirits. It hearkens back to the days of Prohibition with its art deco stylings and tropical travel poster-like imagery. You feel like you may step off of the plane in the picture and end up in La Floradita in Havanna, sitting right next to Papa Hemingway himself.  In the glass, the spirit is a lovely amber color. It’s not very dark like the Plantation Overproof or Lemonhart 151, but it’s got enough color to give it character.  Nose  Fill a glass with the Cuban Inspired and be prepared for it to fill the room. Sitting with a glass of it next to me while putting together my notes, I could smell the rum without ever getting the glass off of the desk.  The rum is rich – so much more than just the burning sensation of ethanol that tortures anyone who generally strays into the robust category of overproof rums. Not to say that there isn’t burn. I wouldn’t recommend sticking your nose deep into a glass and inhaling deeply unless you’re trying to teach your nostrils a lesson. But this is no gasoline.  Notes of cocoa and bananas mingle with the tinge of heat on the nose, bringing to mind desserts like bananas foster. There’s an undercurrent of toasted marshmallow and caramel as well, all before the heat of the spirit brings to mind tall grasses in humid sunshine.  Palate  Let’s get the first thing everyone’s wondering out of the way first: yes, it’s hot. You’re drinking something that’s over 75% alcohol by volume, so if you’re drinking it neat, it’s going to bring some fire for your throat – and lips and tongue and pretty much everywhere else. That being said, one could be forgiven for deciding to drink this poured into a snifter all on its own, or possibly straight out of the bottle.  Before the heat comes, you can taste Bryan’s hard work with entry notes of marshmallow and toffee. The heat from the alcohol is not far behind – don’t gulp this – but after it washes over you you don’t find yourself left with searing pain. Instead, the finish is clean on the tongue, and in the back of the mouth and throat there are elements of candied orange peel and toasted banana.  That’s if you go neat. Of course, with so much heat, most people – if they aren’t mixing – will probably want to throw in an ice cube, and introducing ice to this rum creates impressive change. There’s still a richness, but the tamed heat exposes the oily body of the spirit along with the grassier elements that are hinted at in the flash from rich to hot. Greener notes of straw combine with chocolate and raisins, leaving you with something reminiscent of leather on the finish

name: Plantation Rum O.F.T.D
description: Nose : Intense and very precise notes of coffee, orange, plum, jam and truffles. Palate : It bursts with caramel cream, chocolate and vanilla notes. It continues on with cinnamon, raisins, nutmeg, oak and molasses with smoky accents. Result : Long and lingering with dark chocolate, clove and caramel.

name: Game of Thrones Talisker House Greyjoy
description: The Talisker Select Reserve Game of Thrones House Greyjoy is a special edition single malt Scotch whisky, crafted to honor the House Greyjoy from the iconic HBO series. This no-age-statement whisky is distilled on the rugged shores of the Isle of Skye, capturing the maritime essence of Talisker. The bottle features the House Greyjoy sigil, a kraken, prominently on the label, and contains an amber-colored liquid. Matured in heavily charred and refill ex-bourbon casks, it boasts an ABV of 45.8%. The whisky offers a complex profile with notes of sweet and smoky brine, dark chocolate, and Sichuan pepper on the nose, followed by flavors of salted caramel, chili, and smoky fruit on the palate.
baxus_class_name: Game of Thrones Talisker House Greyjoy

name: L’Encatada XO Lot 2
description: XO Lot 2.0 is comprised of five single vintage casks:  Domaine Lassalle 1990 -barrel #61 Domaine Lassalle 1984 -barrel #v2 Domaine Del Cassou 1985 - barrel #A1 Domaine Amblat 1988 - barrel #32 Domaine Bellair 1997 - barrel #36

name: L'Encantada XO Lot 1
description: XO Lot 1.0 is comprised of four single vintage casks:  Domaine Lous Pibous 1989 -barrel #61 Domaine Lous Pibous 1987 -barrel #87 Domaine Del Cassou 1994 - barrel #55 Domaine Bellair 1997 - barrel #181

name: Irish Single Malt 2003 12 Year Single Cask #200502 The Creative Whisky Co
description: The Creative Whisky Company The Exclusive Malts 12 Year - 2016 is a distinguished Irish single malt whiskey, distilled in 2003 and bottled in 2016. This limited edition release is part of The Exclusive Malts series, known for its high-quality, single cask bottlings. The whiskey is presented in a clear glass bottle, showcasing its deep amber hue, and features a green label with intricate detailing, including a silver medallion emblem. Bottled at cask strength with an ABV of 53.8%, this expression is non-chill filtered and retains its natural color, emphasizing its purity and robust character.
baxus_class_name: Irish Single Malt 2003 12 Year Single Cask #200502 The Creative Whisky Co

name: Linkwood 1997 18 Year Single Cask #7161 Creative Whisky Co
description: The Creative Whisky Company Linkwood Exclusive Malts 18 Year - 2016 is a distinguished single malt Scotch whisky, distilled at the renowned Linkwood Distillery in Speyside, Scotland. This special edition was distilled on June 23, 1997, and bottled in May 2016, after maturing for 18 years. The whisky is presented in a clear glass bottle, showcasing its deep, rich amber hue, and features a silver emblem or crest on the label, emphasizing its premium status. Bottled at cask strength with an ABV of 46.3%, this expression retains its natural color and robust character. The label details the cask number (7161) and the limited number of bottles produced (only 298), making it a rare and collectible item. This whisky offers a complex profile with notes of sherry, dried fruits, and a hint of spice, reflecting the meticulous craftsmanship and quality associated with both the Creative Whisky Company and the Linkwood Distillery.
baxus_class_name: Linkwood 1997 18 Year Single Cask #7161 Creative Whisky Co

name: Glen Ord 30 Year Cask Strength 2005 Release
description: The Glen Ord 30 Year - 2005 is a prestigious single malt Scotch whisky, part of the Diageo Special Releases series. Distilled in the 1970s and bottled in 2005, this expression is aged for three decades, showcasing the distillery's commitment to quality and tradition. The whisky is bottled at cask strength, 58.7% ABV, which preserves its robust and complex character. The bottle features a distinctive design with a clear glass body, allowing the rich amber liquid to be the focal point, and a black label with the "ORD" branding prominently displayed. The intricate detailing on the bottle, including the age statement and the elegant cap, highlights its premium status. This limited edition release, with only 6,000 bottles available, offers a sophisticated tasting experience with notes of dried fruits, caramel, pepper, and a hint of smokiness.
baxus_class_name: Glen Ord 30 Year Cask Strength 2005 Release

name: Michter's Pot Still Sour Mash 101
description: This bourbon presents a very straightforward, light, and pleasant nose. New oak, corn, grain, and raisins are all present

name: Blanton's Red Takara 1993 Bottling
description:
Blanton's Takara Red is a special edition of the celebrated Blanton's Single Barrel Bourbon, exclusively released for the Japanese market. Part of the Takara series, which also includes Takara Black and Takara Gold, this expression is highly sought after by bourbon enthusiasts and collectors around the world.

Takara Red is distinguished by its unique characteristics, including an aging process that is rumored to be a minimum of eight years, although this is not officially confirmed on the label. It is bottled at 93 proof (46.5% ABV), the same as the standard Blanton's Single Barrel, ensuring a robust flavor profile.

The packaging of Takara Red adds to its allure, featuring a distinctive red box with a woven texture and a deep maroon bag that contrasts with the brown bag of domestic Blanton's. The bottle is adorned with a gold-colored wax seal, similar to that found on Blanton's Straight From The Barrel. The label showcases light brown handwritten and printed portions, along with Japanese script spelling out "Whiskey," further emphasizing its exclusivity.

The Takara Red series is particularly interesting for collectors due to its limited availability and the variations that can arise from individual barrel selections. Some special releases within this series, such as the HBA (Hotel Barmen Association Japan) Single Barrel picks, offer even more unique expressions.

While many enthusiasts speculate about the potential superiority of the Takara series due to its rumored longer aging process, recent reviews suggest that modern releases may be more comparable in quality to standard Blanton's. Nevertheless, Takara Red remains a highly coveted expression in the bourbon world, often commanding premium prices on the secondary market.

name: Yamazaki 2021 Limited Edition
description: A non age stated expression of Yamazaki released in 2021, this edition of the year stated release is reportedly matured in Mizunara oak casks. The vatting is rumoured to be at least 12 years old but Suntory has never fully confirmed this fact. The 2021 edition was the first new annual release since 2017, with the series taking a hiatus between 2018-2020.

name: Joshua Brooks Over 15 Years - 1990s
description: Joshua Brooks Very Old Barrel Bourbon is a distinguished Kentucky Straight Bourbon Whiskey, aged for over 15 years and bottled at 115 proof. The bottle's label features a vintage design with a scenic illustration of a tree, a body of water, and a building in the background, evoking a sense of timeless craftsmanship. This bourbon, likely from the 1990s, reflects a rich heritage and meticulous aging process, promising a deep, complex flavor profile that bourbon enthusiasts will appreciate.

name: Barbancourt 15 Year Estate Reserve
description: The nose is perfumed and complex with candied citrus fruits and roasted, tannic flavors.The palate is powerful, with a great aromatic richness. Almost explosive with cooked pear, citrus fruits, cinnamon, and pepper. The finish is long, with a return of citrus fruits and spices. Distillery Notes.

name: Nikka Yoichi 15 Year
description: Nikka Whisky Single Malt "Yoichi" 15 Year is a premium Japanese whisky produced by the renowned Nikka Whisky Distilling Company. The bottle features a brown glass body with a dark brown cap, and the label prominently displays the brand name "Yoichi" in both English and Japanese characters. The age statement "15 YEAR" is clearly marked, indicating the whisky's extended maturation period. This single malt whisky is known for its rich and complex flavor profile, which includes bold, toasty, and slightly peaty notes, a characteristic attributed to the traditional coal-fired distillation process used at the Yoichi Distillery. The distillery, located in Hokkaido, Japan, was founded in 1934 by Masataka Taketsuru, who sought to replicate the conditions of Scottish whisky-making in Japan. The Yoichi 15 Year is celebrated for its depth, balance, and the unique influence of the coastal environment on its maturation.

name: Blanton's Single Barrel 1988 Bottling
description: Blanton’s Original was the first bourbon to be bottled from a single barrel back in 1984, revolutionising American whiskey and bringing it back to its former glory. Every batch is unique and the bottling strength of 46.5% helps maintain the authentic character of each barrel.

name: Yamazaki 2017 Limited Edition
description: A 2017 special edition release from Yamazaki crafted from various vintages and cask maturations including European oak and port matured spirit. Released as part of the Limited Editions series from the distillery, these were released from 2014-2017 before a hiatus, returning again in 2021.

name: Blanton’s Gold 2011 Bottling
description:
Buffalo Trace Distillery, situated along the banks of the Kentucky River, is one of America's oldest and most renowned distilleries. With a rich history dating back to 1775, Buffalo Trace has been producing exceptional bourbon whiskey for over two centuries. The distillery is known for its commitment to heritage, craftsmanship, and innovation, consistently producing award-winning bourbons under the guidance of Master Distiller Harlen Wheatley.

Blanton's is a distinguished brand within the Buffalo Trace Distillery portfolio, revered for its exceptional single barrel bourbons. Each bottle of Blanton's represents a pinnacle of craftsmanship and quality, showcasing rich and complex flavors derived from carefully selected mash bills and aging processes. Blanton's is known for its signature horse and jockey stoppers, which denote individual barrels and add a unique touch of luxury to this esteemed bourbon brand. 

Blanton's Gold is a prestigious expression from the Blanton's Single Barrel Bourbon range, renowned for its exceptional quality and distinctive character. Bottled at a robust 51.5% ABV, this bourbon showcases rich flavors of caramel, vanilla, and oak, complemented by hints of spice and honey. Each bottle of Blanton's Gold is drawn from a single barrel, ensuring unique variations in flavor and complexity. This expression embodies the epitome of craftsmanship and attention to detail, making it a coveted choice among bourbon enthusiasts worldwide.

name: Suntory Yamazaki Special Reserve
description: The Suntory Special Reserve is a blended whisky that was launched in 1969 to commemorate the 70th anniversary of Suntory, a company with a storied history in Japanese whisky production. This blend is a harmonious combination of specially reserved malt whiskies that have been pot-distilled and aged at the renowned Yamazaki Distillery. The whisky offers a delightful introduction to Japanese whisky, known for its mildness and balance, with pleasant fruity notes of peach and banana, and a spicy finish. The key malt components of the Suntory Special Reserve are Hakushu, aged in white oak casks, and Yamazaki, contributing to its complexity and depth. The nose of this whisky is rich with dried fruits, including prunes, dates, apricot, and berries, with a hint of orange, while the palate is greeted with flavors of white pepper and bitter chocolate, leading to a medium-length finish with lasting fruits and a touch of oak bitterness.

name: Yamazaki Pure Malt From the Barrel
description:
This Suntory Pure Malt Whisky boasts a robust 58% alcohol content for an intense whisky experience.

Explore a symphony of aromas, with oak and toffee mingling alongside subtle hints of wine and brine.

On the palate, expect a bold punch at cask strength, delivering fiery hot spices that mellow with the addition of water, revealing a creamy, custardy texture. While maltiness takes a backseat, the complexity of flavors unravels sip after sip.

The finish is warming and enduring, with creamy textures, lingering spices, and a delicate wine undertone.

While not a staple, the Suntory Pure Malt Whisky Tarudashi Genshu offers a memorable journey into Japanese whisky craftsmanship, sourced directly from the esteemed Yamazaki distillery.
baxus_class_name: Yamazaki Pure Malt From the Barrel

name: Blanton’s Gold 2000 Bottling
description: Blanton's Gold Edition, released in 2000, is a special edition of the renowned Blanton's Single Barrel Bourbon. Bottled at 103 proof (51.5% ABV), this bourbon is known for its rich and complex flavor profile, featuring notes of spicy rye, tobacco, caramel, honey, dark fruit, and citrus. The bottle is distinguished by its iconic horse and jockey stopper, a hallmark of the Blanton's brand. This edition was created for discerning bourbon aficionados who appreciate exceptional smoothness and complexity. The 2000 release of Blanton's Gold is particularly notable for its early introduction as a premium, high-proof expression within the Blanton's lineup, making it a highly sought-after and collectible bourbon.

name: Douglas Laing Big Peat Christmas Edition - 2011
baxus_class_name: Douglas Laing Big Peat Christmas Edition - 2011

name: Blanton's Gold 2022 Bottling
description: A superb single barrel bourbon. Blanton's Gold is distilled from a mashbill of corn, rye and malted barley. Each bottle is hand filled, sealed, labelled and individually numbered.

name: Blanton’s Red Takara 1992 Bottling
description:
The Blanton's Takara Edition is a special Japanese-exclusive release of the iconic Blanton's Single Barrel Bourbon. This expression has been aged for an additional 2 years beyond the standard Blanton's Single Barrel, resulting in a more complex and refined flavor profile. 

On the nose, this bourbon offers a slightly spicy and nutty aroma. The palate is well-rounded, with flavors of caramel, vanilla, honey, and corn. The finish is sweet and long-lasting, with a touch of cinnamon. 

Distributed exclusively in Japan by Takara, this limited and sought-after Blanton's expression is a must-try for bourbon enthusiasts looking to experience an elevated take on this classic American whiskey

name: Hibiki Harmony Master's Select
description: The Hibiki Japanese Harmony Master's Select, released in 2016, is a meticulously crafted blend from Suntory's renowned distilleries: Yamazaki, Hakushu, and Chita. This expression is a blend of ten different malt and grain whiskies aged in five types of casks, including American white oak, sherry, and Mizunara oak casks. Bottled at 43% ABV, it carries no age statement but is celebrated for its harmonious and complex flavor profile. The bottle design, with its 24 facets representing the 24 hours in a day and the 24 seasonal divides in a year, reflects the Japanese philosophy of harmony and meticulous craftsmanship.

name: Hibiki Japanese Harmony
description: Hibiki Japanese Harmony is a blend of Japanese malt and grain whiskies from Yamazaki, Hakushu and Chita. Presented in the brand's trademark 24-faceted bottle representing the Japanese seasons, this whisky is light, approachable and moreish with enticing notes of orange peel and white chocolate.

name: Thornton 2017 3 Year Double Cask Rum Single Cask Nation
description: This single cask bottling of Kosher for Passover American rum, distilled in January 2019, spent three years maturing in a new charred oak cask.
baxus_class_name: Thornton 2017 3 Year Double Cask Rum Single Cask Nation

name: Blue Spot 7 Year Batch 3
description: The Blue Spot 7 Year Old Cask Strength Single Pot Still Irish Whiskey is a celebrated release from Mitchell & Son, a historic wine and spirits merchant in Ireland. This expression, part of the renowned Spot Whiskey range, is triple distilled and aged for at least 7 years in a combination of bourbon, sherry, and Madeira casks. The whiskey is bottled at cask strength, which in this case is 58.7% ABV, ensuring a robust and full-bodied character. The bottle features a distinctive blue and white label with the "Blue Spot" name prominently displayed. The label also highlights that this whiskey is non-chill filtered, preserving its natural flavors and complexity. The liquid inside the bottle has a rich amber color, indicative of its maturation process. This particular batch, Batch 3, is known for its bold and spicy profile, with notes of ginger, nutmeg, and cinnamon on the nose, followed by flavors of black and Sichuan peppers, vanilla, green apple, peaches, and toasted hazelnuts on the palate. The finish is long and creamy, with lingering notes of milk chocolate, fresh fruit, and nuts. Overall, Blue Spot 7 Year Old Cask Strength is a testament to the quality and craftsmanship of Mitchell & Son, offering a unique and flavorful experience for whiskey enthusiasts.

name: Wild Turkey Batch W-T-01-99 Rare Breed
description: A 1999 release of Wild Turkey Rare Breed, a barrel proof expression of bourbon. Older editions of Wild Turkey are particularly sought after amongst enthusiasts, notably for their remarkably different taste profile to modern Wild Turkey bottles. The distillery originally produced bourbon using cypress wood tanks but these were slowly phased out from 1984 until 1990. The other notable production change came in 2004 when the barrel entry proof was changed to 110, up from 107. The combination of these changes have resulted in serious demand for older vintage bottlings from the much loved distillery, with some believing 1990s era bottlings to be the distillery’s best ever.
baxus_class_name: Wild Turkey Batch W-T-01-99 Rare Breed

name: Dos Artes Day Of The Dead Anejo - 2023
description:
The Dos Artes Anejo "Day of the Dead" edition is a beautifully crafted tequila that comes in a decorative ceramic bottle, adorned with vibrant and intricate designs inspired by the Mexican holiday Día de los Muertos. The bottle features a skull-like face with detailed floral and geometric patterns in shades of red, orange, and black against a light background, capturing the festive and celebratory spirit of the holiday. This special edition is likely a type of Anejo tequila, given the cultural references and the name "Dos Artes," which suggests a blend of artistry in both the tequila's creation and its presentation. The bottle is not only a tribute to the rich traditions of Mexico but also a collectible piece of art that tequila enthusiasts and collectors would be proud to display
.
baxus_class_name: Dos Artes Day Of The Dead Anejo - 2023

name: Kavalan 2012 Solist Vinho Barrique Bottled 2017
description: A single cask expression of Kavalan distilled in 2012 as noted by the cask number. This edition was matured in an ex-wine barrique and was bottled at a cask strength of 55.6% Abv in 2017.

name: Talisker 10 Year Made By The Sea
description: BODY - Full and rich. NOSE - Powerful peat-smoke with just a hint of the sea-water salt of fresh oysters, with a citrus sweetness. PALATE - A rich dried-fruit sweetness, clouds of smoke, strong barley-malt flavours, warming and intense. Peppery at the back of the mouth.
baxus_class_name: Talisker 10 Year Made By The Sea

name: Glengoyne 21 Year
description:
Nestled in the serene landscape of Dumgoyne Hill in the Southern Highlands, Glengoyne Distillery has honed its artistry over two centuries, and this expression epitomizes its mastery.

Aged to perfection for 21 years in the finest oak casks, this whisky exudes a rich, amber hue that hints at the depth of flavor within. As the golden liquid cascades into your glass, it releases an enchanting bouquet of aromas — from sweet toffee and ripe apples to hints of oak and subtle spices, each layer inviting you to explore further.

On the palate, Glengoyne 21 Year Old unfolds with grace and complexity. Silky smooth, yet robust, it tantalizes your taste buds with notes of creamy caramel, dried fruits, and gentle sherry undertones, all interwoven with a touch of nuttiness and warming spices that linger long after each sip.

With each indulgent taste, Glengoyne 21 Year Old reveals the culmination of time, patience, and expertise that define the Glengoyne legacy. Whether savored neat or with a splash of water, it offers a truly remarkable whisky experience, a testament to the artistry and dedication of Scotland's renowned whisky makers.

name: Williamson (Laphroaig) 2008 8 Year Single Cask Five Lions
description: A 2008 vintage single cask expression of Williamson, the trade name used to refer to the Laphroaig distillery. This single cask spent 8 years maturing in a 2nd fill American oak bourbon barrel before being bottled in 2018 at 57.8% Abv by Five Lions.
baxus_class_name: Williamson (Laphroaig) 2008 8 Year Single Cask Five Lions

name: Glenmorangie Sauternes Wood 15 Year
description: The Glenmorangie Sauternes Wood 15 Year is a distinguished single malt Scotch whisky from the Highlands of Scotland. This expression is notable for its unique maturation process, initially aged in American oak casks before being finished in Sauternes wine barriques from the Bordeaux region. This dual maturation technique imparts a distinct character to the whisky, setting it apart from other Glenmorangie offerings. The bottle showcases the brand's commitment to craftsmanship and innovation, reflecting Glenmorangie's long-standing tradition of producing high-quality whiskies.

name: Blanton's Single Barrel 2018 Bottling
description:
From the producer: 

"In the winter of 1881, Albert Bacon Blanton was born into one of the first families of bourbon history. At the age of sixteen, he started work in the Distillery as an office boy and fast became a leading pioneer in the development of bourbon. From the time he was made company president in 1921 until his retirement in 1952, his Distillery expanded from 44 to 144 buildings to become the largest Distillery of its day. During that period Colonel Blanton created his very special and limited supply of bourbon - his private reserve - handpicked and stored in what now is known as the famous Warehouse H. Although Colonel Blanton died in the spring of 1959, his legacy lives. Introduced in 1984, Blanton’s namesake bourbon was the first ever Single Barrel Bourbon sold commercially. The Single Barrel Bourbon is the first of its kind."

name: Thomas H. Handy 2011 Release
description: The 2011 release of Thomas H. Handy from Buffalo Trace crafted from their rye whiskey mashbill. This years edition was bottled at 128.6 proof.

name: Aberlour 2010 13 Year Double Cask For The Whisky Club
description: A 2010 vintage expression of Aberlour matured in bourbon and sherry casks for 13 years. It was bottled at 48% Abv exclusively for The Whisky Club in Australia.
baxus_class_name: Aberlour 2010 13 Year Double Cask For The Whisky Club

name: Springbank 12 Year Batch 11
description: A 2015 expression of Springbank's hugely popular 12 year old bottled at a cask strength of 53.8% Abv. Batch 11 was crafted from a vatting of 70% sherry casks and 30% bourbon casks.

name: Penelope Rio
description:
Penelope Rio Bourbon is an innovative and exciting release from Penelope Bourbon's Cooper Series, which explores unique cask finishes from around the world. This 2024 edition showcases a double cask finish, combining American honey barrels and Brazilian Amburana wood to create a truly distinctive flavor profile.

Bottled at 98 proof (49% ABV), this straight bourbon whiskey offers a captivating sensory experience. On the nose, it presents enticing aromas of sweet honey, burnt wood, cinnamon potpourri, and cedar, with hints of burnt orange rind and dark fruit. The palate is equally complex, featuring flavors reminiscent of Greek baklava, charred marshmallow, and a harmonious blend of sweet and savory notes.

As the whiskey develops, it reveals layers of graham cracker, cinnamon stick, cream soda, and roasted malt. The finish is full-bodied and lingering, with a perfect balance of sweetness and spice. Penelope Rio Bourbon manages to improve upon its already popular predecessor, offering bourbon enthusiasts a unique tasting experience that captures the vibrant spirit of Brazil.

name: Heaven Hill 18 Year Heritage Collection 2024 Release
description: A special 2024 edition release from Heaven Hill in their heritage collection series. This edition features an 18 year old expression of bourbon bottled at 60% Abv and crafted from a mashbill of 78% corn, 10% rye and 12% malted barley.
baxus_class_name: Heaven Hill 18 Year Heritage Collection 2024 Release

name: Augusta 8 Year Single Barrel #155 For Baxus Old Route 8
description: An 8 year old expression of Kentucky bourbon bottled at 57.75% Abv by Augusta. This single barrel was chosen by the Baxus team and has a mashbill of 78% corn, 13% rye and 9% malted barley.
baxus_class_name: Augusta 8 Year Single Barrel #155 For Baxus Old Route 8

name: 1792 Sweet Wheat
description: A special offering from the Barton distillery in Bardstown crafted from a wheated mashbill and bottled at 45.6% Abv.

name: Dream Spirits 9 Year Cask Strength Barrel No. I-001
description:
A household name in the spirits industry, Prav Saraff's Dream Spirits aims to source the best possible barrels in order to bring quality whiskey to consumers. 

This bourbon, distilled in Indiana, was bottled at cask strength after 9 years in the barrel.
baxus_class_name: Dream Spirits 9 Year Cask Strength Barrel No. I-001

name: WhistlePig The Boss Hog V Spirit of Mauve
description: This edition of The Boss Hog, The Spirit of Mauve, is a 13 Year Straight Rye Whiskey finished in Calvados Casks in honor of the celebrity pet pig Mauve's undying love of apples. The result is extraordinary. A unique blend of sweet and spiced flavors with a fine balance between American power and French sophistication.
series: The Boss Hog 5th Edition - Spirit of Mauve
baxus_class_name: WhistlePig The Boss Hog V Spirit of Mauve

name: Ezra Brooks 15 Year 200ml 1977 Bottling
description: A 1977 bottling of Ezra Brooks 15 Year old bottled by the Medley distillery in Owensboro. Bottled at 101 proof this high proof older bottling was likely produced at either Medley themselves, which closed in the early 1990s, or the original Hoffman distillery who originally owned the Ezra Brooks brand.

name: Laphroaig 18 year
description: Matured for 18 years in American oak casks. Plenty of familiar south coast Islay smokiness, mellowed slightly by the sweetness imparted from the casks, culminating in a rewarding dram perfect for evening sipping.

name: Remy Martin Louis XIII Grand Champagne Cognac 1970s Bottling
description: A circa early 1970s bottling of Remy Martin's flagship Louis XIII Cognac containing matured French brandy aged up to 100 years.
baxus_class_name: Remy Martin Louis XIII Grand Champagne Cognac 1970s Bottling

name: Remy Martin Louis XIII Grand Champagne Cognac 1990s Bottling
description: A circa 1990s bottling of Remy Martin's flagship Louis XIII Cognac containing matured French brandy aged up to 100 years.
baxus_class_name: Remy Martin Louis XIII Grand Champagne Cognac 1990s Bottling

name: Old Stagg 1914 19 Year Bottled In Bond
description: A 1914 vintage expression of Old Stagg Special Reserve bourbon matured for a huge 19 years! Bottled in bond at 50% Abv in 1933 by Schenley, this release of Stagg bourbon was sourced from the original George T. Stagg distillery in Frankfort which is now known as the Buffalo Trace distillery. Bottled by Schenley after they acquired the GTS distillery this exceptionally old pint sized bottling is a true rarity.
baxus_class_name: Old Stagg 1914 19 Year Bottled In Bond

name: Rebel Yell 6 Year 1971 Bottling Half Pint
description: A 1971 bottling of a small format expression of Rebel Yell bourbon. Matured for 6 years this half pint sized bottle was released at 90 proof. This is a Stitzel-Weller era expression of the label and was crafted from their original wheated bourbon recipe.
baxus_class_name: Rebel Yell 6 Year 1971 Bottling Half Pint

name: Old Fitzgerald Bottled In Bond 1960s Bottling Gallon Cradle
description:
A huge gallon format bottling of Old Fitzgerald from the 1960s! This over 3.7 liter bottling is crafted from Stitzel-Weller's original wheated bourbon recipe and is held on a wooden cradle. 

**Please note this large format bottle arrived leaking. Please carefully inspect images before purchase.
baxus_class_name: Old Fitzgerald Bottled In Bond 1960s Bottling Gallon Cradle

name: Mammoth Cave 1916 Bottled In Bond 1933
description: A 1916 vintage expression of Mammoth Cave, a historic label owned by W.L. Weller & Sons that prior to prohibition William Larue Weller founded. This pint size was bottled in 1933 at 17 years of age using barrels sourced from the closed Daviess County Distillery. Bottled by A.PH. Stitzel, one of the few firms to have a license to bottle stocks during prohibition. the Daviess County Distillery produced the Kentucky Club brand prior to prohibition, with the site owned by various important figures including Geo. E. Medley, Mattingly & Moore, R. Monarch and Dick Meschendorf. A fire destroyed a warehouse and bottling house in 1905 but the site was rebuilt. When prohibition hit the distillery was closed and stocks sold to the Wathen Brothers, who presumably sold some stocks to A.PH. Stitzel for bottling.

name: Old Fitzgerald 1917 Bottled In Bond 1929
description: A 1917 vintage expression of bottled in bond bourbon sourced from the Wright & Taylor/Old Charter distillery. Bottled in 1929 by A.PH. Stitzel during prohibition exclusively for medicinal purposes. Previously the Old Charter Distillery, the Wright & Taylor firm acquired Old Charter in 1896 and expanded the site. Prohibition closed the distillery in 1920 but Wright & Taylor moved all of their existing stocks to the A.PH. Stitzel distillery who were able to bottle these barrels throughout prohibition. Old Charter would then be sold in 1933 to the Bernheim distillery, which itself would be bought in 1937 by Schenley.

name: Old McBrayer 1917 17 Year Bottled In Bond Quart
description: A 1917 vintage expression of Old McBrayer bourbon whiskey matured for 17 years. This release used barrels sourced from the Glenmore distillery DSP KY24 whilst they were under the ownership of H.S. Barton. This was then bottled in bond at 50% Abv by American Medicinal Spirits Company in 1934. AMS were the prohibition era name of the whiskey trust, a firm who aimed to consolidate most of America's distilling operations. AMS would then become National Distillers, thriving after prohibition before being purchased by Jim Beam in 1987.
baxus_class_name: Old McBrayer 1917 17 Year Bottled In Bond Quart

name: Glenrothes 1968 Single Cask #13504 Bottled 2018 The Last Drop 50ml Miniature
description: A 1968 vintage single cask expression of Glenrothes matured for almost five decades in a bourbon barrel. Bottled in 2018 at 51.2% Abv by The Last Drop Distillers Limited.
baxus_class_name: Glenrothes 1968 Single Cask #13504 Bottled 2018 The Last Drop 50ml Miniature

name: Mackinlay & Co. Rare Old
description: In 2006, The New Zealand Antarctic Heritage Trust found three cases of Chas Mackinlay & Co’s whisky in the ice under Ernest Shackleton’s hut. Shackleton made an expedition to Antarctic in 1907-1909. The expedition didn’t go well, forcing Shackleton to abandon their hut and leave stuff behind – including the whisky and some Australian brandy made in Hunter Valley. The whisky found from Antarctic was from the Mackinlay’s Rare Old Highland Malt brand, which is nowadays owned by Whyte & Mackay (acquired it as part of Invergordon Distillers in 1995). Mackinlay’s whisky has been discontinued for several years. In two months after the samples were brought to Scotland, Whyte & Mackay recreated the Mackinlay’s whisky found from Shackleton’s hut, releasing a 50,000 bottle edition of the replica whisky.

name: W.B. Saffell
description: The Whiskey Baron Collection from Campari is an interesting one. These little 375ml bottles seem to vary drastically in availability price and popularity as well. Slight oak gives way to vanilla but this keeps coming back to big sweet caramel. Right up front is mild vanilla that’s immediately rolled over into a caramel candy. A gorgeous mouthfeel here. A delicate amount of citrus is present–but the buttery caramel and even a bit of dark amber maple syrup mix in as this coats the palate. Does not drink to it’s proof this is an extremely easy-sipper. At 107 proof WB Saffell brings with it a bit of heat that hugs the palate for a nice finish and doesn’t fall away–this is in no way a hot bourbon. There’s a little bit of spice in here but the long voluptuous finish is still holding a sweet note that won’t quit (in a good way).

name: Orphan Barrel Rhetoric 25 Year
description: A 25 year old expression of Kentucky bourbon bottled by Orphan Barrel as part of their rhetoric series. The barrels from this release are rumoured to be sourced from Bernheim distillery whilst under Diageo's ownership.

name: Chivas 12 Year 1970s Bottling Quart
description: A 1970s era bottling of Chivas's signature 12 year old expression bottled at 43% Abv in a quart format.

name: Castle & Key The Woolgather Autumn 2023 Release
description: An autumn 2023 special release from Castle & Key distillery crafted from their restoration rye finished in red vermouth barrels.
baxus_class_name: Castle & Key The Woolgather Autumn 2023 Release

name: VOSN Straight Outta Bardstown 10 Year For The Dusty Bunker
description: A 10 year old expression of Very Olde St Nick bourbon from the Preservation distillery in Bardstown. This single barrel was bottled at 65.3% Abv and was chosen exclusively for The Dusty Bunker.
baxus_class_name: VOSN Straight Outta Bardstown 10 Year For The Dusty Bunker

name: Smooth Ambler Old Scout 7 Year Cask Strength Single Barrel Rye #729
description: A 2014 bottling of cask strength, single barrel rye whiskey produced by Smooth Ambler under their old scout label. Barrel #729 was matured for 7 years and bottled at 60.7% Abv.
baxus_class_name: Smooth Ambler Old Scout 7 Year Cask Strength Single Barrel Rye #729

name: Jim Beam 100 Month New Jersey Central Train Car Early 1980s Decanter
description: An early 1980s era bottling of Jim Beam matured for 100 months and bottled in a unique train car decanter that can be attached to other Beam train decanters.
baxus_class_name: Jim Beam 100 Month New Jersey Central Train Car Early 1980s Decanter

name: MGP 11 Year Single Cask Bourbon For Whiskey Jewbilee
description: An 11 year 7 months old expression of MGP bourbon from Indiana bottled by Single Cask Nation at 54.15% Abv exclusively for the Whiskey Jewbilee festival.
baxus_class_name: MGP 11 Year Single Cask Bourbon For Whiskey Jewbilee

name: Very Olde St. Nick 20 Year Antique Cask Believe Lot 2
description: A 20 year old expression of Kentucky Bourbon bottled under the legendary Very Olde St. Nick label by Preservation distillery in Bardstown. This sourced bourbon was matured for over 2 decades and bottled at 59.2% Abv.
baxus_class_name: Very Olde St. Nick 20 Year Antique Cask Believe Lot 2

name: Cats Eye Obtainium 1995 26 Year Single Barrel #SC-00321 Canadian Whiskey
description: A 1995 vintage single cask expression of Canadian whiskey matured for 26 years. It was bottled by Cats Eye distillery at a monster hazmat strength of 77% Abv in 2021.
baxus_class_name: Cats Eye Obtainium 1995 26 Year Single Barrel #SC-00321 Canadian Whiskey

name: Very Olde St. Nick Ancient 13 Year Estate Lot #01
description: A 13 year old expression of Very Olde St. Nick, a storied brand from the Preservation distillery in Bardstown. This lot is bottled at a strength of 56.15% Abv.
baxus_class_name: Very Olde St. Nick Ancient 13 Year Estate Lot #01

name: Very Olde St. Nick Ancient 15 Year Estate
description: A 15 year old expression of Very Olde St. Nick, a storied brand from the Preservation distillery in Bardstown. This lot is bottled at a strength of 54.15% Abv.
baxus_class_name: Very Olde St. Nick Ancient 15 Year Estate

name: Bain's 15 Year Single Grain Sonically Matured
description: A 15 year old expression of single grain whisky from South African producer Bain's. A small batch of four barrels were stored in a cellar and had music played constantly for 5 months. The sound waves reportedly caused the liquid in the barrels to interact further with the wood.
baxus_class_name: Bain's 15 Year Single Grain Sonically Matured

name: George T. Stagg 2019 Release
description: A 2019 release of the annual George T Stagg bourbon crafted from Buffalo Trace's #1 low rye mashbill. This batch was matured for 15 years and 4 months and is bottled at 58.45% Abv.

name: Nelson Bros 15 Year Rye Gift Shop Exclusive
description: A 15 year old expression of rye whiskey from Nelson Bros at the Nelson Green Briar distillery in Tennessee. This release was distilled in Indiana and bottled at 54.2% Abv.
baxus_class_name: Nelson Bros 15 Year Rye Gift Shop Exclusive

name: Cragganmore 1989 21 Year Cask Strength
description: Distilled in 1989 this small batch release from the Cragganmore distillery was matured for 21 years. It was bottled at natural cask strength in 2010 at 56% Abv as part of the Diageo special releases.

name: Preservation 6 Year Pot Still For The Dusty Bunker
description: A 1-3 barrel blend of pot distilled wheated bourbon produced by Preservation distillery in Bardstown. This batch was aged for 6-7 years and bottled at 57.1% Abv exclusively for The Dusty Bunker.
baxus_class_name: Preservation 6 Year Pot Still For The Dusty Bunker

name: Penderyn Bryn Terfel Icons Of Wales #5
description: The 5th edition in Welsh distillery Penderyn's Icons Of Wales series. This bourbon matured release is bottled at 41% Abv and celebrates the Welsh opera singer Bryn Terfel with a velvet theatre inspired bottle design.
baxus_class_name: Penderyn Bryn Terfel Icons Of Wales #5

name: George T. Stagg 2020 Release
description: A 2020 release of the annual George T Stagg bourbon crafted from Buffalo Trace's #1 low rye mashbill. This batch was distilled in spring 2005 matured for 15 years and is bottled at 65.2% Abv.

name: Willett 8 Year Single Barrel Rye #6068 For Pacific Edge California 2022
description: An 8 year old expression of rye whiskey from Willett bottled exclusively for Pacific Edge in California at 65.9% Abv.
baxus_class_name: Willett 8 Year Single Barrel Rye #6068 For Pacific Edge California 2022

name: Maker's Mark Cellar Aged 2023 Release
description: The 2023 release of Maker's Mark's cellar aged expression. This series sees extra matured wheated bourbon moved to their unique limestone cellar, a temperature-controlled environment that allows for slower, more consistent aging. This edition is a blend of 13% 11-year-old and 87% 12-year-old Maker's Mark bourbon, bottled at a robust 57.85% ABV.

name: Wolves x Willett Rye Collaboration Batch 1
description: A special edition collaboration between Wolves whisky and Willett in Bardstown. This blended rye whiskey is crafted from Willett produced rye whiskey as well as Indiana sourced rye whiskies. Matured for 6-7 years, this batch 1 was bottled at an abv of 51.5% Abv.
baxus_class_name: Wolves x Willett Rye Collaboration Batch 1

name: Old Carter Barrel Strength Batch 15
description: The 15th batch of bourbon from Old Carter bottled at a barrel strength of 58.5% Abv. This release was distilled in Indiana and produced 3146 bottles.

name: Pinhook 16 Year Single Barrel #518
description: A 16 year old expression of straight bourbon whiskey distilled in Indiana. Bottled at 62.1% Abv from a single barrel by Pinhook.

name: Adelphi The Glover 14 Year
description: A blended malt whisky from Adelphi crafted from spirit sourced from the ghost Japanese distillery Hanyu. This blend includes Glen Garioch, Longmorn and Hanyu whisky matured for at least 14 years before being bottled at 44.3% Abv in 2015.

name: Old Fitzgerald 2003 19 Year Bottled In Bond Decanter
description: A 2003 vintage expression of wheated bourbon from Heaven Hill matured for 19 years. This fan favourite release is bottled in bond at 50% Abv as part of the Old Fitzgerald label and comes packaged in a stunning heavy glass decanter.
baxus_class_name: Old Fitzgerald 2003 19 Year Bottled In Bond Decanter

name: Bain's Single Grain Shiraz Cask Finish
description: A single grain expression from Bain's in South Africa finished in ex-shiraz wine casks. This limited offering is bottled at 63.5% Abv in a 1 litre format.
baxus_class_name: Bain's Single Grain Shiraz Cask Finish

name: Weller 12 Year 700ml
description: A 12 year old expression of wheated bourbon from Buffalo Trace bottled at 90 proof as part of their highly sought after Weller series.

name: Angel's Envy Bottled In Bond Cask Strength Signed Bottle
description: A distillery exclusive release from Angel's Envy bottled at a cask strength of 50% Abv, thus making it a bottled in bond product. This release was primarily blended from low barrel proof entry barrels who's cask strengths were under 50% Abv, with a small number of higher entry proof barrels used to make sure the vatting finished at 50% Abv. Master distiller Owen Martin noted this vatting is is 50% Abv to a large number of decimal places. Bottled in a 375ml format release this lot is signed.
baxus_class_name: Angel's Envy Bottled In Bond Cask Strength Signed Bottle

name: Old Forester Rum Finish 117 Series
description: A distillery only release from Old Forester crafted using their signature bourbon finished in ex-rum casks. The 117 series is bottled in a 375ml format and this edition was launched in July 2024 and bottled at 47.5% Abv.

name: Angel's Envy Madeira Casks Cellar Collection Release 3
description: The third release in Angel's Envy's cellar series sees their bourbon whiskey finished in madeira wine casks and bottled at 50% Abv.
baxus_class_name: Angel's Envy Madeira Casks Cellar Collection Release 3

name: Uncle Nearest 777 Anniversary Blend Barrel #007
description: To celebrate the 7th year since Uncle Nearest was founded in 2017 the distillery has released a special vatting matured for 7 years. This is barrel 007 which was bottled in 2024 at 60.85% Abv.

name: Russell’s Reserve Private Barrel Selection 2023 Bottling
baxus_class_name: Russell’s Reserve Private Barrel Selection 2023 Bottling

name: Augusta Buckner’s 13 Year Single Barrel #105
description: A 13 year old expression of Kentucky bourbon bottled by Augusta distillery as part of their premium Buckners range. This single barrel was sourced from an undisclosed Kentucky distillery and bottled at a huge hazmat strength of 71% Abv.

name: Jack Daniel's Coy Hill 2024 Barrel #24-07309
description: A special 2024 release from Jack Daniel's crafted from barrels pulled exclusively from their Coy Hill rickhouse. Bottled as single barrels these casks have been exposed to high levels of heat in the Coy Hill rickhouse creating intensely mature Tennessee whiskeys. This barrel was distilled in 2013 and bottled in 2024 at 61.4% Abv.

name: Mars Komagatake Limited Edition 2020
description: A 2020 special edition release from Mars whisky in Japan produced from unpeated barley at their Shinshu distillery. This edition was matured in bourbon and sherry casks before being bottled at 50% Abv.

name: Bardstown 6 Year Single Barrel Bourbon
description: A single barrel expression of bourbon from Bardstown Bourbon Co crafted from a four grain mashbill of 60% corn, 26% rye, 10% wheat and 4% malted barley. Matured for 6 years this barrel was bottled at 60% Abv.

name: Macallan 15 Year Triple Cask
description: A 15 year old expression from Macallan as part of their triple cask series. This edition is matured in American & European oak sherry casks as well as American oak ex-bourbon casks.

name: Russell's Reserve 2014 9 Year Single Barrel For Drammers #63
description: A 2014 vintage single barrel offering of Russell's Reserve from Wild Turkey matured for 9 years. This barrel was matured on the 4th floor of warehouse K on the Tyrone campus. Barrel #23-0035 was chosen exclusively for Drammers.
baxus_class_name: Russell's Reserve 2014 9 Year Single Barrel For Drammers #63

name: Barrell Craft Spirits 33 Year Old Cask Strength Canadian Whiskey
description: A huge 33 year old age statement from Barrell Craft Spirits. This release was crafted from Canadian whiskey finished in Oloroso sherry & French oak casks. It was bottled at a hazmat cask strength of 70% Abv.
baxus_class_name: Barrell Craft Spirits 33 Year Old Cask Strength Canadian Whiskey

name: Bushmills 2010 Double Moscatel Finish For The Whisky Club
description: A 2010 vintage expression of Bushmills single malt matured in Oloroso sherry casks and then finished in rare Moscatel wine casks. This batch was recasked into Moscatel in 2021 and then bottled in 2024 at a cask strength of 49.1% Abv exclusively for The Whisky Club in Australia.
baxus_class_name: Bushmills 2010 Double Moscatel Finish For The Whisky Club

name: Wilderness Trail 5 Year Single Barrel Wheated Bourbon For Drammers
description: A single barrel expression of wheated bourbon from Wilderness Trail matured for 5 years and 3 months in an independent stave company barrel that had a #4 char. Crafted with their FP1 yeast strain it was bottled at 55.4% Abv and chosen exclusively for Drammers.
baxus_class_name: Wilderness Trail 5 Year Single Barrel Wheated Bourbon For Drammers

name: Old Charter Oak French Oak
description: A special release from Buffalo Trace crafted from spirit matured in French oak instead of the usual American oak casks. Old Charter is a legacy brand from the Ancient Age distillery, the previous name used by BT. Old Charter quietly disappeared in the later 2000s but the company has brought the label back with this unique wood series. Rumoured to be 12 years of age, this release is bottled at 92 proof.

name: Old Rip Van Winkle 10 Year 2018 Bottling
description:
One of the most recognizable names in bourbon, the legacy of Pappy Van Winkle is both extensive and complex. Originating at the illustrious Stitzel-Weller distillery, the modern iteration of this incredibly hard-to-find whiskey is currently produced at Buffalo Trace in Kentucky. 

The youngest member of the Van Winkle line, the 10 year old is bottled at a higher proof of 107.
baxus_class_name: Old Rip Van Winkle 10 Year 2018 Bottling

name: Russell's Reserve 13 Year Batch 2
description: The second batch of Russell's Reserve 13 year from Wild Turkey bottled at a barrel proof of 57.4% Abv. Batch 2 has the LL/JL batch codes and was reportedly a similar blend to that of batch 1.

name: Old Rip Van Winkle 10 Year 2023 Bottling
description: One of the most recognizable names in bourbon, the legacy of Pappy Van Winkle is both extensive and complex. Originating at the illustrious Stitzel-Weller distillery, the modern iteration of this incredibly hard-to-find whiskey is currently produced at Buffalo Trace in Kentucky.   The youngest member of the Van Winkle line, the 10 year old is bottled at a higher proof of 107.
baxus_class_name: Old Rip Van Winkle 10 Year 2023 Bottling

name: Russell’s Reserve Single Rickhouse Camp Nelson F
baxus_class_name: Russell’s Reserve Single Rickhouse Camp Nelson F

name: Pappy Van Winkle 15 Year Family Reserve Pre-2007 Bottling
description: A circa 2002-2007 bottling of Pappy Van Winkle 15 year old. This era is denoted by the Frankfort address on the bottle, as Julian Van Winkle bottled his bourbon at his Lawrenceburg site until moving in 2002. Laser codes were then introduced to the series in 2007. This bottle does not have a laser code but holds the Frankfort address, this making it a 2002-2007 era bottling. This window of time is within the production period of Stitzel-Weller and likely contains wheated bourbon produced at the now legendary closed Louisville distillery.
baxus_class_name: Pappy Van Winkle 15 Year Family Reserve Pre-2007 Bottling

name: Bruichladdich 2003 8 Year Single Cask Micro-Provenance
description: A 2003 vintage of peated Bruichladdich first matured in bourbon casks before being finished in a refill sherry cask. After 8 years it was bottled at 54.2% Abv exclusively for K&L wines for the US market.

name: Angels Envy Cask Strength Rye 2023 Release
description: The 2023 edition of Angel's Envy rye whiskey bottled at cask strength. This release was finished in sauternes wine casks as well as toasted oak barrels before being bottled at 57.2% Abv.
baxus_class_name: Angels Envy Cask Strength Rye 2023 Release

name: Weller Antique 107
description: A non age stated expression of wheated bourbon from Buffalo Trace bottled as part of the highly sought after Weller series. This higher proof offering of the brand is a fan favourite and is crafted from a wheated mashbill pioneered by William Larue Weller and then perfected by Pappy Van Winkle.

name: Weller 12 Year
description: A 12 year old expression of wheated bourbon produced at the Buffalo Trace distillery. This highly sought after release is produced to a heritage recipe pioneered by William Larue Weller and then perfected by Pappy Van Winkle. This 12 year old release is bottled at 90 proof.

name: Michter's Barrel Strength Rye 2024 Release
description: The 2024 release of Michter's barrel strength offering of rye. This edition is bottled at 110.2 proof.

name: JYPSI Whiskey Club Marzipan Blend #1
description:
A special edition blend of straight bourbon whiskey and Indian single malt whisky. This custom blend was produced exclusively for Club Marzipan, the VIP group for esteemed whiskey writer Fred Minnick. 

Limited Edition Batch #1 contains a blend of 90% Indiana sourced bourbon whiskey that has been finished in Mizunara casks blended with 10% 10 year old Indian single malt whisky. This is all vatted together and then bottled at 51.5% Abv.

name: Springbank 2000 16 Year Old Single NZ Whisky Cask Cadenhead’s
description: A 2000 vintage single cask expression from Springbank matured in a unique cask that previously held New Zealand whisky. Matured for 16 years it was bottled in 2017 at 51% Abv exclusively for their warehouse tasting. This special tasting allows visitors to Cadenhead’s in Campbeltown to taste a variety of hand picked casks and then purchase a favourite. As such they are usually only available to those who make the trip to the bottler’s warehouses
baxus_class_name: Springbank 2000 16 Year Old Single NZ Whisky Cask Cadenhead’s

name: George T. Stagg 2023 Release
description: A 2023 release of the annual George T Stagg bourbon crafted from Buffalo Trace's #1 low rye mashbill. This batch was distilled in spring 2008 matured for 15 years and 3 months and is bottled at 67.5% Abv.

name: Rare Character 2016 7 Year Single Maple Cask Finished Bourbon
description: Distilled in 2016, cask MAP.B.3576was matured for 7 years and finished in an ex-maple cask. This straight bourbon whiskey was distilled in Indiana and bottled by Rare Character in February 2024 at 57.8% Abv.
baxus_class_name: Rare Character 2016 7 Year Single Maple Cask Finished Bourbon

name: JYPSI Whiskey Club Marzipan Blend #2
description:
A special edition blend of straight bourbon whiskey and Indian single malt whisky. This custom blend was produced exclusively for Club Marzipan, the VIP group for esteemed whiskey writer Fred Minnick. 

Limited Edition Batch #2 contains a blend of 70% Indiana sourced bourbon whiskey that has been finished in Mizunara casks blended with 30% 10 year old Indian single malt whisky. This is all vatted together and then bottled at 51.5% Abv.

name: Glenfiddich 20 Year Mr Porter
description: A 2021 special edition from Glenfiddich in collaboration with luxury fashion retailer Mr Porter. Matured for 20 years in new American oak, bourbon casks and sherry casks, this expression of Glenfiddich is bottled at 48% Abv and presented in a white casing.

name: Bowmore 21 Year 1990s Bottling
description: A 1990s era bottling of Bowmore matured for 21 years in bourbon and sherry casks before being bottled at 43% Abv. This elegant presentation of Bowmore featuring the signature seagulls label is crafted from spirit distilled in the 1970s, a highly praised era of production for the Islay distillery that has made expressions like this 21 year old highly sought after.

name: Jack Daniel’s 12 Year Batch 1
description: The first batch of Jack Daniel's 12 year old expression of Tennessee whiskey. This age statement is bottled at 107 proof.

name: Pappy Van Winkle 20 Year Family Reserve Pre-1999 Bottling
description: A pre-1999 era bottling of Pappy Van Winkle 20 year. Launched in 1994 the 20yo green glass edition was released until 1999 when Julian Van Winkle switched to clear glass bottles. The spirit inside this bottle is likely rye grain mashbill bourbon sourced from the Boone County distillery, although some releases may also contain wheated bourbon from Stitzel-Weller.
baxus_class_name: Pappy Van Winkle 20 Year Family Reserve Pre-1999 Bottling

name: Redemption 10 Year Barrel Proof Bourbon Batch 2
description: The second batch of 10 year old barrel proof bourbon from Redemption. This batch was sourced from Indiana and bottled at 57.2% Abv.
baxus_class_name: Redemption 10 Year Barrel Proof Bourbon Batch 2

name: Pappy Van Winkle Family Reserve 23 Year Gold Wax 1st Release 1998 Bottling
description: The first ever bottling of Pappy Van Winkle 23 year old bottled in 1998 in cognac style green tinged glass. Julian Van Winkle bottled this exceptional bourbon from rye grain mashbill stocks distilled at the closed Old Boone distillery. He launched the 20 year old Pappy Van Winkle in 1994 and then this 23 year old in 1998.
baxus_class_name: Pappy Van Winkle Family Reserve 23 Year Gold Wax 1st Release 1998 Bottling

name: Nikka Yoichi Single Malt
description:
From the producer: "Yoichi Single Malt is a range of single malt expressions from the Yoichi Distillery, Nikka's first distillery built in 1934. The founder Masataka Taketsuru chose the town of Yoichi in Hokkaido because of the similar environmental conditions to Scotland, where he learned whisky-making.

 
Yoichi malts are described as bold and strong with refined peaty notes and smokiness brought by the traditional direct coal-fired distillation. Sea breeze from the Ishikari Bay delivers a briny hint to the whisky during maturation."

name: Elijah Craig 18 Year Single Barrel
description: An 18 year old expression of Elijah Craig bourbon drawn from a single barrel and bottled at 45% Abv.

name: Barrell Vantage Toasted
description: A black label edition of Barrell bourbon's Vantage blend which takes bourbon and finishes it in Mizunara, French Oak, Toasted American Oak & Grand Cru American Oak.

name: Four Roses 130th Anniversary 2018
description: A 2018 special release from Four Roses of barrel strength bourbon bottled to celebrate their 130th anniversary.

name: Bardstown Bourbon Company Cathedral French Oak
description:
A 2025 special release from Bardstown Bourbon Co crafted using up to 18 year old Kentucky bourbon finished in 300 year old French oak wood. The barrels used for this release were crafted from oak trees aged over 300 years, the same oak trees that were chosen to restore the famous Notre Dame. Rumour has it roughly six barrels were crafted and the blend was finished for over 14 months. 

Bottled in a 375ml format at 55.05% Abv.
baxus_class_name: Bardstown Bourbon Company Cathedral French Oak

name: Nathan Green 15 Year Single Barrel For British Bourbon Society
description: A 15 year old expression of American whiskey distilled in Tennessee. Sourced and bottled by Uncle Nearest distillery, this single barrel was bottled at 59.3% Abv and chosen exclusively for the British Bourbon Society.
baxus_class_name: Nathan Green 15 Year Single Barrel For British Bourbon Society

name: Evan Williams 2017 Single Barrel For Kentucky Derby 2025
description: A 2025 limited release from Evan Williams distilled by Heaven Hill. Produced in 2017 this single barrel was bottled in 2025 at 53% Abv to celebrate the 2025 Kentucky Derby.
baxus_class_name: Evan Williams 2017 Single Barrel For Kentucky Derby 2025

name: Stagg Batch 24C
description: A 2024 release of Stagg bourbon crafted from Buffalo Trace's #1 low rye mashbill. Batch 24C was bottled at a barrel proof of 128.9 proof.

name: Stagg Batch 24D
description: A 2024 release of Stagg bourbon crafted from Buffalo Trace's #1 low rye mashbill. Batch 24D was bottled at a barrel proof of 127.4 proof.

name: Maker's Mark 2021 Wood Finishing Series FAE-01
description: A 2021 special edition from Maker's Mark bottled as part of their wood finishing series. This release saw 10 toasted American oak staves used for the barrels before being bottled at 55.3% Abv.
baxus_class_name: Maker's Mark 2021 Wood Finishing Series FAE-01

name: WhistlePig 6 Year Single Barrel Rye Big Papi David Ortiz Pick
description: A 6 year old expression of rye whiskey from Whistlepig produced at their Vermont distillery. This single barrel is a wacky and wild honouring of David Ortiz's inception into the baseball hall of fame. Ortiz chosen this single barrel and then Whistlepig placed a maple wood baseball bat into the barrel to finish the whiskey. A crazy concept!
baxus_class_name: WhistlePig 6 Year Single Barrel Rye Big Papi David Ortiz Pick

name: Angels Envy Cask Strength Rye 2023 Release
description: The 2023 edition of Angel's Envy rye whiskey bottled at cask strength. This release was finished in sauternes wine casks as well as toasted oak barrels before being bottled at 57.2% Abv.
baxus_class_name: Angels Envy Cask Strength Rye 2023 Release

name: Angel's Envy Cask Strength Bourbon 2023 Release
description: The 2023 edition of Angel's Envy's cask strength release of their signature port wine finished bourbon. This batch was bottled at 59.1% Abv.
baxus_class_name: Angel's Envy Cask Strength Bourbon 2023 Release

name: Maker's Mark 2021 Wood Finishing Series FAE-02
description: A 2021 special edition from Maker's Mark bottled as part of their wood finishing series. This release saw 10 toasted French oak staves used for the barrels before being bottled at 54.55% Abv.
baxus_class_name: Maker's Mark 2021 Wood Finishing Series FAE-02

name: Maker’s Mark 2022 Wood Finishing Series BRT-02
description: A 2022 special edition from Maker's Mark bottled as part of their wood finishing series. This release saw 10 toasted French oak staves used for the barrels before being bottled at 54.7% Abv.
