name: Old Forester President's Choice 9 Year
description:
Old Forester President's Choice is a prestigious expression from the iconic Old Forester brand, known for its rich heritage and commitment to quality. This single barrel bourbon has its roots in a tradition that began in 1890 when George Garvin Brown, the founder of Old Forester Distillery, gifted a barrel of bourbon to the Governor of Kentucky. The modern version of President's Choice was revived in 1964 by G.G.B. the 2nd, who initially offered it exclusively to presidents and executives of other companies.

Today, President's Choice represents some of the finest barrels from Old Forester, hand-selected for their exceptional quality and unique characteristics. Typically aged between 7 to 12 years, these barrels are bottled at a proof range of 105 to 120, depending on the optimal flavor profile. The expression is released only when barrels exhibit truly remarkable character, making it a limited and highly coveted offering among bourbon enthusiasts.

In recent years, Old Forester has increased the frequency of President's Choice releases, making this exclusive bourbon more accessible. The brand also offers a President's Choice Tasting Experience at their distillery, allowing visitors to delve into the rich heritage of Old Forester while sampling this sought-after expression.

Each release of President's Choice showcases a unique flavor profile, reflecting the craftsmanship that Old Forester is known for. Tasting notes often include rich caramel, brown sugar, dark fruits, and complex oak flavors, with distinct nuances varying from barrel to barrel.

name: Weller 12 Year 1 Liter
description:
W.L. Weller 12 Year is a highly regarded wheated bourbon produced by Buffalo Trace Distillery. Named after William Larue Weller, who is credited with pioneering the use of wheat as a secondary grain in bourbon, this whiskey is part of the prestigious Weller line. Bottled at 90 proof (45% ABV), the bourbon is aged for a full 12 years, offering a rich and complex flavor profile.

The bourbon features a distinctive wheated mash bill, believed to be approximately 70% corn, 14-16% wheat, and 16-14% malted barley. Its flavor characteristics include notes of caramel, vanilla, dark fruits, and toasted oak, with a smooth and balanced finish. The Weller 12 Year has gained significant popularity among bourbon enthusiasts, often commanding prices well above its suggested retail price due to its reputation and limited availability.

Buffalo Trace carefully selects and ages these barrels, creating a bourbon that showcases the depth and complexity that comes from extended maturation. While the bourbon's proof and age statement are becoming more common in the market, Weller 12 Year continues to be highly sought after by collectors and whiskey lovers alike.

name: Michter's 10 Year Single Barrel Bourbon 2020
description: A 2020 bottling of 10 year old bourbon bottled from a single barrel by Michter's. Prior to 2015 Michter's was contract producing its spirits at an undisclosed Brown-Forman distillery, rumoured to be Early Times/Old Forester. In 2015 the company established their full scale distillery in Shively, slowly transitioning to their own spirit. This 2020 bottling will have been crafted from spirit contract distilled by Michter's at the undisclosed Brown-Forman site.

name: Angel's Envy Cask Strength 2018 Release
description:
Angel's Envy is a pioneering bourbon brand founded in 2010 by legendary Master Distiller Lincoln Henderson and his son Wes Henderson. After Lincoln's retirement from Brown-Forman, where he had developed renowned brands like Woodford Reserve, he came out of retirement to create a whiskey that would challenge traditional bourbon-making techniques.

The brand's innovative approach centers on secondary barrel finishing, a technique more commonly used in Scotch whisky production. Lincoln and Wes began experimenting with aging bourbon in port wine casks, a method that was initially met with skepticism from bourbon purists. The brand's name originated from Lincoln's joke that while the "angel's share" is the portion of whiskey lost to evaporation during aging, the remaining liquid must be what the angels would envy.

In 2013, Angel's Envy broke ground on its distillery in downtown Louisville, becoming the first full-production whiskey distillery in the city's urban center. This historic location, situated on Whiskey Row, symbolizes the brand's commitment to both innovation and bourbon heritage. The distillery was completed in 2016 and has since expanded, welcoming 10,000 visitors annually.

Now owned by Bacardi, Angel's Envy has grown from a family project to a nationally and internationally distributed brand. They continue to push boundaries by experimenting with various finishing techniques, including rum and sherry cask finishes, while maintaining a commitment to quality and craftsmanship passed down through three generations of the Henderson family.

The Cask Strength series from Angel's Envy is a limited release that aims to add an extra appeal to the already illustrious bourbon brand. Bottled at a higher proof, the Cask Strength line is still finished in Port Wine barrels.

name: Eagle Rare 10 Year Single Barrel Select 1.75 Liter
description:
Eagle Rare Single Barrel Select is a special bottling derived from Buffalo Trace Distillery's exclusive Single Barrel Select Program. 

These single barrel selections offer bourbon enthusiasts a unique opportunity to experience a more individualized expression of Eagle Rare. While Buffalo Trace transitioned away from the official "single barrel" designation around 2017 due to mechanical bottling constraints, they continue to select high-quality barrels for these special releases. Each bottle represents a distinct barrel, providing subtle variations in flavor profile while maintaining the core characteristics of Eagle Rare's 10-year bourbon.

The Single Barrel Select remains highly sought after, with limited availability and significant demand among whiskey collectors and enthusiasts. Bottled at the standard 90 proof, these selections showcase Buffalo Trace's commitment to quality and craftsmanship in bourbon production.
baxus_class_name: Eagle Rare 10 Year Single Barrel Select 1.75 Liter

name: Michter's Single Barrel Rye 2018 Bottling Signed Bottle
description: A single barrel expression of rye whiskey from Michter's bottled in 2018. This era of spirit is likely sourced from the undisclosed Brown-Forman distillery Michter's was using to contract distil their spirits. This lot is a signed bottle.
baxus_class_name: Michter's Single Barrel Rye 2018 Bottling Signed Bottle

name: Smoke Wagon Uncut Unfiltered Batch 35
description: A 2021 release of Smoke Wagon bourbon crafted from sourced whiskey bottled at a barrel proof of 57.68% Abv.

name: WhistlePig The Boss Hog IV The Black Prince
description: The 4th edition of Whistlepig's signature flagship release the Boss Hog. This edition takes straight rye whiskey and finishes is in Armagnac barrels.
baxus_class_name: WhistlePig The Boss Hog IV The Black Prince

name: Old Grand-Dad 114 200ml 1981 Bottling
description: A circa 1981 bottling of Old Grand-Dad 114 produced by National Distillers at the Old Grand-Dad distillery in Frankfort. This early 1980s bottling is presented in a 200ml format bottle.

name: Old Fitzgerald 1972 6 Year Bottled In Bond Pint
description: A 1972 vintage expression of Old Fitzgerald produced by Stitzel-Weller under the ownership of Norton Simon. This 6 year old bourbon was bottled in bond at 50% Abv in 1978 in a 1 pint format.
baxus_class_name: Old Fitzgerald 1972 6 Year Bottled In Bond Pint

name: Old Taylor 6 Year 200ml 1989 Bottling
description: A 1989 bottling of Old Taylor 6 year produced by the original Old Taylor distillery and bottled by Jim Beam in 1989. Beam acquired National Distillers in 1987 and this miniature bottling likely uses remaining barrels from the Old Taylor distillery.

name: Rebel Yell 6 Year Handle 1980 Bottling
description: A 1980 bottling of Rebel Yell 6 year old produced at the Stitzel-Weller distillery. This large 1.75 litre format handle bottling was often just available in Kentucky and the southern states.

name: Ancient Age 6 Year 1971 Bottling Half Gallon
description: A large format handle sized bottling of Ancient Age bourbon produced at the George T. Stagg distillery, known today as the Buffalo Trace distillery. This 6 year old bourbon was bottled in a half gallon handle size at 86 proof in 1971.
baxus_class_name: Ancient Age 6 Year 1971 Bottling Half Gallon

name: Mount Vernon 1945 Bottled In Bond 1950
description: A 1945 vintage expression of Mount Vernon rye whiskey produced at the Mount Vernon Distillery in Baltimore, Maryland by National Distillers. Bottled in bond at 50% Abv in 1950 this era of Mount Vernon was produced during the heyday of post prohibition rye before the brand was discontinued by Jim Beam in 1987.

name: Old Fitzgerald Bottled In Bond Handle 1995 Bottling
description: A big format bottling of Old Fitzgerald bottled in bond at 50% Abv. Bottled in a 1.75 litre handle format this 1995 bottling was produced at the now legendary Stitzel-Weller distillery.
baxus_class_name: Old Fitzgerald Bottled In Bond Handle 1995 Bottling

name: Cabin Still 5 Year Decanter 1970 Bottling
description: A 1970 bottling of Cabin Still, a storied brand produced by Stitzel-Weller. When SW launched their new distillery on derby day 1935 they launched Old Fitzgerald as their flagship brand. Usually aged for 7+ years and bottled in bond, Old Fitz was the premium offering from Stitzel, whilst the Cabin Still brand offered a younger and lower proof offering of wheated bourbon. Cabin Still was commonly marked as the sportsman's choice, a fine bourbon perfect for a flask whilst hunting. This 86 proof decanter was matured for 5 years before being bottled in 1970.

name: Blanton's 1984 Bottling First Release
description: A 1984 bottling of Blanton's single barrel bourbon dumped as part of the very first year of Blanton's release. This single barrel was  stored in warehouse JL on rick number 45 and was bottled from barrel number 482 on 10-4-84. Bottled at the usual 93 proof this is the very first batch of Blanton's single barrels ever bottled.

name: Old Fitzgerald's 1849 8 Year 1974 Bottling
description: A 1974 bottling of Old Fitzgerald's 1849 branded bourbon matured for 8 years and bottled at 90 proof. This will have been produced from their original wheated mashbill and with hand crafted jug yeast.

name: Booker's 25th Anniversary
description: A 2014 special release from Jim Beam in their flagship Booker's bourbon label. This edition celebrates 25 years since the Booker's line was made commercially available. Usually Booker's batches are 6-8 years in age, but for this batch the bourbon was barrelled in 2003 and matured for 10-11 years before bottling. This special anniversary release is bottled at 130.8 proof and is heralded as the best of the anniversary label Booker's editions.

name: Old Forester 8 Year 125th Anniversary
description: A 1995 bottling of Old Forester matured for 8 years and bottled at 125 proof as a celebration of Brown-Forman's 125th anniversary. This bottling available exclusively to employees of Brown-Forman.

name: Old Ezra 15 Year 1980 Bottling
description: A 1980 vintage bottling Old Ezra 15 year old from Ezra Brooks. This era of the brand was produced at the Medley distillery in Owensboro, a few years before it was sold to David Sherman (later Lux Row). Ezra Brooks was originally produced at the Hoffman/Old Commonwealth distillery in Lawrenceburg, with Medley acquiring the brand after Hoffman closed.

name: Michter's 20 Year 2016 Release
description: The 2016 release of Michter's ultra aged 20 year old Kentucky bourbon. This edition was bottled at 57.1% Abv. The source of these barrels has long been rumoured as wheated bourbon produced at the Bernheim distillery in the 1990s under United Distillers ownership. However, no official source has ever been given for the high age statement Michter's products and founder Joe Magliocco worked with KBD (now Willett) in Bardstown to source barrels from right across Kentucky.

name: Michter's Celebration Sour Mash 2016 Release
description: The 2016 release of Michter's ultra premium offering crafted from bourbon and rye whiskies aged up to 30 years of age. The celebration sour mash represents the pinnacle of Michter's well matured sourced stocks. The barrels vatted for this release were distilled in the late 1980s and into the 1990s. Michter's has sourced from all across the US but well matured stocks such as these are a true unicorn.

name: WhistlePig The Boss Hog VI The Samurai Scientist
description: The 6th edition of Whistlepig's boss hog flagship release. This barrel take straight rye whiskey and finishes in Japanese Umeshu/plum wine barrels.
baxus_class_name: WhistlePig The Boss Hog VI The Samurai Scientist

name: Courvoisier V.O.C 1970s Bottling
description: Estimated to be from the late 1970s, this V.O.C Cognac from Courvoisier is noted to be the style of brandy favoured by Napoleon himself. Bottled at 80 proof in a unique decanter.

name: A.H. Hirsch Reserve 1974 15 Year Gold Wax 1st Release
description: A 1974 vintage expression of pot still produced straight bourbon whiskey from the original Michter's distillery in Pennsylvania. Adolph Hirsch commissioned 400 barrels to be filled by Michter's master distiller Dick Stoll. These barrels were left to mature in Pennsylvania until Michter's shut its doors in the 1980s. The stocks were purchased by liquor legend Gordon Hue, who then contracted Julian Van Winkle to bottle the barrels. A number of different versions of this 400 barrel batch were released, some with wax tops and a hand-full exclusive to the Japanese market. The stocks eventually changed hands, resulting in this gold foil topped edition. This is the bourbon heralded by Chuck Cowdery as "The best bourbon you'll never try" in his book. The mythos of the Michter's pot still product has become legend and resulted in this 1974 batch being amongst the most sought after bourbon in Kentucky.
baxus_class_name: A.H. Hirsch Reserve 1974 15 Year Gold Wax 1st Release

name: Glenlivet 16 Year Nadurra Batch 0112R
description: A 16 year old expression of Glenlivet's Naddurra, a natural cask strength expression of single malt. Batch 0112R was bottled in 2012 at 53/5% Abv.

name: Midleton Very Rare 2000
description: The 2000 release of Midleton's Very Rare blended Irish whiskey. This annual edition is a blend of the finest and oldest casks available in the expansive Midleton warehouses. This series has become a huge hit amongst Irish whiskey enthusiasts, with older vintage releases highly sought after to complete their collection.

name: Jack Daniel's Green Label
description: A younger expression of Jack Daniel's signature Tennessee whiskey bottled in a unique green label format.

name: Early Times Mint Julep Cocktail 1 Liter
description: A 1 litre bottling of Early Times branded Mint Julep cocktail bottled at 30% Abv in a 1 liter format.
baxus_class_name: Early Times Mint Julep Cocktail 1 Liter

name: Glenfarclas 21 Year Cask Strength
description:
From the revered Glenfarclas distillery comes this exceptional expression, matured for over two decades to achieve unparalleled depth and complexity.

Bottled at cask strength, this whisky embodies the true essence of Glenfarclas' rich heritage and unwavering dedication to quality. Each sip unveils a symphony of flavors, from luscious caramel and decadent toffee to subtle hints of oak and spice, culminating in a harmonious balance that delights the senses.

As the second batch tailored for the Japanese market, this limited edition release showcases the mastery of Glenfarclas' whisky-making tradition, offering enthusiasts a rare opportunity to savor the best of Speyside craftsmanship. Whether savored neat or with a splash of water, this bottle promises a transcendent tasting experience, where every moment is a celebration of whisky excellence and sophistication.

name: Auchroisk 1974 28 Year Rare Malts
description: The Rare Malt Selection was a historic selection of single malt whiskies from operational and lost distilleries that were released by Diageo between 1995 and 2005. As with the Flora & Fauna series, they were often from lesser-seen single malt distilleries. This is a 1974 vintage expression of Auchroisk matured for 28 years and bottled at 56.8% Abv. Auchroisk is an uncommon distillery to see and the bulk of spirit produced there is used for Diageo's blended whiskies like Johnnie Walker.

name: Glendronach 1992 21 Year Single Butt #188
description: A 1992 vintage single cask expression of Glendronach matured for 21 years in an Oloroso sherry butt. Cask 188 was bottled in 2013 at 59.3% Abv for the US market.

name: Tamnavulin 1968 45 Year Old Single Cask #10279 Douglas Laing
description: A very early vintage expression of Tamnavulin distilled in 1968 and matured for a huge 45 years! Aged in a refill barrel it was bottled in 2014 at 40.1% Abv by Douglas Laing as part of their executive decision label, a series which features their grandest and most impressive casks. Tamnavulin was first opened in 1966 so this 1968 vintage was produced just two short years into the distillery’s life! **Please carefully note the condition of the wax seal in the images.
baxus_class_name: Tamnavulin 1968 45 Year Old Single Cask #10279 Douglas Laing

name: Buzzard's Roost Toasted Barrel Rye
description:
Buzzard's Roost is an innovative whiskey brand founded in 2019 by Jason Brauner and Judy Hollis Jones, both of whom have deep roots in the Kentucky bourbon scene. The brand is based in Louisville and has quickly gained recognition for its unique approach to whiskey production, focusing on small-batch offerings that emphasize quality and distinct flavor profiles.

The company sources its whiskey primarily from the Midwest Grain Products (MGP) distillery, utilizing aged spirits and then subjecting them to secondary maturation in proprietary barrels developed in collaboration with Independent Stave Company. This process involves extensive research into toasting techniques, allowing Buzzard's Roost to create a variety of flavor profiles that enhance the whiskey's complexity. With 17 different proprietary toast profiles, each release showcases a careful balance of sweetness and spice, setting it apart in a crowded market.

Buzzard's Roost has established a strong community presence, with the opening of the Buzzard's Roost Whiskey Row Experience in downtown Louisville, which serves as both a tasting room and an educational space for whiskey enthusiasts. The brand emphasizes its commitment to craftsmanship and innovation while fostering connections within the local community and the broader bourbon industry.

With a growing portfolio that includes various bourbons and ryes, Buzzard's Roost continues to expand its reach, currently distributing its products across 20 states. The brand's dedication to producing high-quality, flavorful whiskies has made it a notable player in the modern American whiskey landscape.

name: Hidden Barn Batch 2
description:
Hidden Barn is an independent whiskey brand established in 2022, founded by whiskey enthusiasts Nate Winegar, Royce Neeley of Neeley Family Distillery, and acclaimed Master Blender Jackie Zykan. The brand focuses on sourcing and blending exceptional casks from various American distilleries, producing small-batch releases that highlight the unique characteristics of each barrel. Hidden Barn emphasizes transparency in its production processes, allowing consumers to appreciate the distinct flavors and profiles of its whiskeys.

The name "Hidden Barn" pays homage to the Prohibition era when distillers concealed their operations in black-painted barns to evade law enforcement. Each release is a collaboration with different distilleries, showcasing a diverse range of flavor profiles that encourage exploration among whiskey drinkers. The brand has quickly gained recognition for its commitment to quality and craftsmanship, with notable releases such as the 7-Year Double Barreled Bourbon, which has received accolades for its rich flavor and complexity.

name: Evan Williams 2013 Single Barrel Bottled 2021
description: Evan Williams Single Barrel Vintage 2013, bottled in 2021, is a distinguished expression from Heaven Hill Distillery that showcases the art of single barrel bourbon production. As the only vintage-dated single barrel bourbon on the market, this release offers a unique tasting experience that captures a specific moment in time. Distilled in 2008 and aged for approximately 8 years before bottling in 2016, this bourbon has developed a complex flavor profile during its maturation in American white oak barrels. Bottled at 86.6 proof (43.3% ABV), it strikes a balance between flavor intensity and approachability. On the nose, this vintage likely presents aromas of caramel, vanilla, and oak, complemented by hints of dried fruits and subtle spices. The palate may offer flavors of honey, toasted nuts, and cinnamon, with undertones of leather and tobacco. The finish is expected to be smooth and lingering, with a pleasant warmth and notes of oak and sweet corn. Each bottle of Evan Williams Single Barrel Vintage is marked with the date it was put into oak, the bottling year, and the exact barrel number, allowing enthusiasts to trace the bourbon's journey from grain to glass. This attention to detail and transparency has made the Evan Williams Single Barrel Vintage series a favorite among bourbon connoisseurs and collectors alike.

name: Ledaig 2004 10 Year Single Butt #900170 Signatory Vintage
description: A 2004 vintage single cask expression of Ledaig, the heavily peated spirit produced at Tobermory distillery. This cask was matured for 10 years in a 1st fill sherry butt and bottled at 61.3% Abv by Signatory Vintage.
baxus_class_name: Ledaig 2004 10 Year Single Butt #900170 Signatory Vintage

name: Stagg Batch 22B
description: A 2022 release of barrel proof bourbon from Buffalo Trace crafted from their #1 low rye mashbill. Batch 22B is bottled at 65% Abv.

name: Knob Creek 2014 9 Year Single Barrel Bourbon For King Of The Lions
description: A 2014 vintage single barrel from Jim Beam as part of their Knob Creek label. Matured for just under 10 years this single barrel was chosen by King Of The Lions and is bottled at 60% Abv.
baxus_class_name: Knob Creek 2014 9 Year Single Barrel Bourbon For King Of The Lions

name: Baker's 7 Year 107 Proof
description:
Baker's Bourbon is a distinguished member of Jim Beam's Small Batch Bourbon Collection, named in honor of Baker Beam, the grandnephew of legendary bourbon maker Jim Beam. Created by Booker Noe as a tribute to Baker's lifelong dedication to the distillery, the brand has a rich family history deeply rooted in Kentucky bourbon-making tradition.

Originally introduced as a small batch bourbon, Baker's underwent a significant transformation in recent years, transitioning to a single barrel format. This change was designed to differentiate the brand within Jim Beam's portfolio and provide whiskey enthusiasts with a more unique drinking experience. Each bottle now represents a singular expression, with variations between individual barrels.

Part of the prestigious Small Batch Collection alongside Booker's, Knob Creek, and Basil Hayden's, Baker's occupies a distinctive position in the lineup. The bourbon is typically aged a minimum of seven years, with some expressions reaching up to 13 years. Distilled at the Jim Beam facility in Clermont, Kentucky, Baker's embodies the classic Beam bourbon profile while offering its own distinctive character.

The brand reflects a commitment to honoring family legacy and bourbon craftsmanship. Each bottle pays homage to the maverick spirit of Baker Beam, who spent 38 years working at the Jim Beam distillery and knew every inch of the facility. This personal connection continues to define Baker's approach to bourbon production, making it more than just a spirit, but a celebration of family and tradition.

name: Laphroaig Cairdeas Port Wood Feis Ile 2013
description: A special edition release from Laphroaig finished in port wood casks and bottled in 2013 exclusively for the Feis Ile Islay festival.
baxus_class_name: Laphroaig Cairdeas Port Wood Feis Ile 2013

name: 2019 Domaine G. Roumier Morey-Saint-Denis 1st Cru - Clos De La Bussière
description: A 2019 vintage expression of Burgundy wine from Domaine Georges Roumier.
baxus_class_name: 2019 Domaine G. Roumier Morey-Saint-Denis 1st Cru - Clos De La Bussière

name: 2020 Domaine Jacques Prieur Puligny-Montrachet Les Combettes Premier Cru
description: A 2020 vintage premier cru Burgundy from Domaine Jacques Prieur.
baxus_class_name: 2020 Domaine Jacques Prieur Puligny-Montrachet Les Combettes Premier Cru

name: Glen Scotia 2000 16 Year Old Single Butt Cadenhead’s
description: A 2000 vintage single cask expression of Campbeltown whisky from the Glen Scotia distillery. Matured for 16 years in a butt it was bottled as part of the Cadenhead’s warehouse tasting experience. This special tasting allows visitors to Cadenhead’s in Campbeltown to taste a variety of hand picked casks and then purchase a favourite. As such they are usually only available to those who make the trip to the bottler’s warehouses.
baxus_class_name: Glen Scotia 2000 16 Year Old Single Butt Cadenhead’s

name: Glenrothes 1997 19 Year Old Single Butt Cadenhead’s
description: A 1997 vintage single cask expression of Speyside whisky from the Glenrothes distillery. Matured for 19 years in a butt it was bottled as part of the Cadenhead’s warehouse tasting experience. This special tasting allows visitors to Cadenhead’s in Campbeltown to taste a variety of hand picked casks and then purchase a favourite. As such they are usually only available to those who make the trip to the bottler’s warehouses.
baxus_class_name: Glenrothes 1997 19 Year Old Single Butt Cadenhead’s

name: Kilchoman Comraich Batch No. 3
description: A small batch expression of Kilchoman crafted from 100% Islay barley this batch included a sherry butt and two bourbon barrels. The spirit was distilled in 2008 & 2010 and then bottled in 2019 at 55.7% Abv.

name: Macallan The Harmony Collection Intense Arabica
description: The Macallan Harmony Collection, created by Whisky Maker Steven Brenner, aims to bring a unique angle to whisky enjoyment in the form of pairing the spirit with coffee. Creating several whiskies with distinct coffee notes was a challenge that resulted in some of the distillery's most singular flavor profiles to date.
baxus_class_name: Macallan The Harmony Collection Intense Arabica

name: Pappy Van Winkle 20 Year Family Reserve 2013 Bottling
description: A 2013 bottling of Pappy Van Winkle 20 year old bourbon. This era of Pappy was crafted from barrels produced at the Stitzel-Weller distillery, the legendary closed distillery that produced Old Fitzgerald. This 2013 era release was bottled at Buffalo Trace after Julian Van Winkle moved his operations to there. Stitzel-Weller stopped producing in 1992 so this 2013 will be the first year of Buffalo Trace distilled liquid.
baxus_class_name: Pappy Van Winkle 20 Year Family Reserve 2013 Bottling

name: Van Winkle 12 Year Special Reserve Lot "B" 2023 Bottling
description: A 12 year old expression of wheated bourbon carefully chosen by Julian Van Winkle, the grandson of the original Pappy Van Winkle. Early Van Winkle offerings were crafted from barrels sourced from the legendary closed Stitzel-Weller distillery, but in 2002 Julian struck a deal with Buffalo Trace to use their wheated bourbon once his stored barrels ran empty. This 2023 bottling will have been crafted from Buffalo Trace's wheated bourbon mashbill and carefully blended by Julian and his son Preston Van Winkle.
baxus_class_name: Van Winkle 12 Year Special Reserve Lot "B" 2023 Bottling

name: Van Winkle 12 Year Special Reserve Lot "B" 2022 Bottling
description: A 12 year old expression of wheated bourbon carefully chosen by Julian Van Winkle, the grandson of the original Pappy Van Winkle. Early Van Winkle offerings were crafted from barrels sourced from the legendary closed Stitzel-Weller distillery, but in 2002 Julian struck a deal with Buffalo Trace to use their wheated bourbon once his stored barrels ran empty. This 2022 bottling will have been crafted from Buffalo Trace's wheated bourbon mashbill and carefully blended by Julian and his son Preston Van Winkle.
baxus_class_name: Van Winkle 12 Year Special Reserve Lot "B" 2022 Bottling

name: Kentucky Owl Rye 11 Year Old Batch 1
description: The first batch of rye whiskey from Kentucky Owl matured for 11 years and bottled at 55.3% Abv. This Kentucky sourced rye whiskey was bottled in 2017. Although the source was never confirmed this highly praised batch is rumoured to come from a mixture of Barton & Old Forester, with the head of Kentucky Owl Dixon Dedman further maturing the rye in bourbon barrels to mellow. In 2018 Kentucky Owl was sold to the large conglomerate Stoli and whilst successive releases have been praised, none compare to the quality provided by batch 1.
baxus_class_name: Kentucky Owl Rye 11 Year Old Batch 1

name: Old Rip Van Winkle 10 Year 2017 Bottling
description:
One of the most recognizable names in bourbon, the legacy of Pappy Van Winkle is both extensive and complex. Originating at the illustrious Stitzel-Weller distillery, the modern iteration of this incredibly hard-to-find whiskey is currently produced at Buffalo Trace in Kentucky. 

The youngest member of the Van Winkle line, the 10 year old is bottled at a higher proof of 107.
baxus_class_name: Old Rip Van Winkle 10 Year 2017 Bottling

name: Stagg Jr. Batch 11
description: A 2018 release of barrel proof bourbon from Buffalo Trace crafted from their #1 low rye mashbill. Batch 11 is bottled at 63.95% Abv.

name: Stagg Batch 24A
description: A barrel proof expression of bourbon from Buffalo Trace crafted from their #1 low rye mashbill. Batch 24A is bottled at 63.8% Abv.

name: Willett 2012 9 Year Rye XCF Stout Barrel Finish
description: A 2012 vintage batch of rye whiskey produced by Willett was matured for 9 years before being finished in stout barrels. Bottled as the second edition in their XCF or exploratory cask finish series it was bottled at 55.3% Abv.
baxus_class_name: Willett 2012 9 Year Rye XCF Stout Barrel Finish

name: Gran Coramino Reposado Tequila
description: A 100% agave tequila from Gran Coramino rested in European oak casks and bottled at 40% Abv.

name: Bowmore ARC-52
description: Bowmore ARC-52 is the story of ground-breaking Aston Martin design bringing to life a striking decanter, unlike anything ever seen before, containing one of our oldest ever Bowmore whiskies.  Never before have we showcased our inspiring partnership through such absolute innovation and collaborative creativity to bring our worlds together so boldly and definitively.  In its physical form, this is an ingenious object; half Bowmore, half Aston Martin, travelling in two directions at the same time, exploring the ideals of balance, capturing perfect stability combined with definitive intensity.  It is this concept of balance which defines every aspect of ARC-52.  Taking the very same approach to achieving balance and optimal form when designing an Aston Martin, this vessel calls on these exacting principles from the latest 3D printing to hand crafted clay modelling in realising its form.   The cutting-edge engineering of Aston Martin combined with the unfaltering attention to detail and craftsmanship of Bowmore has made ARC-52 a reality.  Bringing these two worlds together has not been without challenge and has seen considerable time invested to realise the vision.  From the meticulously engineered, bespoke magnetic key which releases the striking aluminium top almost by magic, whilst maintaining the sleek, clean lines to the individually, hand blown glass, this is design on a different scale.

name: Macallan The Reach
description: The oldest whisky released by The Macallan, this extraordinarily rare single malt whisky celebrates the artisanship that it took to craft it — from 1940 to today.

name: Glenmorangie Astar
description: Glenmorangie Astar is a Highland single malt Scotch whisky, first released in 2008 with a re-release in 2017. The name "Astar," meaning "journey" in Gaelic, reflects the meticulous process behind its creation. This whisky is notable for its unique maturation process, involving casks made from slow-grown oak trees from the Ozark Mountains in Missouri. These trees are air-seasoned for two years, which is significantly longer than the traditional three to six months. The staves are then toasted, rather than heavily charred, and used to age bourbon before being shipped to Scotland. Glenmorangie fills these bespoke casks with their spirit, allowing it to mature for over five years. The Astar is bottled at cask strength and is known for its rich and complex profile, making it a distinctive offering in the Glenmorangie range.

name: Ketel One 325th Anniversary Commemorative Bottle
description: A special anniversary edition of Ketel One Vodka.

name: Willett 7 Year Single Barrel Bourbon #6498
description: A 7 year old expression of bourbon from Willett bottled from a single barrel as part of their purple top family estate series. Barrel 6498 was bottled at 62.9% Abv.

name: Schenley O.F.C 1945 25th Anniversary 1957 Bottling
description: A 1945 vintage expression of Canadian whiskey from Schenley bottled in 1957 to celebrate their 25th anniversary.

name: Beam 100 Months Old Civil War Centennial Decanter 1961 Bottling
description:
*Please note the tax stamp for this lot. It has broken away over the decanter top but is still across the cork seal. Please inspect images carefully.

A 1961 bottling of 100 month old Beam bourbon bottled in a ceramic decanter to celebrate the centennial of the civil war.
baxus_class_name: Beam 100 Months Old Civil War Centennial Decanter 1961 Bottling

name: Corazón Reposado Elmer T Lee Single Barrel #005 Tequila
description: Produced at Casa San Matías, this anejo tequila was matured for 12 months in casks that previously held Elmer T Lee bourbon. Corazon is crafted from 100% Blue Weber agave and is then bottled as a single barrel.
baxus_class_name: Corazón Reposado Elmer T Lee Single Barrel #005 Tequila

name: Old Forester 1956 Bottled In Bond 1961
description: A 1956 bottled in bond expression of Old Forester bourbon produced by Brown-Forman. This release was bottled in 1961 in a unique decanter.

name: Old Fitzgerald Prime 1988 Bottling Handle
description: A large format bottling of Old Fitzgerald prime bourbon produced by Stitzel-Weller distillery and bottled in 1988.

name: Compass Box This Is Not A Festival Whisky
description: A blended Scotch whisky from Compass Box crafted from the following distilleries:  Caol Ila, Highland Park, Clynelish, Glen Elgin, North British, Cameronbridge. These components were matured in 1st fill and refill American oak barrels and hogsheads. This batch was bottled for French retailer La Maison Du Whisky.
baxus_class_name: Compass Box This Is Not A Festival Whisky

name: Longrow 2007 9 Year Single Cask For Pacific Edge
description: A 2007 vintage single cask expression of Longrow, the most heavily peated spirit produced at Springbank in Campbeltown. This cask was matured for 9 years in a 1st fill Sauternes sweet wine cask. It was bottled at 58% Abv in 2017 exclusively for Pacific Edge Spirits and the wider US market.
baxus_class_name: Longrow 2007 9 Year Single Cask For Pacific Edge

name: Compass Box Canvas
description: A well presented expression from blender Compass Box crafted from malt whiskies. This recipe includes 43.4% Tomatin from refill bourbon casks, 24.2% Glenburgie from 1st fill bourbon casks, 15.4% Glen Elgin from recharred American oak hogsheads, 10.9% Tomatin from orange wine casks and then just 6.1% Imperial matured in 1st fill bourbon barrels. This blend was vatted together and then bottled at 46% Abv.

name: Bain's 18 Year Oloroso Cask Finish
description: An 18 year old expression of single grain whisky from the James Sedgewick distillery in South Africa. This special release was finished in Oloroso sherry casks and bottled at 50.5% Abv in a 1 litre format.

name: Bain's 18 Year PX Cask Finish
description: An 18 year old expression of single grain whisky from the James Sedgewick distillery in South Africa. This special release was finished in PX sherry casks and bottled at 50.5% Abv in a 1 litre format.

name: Courvoisier VS Early 1980s Bottling
description: A 1983-1985 era bottling of Courvoisier's Very Special (V.S) Cognac. This full size bottling was imported to the US and bottled at 80 proof.

name: Weller Full Proof Single Barrel Select "Mamba"
description: A single barrel store pick offering of Buffalo Trace's Weller full proof. Bottled at 57% Abv this single barrel was customised by the barrel picker with a tribute to Kobe Bryant featuring his image and a Lakers coloured Black Mamba on the back label.
baxus_class_name: Weller Full Proof Single Barrel Select "Mamba"

name: Macallan 1971 27 Year Single Butt #121096128 Signatory Vintage
description: A 1971 vintage single cask expression of Macallan matured for 27 years in a sherry butt. Bottled in 1999 at 54.2% Abv by signatory Vintage in their classic dumpy series.
baxus_class_name: Macallan 1971 27 Year Single Butt #121096128 Signatory Vintage

name: Kweichow Moutai
description: The brand Kweichow Moutai was officially named as the 'National Liquour of China' in 1949 by Zhou Enlai, the first Premier of the People's Republic of China. Since then, Moutai has played a significant role in the history of China's diplomacy. Moutai is distilled spirit from only 3 ingredients: sorghum, wheat and water from the pristine Chishui river. Moutai's complex taste and aroma is highly attributed to the unique production process and ingredients which are harvested according to the Lunar calender. Moutai is the most well-known brand of Baijiu in the world. It is considered a luxury item within Chinese culture, with a long and rich history. The liquour is named after the town of Moutai in China where it is exclusively produced (Guizhou province). Much like Champagne or Cognac, Moutai, the spirit, can only be given that name if it is produced in the town of Moutai.

name: Dewar's White Label Mid 1970s Bottling
description: A circa mid to late 1970s bottling of Dewar's white label imported to the US by Schenley. This label features both imperial and metric units but a tax stamp from prior to 1977, suggesting this bottle likely ranges from 1975-1977. Dewar's is a hugely popular blended Scotch whisky crafted around a core of Aberfeldy malt whisky and other Distillers Company Limited (now Diageo) malt & grains.

name: Elijah Craig Single Barrel For Parlour & Portage House
description: A single barrel expression of Elijah Craig bourbon, this barrel was chosen by Parlour & Portage House and is bottled at 94 proof.
baxus_class_name: Elijah Craig Single Barrel For Parlour & Portage House

name: Penelope 10 Year Single Barrel Bourbon
description: A 2013 vintage single barrel from Penelope matured for 10 years and bottled at 98 proof. Crafted from a mashbill of 75% corn, 21% Rye and 4% malted barley it was distilled in Indiana and bottled by Penelope.

name: 78 Legends 5 Year & 50 Year Blend Signed Bottle
description: A wild blend of 5 year old bourbon and 50 year old bourbon!! 78 Legends comprises bourbon from long lost barrels held by the Thompson Family, the bottlers of the crazy 50 year old bourbon as well as a younger 5 year old inclusion. This bottling celebrates the players and coaches of the 1978 NCAA basketball national championship team.
baxus_class_name: 78 Legends 5 Year & 50 Year Blend Signed Bottle

name: Garnier Liqueur Trio 1970s Bottlings
description: A trio of Garnier produced liqueurs including a creme de menthe, liqueur d'or and blackberry liqueur. The Creme De Menthe is bottled at 60 proof, Liqueur d'Or at 86 proof and the blackberry liqueur at 60 proof.

name: Old Bardstown Black Label 2009 Bottling
description: An older bottling of Old Bardstown branded bourbon bottled by Willett in Bardstown. This era of the label was likely crafted from sourced bourbon and before Willett transitioned the brand to a white label bottling.

name: Glen Grant 1948 72 Year Old Single American Oak Sherry Cask #440 Gordon & Macphail
description: Distilled just after the second world war, this 1948 vintage single cask expression of Glen Grant was matured for a huge 72 years. A mythical age statement, whisky of this age is nigh impossible to produce and only the masters at Gordon & Macphail are able to achieve such a feat. Matured in a rare American oak ex-sherry cask it was bottled in 2020 at an incredible strength of 52.5% Abv. Presented in a Dartington Crystal decanter, just 290 bottles were produced in a signature American black walnut wooden box.
baxus_class_name: Glen Grant 1948 72 Year Old Single American Oak Sherry Cask #440 Gordon & Macphail

name: Old Forester 1980 Bottling
description: A Japanese export expression of Old Forester bottled in 1980 at 86 proof.

name: Bacardi Carta Blanca Superior 1940s Bottling Liter
description: A circa 1940s bottling of Bacardi Carta Blanca Superior distilled by the Bacardi family at their Santiago de Cuba distilleries. The brand was founded in 1862 by Facundo Bacardi Masso, a Catalonian merchant who opened two distilleries to create both a light and heavy style of rum. His blended rum was a huge hit and allowed Facundo to purchase more and more distilleries, expanding further into Mexico and Puerto Rico. The Bacardi family held the firm until the company was seized by Fidel Castro in 1959 amid the Cuban Revolution. As the nation began nationalising industry, Bacardi moved its headquarters and continued production in Puerto Rico, Brazil, Spain, Canada and Mexico. This was bottled in Spain under the supervision of the Bacardi family who opened bottling facilities there in 1910. The tax stamp affixed to this bottle suggests this is likely a liter sized bottling, whilst BAXUS cannot be 100% certain of this the physical size of the bottle indicates this to be accurate.
baxus_class_name: Bacardi Carta Blanca Superior 1940s Bottling Liter

name: Bacardi Carta Blanca Superior 1960s Bottling
description: A 1960s era vintage of Bacardi Carta Blanca Superior distilled at their Santiago de Cuba distilleries. The brand was founded in 1862 by Facundo Bacardi Masso, a Catalonian merchant who opened two distilleries to create both a light and heavy style of rum. His blended rum was a huge hit and allowed Facundo to purchase more and more distilleries, expanding further into Mexico and Puerto Rico. The Bacardi family held the firm until the company was seized by Fidel Castro in 1959 amid the Cuban Revolution. As the nation began nationalising industry, Bacardi moved its headquarters and continued production in Puerto Rico, Brazil, Spain, Canada and Mexico.

name: Ron Antich 1904 Reserva 1930s-1940s Bottling
description: A circa 1930s-1940s era bottling of Jamaican rum produced under the Ron Antich branding. Reserva 1904 suggests this may have been produced in the year 1904 but with vintage bottles such as this we cannot be certain. Please note no size or Abv is noted but expect this to be roughly 700-750ml in size, strength could be 40% to a high overproof strength.

name: Johnnie Walker Red Label 1970s Bottling Half Size
description: A circa 1970s bottling of Johnnie Walker Red Label blended Scotch whisky. This half size bottling is released at 70 imperial proof/40% Abv.
baxus_class_name: Johnnie Walker Red Label 1970s Bottling Half Size

name: Ron Barcelo Imperial Premium Blend 30th Anniversary
description: A 30th anniversary expression of Ron Barcelo Dominican rum crafted from matured reserves.
baxus_class_name: Ron Barcelo Imperial Premium Blend 30th Anniversary

name: Hennessy XO Baccarat Decanter
description: A crystal decanter presented expression of Hennessy's XO Cognac offering.

name: Glenrothes 2013 5 Year Single Puncheon Douglas Laing
description: A 2013 vintage single cask expression of Glenrothes matured for 5 years in a sherry puncheon. It was bottled in 2018 at 46% Abv by Douglas Laing as part of their Provenance label.
baxus_class_name: Glenrothes 2013 5 Year Single Puncheon Douglas Laing

name: Chartreuse Green 1980s Bottling L.Garnier
description:
A circa 1980s bottling of green label Chartreuse. Older expressions of Chartreuse are highly sought after as the liqueur actively eats sugar, mellowing over time and creating an exceptionally rich and decadent spirit. Chartreuse has been made by French monks for close to two centuries now, with the recipe a close guarded secret. The monks have been forced into exile at various times in the past, moving production to Spain at one point.

Note no strength is noted on the label but this is likely bottled at the usual 55% Abv for green label. The liquid beads as a high strength liqueur should.

name: Old Overholt 1935 Bottled In Bond 1943
description: An original Old Overholt rye whiskey produced in 1936 at Large distillery in Pennsylvania to supply Old Overholt. This 1936 distilled rye whiskey was matured for 7-8 years and bottled in bond in 1943 at 100 proof.

name: Ron Caspi 25 Year
description: A 25 year old expression of Cuban made rum bottled at 43.7% Abv. Note that no size is given but we estimate this to be a 700-750ml sized bottle.

name: Old Havana Brand Rum 1960s Bottling
description: A 1960s era bottling of Old Havana Brand rum produced in Cuba and bottled at 90 proof.

name: Leroux Figaro Rum 1950s Bottling
description: A 1950s era bottling of Leroux blended rum bottled at 84 proof.

name: Jameson 7 Year 1960s Bottling
description: A 7 year old expression of Jameson bottled in the 1960s. This era of production was crafted from malted barley, wheat and oat grains and the 7 year age statement was discontinued in 1968 in favour of the now popular Jameson red seal. Although no Abv or size are given for this bottle it is approximately 700-750ml in size. This era of the Jameson blend was produced at their Bow Street distillery which closed in 1975, with production moving to their Midleton distillery instead.

name: A. Tonelli Chartreuse Circa 1950s Bottling
description: This bottle is a considerable enigma and minimal reference material exists to further back date this bottle than the 1950s. Produced by A.Tonelli in Italy this appears not to be the brand of Chartreuse product of the French monks but instead an imitation. No size or Abv is stated but we expect this to be similar to the Martini branded bottle and therefore roughly 700-1000ml in size and 30% approximate strength.

name: Hennessy Bras Arme 1970s Bottling
description: A 1970s era bottling of Hennessy's Bras Arme Cognac. Note this bottle has no size stated but expect this is approximately a 700-750ml bottle at 40-43% Abv.

name: Hennessy Three Star 1960s Bottling
description: A 1960s era bottling of Hennessy Cognac matured for at least two years. Note no size or Abv is stated but expect this to be a 700-750ml and 40-43% Abv bottling. Three stars declared means the Cognac is a minimum of 2 years old but 15-20 year old Cognacs are routinely included in these blends.

name: Red Hackle Blended Scotch Whisky 1960s Bottling
baxus_class_name: Red Hackle Blended Scotch Whisky 1960s Bottling

name: Limestone Whisky 1912 Bottled In Bond 1923
description: A 1912 vintage pint sized bottling of Limestone branded whisky produced at the original J.H. Rogers distillery in Maysville Kentucky. Bottled in bond during prohibition in 1923 at 50% Abv. The J.H. Rogers distillery was named after the titular James H. Roger who acquired the Mayville located distillery from T. W. Wheatley in 1879. Throughout his tenure as owner of Rogers distillery he expanded the site and produced Belle Of Maysville, Old Time whiskey and Limestone whisky would became his main brand. He would pass away in 1890 and his wife Lida would become the distillery's owner, whereby she persuaded her brother Frank H. Clarke to operate the site. When Lida died in 1911 the distillery passed to her son John Clarke Rogers. He fought valiantly to maintain independence with firms like the Whiskey Trust circling, pressuring small distilleries to join their monopoly or to sell their whiskey exclusively to the trust. Rogers held out but prohibition eventually came looming in 1920 and shuttered the Maysville site.

name: Old Forester 1916 18 Year Bottled In Bond
description: A 1916 vintage expression of Old Forester branded whiskey produced at the Mayfield distillery. This bottled in bond pint was matured for 18 summers and bottled in 1933. Mayfield distillery RD #229 was founded in the 1870s and sat alongside the Atherton RD #87 and Carter distillery RD #377 in LaRue County. Mayfield was acquired by the notorious Whiskey Trust in 1899 and produced bourbon until prohibition hit in 1919. The barrels from this distillery were sold under the doing business name as Boldrick and Callaghan as is shown on the tax stamp of the bottle.
baxus_class_name: Old Forester 1916 18 Year Bottled In Bond

name: Scott Blue Royal Club 1930s Bottling
description: A circa 1930s era bottling of blended Scotch whisky produced by Scott Blue under their Royal Club brand. Note that no size or Abv is given for this bottle but we expect it to be approximately 700-750ml and 40-43% Abv.

name: James Martin's 20 Year Fine & Rare 1970s Bottling
description: A 1970s era bottling of James Martin's 20 year old blended Scotch whisky bottled at 43% Abv. This blend was historically crafted with mature Highland malt whisky from Glenmorangie.
baxus_class_name: James Martin's 20 Year Fine & Rare 1970s Bottling

name: A. Epelstein Vieux Cognac 1940s Bottling
description: A circa 1940s bottling of Cognac from A. Epelstein with a handwritten note on the rear noting it was purchased from London merchants Berry Bros & Rudd in 1947. This circa 2nd world war Cognac has no size or Abv but we expect this to be roughly 700-750ml in size and 40-43% Abv in strength.

name: Queen Victoria Blended Scotch Whisky Liqueur 1950s Bottling
description: A 1950s era bottling of Queen Victoria Scotch Whisky liqueur produced by Nicholson & Sons and imported to the US.
baxus_class_name: Queen Victoria Blended Scotch Whisky Liqueur 1950s Bottling

name: Silver Wedding 1916 Bottled In Bond 1932
description: A 1916 vintage expression of Silver Wedding whiskey produced by Schenley using spirit from the Fleischman & Co. Distillery in Ohio. Bottled in bond in 1932 at 50% Abv the brand was a sister release to the popular Golden Wedding rye produced by Joseph. S. Finch in Pittsburgh. A few different releases of Silver Wedding were produced during prohibition, including late 1920s bottlings containing Midway Distilling whiskey bottled by George T. Stagg. When Schenley acquired the Stagg distillery brands such as this came along too. The Fleischman distillery in Ohio was known for its Magnolia branded rye whiskey. The Fleischman firm was one of few to be revived post prohibition. They merged with Royal Baking Powder Company, E. W. Gillett, Widlar Food Products Company, and Chase & Sanborn Coffee Company to create the new firm "Standard Brands". This new conglomerate acquired the Davies County/Medley distillery in 1940 from Thomas Medley. The firm would acquire brands like Ezra Brooks and bottle it using Medley produced spirit. Fleischman had ultimately been dissolved into the wider Standard Brands portfolio and in 1980 they sold their distilling interests to Glenmore as the larger firm merged with Nabisco in 1981.

name: Pappy Van Winkle 15 Year Family Reserve 2012 Bottling
description: A 15 year old expression of wheated bourbon carefully chosen by Julian Van Winkle, the grandson of the original Pappy Van Winkle. Early Van Winkle offerings were crafted from barrels sourced from the legendary closed Stitzel-Weller distillery, but in 2002 Julian struck a deal with Buffalo Trace to use their wheated bourbon once his stored barrels ran empty. This 2012 bottling will have been crafted from Buffalo Trace's wheated bourbon mashbill and carefully blended by Julian Van Winkle.
baxus_class_name: Pappy Van Winkle 15 Year Family Reserve 2012 Bottling

name: Old Bridgeport Rye 1916 Bottled In Bond 1924
description: A 1916 vintage Monogahela rye whiskey produced by the Hamburger distillery in Pennsylvania. Founded by Phillip H. Hamburger, a Jewish born German man who emigrated to the United States when he was 17. He founded his own wholesale liquor firm in 1871. In 1883 Hamburger acquired a distillery in Bridgeport from George W. Jones, he changed the name of this site to the Hamburger Distillery Co., Ltd in 1890. He produced Monogahela rye, a style of rye from that region in Pennsylvania, and bottled it under his Old Bridgeport label. Prohibition eventually shut the facility down in 1920 and Hamburger himself would pass away just one year later.
baxus_class_name: Old Bridgeport Rye 1916 Bottled In Bond 1924

name: Seagram's Pedigree 1929 8 Year Rye
description: A 1929 expression of rye whiskey produced by Seagram's at their Waterloo distillery in Ontario, Canada. Matured for 8 years this expression was bottled at 100 proof in a stunning book shaped bottle style.

name: Domaine Aux Ducs 1939 Darroze 1987 Bottling
description: A 1939 vintage expression of Bas-Armagnac produced by Domain Aux Ducs and bottled in 1987 by agent Franics Darroze.

name: Cuvée Extraordinaire 1974 13 Year Cognac B.Robertin
description: A 1974 vintage expression of Cognac matured for 13 years and bottled from B. Robertin's reserves.

name: Bonnie Charlie Blended Scotch Whisky 1950s Bottling
description: A 1950s era bottling of blended Scotch whisky under the Bonnie Charles brand. Curiously this blend was bottled at 100 proof when most Scotch whiskies of this era were bottled around 80-86 proof.
baxus_class_name: Bonnie Charlie Blended Scotch Whisky 1950s Bottling

name: Johnnie Walker Red Label 1950s Bottling
description: A 1960s era cork sealed bottling of Johnnie Walker Black Label. This era of the blend contained many unique distilleries that have since closed including Port Ellen and Coleburn.

name: L. Martini Chartreuse Circa 1950s Bottling
description: This bottle is a considerable enigma and minimal reference material exists to further back date this bottle than the 1950s. Produced by L. Martini this appears not to be the brand of Chartreuse product of the French monks but instead an imitation which is bottled at 40% Abv in a 1 liter format.

name: Martinazzi Chartreuse-Cognac 1950s Bottling
description: A circa 1950s era bottling of Chartreuse Cognac from E.Martinazzi & Co. The connection to the real Chartreuse liquor is unclear as little history is available on Martinazzi & co but this is estimated to be a cognac base spirit flavoured with herbs and flowers much like the monk produced Chartreuse.

name: Baron De Sigognac 1956 Vaghi Bas Armagnac 1987 Bottling
description: A 1956 vintage expression of Armagnac sourced from Baron De Sigognac bottled by Vaghi in 1987.
baxus_class_name: Baron De Sigognac 1956 Vaghi Bas Armagnac 1987 Bottling

name: Smirnoff De Czar No. 63 Replica Bottle
description: A special edition bottle from Smirnoff Vodka featuring a replica of a bottle produce prior to the Russian revolution.
baxus_class_name: Smirnoff De Czar No. 63 Replica Bottle

name: Speyside 10 Year For Speyside Cooperage
description: A secret Speyside whisky matured for 10 years and bottled at 40% Abv exclusively for Speyside Cooperage.

name: Martell Very Old Pale Cognac 1960s Bottling
description: A 1960s era bottling of three star very old pale Cognac from Martell.
baxus_class_name: Martell Very Old Pale Cognac 1960s Bottling

name: Yamazaki 18 Year Mizunara Cask Suntory 100th Anniversary
description: Released in 2023 to celebrate the 100th anniversary since Suntory started making whisky, this 18 year old expression from Yamazaki was exclusively matured in native Japanese mizunara oak casks. Bottled at 48% Abv and presented in a black box.
baxus_class_name: Yamazaki 18 Year Mizunara Cask Suntory 100th Anniversary

name: Old Forester Rye Barrel Strength Single Barrel
description: A single barrel expression of rye whiskey from Brown-Forman's Old Forester distillery bottled at barrel strength.
baxus_class_name: Old Forester Rye Barrel Strength Single Barrel

name: Lang's Extra Special Old Scotch Whisky 1960s Bottling
description: A 1960s era bottling of Lang's blended Scotch whisky. Note that no size or strength is given but expect this to be a 700-750ml bottle at 40-43% Abv.
baxus_class_name: Lang's Extra Special Old Scotch Whisky 1960s Bottling

name: Normandin Mercier XO Grande Champagne Cognac
description: A carefully blended XO Cognac from Normandin Mercier located in La Rochelle, France.
baxus_class_name: Normandin Mercier XO Grande Champagne Cognac

name: Old Fitzgerald 1849 8 Year 1990 Bottling
description: A 1990 bottling of Old Fitzgerald's 1849 brand bourbon matured for 8 year and bottled at 90 proof.

name: Booker's The Reserves 2024
description: A 2024 special release from Jim Beam in their barrel proof Booker's label. This expansion of the label is Freddie Noe's opportunity to blend mature casks of Beam bourbon from right across their rickhouses, resulting in this release featuring 8, 9, 10, and 14 year bourbon. Bottled at a barrel proof of 62.95% Abv.

name: Secret Speyside Macallan 1999 20 Year For Finest Whisky Berlin Sansibar
description: A 1999 vintage expression of a secret Speyside whisky confirmed to be sourced from the Macallan distillery. Matured for 20 years in a sherry cask it was bottled at 44.4% Abv for Finest Whisky Berlin by German independent bottler Sansibar. The label features a painting of the Macallan’s signature Easter Elchies house.
baxus_class_name: Secret Speyside Macallan 1999 20 Year For Finest Whisky Berlin Sansibar

name: Heaven Hill 6 Year Bottled in Bond
description:
Heaven Hill Old Style Bourbon is a historic brand that reflects the legacy of Heaven Hill Distilleries, which was founded in 1935 in Bardstown, Kentucky. Shortly after its establishment, Heaven Hill introduced its first bourbon, marking the beginning of a long tradition of quality bourbon production.

As a family-owned distillery, Heaven Hill has maintained its independence throughout its history, allowing it to preserve traditional bourbon-making methods while also embracing innovation. This dedication to craftsmanship is evident in their extensive portfolio, which includes numerous well-known bourbon brands.

Heaven Hill remains a significant player in the bourbon industry, known for its commitment to quality and tradition. Old Style Bourbon exemplifies this balance between heritage and modern production techniques, continuing the distillery's legacy as a respected producer of fine American whiskey.
baxus_class_name: Heaven Hill 6 Year Bottled in Bond

name: Blanton's Straight From The Barrel 2020 Bottling
description: Not only one of the world’s best bourbons, Blanton’s Straight from the Barrel is one of the world’s best whiskeys. Created for connoisseurs familiar with cask strength whiskeys, this enormous taste profile reaches depths of flavor found only in the rarest of spirits. On the nose we get notes of dark chocolate, caramel and butter with earthy undertones of walnut and hazelnut.  The palate delivers intrepid notes of warm vanilla, oak, toasted nuts and a rich spiciness with hints of butterscotch or honey.  The high alcohol by volume is intense and powerful yet inviting. The deep and resonate finish on this bourbon is nothing short of legendary. Straight from the barrel is best served neat or with a splash of water. Un-filtered, un-cut, unbelievable.
baxus_class_name: Blanton's Straight From The Barrel 2020 Bottling

name: Heaven Hill 17 Year Heritage Collection 2022 Release
description: A special 2022 edition release from Heaven Hill in their heritage collection series. This edition features a 17 year old expression of bourbon bottled at 59.1% Abv and crafted from a mashbill of 78% corn, 10% rye and 12% malted barley. This blend actually comprised barrels matured much older than 17 years, with the blend made of 28% 20yo bourbon, 44% 19yo bourbon and just 28% is the 17 year old bourbon.
baxus_class_name: Heaven Hill 17 Year Heritage Collection 2022 Release

name: Old Ezra 7 Year Rye
description:
Old Ezra 7 Year Straight Rye is a notable expression from Lux Row Distillers, reflecting the distillery's commitment to producing high-quality, flavorful rye whiskey. Launched as part of the Old Ezra brand, this straight rye whiskey is crafted using a blend of two distinct mash bills: one with a 51% rye content and another featuring an impressive 95% rye. This combination allows for a rich and complex flavor profile that appeals to both rye enthusiasts and newcomers alike.

The whiskey is aged for seven years in charred American oak barrels, which contributes to its depth and character. Old Ezra 7 Year Straight Rye is bottled at a robust proof, ensuring that the bold flavors are fully expressed. The brand has garnered attention for its quality and has received accolades, including gold medals at various spirits competitions.

For collectors, Old Ezra represents a blend of tradition and modern craftsmanship, making it a valuable addition to any whiskey collection. The brand's emphasis on quality and the unique characteristics of its rye whiskey make it a standout choice in the competitive landscape of American spirits. As interest in craft distilling continues to grow, Old Ezra 7 Year Straight Rye stands as a testament to the enduring appeal of well-aged rye whiskey.

name: Lark Rum & PX Sherry FInish
description:
Inspired by one of the greatest flavour pairings of all time, Rum and Raisin, this unique single malt will have you daydreaming of shipwrecks on remote sun-swept islands in no time.

Casks of ex-Bourbon, ex-Sherry and White Oak were chosen from our Bothwell Distillery to form a bright and luscious fruit-filled base, which was finished in equal parts ex-Seppeltsfield PX Sherry and ex-Lark Quiet Cannon Rum casks. This duo of cask favourites sees surprising notes of dried papaya and Quiet Cannon rum collide with deep forest fruits, cherries, and plum pudding before finally giving way to an incredibly fresh and complex finish. Our Limited Release Rum & PX Sherry is a classic reimagined.

The bulk of the marriage is made up of bright and juicy ex-bourbon cask matured Whisky with a smattering of ex-Sherry and White Oak casks which serve to fuse this bright spark of a marriage with the heavy, sweet notes of the Rum and PX Sherry.

The Whisky was initially matured for between 5.5 and 7 years in 100 and 200L casks, then finished in ex-Seppeltfield PX Sherry and ex-Lark Quiet Cannon Rum casks for 3 months.

name: A Midwinter Night's Dram Act 6 Scene 6
description: A 2018 edition of High West's highly praised Midwinter Night's Dram. This release is a blend of rye whiskies finished in port barrels. Older editions of this blend contain larger amounts of Barton and MGP distilled rye whiskies, with newer releases containing rye whiskey produced by High West.
baxus_class_name: A Midwinter Night's Dram Act 6 Scene 6

name: Ron Arecha Extra 1960s Bottling
description: A 1960s bottling of Ron Arecha Extra rum produced by Jose Arechabala, the producer behind the Havana Club brand of Cuban rum.

name: Jack Daniel’s Twice Barreled American Single Malt Special Release 2022
description: A 2022 special edition from Jack Daniel's crafted from a malt mashbill aged in American oak barrels before being finished in Oloroso sherry casks.
baxus_class_name: Jack Daniel’s Twice Barreled American Single Malt Special Release 2022

name: Jack Daniel’s Twice Barreled American Single Malt Special Release 2022
description: A 2022 special edition from Jack Daniel's crafted from a malt mashbill aged in American oak barrels before being finished in Oloroso sherry casks.
baxus_class_name: Jack Daniel’s Twice Barreled American Single Malt Special Release 2022

name: Johnnie Walker Black Label 1960s Bottling
description: A 1960s era cork sealed bottling of Johnnie Walker Black Label. This era of the blend contained many unique distilleries that have since closed including Port Ellen and Coleburn.

name: Midleton Very Rare Barry Crockett Legacy
description:
Midleton Very Rare Barry Crockett Legacy is an exceptional Irish whiskey that pays homage to the legendary master distiller Barry Crockett, who retired in 2013 after an illustrious 47-year career at the Midleton Distillery. This single pot still whiskey represents the pinnacle of Irish whiskey craftsmanship and is highly regarded as one of the best in Midleton's range.

The whiskey is crafted using a blend of pot still spirits from light, medium, and heavy styles, showcasing the versatility and complexity of the single pot still category. It is primarily matured in first-fill bourbon casks, with a small portion aged in virgin American oak barrels, imparting a unique flavor profile.

On the nose, it offers soft and delicate aromas of acacia honey, white flowers, and baked bread, complemented by subtle notes of caramel toffee. The palate is remarkably complex, presenting a harmonious blend of citrus fruits, mixed peel, toffee, cocoa, honey, and Belgian waffles. There are also intriguing hints of engine oil and marshmallow, creating a truly multifaceted tasting experience.

When reduced with water, the whiskey reveals even more delicate aromas and additional fruity notes. The palate becomes softer and more polished, with new flavors of boiled sweets, pear drops, kiwi fruit, and melon emerging.

Bottled at 46% ABV, this non-chill filtered whiskey offers a smooth, light, and soft finish that lingers pleasantly. The Barry Crockett Legacy has garnered numerous accolades, including Gold Medals at the Irish Whiskey Awards and Master awards at the Irish Whiskey Masters.

This limited edition release exemplifies the art of Irish whiskey-making and serves as a fitting tribute to Barry Crockett's enduring legacy in the world of fine spirits.
baxus_class_name: Midleton Very Rare Barry Crockett Legacy

name: Macallan Edition No. 5
description: From the distiller: "The Macallan Edition No. 5 is our very own homage to the diversity and complexity of natural colour. Inspired by a coming together of whisky making mastery and colour expertise and insight, this single malt celebrates both The Macallan’s commitment to natural colour and the intricate whisky making process.100% natural in colour, all of our exceptional whiskies from The Macallan are shaped from time spent in the very best casks; maturing, nurturing and developing character. World renowned colour masters at the Pantone Color Institute created a uniquely bold shade of purple; reflecting an enigmatic, multi-faceted and intricate combination of red and blue."

name: Macallan Edition No. 3
description: Inspiration and innovation lie at the heart of The Macallan and nowhere is this more evident than in The Edition Series. Edition No. 3 brings to life the flavour experience of The Macallan through aroma, calling on Master Perfumer Roja Dove's remarkable sensory knowledge and expert sense of smell to create the third unique expression in the series. Borne of two art forms, Edition No. 3 unites the worlds of whisky and aroma to reveal the complexities of single malt character and the power of the senses in creating and experiencing The Macallan. When we experience and enjoy whisky, the power of aroma is unquestionable - and it is this power that makes the approach to Edition No. 3 truly mesmerizing.

name: Macallan Edition No. 4
description: From the distiller: "The fourth release in this innovative annual Series, Edition No.4 embodies the craftsmanship and pioneering design of the new Macallan Distillery and demonstrates the mastery of whisky making since 1824. As we enter an exciting new era, this limited edition marks the coming together of our history and new horizons in the creation of two structural masterpieces: a remarkable whisky and a magnificent new distillery."

name: Jefferson's Presidential Select 30 Year Batch 1
description: An absolutely huge age stated expression of bourbon from Jefferson's bottled as part of their esteemed Presidential Select series. Batch 1 of this three decade old whiskey was bottled at 90.4 proof. Whilst the source was never declared rumours are abound in the wider whiskey community, many suggest Stitzel-Weller as Jefferson's frequently sourced their bourbon from the closed distillery in the early 2000's. As many distilleries were closing in the late 80's and early 90's Jefferson was able to acquire well matured stocks from all across the US, so the true source of this 30 year old spirit will always remain a mystery.

name: Midleton Very Rare 2018 Release
description:
The Midleton Very Rare Vintage Release 2018 is a highly esteemed expression in the prestigious Midleton Very Rare series, which has been released annually since 1984. This particular vintage showcases the exceptional craftsmanship and expertise of Midleton's master distillers.

The 2018 release was carefully crafted by Master Distiller Brian Nation, who selected a blend of rare and hand-picked single pot still and single grain Irish whiskeys. These whiskeys were matured in lightly charred ex-bourbon American oak barrels for between 12 and 28 years, creating a complex and beautifully balanced spirit.

name: Remy Martin Louis XIII Jeroboam 3 Liter
description:
A jewel of the LOUIS XIII Iconic Collection, the Jeroboam is a 3-liter crystal decanter filled with the house’s most revered blend - a symphony of up to 1,200 eaux-de-vie, all sourced from Grande Champagne and aged between 40 and 100 years. This storied cognac is renowned for its depth, complexity, and opulence, offering notes of honeyed dried fruits, leather, and fig with a long floral finish.

Hand-blown and individually numbered, each decanter is crafted by 11 master artisans at Vista Alegre - only 200 are released worldwide each year and only 30 in 2025 for America. Housed in a custom European oak case, the Jeroboam includes bespoke service accessories: a crystal stopper, LOUIS XIII Spear pipette, four Pillet tasting glasses, and a display podium.
An heirloom in every sense, the Louis XIII Jeroboam is designed to be shared and passed down - an enduring celebration of time, craftsmanship, and legacy.
baxus_class_name: Remy Martin Louis XIII Jeroboam 3 Liter

name: Michter's Shenk's 2021 Release
description:
Shenk's Homestead is a premium whiskey brand produced by Michter's Distillery, honoring the legacy of John Shenk, who founded a distillery in 1753 that would eventually become Michter's. This Kentucky Sour Mash Whiskey is known for its innovative approach to production and aging techniques.

The 2024 release of Shenk's Homestead features a substantial amount of rye in its composition, including rye whiskey aged in French oak barrels from the Vosges region. These barrels are naturally air-dried and seasoned for 24 months before being toasted to specific requirements. The blend also incorporates whiskies made with malted rye and caramel malt, aiming to introduce creamy textures and enhanced spice flavors.

Bottled at 91.2 proof (45.6% ABV), Shenk's Homestead is released annually as a limited edition. Each year's expression often showcases different maturation techniques or barrel finishes, making it a subject of interest for whiskey enthusiasts. The 2024 version is noted for its complex flavor profile, featuring notes of allspice, cloves, white pepper, along with fruity elements like pears, apricot, and orange.

Shenk's Homestead represents Michter's commitment to crafting unique, high-quality whiskeys that balance traditional methods with innovative approaches to aging and blending.

name: Macallan 1967 40 Year Old Single Cask #7683
description: A 1967 vintage single cask expression from Macallan matured for an incredible 40 years! This four decade old malt whisky was bottled in 2007 at 47.5% Abv by esteemed independent bottler Duncan Taylor. Vintage expressions of Macallan are sought after due to the use of golden promise barley, a strain noted for creating a robust spirit able to withstand sherry cask maturation.

name: Old Rip Van Winkle 10 Year 107 Proof Squat 2012 Bottling
description: A dumpy style bottling of the highly regarded Old Rip Van Winkle 10 year old bourbon. This 2012 bottling was the final year that Buffalo Trace used this squat bottle before permanently transitioning to the cognac style glass they introduced for the line in 2004. Both 90 proof and 107 proof editions of the 10 year old were released in the 2010s, with the 107 number being a particularly historical figure to the Van Winkles as it was the original barrel entry proof from the Stitzel-Weller distillery.
baxus_class_name: Old Rip Van Winkle 10 Year 107 Proof Squat 2012 Bottling

name: Clynelish 1995 23 Year Single Butt #8660 Single Cask Nation
description: A 1995 vintage single cask expression from Clynelish matured for 23 years in an Oloroso sherry butt. It was bottled in 2019 at 52.4% Abv by Single Cask Nation.
baxus_class_name: Clynelish 1995 23 Year Single Butt #8660 Single Cask Nation

name: Weller Full Proof Single Barrel Select
description:
Weller Full Proof Single Barrel Select is a premium expression from Buffalo Trace Distillery's renowned Weller line of wheated bourbons. This offering showcases the full potential of individual barrels, bottled at a robust 114 proof (57% ABV) without chill filtration. As a single barrel selection, each bottle represents the unique characteristics of its source barrel, providing a one-of-a-kind tasting experience that can vary subtly between selections.

Typically chosen by retailers, bars, or whiskey clubs, Weller Full Proof Single Barrel Select allows connoisseurs to explore the nuances of Buffalo Trace's wheated bourbon mashbill at its full, uncut strength. While not age-stated, these selections are generally aged for 5 to 8 years, developing a complex flavor profile that balances the sweetness of wheat with the depth of well-aged bourbon.

The Full Proof expression is particularly prized for its intensity and rich mouthfeel, offering a more robust experience compared to other Weller offerings. Its high proof and lack of chill filtration preserve the bourbon's natural oils and flavor compounds, resulting in a full-bodied whiskey that showcases the distillery's craftsmanship. Due to its limited availability and the reputation of the Weller brand, Weller Full Proof Single Barrel Select has become highly sought after by bourbon enthusiasts, often commanding premium prices and generating significant excitement when released.
baxus_class_name: Weller Full Proof Single Barrel Select

name: Old Taylor 1975 Bottling Quart
description: A 1975 bottling of Old Taylor bourbon produced at the original Old Taylor distillery before it was closed. This Quart sized bottling was released by National Distillers before Beam acquired them in 1987.

name: Old Fitzgerald 2005 14 Year Bottled In Bond Decanter
description: A 2005 vintage expression of wheated bourbon from Heaven Hill matured for 14 years. This fan favourite release is bottled in bond at 50% Abv as part of the Old Fitzgerald label and comes packaged in a stunning heavy glass decanter.
baxus_class_name: Old Fitzgerald 2005 14 Year Bottled In Bond Decanter

name: Four Roses 8 Year Single Barrel OBSV
description: A single barrel expression of Four Roses 100 proof offering. This private cask was crafted from the OBSV recipe which includes a 35% rye mashbill.
baxus_class_name: Four Roses 8 Year Single Barrel OBSV

name: Beam’s Choice 8 Year Diamond Quilted Silver 1970s Bottling
description: A late 1960s/early 1970s era bottling of Jim Beam matured for 8 years. This unique silver decanter comes in a 4/5th quart format making this a pre-1976 bottling. The distillate used for this decanter will have been distilled in the 1960s.
baxus_class_name: Beam’s Choice 8 Year Diamond Quilted Silver 1970s Bottling

name: Michter's 25 Year Bourbon 2020 Release
description: From the distiller: "We believe that our 25 Year Kentucky Straight Bourbon is as fine as any bourbon ever released throughout Michter’s storied history. This exceptionally flavorful bourbon was distilled from a select mashbill, then matured to perfection for over a quarter of a century in specially chosen, new charred American white oak barrels. We continue to strive to make the best bourbon possible regardless of production cost. We hope you enjoy our Michter’s 25 Year Limited Release Bourbon as a fine emblem of our commitment to excellence."

name: Colonel E.H. Taylor Barrel Proof Batch 12
description: The 12th batch of barrel proof bourbon from Buffalo Trace bottled as part of their EH Taylor label. This release was bottled at 131.1 proof in 2023.
baxus_class_name: Colonel E.H. Taylor Barrel Proof Batch 12

name: Old Lewis Hunter 6 Year 1974 Bottling
description: A 1974 vintage expression of bourbon distilled at the Old Lewis Hunter distillery in Cynthiana. This was produced by Frankfort Distillers Company/Seagrams just before Old Lewis Hunter shut down. The distillery struggled throughout its life and often shifted between producing bourbon and industrial alcohol for the war effort. In the early 1970s Seagram's deemed the site surplus to its needs and shuttered it. It has laid abandoned since the 70s and only recently has the site been purchased to be converted back into a distillery.

name: Seagram's Benchmark 6 Year 1973 Bottling
description: A 1973 bottling of Seagram's Benchmark bourbon matured for 6 years and bottled at 86 proof. This era of the brand was produced at the Seagram's Louisville distillery long before the brand was sold to Sazerac.

name: Ardmore 2009 13 Year Single Cask For Australia Whisky Sponge
description: A 2009 vintage single cask expression of Ardmore peated single malt matured for 13 years in a refill barrel. This cask as bottled exclusively for Whisky & Alement, a bar in Melbourne, Australia. Bottled at 57.1% Abv with just 120 bottles released by acclaimed bottler Whisky Sponge.
baxus_class_name: Ardmore 2009 13 Year Single Cask For Australia Whisky Sponge
